text: Poured from the bottle into a tulip glass at the World of Beer in Columbia, SC. The appearance is a slightly hazy gold color with a medium sized white head. There is a ton of carbonation. The aroma is bananas, wheat and cloves. The taste is sweet bread with bananas and maybe some peaches.

Bottle from Beerhawk. Clear vibrant light gold with fluffy white head. Heaps of gorgeous looking refreshing bubbles. With a head like that you¬íre going to get plenty on the nose. I get scents of fresh zesty orange a light herby spice and sweet warm toffee sauce. So far so very good. Take a sip and get warm fruity oranginess and cloves fizzing in my chest. It¬ís peppery in a Belgian way and very reminiscent of a Witbier. A light body with crisp sharp carbonation builds refreshment levels leaving a little oilyness on the lips. This is a brilliantly bright refreshing crisp beer with a softening fluffy top and a warming spice finish. Damn near as perfect an example of Belgian brewing as I¬íve experienced. Was like an amplified Witbier.
Farven er gylden gul og let uklar, medens skumkronen er cremet og hvid. Aromaen og smagen er br√∏d, banan, p√¶re, krydderier (koriander?) og citrus. Det er i den grad en god √∏l.

Light yellow, with thick white head. Aroma sweet and yeasty. Nice continued balance between sweetness, fruity yeast and some spice in the taste. The sweetness then goes aways quickly and the finish is dry. Classical tripel!

Zoet biertje, zeker niet bitter. Een alleman vriend. Zijn er goed meer van te drinken ondanks de stevige smaak.

Pours pale, hazy, massive head. Caramel, malty, banana, cloves, vanilla, yeast, alcohol. Very sweet, little bitter. Full body, fizzy. Nice classic.
Nice aroma of malts, wheat is perciptible. Then aroma of belgian ale yeast. Pale color. Very high carbonation, too much for me.
This beer is really fruity and strong. The aroma is amazing. Love the fruity smell.

33cl bottle. hazy golden color. medium to big white head. hops,belgo yeast, banana, pepper, citrus. medium bitterness. medium to high carbonation. refreshing!

Slight fruity with a subtle herb aroma. Not perfectly bright. Good head. Classic Belgium esters on the palette but with a predominant phenolic bite. Not out of place for a tripel. Very good and characterful example of the style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wonderful beer - the head is so smooth, the packaging is beautiful, the taste amazing. I always search this one out. Try it if you never had!

Wonderful beer. From the aroma to the initial foam and crisp sweetness on the palate with a lingering finish, this is a fantastic beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Originally rated on 12/24/2008. It poured a slightly hazy golden body, good carbonation, but the head quickly fizzled out and didnt leave any lace to speak of. Aroma of wheat, corriander, spice, and yeast. Mouthfeel was crisp and clean due to the carbonation. Flavor was a mixture of the three grains with orange, spices, and some slightly sweet malts showing up, the alcohol was barley noticeable at the end. It leaves a faint but plesant clean aftertaste, overall its a pretty fine beer thats worth a try

Aroma: Lemon, coriander, a bit Belgian yeasts, 
Appearance: Yellow, haze with white head.
Taste: malty, fruity, coriander, a light bitterness in finish.
Palate: Smooth, full body, average carbonation.
Prima makkelijk drinkbaar tripeltje. gebalanceerd, heel iets koriander, gemiddeld zoet bitter. is ok.

330 mL Bottle - Poured into a tulip: pale to slightly hazy deep gold, head started lively and fizzy then built into frothy white mountain on top of the glass and calmed to a cap-film all the way down, effervescent rising carbonation - nice look. Aroma of fruit, banana, yeast, floral, sweet honey, classic Belgian spice of pepper coriander and clove, and a bit of vanilla. Well balanced taste, some sweet fruitiness, spice, hint of bitterness and alcohol well subdued but still there in the lightness of the body. Light-medium body, lively tingly carbonation, thin dry finish. Overall: Solid tripel, well balanced, quite drinkable, but still leans a bit sweet for me personally.
A rather industrial beer posing as some heritage brew. Very one-dimensional, a bit syropy.

Karmeliet al vaak gehad, nog niet beoordeelt. Veel schuim, blijft niet lang staan, kruidige geur, kruidige smaak, richting koriander, sinaasappel, gist, weinig hop, weinig mout, weinig bitter, goed in balans

Hazy golden with little white head. Aroma is basil, leek, dandelion, curry, some herbs, citrus. Taste is spicy and soursweet leek, a bit too phenolic. Rather hard to drink. Medium body, too heavy. Still ok.
Bottle from Bierland, Belgium. Wheaty triple with huge alcohol palate that sticks in the breath and an enormous fizz. Strong notes of banana. Very relaxing beer to mull over.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2017 I¬ím a little surprised by the stellar rating this beer got compared to something like Judas or even Delirium. Nonetheless, as it¬ís a variety of beer I¬ím quite fond of, I still enjoy this refreshing TK.

edit: had again from a sharer and somehow went down much better this time. Good balance. upped.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2017 On tap at Heritage Belfian Beer cafe in Sydney. Pours a hazy golden orange with a white head. Aroma: herbal, banana, vanilla aromas dominate. Mild citrus and sugarcane aromas. Taste: Banana, ripe fruit, sugarcane, wheat flavours complement the malt flavour that hits the palate first. Sweet but well balanced. Simply delicious.

Bottle, 0.75l. Hazy golden pour with two finger creamy white head. Very good retention, thick lacing. Absolutely beautiful and rich nose. Nice hop presence, lemon, lime, grassy. Delicious.

Medium body, smooth and light on the tongue. Lively carbonation, really brings out the citrus aroma into the spotlight. Balanced tartness and bitterness. Aroma of malts, yeast and wheat. Full and rich. Herbal, strong coriander presence. Lemons and lime.. Slightly peppery. Malty sweetness coming through a bit during the finish. Very subtle alcohol presence, well hidden and nicely subdued. Dry mouthfeel. Lasting citrus flavored finish.

Overall, this one was incredibly tasty. Absolutely delicious tripel.

Keg at Bar Castei, Montecchio Maggiore (VI), Italy. Colour is clear hazy yellow with a big long-lasting white head. Aroma is citrus, zest, spices, herbs, malts, yeasts. Taste is similar to aroma. Bottle at home.

Bottle pours light gold with sparkling white head. Aroma of banana like yeast esters. Tastes is light sweet and balanced. Clove like hints in the finish. Really good tripel.

Very classic. Triple without any bad nor good surprise. Good balance not too much alcohol

Pours a light hazy gold that you can still see through - almost like a cloudy pilsner. Big fluffy white head that slowly dissipates, small champagne-like bubbles. Aroma is straw, light bread and grain with a spritz of sugared lemon. Crisp mouthfeel that is very surprisingly viscous on the lips afterward. Lively small carbonation. First instant on the lips is for a fraction of a second pilsner before an immediate bready sweetness filled in with honey citrus, apricot and other light fruit. One of the more refreshing tripels I have had. Could drink a lot of this with no problem.

Bottle at beerbistro. Surprised I haven¬ít rated this, having had it many times. Golden yellow with finely bubbled white head. Nice spicy aroma, with citrus and straw, some pepper notes. Lively carbonation, smooth finish. Spicy flavours of lemon, pepper, straw. This is a great beer.

The carbonation ressembles champagne, making noises just like fizzy juice. Very lively carbonation. The ending is smooth, a bit boozy and warming. I did not except to like another belgian beer this much.

330ml. bottle in Vientiane, Laos. Pours a caramel brown with a good, white retentive head. Aromas of yeast, smoke and spice. A fruity and yeasty taste. Complex and pleasant. A good tripel.

Pours clear golden with a large, creamy and lacy white head. Really nice and refreshing aroma. Sweet, but well balanced. Smooth with good carbonation. Very good tripel.

Draft Pint at The Porterhouse, Covent Garden, London in July 2009 - And Bottles - Pale yellowy amber. Malty; wheaty, oaty; apparently uses wheat, barley & oat grains. Very Spicy (clove, coriander & vanilla) and Yeasty. Fruity; oranges, lemon. Honey. Smooth and quite sweet. Alcohol well disguised. Easy drinking for its ABV. Lovely. Very good. Terrific beer! (2009-07)

one of the best of Belgiums beer for me. White beautiful rack foam. The aroma of citrus, banana and flowers. Rich and balanced flavor with the same fruits and flowers. A little hop and a nice warming alcohol.

Go√ªteuse, savoureuse et forte sans √™tre agressive. Un v√©ritable classique, un must √† la pression !

Superbe blonde tout juste dor√©e, bien translucide, avec une mousse blanche bien √©paisse avec de belles bulles. Le nez est une promesse. Des malts caramel extr√™mement gourmands et frais, des c√©r√©ales chaudes bien arrondis par l¬íusage d¬íavoine et de froment en plus de l¬íorge, du raisin, de la prune, de la mirabelle, de belles notes de framboise, de groseille, de coriandre, de pamplemousse, de citron vert et d¬íorange, de vanille, de banane et de miel... Les ar√¥mes sont v√©ritablement soyeux, doux, ronds, pleins et chauds... Les 8.4% sont monstrueux de justesse, ils portent les ar√¥mes √† leur paroxysme. La texture est ronde, chaude, liquoreuse, la carbonatation est vive tandis que l¬íamertume est l√©g√®re mais longue et les sucres riches. On retrouve aussi des saveurs poivr√©es voir menthol√©es qui pimentent le palet. La longueur est divine, sur l¬íalcool, les 3 grains, les sucres des malts, une l√©g√®re amertume et le poivre. Une triple parfaite √† tous les niveaux, que ce soit les ar√¥mes complexes, les saveurs parfaitement √©quilibr√©es, un alcool de tr√®s haut niveau, une arri√®re-bouche qui laisse des traces et un houblonnage juste. Le top-niveau, ind√©niablement. Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2017 330 ml bottle, served in original glass at de Kroeg, Antwerp. Unique aroma. Very yeasty; cereal, banana and vanilla aroma. Rather sweet and fruity, slightly bitter. Bottle at home. Full white head. Smells sweet and yeasty. Taste of lemons This is carbonated. Smooth on the palate. Overall this is nice and drinkable.

bread, cereal, amber, heavy cloying sweetness, medium body, average carbonation,

Flavor of sweet malts, again with the citric notes, however a little artificial, some ripe apples and pears and bitter spices. UPDATED: FEB 18, 2017 Nice aroma. Very thick white head. Medium sweet, easy drinkable, would certainly drink again.

Bottle from SAQ. After I got I like tripel beer a lot, I¬íve tried many of them mostly local. Superb golden color, a little hazy. Nice creamy long lasting head, nice lacing as well.
Aroma is complex and refined with bread, bananas, peaches and citrus, spiced with coriander, pepper, cloves and some vanilla. No alcohol in the aroma.
Taste has the same complexity, balance and refinement. Sweet-bitter and fruity, discretely seasoned with spices. The alcohol is very discrete as well and the aftertaste is long and relatively intense. Mouth feel is creamy and velvety, warm and pleasant.
For me this really is the perfect tripel and it brings me joy every time I taste it.

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 12th March 2017. Poured into a Chimay goblet. It poured a wonderful clear golden colour with a two finger foamy white head that had pretty good retention, nice curtain lacing that eventually settles to a thin foamy cap. Aromas are wheaty, banana, clove and peach with light citrus and vanilla. Tastes zesty lemon sweetness, sour peach gummy candy, yeast, lightly bready and spicy with a hint of honey, banana and clove. Creamy, medium bodied with moderate to high carbonation with some obvious booziness every now and then. Overall, wow, this has to easily be one of my favourite Tripels and I can¬ít believe it¬ís taken me this long to try it. It would be almost perfect if the booziness was toned down a bit. Having said that, it¬ís still a great beer and easily a must buy beer for me.
One of my best beers. It¬ís on my favorites list for quit some time now. Summer, winter... you can enjoy it all year long.

Beer drinks quite easy with characteristic Beligian Triple sweetness and character, I detected a hint of peach at times. I found it complex and interesting and want to go back for another.

A bottle from the Cafe Bastille near Tai Power Building, drunk at home. Aroma: plenty of wheat in there, sweet, flowery. Appearance: clear, pale amber; head is minimal, but sticks around. Palate: medium-bodied, rather creamy, soft carbonation. Finishes long, pleasing balance of astringency and sweetness. Taste: extremely well-balanced, lemony and floral but not oversweet. Aroma: slightly floral, but mostly citrus hops. Appearance: cloudy yellow with a lovely white thick head. Taste: slightly spiced with ginger with sweet malts followed by slight bitterness. One of the best common Belgians in my opinions.

I bought this bottle in Paris, in a G7 supermarket. I drank it yesterday with a delicious meal. In my point of view, it is a really nice product. The body is yellow, creamy and troubled, thin and white foam, sparkling, relative high carbonation. The taste is perfect for a tripel, perfect side of malt, giving a side of fruits, banana, cloves, apricot, some hop and nice mix with the alcohol, wheat, perfect.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 (6-Jan-2017) Trying an experiment in seeing what aging does to Karmeliet. Bought 5 75cl bottles and will try one each half year. The first one, which I tried soon after buying seems a little more aggressive in the carbonisation than the 33cl bottle I tried recently, that had been in my fridge for a while. Seems to indicate a little age will help in making it softer and more elegant. Still a great beer, but I suspect the next bottles will be better. Work in progress...

(2-Sep-2016) Truly one of the best beers out there. Beautiful white, very fine foam. Extremely balanced: sweetness, acidity, creaminess, carbonisation, bitterness are never screaming for attention, yet are all contributing to the mix. Vanilla, lemon zest, subtle coriander, citrus, banana, yeast. Extremely smooth and satisfying. Never disappointed with this one.
On tap at Archive for Armakeggon 2016. Fruity with hints of banana and clove, lingering alcohol warmth, not bad.
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 Floral aroma. Very pleasant taste, quite yeasty, vanilla, candy sugar, floral notes, warm long aftertaste. A very good triple.

Tulip glass from a tap at Barley¬ís in Greenville SC (from 2012 notes).

A: Pours a bright, pale honey/golden color, with a small-to-moderate size, exceptionally creamy head. Head has good retention, at least as a ring.

S&T: Light and fruity, although no specific fruit comes to the fore. Clove and banana elements, but less pronounced than in some tripels. Honey too. The aroma is a bit boozy, but in a positive way ... think fine brandy or liqueur. 

M: Very smooth, with a bit of alcohol warming. Nice, light carbonation. 

Overall: One of the best tasting tripels I have ever had. Complex and flavorful, but not challenging. Very refined. Makes an excellent sipper, and I took a good long time to finish my serving, enjoying every sip.

On tap @ La Taverne du Petit Wasquehal, Wasquehal - FR. Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and high light white foam. Smell: caramel and grain notes. Bread notes. Alcohol finish. Aftertaste: sweet, caramel and toffee. Dry finish, astringent with boozy alcohol. Not so balanced with alcohol taste.
Bubbly, fruity, slightly spicy, nice yeast presence. Definitely a solid standard and great example of style.

0,33l bottle. Hazy yellow colour with long lasting big creamy white head. Aroma: Floral with honey, banana and citrus. Taste: very sweet tasty start with a pleasent light bitter/sour mouthfeel. Full body with fizzy carbonation. Long sweet/sour finish. Good tripel.

Yellow gold, transparent and alive. Gasification medium-high fine bubble. It makes an appearance cereal, especially wheat, so you can remember a German weiss bier. Taste dominated by malt, which gives it a sweet character. Beer with malty body, but soft and creamy torque characteristic provided by oats. Fruit continues to persist in taste, like spices detected in the aroma. Balanced, it ends with a balanced bitterness, which overlooks the alcohol, without actually distorting the whole.

On draught at Cafe Benelux, Milwaukee. Appearance: slightly hazy deep golden, with a thick frothy white head that lingers with brilliant lacing. 
Aroma: A fruity burst of pear and banana, with some sweet lemony/ orange rind and apple. 
Taste: Strong, sweet wheaty maltiness, with strong Belgian yeast esters of clove, pear, and light banana. A touch of light pepper shows up on the backside, followed by a light bitterness just enough to prevent the beer from being cloyingly sweet. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body with a light creaminess and moderately high carbonation. A touch of alcohol warmth. 
Finish: Lingering spicy clove, per, and banana esters. 
Overall: A truly world class beer, with a brilliant showcase of fruity Belgian yeast esters. Complex apple, pear, banana, and clove aroma and flavors throughout, all while hiding the true strength of the beer. Also, can¬ít underestimate the beautiful, long lasting head that displays wonderful lacing.
Davvero fantastica, aroma fruttato, schiuma densa e cremosa, gusto leggermente amarognolo con sentori di vaniglia, cereali e banana. Stupenda!

Piwo w kolorze pomaranczowo-slomkowym, klarowne z obfita efektowna piana. W aromacie typowe drozdze, slodkie owoce i przyprawy. Czuc lekko kolendre i banany. W smaku cytrusy, kwiaty i pszenica. 330ml bottle. Pours a large bubbly 2 finger head of white foam and slowly dissipates to a fairly thin layer. Has a hazy light orange colour. Aromas of yeast and some hops and malts. Flavours of light malts, very yeasty, orange, barley, citrus notes. Creamy mouthfeel, active carbonation and tingly on the palate. Very tasty. Very good stuff.
Perfect Aroma both after and before drink. This beer is very balance in every dimention. I'm very love this beer. Tasty is very good. Nice colour and beautiful head.

Beautifully hidden alcohol. It poured hazy straw, the aroma was a little fruity wheat with hints of banana and some spices. Nicely thick but with high carbonation. Palate is pretty awesome. Overall it¬ís an extremely enjoyable beer.

Hazy and yellow. Aroma is yeast, sweet fruits and malt. Some spice in the taste, mixed in with sweet fruits once more. Something seems off with the balance but I can¬ít figure out what. A pretty mediocre beer.

Pours a hazy straw yellow with a big white head of foam. Aroma of wheat and grassy grains. Taste is slightly tart and effervescent with wheat and grass flavors. Some hints of banana. It finishes somewhat dry and loses the sweetness. Not as refreshing as I thought it would be. Still pretty enjoyable except for the dryness.
Flaska Cambrinus, Brygge. Halmgul med luftig vit skumkrona. Doft av skumbanan och kn√§ck. Mediums√∂t, frisk kropp. Smak av skumbanan, citrus, √∂rter och peppar.

0.33l bottle.

Bright golden with large white head. Plenty of lacing. Yeasty and citrus-like aroma and taste.

On tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear golden with a creamy, white head. Aroma has wheat, belgian yeast, vanilla, light citrus, grain, dry spices, floral, light floral hops as well.. Taste is sweet, vanilla, light for the abv, light hoppy finish. High carb, smooth body. Balanced and nice
awesome slightly fruity taste with a hint of caramel. Finds the perfect balance between the fruit flavours and dryness. Perfect summer beer :)
What a pleasant surprise! Didn¬ít discover this until recently. Very enjoyable.
Glas van de tap. Goudgeel helder bier met stevig wit schuim. Aroma is fruitig met een vleugje banaan. In de smaak komt de banaan duidelijk naar boven. Smaak ebt snel weg.

33cl bottle at home. Pours a clear golden colour with a big creamy white head which leaves lacing. Aroma of banana, caramel, citrus, malt, spices. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with a soft bitter finish. Notes of coriander, spices, malts, yeast, banana, citrus. Sticky texture, medium bodied with lively carbonation.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is banana, permanent marker, citrus, dusty barnyard, dry, not as harsh as a typical Tripel, quite subdued, in fact. Appearance is straw golden, white head, hazy, with a head I expect to stick around. Taste is nice. Citrus, tropical fruit, banana, dusty, barnyard, dry, top notch. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, dry citrus aftertaste. Overall, this one makes a believer out of me yet. Normally I hate this style but this one is different from all the other Tripels. Well done.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 for the damn book. The pour is a slightly foggy golden yellow color with a nice cap and thick collar of white head leaving a couple spots of lace. The aroma is surprisingly pretty good. There is a strong lemongrass and a great citrus rind. The maltiness and spiciness of any other tripel I¬íve had at this point aren¬ít really present, and I¬ím a fan of the aroma on this. It¬ís nice and crisp and clean. The flavor is pretty good. The Belgian malts and spice are there, but not overpowering. The lemongrass and citrus rind really bring this one in. There is a little dusty barnyard piece to it that balances out well. The mouth feel is good. But a little off. The viscosity is good and there is a slight under carbonation. I would like this to be a little more effervescent. The aftertaste is tropical fruits and dusty lemongrass. I like it. I never thought I¬íd say that about a tripel.

Pale yellow colour. Medium white head which stays quite a long time. Sweet flowery aroma. Hints of vanilla and caramel. Sweet flowery beginning. Caramel, hints of yeast. Sweet, flowery finish. Sweetness in the aftertaste. Rather medium bodied. Heavy palate. Quite sweet. Slightly alcoholy. Quite drinkable. Somehow memories about tasting this beer earlier were better than the beer itself now when writing this opinion.
Una de las mejores belgas del mundo sin duda, trigo, avena y cebada equilibradas y con 8,5 grados que entran solos.

Beautiful, tasty looking beer! Hazy, yellow with tiny bubbles racing to the top. Huge, four finger high, white, creamy head that leaves a lot of lacing on the glass. 

Nose: Caramel malt, belgian yeast, citrus, wheat, banana and vanilla. 
Taste: Oh! So smooth! Bread, yeast, banana, caramel, citrus, spices and clove. 
Mouth: As I said; smooth! Soft and creamy. High and smooth carbonation, almost creamy feeling! Dry ending. Very well hidden ABV! 

This is an amazing beer! 

And of course Brouwerij Bosteels should know what they are doing... The brewery was founded in 1791 and is still owned and operated by the same family, now its seventh generation! 

This is what I call craftbeer! :)
Cold, it¬ís like a hefe with banana notes. As it warms up it gets much more interesting, with funky cumin and coriander notes. Hazy yellow pour.

Pours clear golden with some white head that quickly fades. Aroma is semi-sweet and biscuit with prominent coriander in a complex warm fruity manner. Taste is biscuit malty, with fruity notes and surprisingly dry, despite the sweetness in the aroma. Taste has balanced spices with coriander as the most prominent and some esters with banana flavor. End is fruity yet semi-dry with laid back bitterness. High drinkability.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Still working my way through the classics. Pours a glowing golden orange with a huge foamy head that quickly dissipates. Honey and biscuits on the nose with yeast and light cinnamon and clove notes. Very active carbonation with the same flavors above and a touch of mint. Great hoppy bitterness on the finish with honey, lemon and pepper. A great beer that lives up to the hype.

AROMA: Pungent fruit and spice. Green apple, banana, flowers, clove, black pepper. 10/12APPEARANCE: Deep gold; slightly hazy; CO2 visible. Large, white, foamy head. 3/3FLAVOR: Spicy tingly sensation immediate. Peppercorn and alcohol first followed by blonde/pale malt. Lemonpeel, banana, melon and green pear on second half. Pours a lovely clear bright gold, with a fizzy fast dissipating head. The aroma is divine - big dominant banana bread, touches of yeast esters, lemon, wheat, vanilla. The taste is very similar, citrus is a bit more pronounced, solid wheat and grain base, a hint of honey, champagne yeast. The aroma on this beer is amazing. Bready, sweet, spicy, and full of clove and juicy fruits. Super aromatic and absolutely delicious. There¬ís a ton of lemon as well, which cuts through the sweetness and makes it even more complex. Taste is sweet and spicy. Lot¬ís of clove and peppercorn mixed with lemon, juicy tropical fruit and a bone dry white wine. It¬ís perfect. Leaves you wanting more sip after sip. This is probably my favorite tripel and definitely try it if you haven¬ít, it¬ís so delicious.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2017 2014 Reserva Vintage, 150cl Magnum bottle cellared for Biere mit Stil 1: Worldwide Tripel [email¬†protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Freiburg JAN2016. -  - Sweet lemon rind and lemon balm/melissa, buttered oat biscuits and buttermilk, vanilla almond porridge and orange rind - depending on the type and size of container (kegged in Strasbourg or De Kust; big-bottled at home, smaller sizes in between) this 3-grain tripel, like many masterpieces, has many hues and dayshapes. Might have been even creamier and a tad less sweet back in 2007-8 when this was my drink of choice for a spell, but I really can¬ít tell. No soapy coriander in this big ripened bottle, matured and mellowed to full complexity. Great balance of rich, natural grain fruitiness and an almost culinary display of hop zest and ap√©ritif dryness. Up there with the best fresh & fr√ºhlingshafte non-phenolic tripels along with Chimay Blance and Gouden Carolus. (Might tone this down a bit once I get over what a fitting apotheosis downing a full glass of it was to conclude a series of 15-odd worldwide tripels.) // Resampled bottle (BL sampler 2017-V): a big sugary-simplistic letdown - has the recipe been tinkered with even pre-ABInbev? None of the round orange creaminess, instead lots of carbonated sugarbubbles interrupting lemony hops on an oddly flat grainy base.... -1.0

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Bright amber/gold with a creamy head. Complex mix of aromas; lemon, caramel, cereal and vanilla. Taste is more complex still, very fruity and thirst-quenching but also full-bodied and sweet. Lovely long, dry finish. Everything I need from a beer.

This is one of the best belgian beer ever. Sometimes irregular on tap but all the same good flavor and taste in bottle. Everybody can like this beer even with the high ABV. Nice gold color and a thick head of beer.

Light blonde, hazy with high pillowy head. Very lively carbonation. Aroma bananas, cloves and coriander. Medium palate and disappointingly high carbonation. Taste of citrus fruit, bubblegum, banana and strong bready finish. Alcohol well hidden behind yeast esters and malt backbone, but has decent warm finish. Personally I like this beer although lower carbonation would really help it to shine. Never tried on tap though.

Bottle @ Buitenlust with Thompson. Looks extremely clear with a somewhat sunny color. Smells very pleasant, hoppy with a slight pinch of sweetness. Tastes just like the smell would tell you with a slight hint of bitterness. Overall, an extremely solid beer that I would happily drink again!
A very niceto find strong ale. The multi hop flavor is quite nice, an attractive head and a nice beer glass .

Naturally conditioned and only cloudy if you pour it that way. Colour is a mellow golden and aroma typically Trapiste with a strong malty, spicy aroma.
Heavy body as is to be expected, with the hops making their presence felt in the finish. Negative for me was the amount of condition in the bottle making it both much too fizzy and virtually impossible to pour over any reasonable timeframe.
Pours a really light yellow with a big white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Taste follows nose, a spiciness showing up as it warms. Overall a good triple, easy to drink but nothing really special to me.

This doesn¬ít seem like your usual Belgium Tripel. This beer seems like a fusion of a tripel with a Belgium farmhouse and sour ale. The beer poured a cloudy straw color with small white head. The was the first thing to tip me off that this wasn¬ít gonna be a typical tripel. I smelled a lot of yeast, sour fruit and grassy hops. The flavors fell in line with the aroma, with notes of light bread, yeast, fruity hops, sour apple and lemon. The beer finished on the sour side with more lemon notes and a sour tone.

Nice but simple.

Dark golden color big white head. Rich bready fruity maltiness with some peppery clove phenols to balance. Nice tripel.

Pours a golden color, fairly clear, topped with lots of white frothy head that slowly settles down. Malty aroma, wheaty and fruity notes. Mildly yeasty. Taste sweet and malty, yeasty with some fruity notes. Mild bitterness. Not a fan of this style, so a bit biased review, but not bad.

Poured from a 750ml corked bottle given to me by a coworker into a Duvel tulip. Bottle popped with a nice satisfying burst and an immediate aroma of earthy hops.

Poured a bright pale gold with a thick, fine bubbled, 2 inch, pure white head. Head dissipated into a thin foam within a couple of minutes. Nice lacing on the glass. Beer was slightly cloudy in the glass with a strong, never ending stream of bubbles eminating from the bottom, center of the glass. Very nice. As soon as the bottle was opened, there was a strong, earthy hop aroma. After pouring into the glass this was amplified even more. Although a very appealing aroma, it is rather one dimensional. I don¬ít detect much of anything else. No malt, and only the slightest of Belgian funk. Nice, but not as complex as I was hoping for. Taste follows the aroma. Dominated with hop bitterness, but some malt sweetness, some fruitiness and a touch of funk comes through. At 8.4%, the alcohol is hidden very well. This is a very drinkable beer. I tend to think of this as a Belgian IPA. Hops forward with some character to back it up. Mouthfeel is solid. Rich and full with lots of prickly carbonation felt on the center and back of the tongue. Very nice. To me, this is a highly drinkable Belgian tripel. Usually, I have a difficult time with this style, but this beer - I could have a couple with no problem. The alcohol is hidden well and the flavors balance nicely with nothing overpowering.

Overall, a very good beer. I will have to look for this one again.

33cl pour from chilled bottle into stemmed beer tulip at Verde 1080 in Vienna. Pours golden and hazy with a big fizzy head with pretty good retention. Nose is sweet--candy sugar, a bit of biscuit, a nice light malty scent. Body is medium, fizzy. Not bad. Taste is great. Sweet, but not overwhelmingly. Delicious breadiness, with a hint of citrus and a whisper of bitterness on the end. Layers of maltiness and breadiness. Delicious. Better as it warms.

8.4% ABV

Medium head. Nice wheaty with full bodied yeasty nose in the wonderful chalice it is served in.

Beautiful mouthfeel. Light and full of lively carbonation with a good stout beery heft worthy of a tripel. The carbonation hides the alcoholic punch of the tripel. Beautiful yellow fading towards amber. Just beautiful. I can¬ít stop using that word when describing this tripel. Very nice! I think I¬ím in love! Rare to find a tripel that has the carbonation of a pilsner and the heft of a tripel. Tripels as a general rule are mostly syrupy, constantly reminding you of you of their gravitas. But this is just lovely. All the way to the end when your stomach reminds you that you just had a tripel. Nothing else about the experience other than the heavenly buzz that starts to warmly wrap its tentacles around your pontine cortex and brainstem is characteristic of a tripel.

One of the greats in my book. A definite must have after a long day....

The dudes at Brouwerij Bosteels in Buggenhout. Belgium have stumbled on gold if it¬ís true that they¬íve kept to the recipe from the Carmelites from 1679 in the convent in Dendermonde. Three grains are used, oats, wheat and barley. Pure genius results.

Near the very top of the Favorites List!

Poured from bottle into the tulip-glass that followed. Wow. Beautiful, frothy, long lasting head. Strong, almost unpleasant aroma. (I said "almost") of good yeast and banana. Surprisingly mild but excellent taste. Citrus, herbs, alcohol, banana... The list goes on. Short palate but that?s a good thing, after everything it initially gives you. I could drink this every day. Among my top 5 beers.

On tap at "na 7. schode", Zilina. Clear golden with big white head, persistent, leaves lacing. Sweet malty aroma with belgian yeast, butter, grass, caramel, lot of herbs and hints of orange peel. Taste is malty sweet, caramel, fruity, orange peel with just hints of bittery. Full body, creamy texture, beautifully ballanced.

Pours blonde with a big white head and a sharp, spicy nose with touches of floral and fruit. Flavor is the most balanced tripel I¬íve had to date, with bitter citrus, coriander and modest hops perfectly matching up to the Belgian sugars and bready-fruity malt base. Warm but not boozy. Very strongly carbonated. About as good as beers get.

Hazy golden color. Nice white head, that is persistent till the end. Medium to low carbonation, full bodied, rounded and creamy. Aroma is very complex, plums, strawberry, orange peel, passion fruit (?), yeast... and more that I couldn¬ít understand. Taste is sweet, malt, plums, dried grapes, bread and somehow spicy... don¬ít know for sure if cloves or pepper... Aftertaste is sweet and long.
330ml bottle. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Malt, spices, citrus, wheat, banana, vanilla and clove.

330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie. One of those beers I¬íve had so many times I automatically think I¬íve rated it already, but haven¬ít. Pours hazy gold with vibrant bubbly head. A blossoming aroma of yeast & sweet spice. Taste is spicy, a touch grainy with hints of vanilla, banana & caramel and a soft bitter finish. Truly one of the best.

330 mml bottle tasted several times, last one on 19/04/2015. Hazy yellow colour with a big bubbly white head. Aroma of malts, alcohol and yeast. Taste is very grainy with presence of fresh fruits, yeast and hints of alcohol. Next one please!
Huge foamy white head that lasts surprisingly long, aroma of banana and citrus, taste of citrus and vanilla. Very enjoyable

Bottle from Brewers Droop, Bristol via SouthWest Drinks (tried day after delivery). BBE 23/02/17. Rich obvious banana aroma with some vanilla and light clove. Slightly sulphurous wheat like smell and subtle green freshness. Gusher. Slightly cloudy very pale yellow with a super long lasting white head. Flavour is very wheaty with sulphur overtones, noticeable alcohol blended with a rich almost wine-like equivalence in beer, if such a thing can blend. Honey like. Not quite as ¬ícreamy¬í as promised, possibly overcarbonated slightly but very, very nice.
Lovely Belgian beer, lovely aroma and taste.......................................

A very good beer.
A nice Belgian ale, with several light fruit hints and a nice smooth aftertaste. Very enjoyable

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2015 I have had that several times since I¬íve been introduced to real beers a few months ago. I still respect this very much but my interest for it is declining as I¬ím becoming used to other beer styles. This is an excellent belgian tripel, easy to drink, and full of flavours (banana-vanilla from the yeast, citrus from the wheat, spicy). Sweet, a little sour, and with a semi-dry finish. Well hidden alcohol for a tripel. Very well balanced. Of course you have to like belgian yeast and sweetness.

Bottle in Lovranski Pub. Wonderful hazy golden color with tiny bubbles screaming from the bottom of the glass. Thick, creamy white monster head. Aroma is amazing, something between a classic tripel and belgian wit. You can smell yeast, citrus,herbs, flowers, some ripe banana and notes of caramel. Taste is as above but with some wheat and herbal bitterness. Body is medium with a crispy lightly bitter finish.
Overall: This is an incredible belgian beer. Definitely a must try for every beer lover!

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 Pours golden, wheat like, opaque colour, with creamy, stable white head. 
Alcohol is not noticable, aroma with sweet notes of wheat, oat, with fruity, herbal esters of citrus, grape, banana, cloves, coriander and citrusy peppermint.
Flavor: Taste is similar: malty sweet (wheat, oat, caramel), with fruity notes (esters of grape, banana, citrus, grapefruit), and hints of spices (Coriander, citrusy peppermint and colves). Finish is dy, sticky sweet. 
Malt sweetness is high, hop bitteness is low, body is mout-coating.
Very drinkable triple.

Smells very good with a hint of citrus. Not too fruity like some others.

Taste is just slightly fruity. Not overpowering.

Lots of carbonation and head that lasts to the bottom of the glass.

Overall I was very pleased with this beer. It was not overpowering and very smooth. Could never tell it was a beer of such high ABV. I have 2 more that I plan to cellar. I will follow up in the future. Highly recommended.

MB

330ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a near three finger, white head. Carbonation streaming from the middle of the glass. Aroma has big notes of bubble gum, candy sugar, yeast, slight clove/spice. Very nice. Taste is balanced. Candy sugar, yeast, clove, bubble gum, ginger ale, slight banana and citrus, and a drawn out, pepper/spice ending. Medium-full body with high carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a carbonation that reminds me of ginger ale (slightly prickly), and a dry finish. Overall very nice. Can see why it is highly rated. Candy sugar, bubble gum, Belgian yeast, clove/pepper/spice, over top of a ginger ale like carbonation. No trace of alcohol.

Approx 8 degrees C. Pours hazy dark yellow with large white head. The Champagne of Beers! I have long regarded this as one of the great beers in the world. I haven¬ít had one since I began rating, so I was really looking forward to this bottle. And I was not disappointed! Effervescent in a way I do not really find in other beer - hence the Champagne comparison. Complex aroma of yeast, harvesting and citrus. Taste of wheat and oat - almost with the sweetnes of hefeweizen, yet its own and with a clear, dry maltiness in the aftertaste..No booziness despite high ABV, this is so fresh and drinkable that you do not feel it till you stand up - so be careful! The commercial description is not far off the mark in this case - this is the Tripel which stands out among its peers!
330 ml bottle. Apricot smell, with notes of citrus, almond and pepper. Golden color with white head. Fantastic taste with a very dry ending. Fills your mouth pleasure :D

Bottle conditioned. First brewed 1996; claimed to be based on a recipe from 1679 which used wheat, oat and barley. Tripel Karmeliet is a very refined and complex golden-to-bronze brew with a fantastic creamy head. These characteristics derive not only from the grains used but also from restrained hopping with Styrians and the fruity nature (banana and vanilla) of the house yeast. Aroma has hints of vanilla mixed with citrus aromas. Tripel Karmeliet has not only the lightness and freshness of wheat, but also the creaminess of oats together with a spicy lemony almost quinine dryness.

A medium body of sweetness and somewhat umami¬íish. What I like to call a soft and broad feel on the toungue. Carbonation is soft although heavy with many small bubbles tickling all over.
A nice beer for a warm summer night - less so for a cold winter with tapas in the dining room (as this was written). Quite complex taste and aroma, and a nice although notextraordinary palate.
Keg at the southern. Pours clear golden, aroma and taste of sweet caramel, light bitterness.
33cl @ bottle. Ottima Tripel belga di cui potresti berne 1 lirtro di fila senza problemi. Beverina, dolce, dissetante.

Straw-yellow, light haze, 2-inches of billowing white head that fades at a moderate rate. Aroma is hop dominated. Juniper, pine, lemon grass, grass, herbs, dry wheat grain. Body is huge blanket of fizzy carbonation, moderate coarseness, medium-intense burn, light body, watery and a bit oily. Flavor has a unique lemon drop contribution (which includes a touch of candy sweetness), some grass and grain. Touch of apricot and minimal bitterness in the finish. Great tripel. Refreshingly light body. Still, the carbonation feel is a bit over-the-top. Lemon drop is a bit dominant in the flavor; could use a bit more yeast complexity.
Well...I think this is a gorgeous beer...so fresh and with some banana ending. I recommend it!

Bottle at 28 Springs with Raith and Brisbane. Pours a crystal clear golden yellow. Aroma is bright and nicely floral. Perfume. Flavor has nice hop bittering and is floral. Slight wheat notes. Some orange also. Really nice beer.

From tap at the Beerstore, Thessaloniki. Clear golden color with white head. Fruity aroma, citrusy, dusty, yeasty. Sweet and light bitter taste like the aroma. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

A mid golden orange coloured beer with a frothy white head. A floral and fruity aroma, hints of orange and rose, plus a slight spicy, clove candy aroma. Medium-dry mouthfeel. A strong but mildly tart fruit flavour to start, lots of citrus fruit and an alcohol piney resinous taste. There is a sweetish candy flavour that bring forward the floral element that I find underlying the fruitiness on the finish. Tasted at Brasserie du Lombard, Brussels.

330ml Bottle in Blackfriars, Glasgow (¬£4.95):
This one was a really nice Belgian ale from the start, much as I¬íve come to expect from beers hailing from the country. Tripel Karmeliet was quite a spicy offering with a very lively and well-carbonated feel to it that proved highly enjoyable and every drinkable. Whilst I wouldn¬ít rank it as one of my favourites in the style it was definitely one worth trying and proved to be a fairly good example of the style.

I might just be adding to the noise, but here¬ís my take on this. 
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a hazy golden yellow to orange color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute leaving some light lacing arranging itself nicely around the glass. 
The smell had a nice blend of sweet iced apple with a light citrus bitterness and then a light clove to even things out a bit. 
The taste was mainly sweet but carried a nice crisp spice to it through the clove. There¬ís a slight sticky sweet aftertaste and finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. The carbonation was somewhat sharp but not overbearing. I say this was good. 
Overall, I say that this was a pretty good tripel that I would have again.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 18C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 08:58. AROMA: complex aroma with notes of orange and coriander, mixed with spices and a sweet background. very faint hop notes. APPEARANCE: gold color and hazy. large white head with below average retention. poor lacing. TASTE: mix of flavours of spice, oranges and coriander. low bitterness leading into a sweet finish. low alcohol presence. PALATE: medium body with a slight creaminess from alcohol with no obvious warming sensation. high carbonation. OVERALL: a very interesting 8and delicious) variation of a belgian tripel.

Three-grains tripel launched by Bosteels in 1996, when I accidentally stumbled upon it in an otherwise not too beer-oriented pub. Allegedly after a recipe from the 17th century carmelite convent of Buggenhout, but we all know strong blonde beers didn¬ít exist yet back then, so do not buy this bogus story. Do buy the beer though, as it has become a true classic of the style. I tasted it dozens of times from a regular 33 cl bottle, from tap and also from an aged 75 cl bottle, which this rating is mainly centered around. Poured in its own majestic and royal yet elegant glassware, it builds a near ¬íDuvel-thick¬í, yellowish white, very creamy and remarkably stable head; colour is a warm orangey blonde, almost clear but hazy with deposit, as expected from the style. Appealing aroma of orange, melon, peach, red apple, soap, wheat, ginger, dough, coriander, white pepper, mint, grassy hops, vanilla, lavender, honey, cake. The aged 75 cl version also displays, above all these goodies, a strong, sulphuric, earthy, hay-, sherry- and saison-like ¬íwildness¬í. Taste is a soft sweetish maltiness, vivid fruitiness, orange, peach, honey, relatively strong carbo, light but elegant and refreshing sourish wheat, very velvety and gentle mouthfeel (probably the oats doing their work), a bit rooty, well-rounded, fluffy and full, with the honey factor staying with you all the time; finishes in a nice herbal hop bitterishness with some warming alcohol, just the way you want your tripel to end. If Westmalle Tripel is to be considered "the mother of tripels", this one is at least a proud aunt, which should be respected and revered for adding to the style, expanding its boundaries, without disrespecting it. This is a truly lovely beer, although it comes in different shapes and forms (which should not all be trusted to the same extent - but out of respect for the brewery, I will say no more); one of the big Belgian classics. You¬íll be surprised by its drinkability, for which it deserves extra points: you can drink this all night, only to find out afterwards the considerable amount of alcohol you indulged yourself into, without having noticed it. Kudos to Tripel Karmeliet.

The appearance of this beer is an opaque golden with a large white head that fades somewhat quickly. The aroma blends Belgian yeast, particularly fruity esters, and light malts, and the taste is a very smooth blend of a slight sourness and a mild sweetness with a touch of umami from the yeast presence in this beer. The aftertaste is much lighter than the initial flavor, but the Belgian yeast definitely lingers for a long time on the tongue. The palate fuses medium-light body, a nearly thick texture, and an average carbonation that bites at the tongue as the beer stays in your mouth.
Heerlijk fris biertje, tonen van citrusvruchten, honing, perzik en een hele fijne afdronk. Een heerlijk biertje. Een echte aanrader

330 ml bottle. Dark canary yellow, slightly hazy, with a big, creamy, moderately persistent bright white head. Intense and mesmerizing smell, very floral and perfumy (almost like camomille or lavander), relatively hoppy, slightly spicy, some honey and freshly cut grass notes. Quite complex. Delicate and zingy palate. I¬ím not a fan of very high carbonation level, but it works quite well here, and it¬ís totally drinkable. Subtle bitterness upfront, nice bready malt backbone, quite chunky -almost wheaty- and flavourfull. Herbal, lemony and peppery aftertaste. Lively carbonation, medium body, slightly creamy texture. Surely my 2nd favourite tripel, after the Westmalle one. Great.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color dorado. Sabor a levadura, dulce, ligeramente citrico, especiado.

I¬íve had this on draft at least twice but didn¬ít rate it. This bottle from Leary¬ís in Amesbury. Pours out a hazy light honey color with a huge frothy-fizzy white head. Better after it airs out a while. Thick lace. Aroma of citrus, yeast and honey. Flavor is nice. Fruity with a complex yeast profile. Drying-slightly bitter finish. Very quaffable.

Bottle from N√µmme Comarket (¬Ä 2,90) in Sept 2014. Pours a very pale, bright yellow, I mean, it¬ís dark in the room but it almost seems to have a neon green glare. Head? Whopping, and white. Nice lacing. Nose... I had it sit still for a couple of minutes, then took a strong sniff and it nearly burnt my nostrils (not getting that effect when the head¬ís diminished). A great deal of alcoholic zing there, with a big presence of lemon biscuits or lemon drizzle cake, banana pudding... and a bit grainy and wheaty. Taste is at first sweet mellow wheat and malt, maybe even vanilla, then it builds up the lemon bitterness and the more spicier aspects. Dry, grainy palate. Body light to medium. Carbonation... quite high with loads of small prickly bubbles. Finish is a terribly enjoyable spicy and alcoholic warmth... I¬ím not exactly a fan of Tripels but I do tremendously appreciate this one.

Bottle. Waitrose. Hazy gold. Big, white head. Maybe the nucleator in the Tremens glass had a lot to do with this. Spicy, yeasty, honeyed banana. Some nice, buttery granary bread thing, too. Taste is sweet on the lips, then a little spicy dryness. Palate is soft and slick. Ends up sugary, with a light, lemon zest zing. Drank this with a lemon, apple, and honey polenta cake, and it complemented beautifully.

Als Belgisch bierliefhebber behoeft een tripel als deze natuurlijk weinig hulp om deze aan mij verkocht te krijgen. Telkens sta ik versteld van de manier waarop deze in de buurt kan komen van de ons allen bekende en beminde westmalle tripel. Bieren als deze maken van Belgi√´ een bierland. 

Dit is een bier dat iemand echt kan uitdagen, kan aanzetten tot proeven en blijven proeven. Zelfs als je er twee kort na elkaar drinkt zal je de tweede nog heel hard proeven, er zijn echt wel anderen in hun soort.
Always nice to order this on draught in the colossal goblet glass, as it pours beautifully and takes up plenty of room on the bar. An easy to drink tripel.

Bottle via SL... Looks like a nice brew. Big frothy head with a light yellow color. Nose of flowers, biscuit, bready with an over sweet honey nose. Taste is a sweet but dry tripel. The flowers stand out to me, followed by a light lemon, grass, honey, banana, and hay. Light hop presence. Super smooth, kind of dangerous considering its close to 9 percent. I should let a four pack age. Overall, great beer.

Transfer from BA review on 5-18-13-

 Pours from bottle into a chalice glass

 Appearance ¬ñ Upon pouring, the brew was a golden yellow color with a one finger pure white head and lots of carbonation seen streaming through the brew. The head fades relatively quickly, leaving a lighter level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell ¬ñ The aroma was of a grainy and lightly biscuit nature with some hints of yeast and orange peel. There are aromas of some candied sugar as well a little bit of spice and an herbal/haylike smell mixed within.

 Taste- The taste begins with a nice Belgian malt flavor and flavors of biscuit. Even though it is moderately dry upfront there are some hints of some orange sweetness with other sweeter candied sugar tastes. The orange dwindles more toward the middle as a lemon citrus taste takes it place. Yeast flavors come to the tongue at this time and bring with them some floral hop as well as some spice of clove and coriander. These flavors take the taste to its end, where the candied sugar then largely leaves the taste, with a bit of a herbal taste taking its place, to leave a clean and crisp malty and dry fruit flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel ¬ñ The body of the brew is on the thinner side with a carbonation level that is high with tons of tiny champagne like bubbles. The thinner body and higher carbonation are fantastic for the drier and fruity flavors of the brew and make for a truly fanatic feel and great drinkability.

 Overall ¬ñ Quite easy drinking and enjoyable. This is a very nice triple and renowned for a good reason.

Pours hazy with pale yellow hue. Very frothy, with white two finger head. High carbonation and very fruity, smelling high citrus and banana notes, detecting herbs, cloves and coriander. Very much like a witbeer, however not my favourite style of beer, but I did enjoy its creamy smoothness.

Mijn favoriete abdij-tripel. Een troebel geel bier met een creme-kleurige kraag. Het eerste wat opvalt als je het bier ruikt is citrus en hop. Very nice Belgian Abbey Tripel. Balanced sweetness and a nice bright character with a pleasant lingering finish.

Drink cold (10¬∞)
Eye: nice bottle/label. pours golden/copper with a nice long-lasting head with tiny bubbles. drips of very well on the glass, almost oily in its texture.
Nose: grains, bit spicy and alcoholic if you breath in too rapidly. 
Mouth: grains: wheat (foremost), hops, citrus fruits, some sort of buttery sweets.
Palate: due to its structure it seems a bit oily or even soapy. it rapidly feels dry in the throat.
Overall: smells and tastes like a witbeer, a good one though. I certainly like looking at this beer and this might also influence my judgement of the taste and so on. I¬íll certainly have this one again.

750ml green corked and caged bottle, label featuring a drawing of monks working on a field, poured into a Duvel Tulip. Appearance is cloudy straw colored with a huge thick beige head with good retention, that left some lacing on the glass when reduced. Aroma of banana, herbs, pears and a hint of lemon zest. Flavours of banana, spices, herbs, lemon zest and wheat bread. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, thick soft texture, lively carbonation. Bottle, 330 ml. Pours a golden straw colour with a good finger of soapy white head, very reminiscent of Duvel or Hoegaarden. Big cereal malt character to the aroma, sprinkled with notes of coriander, banana, citrus and some cheesy yeast. Taste takes on a very cereal-y character as well, strongly reminiscent of creamy porridge or rice pudding, behind which are notes of honey, caramel, vanilla, what might be some spices and a tiny yet noticeable citrus edge. Definitely not overly sweet despite the lack of a bitter aftertaste. Palate is pretty exceptional; very full body combining with the oily texture and creamy taste makes for a delightful mouth feel, with just a little bit of carbonation adding some addition texture. A most impressive brew that takes everything good about the likes of Hoegaarden and turns it up to 11!

On bottle @ GH nation (student pub), Uppsala, Sweden 20140730. Clear golden with huge head. Aroma of fruity hops and phenols. Taste is almond, phenols, spices, wheat. Creamy mouthfeel. Almost like a strong wit. Very nice!
Hazy golden color , nice white head. Floral, spicy aroma with notes of belgian yeast. Rich taste of belgian yeast , citrus , malt and spices. Moderate bitterness . Good hidden alcohol. Great beer.

Tripel Karmeliet pours golden with a haze from the yeasts, the white head is of medium-long lifetime and leaves beautiful lacing behind. The nose is massive, with notes of white pepper, citrus zests, strong milk tea, and muted yet recognizable note of vanilla interfering. The nose is phenomenal. The flavor starts off by displaying a generous amount of fruitiness and vinous characteristics, followed by caramel, creaminess, and aromatics of Earl Grey tea - as well as its astringency - on the mid-palate, whereupon the finish opens with spicy pepper and makes the transition into muscat, warming alcohol, and gentle hop bitterness. While complex, the flavor transition and mouthfeel are incredibly smooth and display all the subtleties one can reasonably ask for. What a delightful brew.
Pours hazy golden yellow with a big white head. Aroma - malts, yeast, flowers and some citrus. Sweet taste.

Bottle 0.33L.
Slightly hazy, deep golden body with a huge, creamy, white head, fully lasting with nice lacing; high density of tiny bubbles.
Moderate malty (grains) and hoppy (orange) aroma, with heavy notes of spices (coriander) and notes of peach and yeast.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet flavour with light-to-moderate bitter character in the finish. 
Medium body with oily texture; moderate carbonation; moderate-to-heavy alcoholic warming in the finish.

Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. This lovely beer pours a clear yellow with a beautiful white foam that lingers for quite a long time. Aroma is sweet and malty with citrus, clementine and peach constituting a nice fruity presence atop the malty baseline. A spicy yeast presence brings out some more flowery stuff, too. Banana seems to be traceable as well. It is mild on the palate with a well balanced sweetness that remains fresh and lightweight - because of the wheat and oats, I assume - with only a faint hint of bitterness at the end of its lasting finish. Some boozy warmth also finds its way somewhere in the middle, but not in the bad sense! Quite delicious and always a treat to enjoy!
Bottle 33cl. Lovely en full of life. Golden colour with huge white top which lasts long. Very rich and friendly aroma. Tastes fresh with some bitterness. Some banana and vanilla hints.

Color amarillo intenso, abundante espuma blanca que perdura, finas burbujas, aromas a fruta y levadura belga, en boca es especiada y refrescante, el alcohol est√° muy bien integrado, amargor casi inexistente dejando un agradable, largo y dulce pos gusto, muy completa y equilibrada cada trago es un placer.

The body has a golden color with a cloudy haze. Inside there are little bits of tasty yeast floaters. The head on top is tall, long lasting and bright whit in color. As I drink it leaves some spotty lacing on the glass. Right from the pop of the cap the aroma creeps out of the bottle. It has a bright nose with hints of lemon zest, fruity and funky Belgian yeast. The flavor has sweetness up front with complex grainy malt flavor and a hint of clover honey. The middle sees fruity and funky yeast and mellow warming alcohol taking over and drying out the overall character. It then finishes bone dry with only a hint of herbal hops. The palate is medium bodied with good carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2016 ASPETTO: se non versata tutta nel bicchiere, presenta un colore oro limpido, altrimenti e¬í un po¬í torbido. Si vedono salire tante bollicine, come champagne. Schiuma bianca non molto fine, abbondante e non molto persistente. 
AROMA: predomina l¬íerbaceo, unito a un leggero luppolato, ma il tutto bilanciato da un maltato gradevole.
GUSTO: maltato e fruttato (frutta gialla) di classe, non abbondante. Leggerissimo liquoroso che si avverte soprattutto nella parte finale del sorso. Mentre la bevuta continua, si percepisce un po¬í piu¬í del luppolato e dell¬íerbaceo di classe, ma mai predominanti. Retrogusto fruttato, abbastanza forte e persistente. Birra viscosa e corposa, che scivola benissimo sulla lingua, dalla carbonizzazione abbondante.

Birra perfetta. Si oresenta con una schiuma compatta e duratura, colore giallo acceso. L¬íaroma √® incantevole con un bouquet di fiori, vaniglia e frutta a polpa bianca. In bocca si avverte un piacevole sentore citrico che va a bilanciare ottimamente questa birra fino al, lunghissimo, retrogusto. L¬íalcool, seppur presente, rimane sempre non invasivo n√® fastidioso.

Golden color, thick yellowish foam, intense banana aroma. Tastes fruity, low bitterness.

From the corked, caged dark green bottle. Green is never an appealing thing for me to see. The pour is cloudy, unfiltered pale yellow leading up to a moderate white foamy head that slowly diminishes. Thankfully there is no skunkiness in that aroma of toasted malts, Belgian yeast, Belgian sugar, and light spice. The body is a lot heavier than the typical Tripel so I am not sure whether to rate that high or low. So I rate it 3 in the middle. The taste also brings out those roasted and toasted malts with yeast, vague sugar and spice and a light finish.
Tr√®s jolie couleur, belle tenue de mousse. Un gout incomparable et complexe.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

11.2 oz bottle - pours a transparent gold with big fluffy white head . Yeasty citrus aroma . High carbonation . Taste is of fruity esters , lemony / orange tartness with a sweet honey finish . Very complex , not usually a big tripel fan but this is outstanding . ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33 cl bottle shared two ways. Light hazy golden pour. Lots of yeast, spices, raisins and grains on the nose. Taste is yeasty with sweet honey, some herbal notes and light banana candy.
Golden coloured and very clear.lightly bitter, white foam, golden, medium body, average carbonation,

Pours golden with a white head. Light bitter fruity taste. Citrus, orange, caramel notes, hops. Nice fruity finish.

Bottle. Golden, clear with gushing, big head, which disappeared quickly.
Intense aroma of fruits (peach, apple), honey, candy sugar.
Beer is dry, with medium bitter finish, a bit alcoholic but quite pleasant.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste sweet, banana, belgian yeast. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.
