Sweet citrus fruity and malty, with some mandarin, lemon sherbet notes, lovely spices, nice acidity on the palate, this is a special brew. Lovely.
Soft, dry, spritzy, a very drinkable. A very solid example of what a tripel can & should be.
Clear, bright gold pour. 2 Finger sustaining head. Nose is toasted grains, Belgian yeast, and spice. Bitter. Middle is soft grains and citrus Finish is herbal and bitter. Good beer, many layers.
On tap at 3 sm√• rum GBG. Pours yellow with a small white head. Smells fruity, caramell malt, sweet hoppy. Tastes caramell malt, sweet hoppy and a bit parfume.

Golden color, clear body with frequent carbonation and a medium creamy white head. The nose is yeasty, spicy and fruity with some aroma¬ís of banana. The taste is bitter and fruity with flavours of oranges and bananas. Has a long nice yeasty aftertaste.

Clear golden color, slightly cloudy, with abundant white foam. Smell is citrusy and fruity, with hints of vanilla and sweet malts. The taste combines cereals, fruits and sweet malts and caramel. Very balanced.
In fles van 75cl. Mooi geel van kleur met een goede schuimkop. Licht bitter, Fruitig/kruidig van smaak.
Pours a hazy amber gold with a small white head. Smells of fruit, pear, bit of barn. Taste is sweet and mildly bitter - fruity yeast, biscuits.

Bottle. Pours a rather hazy light brown color with a ginormous white head on it. Nose is light and citrusy with just a hint of some clove in there as well as the traditional Belgian yeast. Taste is a bit sweet, and feels creamy despite the carbonation. Not bad.
Cloudy yellow appearance. Strong Belgian yeast aroma. Very complex taste. Some spiciness lots of sweetness from a high grain bill. Oat flavor in the background.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2014 330ml bottle, poured into Tripel Karmeliet over sized tulip. A: Very pale shade of golden, initial large head faded slightly, but the beer sat under a layer of foam for the duration, clear and fairly lively looking. S: Orange and yeast. T: Layers of orange, esters, yeast and zest, no real sign of the oats listed under ingredients. M: Light and crisp for the strength, had the smoothness the bottle promised, not overly carbonated. O: Less bitter than other tripels, but that could be put down to my changing palate which is growing accustomed to the style.

Bottle 33 cl.
Unclear yellow, with small white head. Sweet malty, yeasty citrus aroma. Flavour follows aroma perfectly. A true Belgian tripel.
Tap @ Taphouse, K√∂penhamn. Maltig och n√•got fruktig, kryddig med h√∂g s√∂tma. Avslutningen √§r torr och s√∂t med maltiga och kryddiga toner.

33 cl bottle. Cloudy, straw yellow color with long lasting small slowly diminishing head. Full fruity body with wonderful long taste. Alcohol doesn¬ít show in any other way but in superb structure. Very good in all aspects.

Bottled 0,33 and from tap. An amazing mix of abbey style ale, belgian white wheat and farmhouse ale. Golden colour, with a long foam, coriander and a bit banana smell, nice swetness but after the first taste, the alcohol remember you for the 8.4%, but in a balance with malty, yeasty taste. One of the best belgian beers I can find in Hungary, in my motherland.

Bottle pour. Cloudy golden with large creamy white head. Aroma is bread, banana, and vanilla. Medium body. Large bread taste that quickly moves to a lingering bitter taste. Not the worst beer, but much better abbey tripel styles are available.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 Bottle pour. Golden with a white fluffy head with mediocre lacing. Malty bready aroma with hints of banana and floral hops. Light in body and light carbonation that dances on the tongue. Initially sweet, but progresses to bitter quickly.

Pours cloudy gold with big head. Nose is fruits and spice. Taste is slightly sweet, bananas, clove, loads of coriander that dominates the palate. Very heavy spice mix, anise, caraway, licorice. Weird taste and not really my thing.

Bottle. Pours a grain collor yellow (slightly hazy), very, very generous foam head. I like the way the carbonation from the bottom tries to find its way to the top of the beer, really pretty. Smells like vanille infused citrus, touch of wheat and grains (fresh). Strong sweet kick to begin with, followed by a boozy kick (lingers a little bit in the back of the mouth), then the taste of sweet oats slowly sets in followed by a touch of sourness. Aftertaste is slightly creamy.

Note: had it from draft as well, not as nice in my opinion. Flavours are much less distinct and the beer even becomes a little watery.

375 from Brewer¬ís Haven.. Probably an old bottle from looking at the dust on it... Poured tonight into my CC Teku.. great off white head... okay lacing.

Light spicy/yet heavier clovey .. not enough fruity ester notes.. I really remember loving this one.. Should probably find time for the smaller bottles when I can.

Top Shelf Tripel..

Provided by J. Halket & drank with RD. This is a sensational beer! Pours to a rich head with a tingling foam. High carbonation works perfectly in the champagne bottle. Aroma of vanilla and zesty alcohol with sweet malt taste and a twist of bitter lemon. This beer has more of everything yet served with a good chill it slips down leaving you wanting much more.
Couldnt believe the head that poured out of this bottle, very floral and citrusy. Not much of a finish, nosr is better than the taste, but still pretty damn good

Very light golden. Highly carbonated with huge white head. Aroma of citrus, raspberry, redcurrant. Slightly sour. Better as it heated up.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a cloudy golden colour, with a thick frothy head. Gorgeous complex and hoppy aroma, matching its fruity and flowery flavour.

Bottle from drinkstore. Pours cloudy gold. Big foam head which thins away. Aroma is banana sweet bread, yeast and slight citrus. Flavour is dry sweet banana, bread, clove with a bitter lemon lift on finish from bubbles. Creamy mouthfeel, with full body. Nice beer.
U. Heel veel (te?) schuim. Niet troebel. G. Zuur & fruitig. S. Niet veel smaak, niet zuur, licht. M. Veel koolzuur. T. Valt tegen.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 Both 750 and 330 ml bottles, several times. Pours a bright golden/desert yellow, with a medium/large foamy head, which thickens out after a while. As soon as I approach the glass I smell that particular wheat/banana aroma, followed by a typical bread sweet maltiness. Citrus and hops are a bit present too, giving it a very complex aroma. Taste is even more articulated: it¬ís sweet, and you can taste so much that wheaty, almost blanche (belgian wit) flavour, followed by a strong citrus, fruit and yeast mid range notes, and a perfectly light bitter finish. Average carbonation, with an almost champagne feel and end notes; very refreshing, fruity and sophisticated finish. The wheat, the fact that it¬ís 3 grains, takes the tripel to another level, adding complexity and balance. Very sessionable in my opinion, and one of the must have belgians in the fridge. Awesome beer

On tap @ Blue Palms. Clear golden pour with a white head. Sweet pale malt and sugar. Candied orange peel, golden raisin, intense herbs, grass, white pepper, and fruity pebbles. Nice clove spiciness. Tastes of dried blueberry, candied orange, and sugar. Pale malt, lots of herbs, and a hint of weed. Lots of raisin, some pear, and clove.

Bottle from Waitrose, Rickmansworth. Poured a pale golden colour, with a massive white head and strong visible carbonation. Aroma of bread, dried fruit, spice and yeast. Full flavours of soft fruit, golden syrup and grain. Finish was apricot, cereal, yeast esters and just a ton of fruit. Classic for a reason.
Pours golden with huge white head. The aroma is nice and fruity. Very tasteful and natural. Beautiful belgian tripel
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow orange colour with a huge creamy off-white head. Sweet aroma of malt, fruit and some yeast. Sweet citrus flavor, malt, spices and slightly bitter finish.
Belgium goes all in. Bitter, sweet, malty, thick, vanilla, banana, citrus and dry. A lovely beer.
Amazing mix of vanilla, fruits, malt and caramel in it¬ís aroma. Full creamy body. Pleasant not too yeasty aftertaste
roasty, resin, raisin, amber, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, lively

Wow we got a gusher here, bottle has exploded upon opening the bottle, when poured its a pale yellow with a fizzy white head , aroma is classic Belgium banana, big orange pith with to Lemony notes, taste is much Same with an initial sweetness which balances the sour note really well, really clean finish
Big big banana flavors. Rich and creamy mouthfeel. Really enjoyed this on tap at barley johns.
Hazy golden color , nice white head. Floral, spicy aroma with notes of belgian yeast. Rich taste of belgian yeast , citrus , malt and spices. Moderate bitterness . Good hidden alcohol. Great beer.

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized foamy off white head. The aroma and flavor have Belgian yeast, sweet honey, floral notes, lemon citrus, candi sugar, peach/apricot fruitiness, and pale grainy malts. Medium bodied.Solid drinking tripel no doubt.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet.
Very pale blaond. True to type, fruity, yet dry. Soft, round, the alcohol is well hidden. Peaches, a little barnyard.
Bottle at Pivo, Oulu. Colour cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruitsl, citrus, Belgian yeast, spices, and malts. Pretty Amazing.
Tap at Happy Gnome. Pours clear golden with very little head. Nose is belgian yeast. Taste is sweet belgian candy sugar.
Una de mis cervezas favoritas, por no decir la que mas. Sin duda una explosi√≥n de sabores a frutados, de un color excelente. En boca parece una macedonia efervescente. Refrescante y genial.

Golden beer with an firm lasting white head. Yeast, citrus and bread combined with a creamy mouthfeel and high carbonation. The high alcohol is almost unnoticeable. The high carbonation makes that this beer doesn¬ít grow overwhelming. Very good triple.

Delightful, refined. Even better when served in Tripel Karmeliet glassware. One of my top 10 favorite beers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Still one of my favorites. Beautiful and complex in taste, alcohol not overpowering (don¬ít drink six). Color and aroma wonderful, and in its distinctive glass, always a treat

Pours a golden, cloudy with fragments of yeast in the glass. A superb creamy, foamy head that is persistant and leaves an attractive lace like effect at the top of the glass. An aroma of hops and yeast. Smooth bitter taste with very discrete alcohol. Altogether an excellent brew. Cheers to the Carmelites!
Mooie goudkleur, weinif wit schuim. Ruikt heerlijk, beetje naar boter. Smaakt fantastisch, beetje bitter. Wel wat veel koolzuur.

This is very nice indeed, I see why it is so highly rated. 750 ml. bottle poured into a large wine glass. Beautiful pour of deep gold with a copious white head that leaves artistic lacing. Aroma is fruity and spicy, with lemon, banana, and orange blossoms standing out along with hay and bread aromas. The taste really hits you with the tart citrus, mostly lemon, and complex Belgian yeast bouquet. Dry and somewhat sour, yet well balanced. Very refreshing, rich, and complex, with the right amount of alcohol presence. Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, and slightly sour and bittersweet finish. Has a nice grain presence in the nose and mouthfeel to balance the fruitiness and the sour. Probably the best Belgian tripel I¬íve had so far.

Poured from the bottle. Huge head. Cloudy golden yellow. Smells of yeast, orange peel, peach. Taste is wheat, yeast and bubbles up front. Transition to creamy, bready, lemon finish. Finish is fairly crisp with not too much lingering finish. Nice beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: beautiful belgian yeast, peach, a bit honey, Appearance a bit hazy, yellow with quickly disappearing head. Taste: some banana, peach, a bit of alcohol. Very drinkable and well ballanced. A bit too much carbonation.
Light colour and bubbly white head. Poured in a trappistes rochefort glass. Quite fresh, almost citrus taste that hides well the alcohol. Acid palate. Quite bubbly in the mouth too.
Pure gold, persistent creamy top, vanilla, banana, full body, some citrus, long finish. The commercial description really says it all
golden hazy color, creamy white head, aroma of banana and citrus with strong citrus retro-olfaction, medium sweetness, medium creamy body with short finish, fantastically fresh

Slightly hazy yellow in glass. Nose is sweet with apple and pear. Slightly bitter in taste, with more of that apple peel and pear, as well as some breadiness. Picked up very slight clove. Dry finish. Very enjoyable and a great tripel.

This beer is one of my favorite beers of all time. It is definitely the best triple on the market. The taste, aroma, and fluffy white head are fantastic and fit the style perfectly . One of my all time go to session beers

One of the most famous Belgian triple, in worldwide distribution and a must have for a beer styles explorer. Apart from this fact it¬ís also a high quality product and I enjoyed every single drop of it. Class!

Light yellow looks with big fluffy head on top. Some lacing is there too. Aroma has typical yeast aromas, spices, some fruits also. Taste has spices, yeast, lemon, some fruity flavors and warming alcohol in the end. Very high carbonation and full body. I think I¬ím not that into tripel as a style.
The pale golden colour is not as interesting as in Quadrupels. The head is very creamy. The initial sharp taste quickly becomes pleasently honey-like.
Bottle. Slightly cloudy yellow with thick white head. Belgian aroma. Taste is amazing and complex. Floral and fruity, banana and vanilla and a delicious soft creamyness. Lovely.
Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une bi√®re tr√®s sucr√©e avec du candy, tr√®s parfaite mais trop bien faite pour √™tre vraiment honn√™te, je suis pas fan du tout
Draft pour. Golden. A lot of fruit and banana on the aroma. Kinda soapy too. Different. Banana and licorice on the taste. Sweet finish. I can enjoy this.

On tap at Pangaea. Nice thick white head. Straw colour. Nice lacing. Aroma is typical Belgium, spicy, maybe banana. Flavor is also banana but very clean, no graininess like some. Very clean smooth palate.
Golden with a thick creamy white head and some thin lacing. Aroma is citrus, spices, herbs and alcohol. Taste is banana, some alcohol, sweet malts and a grassy, dry finish.

I don¬ít get the deal with this beer. Sweet and has a spicy note of pepper. But I get this weird slightly almost meaty quality. I¬íve had probably five bottles at high freshness. It¬ís not awful and I know I¬ím predisposed against the style. But blah.
Golden pour with a white head, bit of a fruity aroma with sweet taste of banana and wheat, with a light bitterness. Very good
cereal, floral, alcohol, pale, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, lively, long finish,

Bottle. Poured a lovely deep gold with a medium white head, decent lacing. Aroma is citrus, vanilla, some herbs, cloves. Flavour is sweet light malts, citrus, spice. finish is dry, slightly bitter. Excellent.
Color dorado p√°lido, espuma blanca. Aromas afrutados de manzana verde. En boca tiene densidad media y refrescante con sabor dulce y afrutado y final amargo equilibrado algo seco. Muy rica.
Een heerlijke, rijke smaak. Citrus, lichte hop. Fris. Plaatje om te zien, met een lichte schuimkraag en een gouden kleur.
Maravilha n√£o me enj√¥o de tomar essa.cerveja.... Espuma alta e resistente sabor uma mistura c√≠trica floral intenso nem consiguimos sentir √°lcool em um final longo!!! Coisa fina minha favorita!

Gli rovino la media e metto in discussione il suo primo posto tra le Abbey Tripel? Me ne far√≤ una ragione; questa √® una tripel situata troppo sul confine dello stile, mescola caratteri di Blanche ed addirittura di Waiss (per via dell¬íassurda scelta dei tre cereali...).
Colore Oro sul paglierino, schiuma abbondante ma con perlage a bollicine medio/grandi, odori di frutta e fiori di campo.
Non ho trovato mai punte di amaro nel suo gusto che rimane dolce e fruttato dall¬íinizio alla fine, retrogusto compreso. Forte, secondo me, la componente agrumata.
L¬íalcool c¬í√® e da una senzazione piacevole ma, assecondando i miei (forse un po¬í grezzi) gusti, la prossima volta mi diriger√≤ su ben altre tripel, con la De Dolle Dulle Teve in testa... ----- The spoil the mean and put question his place among the first Abbey Tripel? I will make a right, this is a tripel located on the border of too much style, blending characters of Blanche and even Waiss (because of the absurd choice of the three cereals ...).
Gold color on the straw, foam filling but with perlage in sparkling medium / large, smells of fruit and flowers.
I have never found bits of bitter taste that remains in its sweet and fruity start to finish, including aftertaste. Strong, in my opinion, the citrus component.
Alcohol and there is a nice feeling, but pandering to my (perhaps a bit ¬írough) taste, next time I will direct you on many other tripel, with De Dolle Dulle Teve favored ...
Golden-bronze body, complex and fresh flavour of grain with touches of citrus and vanilla.

a beer with a nice golden colour. a good creamy and easy to drink beer.i like it more on tap then from the bottle.it has a sweetness and lightly bitter taste and add the high alcohol it¬ís dangerous to drink to much

Blonde, cloudy, 3 finger head, moderate carbonation. Spice notes hit you initially and throughout the glass in a very gentle way. Smells of clove and citrus, but taste is subtle. A bright, refreshing finish with honeysuckle on the back of the tongue.
Just the right amount of carbonation flowing gently through the palate.
Really clean and crisp beer. Well integrated flavors complementing each other with no one specific flavor dominating.
bottle. golden with one finger head. sweet and fruity tripel with excellent flavor and complexity.

Bottle, bit of a gusher. Nice hazy yellow with a huge white head. Aroma: Lots of citrus, but in a subtle way in caramel malts, some pepper. The head initially hides a bit of booziness. Marzipan sweetness, nice bitter, slight sour, great creamy mouthfeel. Somehow these words don¬ít do justice to this excellent tripel.
pale golen colour with no head, hoppy lager aroma, with a complex strong malty hoppy syrupy taste this was very nice excellent beer
The champagne of beer. gassy but fantastic foreplay. Like a book you can¬ít put down. Like no other I have tasted to date. New favorite beer

Aroma: massive citrus fruits, caramel malts. Appearance: clear gold, small white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: citrus sweets, caramel again, low carbonation. Overall: very nice. Bottle at The Champion, Bayswater.

Botella de 330ml. Copa Tulipa amplia de Tripel Karmeliet. Color oro brillante y apariencia cristalina. Espuma blanca, corona muy tupida y persistente. Aromas de levadura Belga, az√∫car, herbal intenso, cereal p√°lido, sutil fen√≥lico y az√∫car de ca√±a con trazos c√≠tricos, de vainilla y esteres. La entrada es chispeante con sabores de maltas dulces redondeados por un toque de pimienta y agradable amargor afrutado. Cuerpo medio/pleno y carbonataci√≥n moderada aunque vivaz. Paladar aterciopelado, voluptuoso y denso con notas de especias. El ABV se percibe como una agradable y azucarada sensaci√≥n. Frescor herbal y de pan en el intermedio. Final dulce y prolongado que persiste en el retrogusto afrutado ¬ñpera y albaricoque- con toques de vainilla. Refrescante y deliciosa!!
330ml bottle. Tripel Karmeliet large Tulip glass. Bright gold color & clear appearance. White foam, very close & lasting crown. Belgian yeast, sugar, intense herbal, pale cereal, subtle phenolic & cane sugar aromas as well as citric, vanilla & estery hints. Sweet malty & sparkling upfront rounded by spicy touch & gentle fruity bitterness. Medium to full body. Moderate but lively carbonation. Velvet palate, voluptuous & dense with spiced notes. ABV is felt as a kind & sugary heat. Crisp herbal & bready freshness in the middle. Long sweet finish lingers in a fruity aftertaste ¬ñ peach & apricot- with vanilla touches. Refreshing & delightful!!

Giant white head, clear yellow, pale color. Aromas of warm, crisp yeast, going along with hints of fresh hops and spices. 

Medium-bodied, defined by yeast, fresh supporting carbonation, and perfect fitting spiciness of cloves, a little pepperiness with citrus peel. Still, this beer is surprisingly refreshing without loosing its decent complexity. Yeast becomes even fluffier, softer as the beer warms up, spices get a little sharper, creating an even more complex body. Spiciness varies between, sweet, sharp, bitter - in that order, leaving a warm feeling in the stomach. Aftertaste is still very smooth, toffeeish, sweet malts, and still spices.
Nice fresh beer. Three different grains. Almost like a weissbier but tasty. Recommended.

33cl bottle @ home. Hazy golden color, strong creamy snow-white head, beautyful. Aroma slight citrus and apple, raw vegetable in the nose, flavor is fruity, citrus and apple again, cereal, leaves, leather. Taste light sweetness, lightly bitter, also umami and salt which is well noticable but not that disturbing. Alcohol is just present but goes quickly into the brain. Medium to full body, sticky and creamy texture, lively carbonation, fruity finish with some bitterness, refreshing. Interesting but not really my style.
Bi√®re vraiment exceptionnelle, √† mon gout l¬íune des meilleurs bi√®res blondes belges. D√©gage beaucoup d¬íar√¥mes et au prix "abordable"
Vraiment une bonne bi√®re qui rafra√Æchie les notes de c√©r√©ales sont parfaite un go√ªt subtil une bi√®re parfaite en somme.
Draft @Bierhuyske (tasting glass). Pours clear golden with white foam. Aroma is fruity. Taste bit sweet, fruity, metal. Dry aftertaste.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2016 Rich honey aroma, taste a bit too sweet. Medium carbonation. Color light yellow, hazy liquid. Nice one.

Re-rate 6.2.2016. - Bottle at Cvajner in Pula, Cro. Hazy yellow liquid with average head. Strong smell of corianeder and a hint of honey. Medium body, medium to heavy carbonation. Taste of coriander, flowers, a hint of honey.

Draft at Taste Of Belgium in OTR on February 28, 2014. Medium gold hue, big fruity/somewhat vinous nose; slick, almost slippery texture, complex fruity flavor with sufficient balancing bitterness, has a refined character. Very fine beer.

330ml bottle from Tallinn. pale yellow somewhat hazy colour, huge rocky white mostly vanishing head, good lacing. Heavily malty aroma of caramel, grain, vanilla, peach, moderate citrusy hops, pepper and a hint of cloves. Taste is initially quite sweet with a bit of acidity but it nicely gives way quite fast to a bittersweet and slightly sour finish with a hint of alcohol. UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 75 cL bottle poured into a goblet. Immediately, a very full, floral aroma with some doughy undertones hit the nose. There¬ís a light, mellow, astringent quality too. After a little while, the classic banana and clove combination spring forth and dominate the aroma, but there are some undertones of vanilla, peach and lemon with a bit of grass and seltzer water. This one starts out a clear, sparkling yellow with a light, soft, pillowy, sudsy (active) head that leaves a light lacing along the glass. As I neared the end of the bottle, and the un-fermented sediment, the beer became more hazy. It¬ís hits the tongue with a mild sweetness, medium bitter, and light sour with some mild astringency. It¬ís a very creamy and smooth beer with a medium to medium-full body (more medium at the start, gets fuller with more un-fermented proteins). It¬ís a very fizzy, above average carbonation that starts with a combination of sweet citrus and dark dried fruits as well as some light caramel and/or butter notes and some spice. It becomes a bit toasty and dry at the finish, where the astringency pops up, and is accompanied by a light alcohol warmth at the swallow. It leaves behind a dry aftertaste that lingers and is composed of bananas, lemons, cloves, and biscuits.
.75l bottle. Clear and golden pour. Hazy finish. Fruity (peach) and balanced. Great beer.

Bottle bier huis ossett. Hazy yellow colour good white head + lacing. Aroma is yeast , banana, lemon. Taste is wheat some creamy banana citrus and spice. Good body and mouthfeel quite strong carbonation. A good beer easy to drink despite high abv.
Very nice tripel. Very minimalist and great on the palate. not too overpowering for a dinner beer.

Pale yellow, big fluffy head. Citrus, yeast, banana, coriander, spices. Medium sweetness, light bitterness, some sourness as well. Alcohol comes through slightly. One of the best tripels around and my personal favourites.

Spicy aroma with an overt wheat support. Hazy deep gold with a white head that does not linger. Solid fruity esters on the flavor, with a lemon background. Yeast presents a chewy counter to the other flavors.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2014 A cloudy straw yellow color with a big frothy white head - lasts long too. Aroma has a solid Belgian barnyard theme: fruits, yeast, grass and some herbal, peppery spiciness. Taste is initially sweetish but later drier. It is on the whole very fruity and also a bit spicy, in a typical herbal and peppery style. The rich fruitiness, spices  and yeasty elements are well present. The palate is round, full and smooth - nearly perfect. The carbonation seems a bit high though. Solid, delicious Belgian tripel.

330ml bottle at home. Pours clear pale gold, massive white head, jumping out the glass. Aromas are cereal, fresh orange, lemon peel, fresh coriander. Taste has a soft bitterness, and gentle sweetness. Creamy texture, clean zingy finish. Grand as owt.

Posee un carb√≥nico bastante pronunciado que resulta chispeante y agradable en lengua.

Su sabor es envolvente, debido a la amplia gama de cereales empleados junto a la malta y el l√∫pulo, sorprende al estar perfectamente combinados en una cerveza gustosa a la par que compleja puesto que se debe mantener un poco en boca cada sorbo para degustar completamente lo que es capaz de ofrecernos esta espumosa.

Fizzy with small bubbles, golden yellow. Nice balance, creamy with vanilla and subtle banana flavors, dry with clean finish

√Ä 8.4% d¬íalcool, cette bi√®re de trois grains d¬íun jaune √©clatant offre une mousse tr√®s g√©n√©reuse. Effervescence visible. Nez de levure, de coriandre et d¬íagrumes. Tr√®s sucr√© comme bouquet. En bouche, c¬íest √©galement fruit√© et sucr√©. Excellent! Traces de miel, d¬íagrumes et d¬íoranges qui donnent un r√©sultat spectaculaire. Cheers!

Tripel Karmeliet has a medium, fizzy, root beer-like, somewhat off-white head and a mostly clear, yellow-golden appearance, with lots of tight bubble streams and not much lacing left behind. The beer did not really cloud up when I swished & poured in the bottom contents. Aroma is of sweet, bready, grains, candied fruit, banana, sourness, a hop zing, and banana peel. Flavor is of banana, coriander, bread, sweetness, candied fruit, banana puree, some hop bitterness, and a background grain husk that one gets with a high-gravity malt liquor, such as St. Ides HG. I also noticed a metallic note in the foam, which was oddly reminiscent of Red Dog from a can. Mouthfeel is medium and prickly, and Tripel Karmeliet finishes mostly dry, crisp, champagne-like, and easy going. Although the alcohol does not present itself in the taste, I could feel it in my head with only half the bottle consumed. Overall, this is a most excellent and strange beer. RJT

Bottle from Waitrose. Pours a slightly hazy straw colour with a bubbly white head. Nice aroma and, despite the fact that the heavy yeasty, medicinal, wheaty, bubblegum thing isn¬ít my favourite, its not too much. Really full mouthfeel - very foamy, very sticky. Tastes good - all of the above with a touch of banana and a fair amount of spiciness, and lemon, and booze. Pretty tasty.
An interesting tripel. I¬íve not heard of one made with oats and wheat before. Pours a bit cloudy and tastes belgian, but seems atypical for a tripel. Dry. Hint of sweetness. Grain and fruit.

Pours intense cloudy yellow with huge rocky, sustainable top, light lasing but very long lasting foam layer. Aroma intense balanced mix between aroma hopping and malt sweetness, fullness. Although must admit that seems to me there is not only barley malt but come corn or rice too. Fruity esters as well, a bit pineapple spicy as well. Taste is pleasant sweet with well balanced bitter from hopping, spicy mouthfeel s well. Medium dry finish, close to full body,thick-slicky texture, average carbonation, long bitter sweet finish. Pure pleasure in this Tripel, like hopping level - for this style it is above average for sure.

Tap. Hilpe√§ Hauki. Pours clear gold whit a low head. Aroma: grassy hops. Pale malt. Taste: medium plus sweetness. Some bitterness. Grass flavors. Palate: medium body. Fruity aftertaste. Good.

I find this a bit on the sweeter side than I normally like from a tripel, but this still has lots of great flavour. Lots of citrus, bananas, all kinds of fruit in here. Has a nice dry, crisp finish to it that reminds me a lot of a good saison.

Had this beer so many times before in Belgium , but this is my first time rate. This has long been my favourite Triple and this bottle from Waitrose does not disappoint. Pours bright golden with white head. Aroma is malts, yeast, spices. Taste is the same with nice alcohol warmth at the end. Very spicy, very malty, medium body, well balanced. Nice tripel.
Pours big white fluffy head. Lots of citrus on the nose including lemon and spices. Pretty complex, lots of flavours including spicey lemon at first and some sweet malts to round it off.

22oz bottle. Pours an opaque golden with a big, frothy white head that dissipates quickly to a cap. A lot of carbonation. Aroma is very fruity and floral. Grapes, citrus hops, yeast and malt. A slight spicy undertone. Mouth is very yeasty with a strong presence of grape. Reminds me almost of a sparkling white wine.

Head: big, white, creamy and persistent. Colour: golden, gets slightly hazy as you get to the bottom of the bottle. Aroma: strong fruity, grapes, flowers, earthy, something acidic too, yeast, if you pour it hazy. Has quite a bit of carbonation which affects the palate. Taste: fruity, grapes, spicy, somewhat bitter. A spicy, zesty after-taste. Medium body. Not as dry as other tripels, which I like. Great beer!

33cl. Pours hazy yellow with a huge lasting white head. A bit acidic. Aroma is sweet malty with some hints of alchool . Flavour simply explodes in your mouth, sweet, malty, some citrus,  nice bitterness in the end and some alchool but perfectly balanced . Absolutely fantastic tripel.

No bottling information.
Appearance: The body is a slightly hazy golden to amber with a towering white head that dissipates unevenly and looks fizzy and thin instead of dense. The retention is great.
Aroma: The aroma is a bit spicy with some lemon. This may be light struck, I¬ím not sure. It smells more like a saison than a tripel.
Taste: Sweet malts, into a complex blend of sweet lemon, sugar, spice, banana and cloves. Great beer.
Palate: Creamy body with high carbonation</br>
Overall: The aroma is throwing me off, but this is pretty great to drink. Light, complex and refreshing. I would love to try this on tap where there¬ís no fear of light struck qualities.
Very nice foam after pouring. Aroma of citrus, yeast, malt and alcohol. Medium bitterness, quite carbonated.

Poured from 75cl bottle. Hazy gold color with fluffy white head. Has a lovely floral, citrus aroma. The texture is highly carbonated and creamy. The flavor is a perfect balance of fruits ( maybe oranges and peaches), coriander spice, alcohol, hops bitter. It has everything you want in a triple. One of the best.

Great stuff! This pours a hazy yellow with a foamy head and is a refreshing drink... lots of floral and citrus flavors with a solid wheat backbone. I was lost impressed by the palate though. Every sip was light, airy, and foamy... thanks in no small part to an excellent pour.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow with a huge frothy white head and lots of carbonation. Aroma of hops and yeast. Sweet fruity and hay-like taste with notes of citrus. Surprisingly full mouthfeel for such a...harmlessly looking trippel. :-) Very fresh and one I can drink again.
Birra molto carbonata con schima poco persistentre, non molto beverina. Aromatica e molto secca, ricorda pi√π uno spumante che una birra. Discreta, non la mia preferita.

Medium gold, clear, persistent white head, fine bubbles.  Pils malt aroma, also some fruit (pears, strawberries) and low spicy phenols in the nose.  Flavor of pilsner malt, light earthy spice, restrained pepper, fruity notes of pear.  Medium bodied, effervescent carbonation, silky smooth and easy drinking.  More fruity than spicy/phenolic.
Bottle at Man in the Moon. Hazy orange colour with a large off-white head. Aroma is sweet orange, malt. Flavour is orange, malt, spices, sweet fruity.

Bottle at The Speaker. It pours golden with a thick white head. The nose is earth, dough, hay, floral, light fruitiness and spice. The taste is hay, floral, light herbal, apple, fresh pear, nectarine, dough, earth, touch of bitterness, underlying alcohol warmth with a dry, crisp finish. Med-full body, effervescent carbonation and velvety mouth-feel. Good depth of flavour. I often find triples too sweet, but this example has the balance spot-on. A classic.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2013 Golden clear, colour with a big white frothy head. Soapy and fruity aroma. The taste is sweet, a little caramel, banana and vanilla. Very fizzy. A bit too sweet for me. C really liked it though.

Clear yellow. Fine fruity earthlike notes. Plenty of carbonation. Dry and sharp peppery. Best as a tripel can get.

Bottle @ home. Profumo di cereali come ci si aspetterebbe, con un sentore fruttato (banana e agrumi) e dolce. Colore ambrato piuttosto opaco con schiuma di consistenza cremosa non persistente. Al palato √® di poco corpo, secca e poco carbonata.  Bella sensazione in generale, per via del finale astringente che non stanca mai. Aroma: coriander, citrus, yeast, malty notes, peach, grass?; Appearance: golden, little hazy, big white long-lasting foam: Taste: medium+ sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour; Palate: medium body, oily/creamy feel, quite lively carbonation (yet quite "smooth" feel), long dry finish; Overall:  great in every way, strong yet refreshing, highly drinkable but better as a sipper. Great.
aroma of citrus, golden clear beer with a white frothy head, light sour and spicy, creamy body with an average carbonation and a long finish

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear yellow like apple juice with a huge head. Aromas of yeast, cloves, coriander, and lemons. Fruity flavors of citrus, spice, honey, peaches and light malts. Dry finish. Yummy.
July 2010. From bottle. Poured golden yellow with a fizzy white head. The carbonation is somewhat high. Grassy and citrusy notes. Dry finish. Excellent beer.
Hace tiempo que tengo debilidad por esta cerveza con una solida base de cereal y mucho caracter belga.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2013 Large white head, golden clear colour, definitely a citrus smell with some sweet notes, high carbonation citrus hints medium bitter creamy taste a bit dry
Citrus, vanilla, raisin, leaves, alcohol, grass, herbs, floral, dough, banana, bread, vanilla
Lite fr√§sch doft. Mycket maltig smak. Alkoholen k√§nns ej bara smakb√§rare. Nja r√§tt s√∂t. Inte helt tokig √∂l p√• sommaren.
Bottle at home, 6th April 2013. Nice flavour, lots of yeast, a few floaters in the bottle, nice, but I am not mad on the style

Hazy yellow with a thick lasting frothy white lacing head. Aroma is wheat, citrus, herbal hops, hay, fruit esters, orange peel. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body, light texture, lively carbonation. Light sweet and dry finish with hay and wheat.

1,5L bottle, 2013.
Appearance: clear blonde beer, little carbonation visible, stable white head.
Nose: oranges, sugars, hops, lots of grain.
Taste: sweet, grain, sharp aftertaste.
Very enjoyable beer, especially in a 1,5L bottle and best enjoyed very young in my opinion.

Superbe triple !
Riche et complexe en ar√¥mes, citron, fleurs et caramel. Une superbe rondeur et un tr√®s bon √©quilibre en font une tr√®s bonne triple.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy light golden with airy white head. Complex aroma of malt with distinct flowery and fruity notes. Sweet, caramellish and malty flavour, gradually giving way to bitter, hoppy notes. Dry finish. Very, very good.
My favourite tripel! Very nice balance the swettness and bitterness. Taste of spices, herbs and lemon.
Amazing sensations when I opened that beer. Always made me happy!!
0,33l bottle. Very nice tripel with golden color. I smell yeast, bread and some fruit. Tastes sweet.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Great triple. My favorite with Zeezuiper.Beautiful beer, pale to golden, hazy liquid and a white head. It smelled like lemon, citrus and herbs. It tasted real good. Light bitter. Light body, sticky texture and a lively carbo.
enormous thick soft head, very nice, big spicy aroma with some sour fruits... bitter sweet, great balance, huge body... pretty sick tripel, reminds me of chouffe, but much more heavy
Botella. Presencia espectacular. Aroma maltas, levadura y como una cerveza de trigo. En boca maltosa y bien compensada seca final algo de regaliz

One of my favorite tripels! Pours a slightly hazy light golden with a thick white head. Aroma of citrus, coriander, herbs, earth and bretta (?). Taste is sweet, slightly boozy, yet refreshing and light with just a hint of sour bitterness to balance the alcohol. It¬ís the perfect blend between a wheat and a tripel!
UPDATED: MAR 26, 2013 Tasty. Drinks away easily despite the 8.5%. Light yellow color and citrus hints. Smooth and good drinkable.

This  beer is fantastic.  Pours pale cloudy yellow with a foamy head.  Aroma is fruity, floral, Banana, vanilla.  Taste is slightly fruity, Banana and really delicious.  According to the label it has won the following awards:  World Beer Cup: Gold Medal; World Beer Championship: Exceptional Belgian Tripel; European Beer Star: Gold; World Beer Awards: Worlds Best Ale

Appearance: Hazy yellow-gold with white head.
Aroma: Citrus - almost pilsner like.
Flavor: Malty, minerally with noticeable alcohol.
Palate: Light, dry effervescent.
Overall: very day and crisp for style.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2014 Aug 2012 - Bottle at room temp.  Good beer - balanced, lightly carbonated, subtle but distinct flavours,  Would have again. (4.0)
May 2014 - Bottle from 2012 - decided to see how it aged.  Very large foamy head (more head than liquid to start with).  Sparkling clear orange.  Aroma - strong lemon, yeast, brown sugar, musty wheat.  Body is medium, touch of carbonation, very foamy.  Taste is fairly alcoholic, mild esters, straw, a bit earthy yet sweet, bit of alcopop.  Held up pretty well, but better fresh. (3.7)

Crisp and smooth. Definitely one of the best wheat-blonde beers I have ever tasted.  Selection from the bat cave. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear yellow with a big time soapy head. Aroma has some citrus notes in it as well as the Belgian yeast, and it has a slight butteriness to it. Flavor is packed with spices and some lemon zest, along with the Belgian yeast rounding it all out. Carbonation is just like that of most tripels I¬íve tried. THIS is the champagne of beers, and any beer connoisseur must have this at least once. CHEERS!

Bottle from keg. Golden amber with med-lge head. Smells..yeasty banana, wheat, some malt, some citrus. Tastes..wheat and fruits, banana, malts, some spice at the end. Have not had one for years, so good, thanks Belgium.
750ml Bottle at Avenue Pub in New Orleans. Pours a golden color with a lot head that takes some time to settle. Citrusy and cloves. A wonderful triple.
Golden yellow with a large white head. I smell yeast, bread, and light fruits. I taste banana, sweet white bread, fruits, and malt. Just wonderful!!!!

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Awesome Belgian with a unique and tasty malt bill. Very crisp palate. Really enjoy this one.

Bottle from Belgianshop. Thick orange color, white head. Bitter/sour taste with citrus, earthy notes, orange peel, ripe fruits and grass. Nicely balanced body, mostly malts. Dry, a bit sweet finish with citrus and grass. Excellent tripel.

A golden yellow with a huge long lasting white creamy he¬íd on the pour into a chalice. Aroma and Taste of Belgian yeast, bread, a nice ripe fruity bouquet, with some nice citrus mildly spicy fruity hops. A medium bodied ale, crisp with lively carbonation and sweet dry spicy hops on the palate. Finish is sweet biscuit malt, Belgian yeast,  bread, citrus apple fruity notes with some flavorful spicy fruity hops bitterness for balance. Overall a excellent, flavorful and enjoyable ale. Very nice indeed.
Had served in the proper chalice and my, was this beer glorious. Without doubt one of the best that I have tasted.

12/03/2013 330ml bottle. Dorata pallida, leggermente spenta e appena torbida, schiuma bianca brillante, abbondante e persistente. Al naso esteri, banana, lievito, spezie, malto. In bocca malto, lievito, ancora frutta, sbilanciata sul dolce e stucchevole gi√† dopo i primi sorsi. Corpo medio, carbonazione leggera. Si gran lunga sopravvalutata.
Bonne bi√®re. superbe couleur ambr√©e et mousse onctueuse. Fruit√©e et douce. Peu d¬íamertume. un chou√Øa (trop)sucr√©e.

Tripel are one of my favorite styles. This beer lives up to its name, but not as smooth and a little to much banana taste. Enjoyed a bottle at Mastro's in Phoenix. Not worth the 16 I paid, but worth a try if you can find it cheaper.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

33cl bottle. Sparkling golden beer, huge frothy head. Really fresh aroma has sweet orange peel, coriander, herbal and floral hop notes, banana and slightly peppery yeast. Whiffs of light candi sugar too. Slightly sweet and caramelly flavor, slightly grainy malts, apricoty fruitiness and balancing herbal hoppiness. Lingering pils malt flavor. Finishes somewhat dry with spicy yeastiness. Not a trace of alcohol. Velvety texture. Karmeliet is just so delicious that its slight sweetness is tolerable.
Light yellow golden w dense white head. Sweet maltx aroma. Really harmonic sweet malty taste. A perfect blonde belgian strong
Bottle at Sybarite Pig. Pretty golden yellow with thin head. No lace. Aroma vanilla and light citrus. Taste of vanilla, lemmon, apricot and wheat. Vanilla on palate as well as bread. Nice beer.

This beer has a cloudy gold color. It has an almost sweet smelling aroma. It is a little spicy and is pretty complex. It has a nice finish which isn't overpowering. It doesn't have a sting alcohol taste for the percentage it is. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a brilliant gold with a huge white head that lasts forever. Aroma is pear, orange, pepper, and banana. Taste is banana, wheat, lemon, peppery spice, and fruity esters. Medium creamy body with excellent carbonation.
Soft mild sweet nose. Pale head. Golden clear color. Soft malty and fruity full filled taste. Avereage hops. Warming alcohol.
Bottle 33 cl. Pear and vanille at the nose. Nice golden, white soft and persistent head. One of my favourite tripel.
Drank at the.buitenlust.. from bottle in glass.. large white dense head stayed on decent time.. smell grass also in taste some malts 2... overall very decent beer

Pale hazy golden colour, medium creamy white head with nice lacing. Aroma is wheat, yeast, banana, a bit spicy and floral. Taste has wheat and yeast too, with some caramel, vanilla and citrus notes, initially sweet with smooth dry and gently bitter finish. Medium body and fizzy carbonation, alcohol is well hidden. Delicious beer, nicely balanced and very enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2016 Bottle. Hazy yellow with a thick lasting frothy white lacing head. Aroma is wheat, citrus, herbal hops, hay, fruit esters, orange peel, vanilla, fruity bubblegum. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body, light texture, lively carbonation. Light sweet and dry finish with hay and wheat. Soft and fruity, drinks really well and much below abv.

Pours a golden blond, with a large head. Smell is of biscuit, and light citrus, with hints of banana. Taste is of sweet orange cookie, cheddar bread, and light earthy spice. Mouthfeel is spritely, with a fair amount of carbonation.

pale golden colour; dense, though not too much white head; aroma of yeast, honey, some banana and other fruits; taste of honey and fruits (mostly banana) with hint of alcohol and not too intensive bitternes; marvellous tripel
Bottle from Waitrose. Very fizzy on pouring. Pale gold, light banana aroma. Flavour is smooth, more bananas, vanilla. Doesn¬ít taste as boozy as 8.4%.Wonderful beer.

Pours a hazy solar yellow with a very thick and fluffy white head. Robust aroma is wheaty and yeasty with just a hint of sweet citrus. Flavor has a hearty wheat core and a strong fruity note of orange, lemon, apple, and even a little banana, plus yeasty and bitter hoppy hints. Firm, smooth texture has a good ragged fizz, and leaves a lively, wheaty finish. Spendy, but worth your bucks.

Sweet, strongly carbonated, no bitterness in taste, floral in taste and smell, light body, fresh, lovely beer.

My only concern bottle is too small I would like a 500 ml size better to avoid having to drink two :)

Draught at Bierhaus. Pours a beautifully refreshing cloudy golden with a medium frothy white head. Lovely sweet aroma of caramel and berries, with a hint of honey and madeira cake. Tastes better than anything imaginable really - lovely toffee and caramel heavy sweetness with a nice light strawberry and orange zing. Elements of a Witbier to it too. Just the most delicious taste you can come across in a beer. Beautifully smooth sweet aftertaste, with a soft carbonation and a beautifully light bitter body. An absolutely remarkable beer, much like I imagine beer on draught in heaven would taste like. No matter how many times I drink this, I can¬ít comprehend how an 8.4% Tripel can be so light, so refreshing and so drinkable. Comfortably in my 3 favourite beers in the world, just beautiful.

Saw this with a "The best beer I¬íve ever tasted!" recommendation on it at the bottle shop, just like at the book store or JB Hi-Fi, so I was very much ready to look down my nose at it. But as much as I tried, I couldn¬ít; this is a rather delicious, and rather unique tripel. Looks great, with a slightly dark gold colour. The aroma isn¬ít huge, but quite fresh with its dominant spicy citrus. Almost, strangely, with a nose somewhat like a white wine. The taste comes at you with some big, candy banana, peppery spiciness and ripe pear. It¬ís a bit lighter than expected. Reminiscent of a blonde. That said, quite sweet and creamy, with that yeasty undertone, but without the heaviness of other tripels. Also due to its boisterous carbonation. The spice and slight bitterness come through at the finish to clean the palate almost completely - and leaves me wanting to go back for more! Very pleasantly surprised.
I really liked it but the 7 of aroma is because we are having a cold. But we like the way of Belgium. Mr. TRAPIST

This is an excellent blonde beer with a hazy orange appearance, and plenty of lively carbonation. It has a yeasty malty aroma and taste, with a nice gentle sweetness. I find this beer is the perfect accompaniment with food.

Bottle. Clear golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of spices, overripe fruit, cloves, wheat, cereal and light yeast. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of spices, clove and cereal. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Really like that this isn¬ít sweet like worse Tripels often are.

(From Notes) On tap from rattle and Hum NY . a slightly murky pale light yellow. Good carbonation but unimpressive head and lacing. Very little observable scent. Creamy taste of banana, on the sweet side. Definitely the type of beer that can sneak up on you with its smoothness and high alcohol content. Very drinkable and pleasant for a high alcohol beer.

Birra al naso fruttata frutti rossi e leggermente caramellato. Ottima da abbinare con carni rosse.

Poured a clear pale golden colour with a white foamy head that retained well for a while but then slowly collapsed. Lacing OK. Low carbonation. Aroma slightly sour; bit off-putting. Taste initially sweet malts followed by a spicy (cloves, pepper) after-taste. Light body. Short spicy finish.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2013 A very well balanced fruity, yet fresh, triple beer. Actually quite easygoing considering the ABV. Great balance. Only the carbonation is quite heavy, could be a little smoother in that area.

Tasty tripel. Light colour - golden straw. Aroma is a mixture of sweet banana yeast and straw. Taste is delicious - big coating of the palate with bold banana flavours and tasty yeast. Light bitterness but not nearly as much as westmalle. Good tripel.

750ml bottle, a gift from dwm1034, split with my bride on Valentine¬ís Day.  Pours a clear, golden-amber color with a huge white head and some lacing.  Aroma is yeasty, spicy, clove, some banana, some orange maybe.  Medium on the palate with big, soft carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, bready, yeasty, fruity, banana, some bitter grapefruit, lemon, with a crisp, spicy finish.  An excellent tripel.

Pleasantly surprised by this beer.  I had heard was good, and never really thought those people had any taste.  Mea culpa as this a lovely light tripel that is a pleasure to drink.  The more I settles, the higher the marks are going.  Alcohol is so well hidden in this beer with its hints of banana vanilla and cloves that one best be careful.

Bottle at Diag bar n grill. Clear orange pour with a ton of foamy white head. Fresh lemon aroma. Banana and lemon zesty flavor with a slight bitter kick on the backbone. Smooth easy taste. Not a fan of this style but this one is tasty

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Yellow/gold with an amazing foamy white head. 
Aroma is citrus fruits and some spice. 
Highly carbonated, great mouthfeel and a citrus, spicy bitter taste.
One of my favourites.

I still don¬ít see the enchant of a Tripel. Although I appreciated this beer, and makes me think about some american beers, I really don¬ít see how its rating is so high. It is a regular bitter and dry Tripel.
Excel.lent cervesa, aromatica, de gran cos sense ser pesada, entrada suau en boca, poca amargor i molt equilibrada, especiada a mesura que passa el tast.

Vrij helder goudkleurig met witte schuimkraag. Aroma van zoetig caramel, banaan, perzik en citrus. Smaak is vooral zoet en vervolgens kruidig eindigend. Hinten van kruidnagel, banaan en sinaasappel. Voelt iets romig aan, maar beperkt. Met aardig wat koolzuur, maar niet te veel.

Aldus Huubs.

Hazy gold with a thick lasting, white, lots of lace, and creamy. Grapefruit and citrus smell, yeast, peach with soft spices and some caramel malt. Frothy, medium oily body. Tastes of citrus hops, Belgian yeast, acidic with some bitter grassy finish. Some banana and light spices. Smooth but has an boozy finish that is a bit of a but off.

2013/02/01 - Pours a hazy gold with a large, foamy white head that lingers. Aroma is citrus, orange, yeast, banana and spices. Taste matches smell. Similar to a hefeweizen with nice, smooth carbonation and a tart finish. Medium mouthfeel. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden hazy body with a large, white head that initially looks rather creamy, but then the tiny bubbles start to merge and creates a big-bubbled very long-lived bath foam that clings well to the glass. The aroma is strong and has a more obvious malty profile than many other beers of this style. It still has plenty of yeast, spices and fruit, but the sweet caramel malty stuff makes the aroma even more complex than the average tripel. There are also some pleasant vanilla notes and some citric hints. The taste is light sweet, light acidic and it has a long-lasting moderate bitter with a bit too much alcohol. The alcohol is rather stingy, aggressive and solvent-like. Still, the flavours are pleasant and quite strong, with fruits, banana, spices, yeast, citrus, vanilla and again this extra layer of malty sweetness. Dry, smooth and pleasant mouthfeel with a lively carbonation and medium body. A very nice ale, but I expected more from the Best Tripel In The World¬ô, or maybe I just wasn¬ít in the triple mood this evening? I guess I should try it again soon.  
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 1 year before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Bottle: Great aroma of citrus and fruity hops. Beer is yellow with a thick head, disappears after a while. Taste is a great a balance between sweet and bitter and still pretty fruity.

750 mL bottle poured into a tulip glass.  Pours a golden color with a two-finger head that has good retention and nice lacing.  Aroma is citrus, banana, clove, bread, and spices.  Taste is sweet with citrus, malt, and bready flavors and ends with a little alcohol warming.

Aroma: Floral, yeast, bread, citrus, lemon peel, notes of candy sugar and coriander-like spice.
Flavor: Yeast, bread, caramel, followed by lemon, more bread and dried flowers (chamomile) on the mid-palate. These flavors carry on into the finish and the yeasty quality reappears.
Palate: Soft and smooth; the carbonation seems, paradoxically, to explode on the tongue, adding a unique dimension the palate.
Comment: Great complexity.  Of the few 1000 or so beers I¬íve tried, this is my new favorite.  Very few can top this. Tasted on 2 different days with consistent notes.  When allowed to warm a bit, pear-like fruit comes through on the mid-palate.
Heerlijk, zeker voor een Tripel wat normaal niet mijn favoriete biersoort is. Iets fruitig karakter (banaan, vanille) met een wat zoete aanzet die overgaat in een volle en iets bittere nasmaak.
nice bottle, good beer color and cream with a wonderful cereal taste and after-taste.
Best beer I have ever had. Goes down smooth, but be careful because this beer will sneak up on you.
One of the best Tripels there is. It just has it all!
Very rich and foamy. Nice smooth texture and taste. Tingling carbornation. Bananaish.
Amazing lacing! Taste of banana and coriander, its nice and cloudy golden color nicely carbonated and the best I¬íve had of this style so far. Very good

Karmeliet is een complex goud- tot bronskleurig bier met een romige schuimkraag. Dit komt onder meer door de gebruikte granen, maar ook door een beperkt gebruik van Stiermarkse hop, het overvloedig kruiden en het fruitig karakter (banaan en vanille) van de huisgist. De zoete aanzet evolueert verder in een uitgesproken sinaasappelsmaak om dan mildbitter uit te vloeien. De aanbevolen schenkingstemperatuur van Tripel Karmeliet ligt rond de 6-9 graden Celsius.
Bottle at a local restaurant.  About what I expected for this style - probably won¬ít get it again

Light aroma of  orange and cereal, very faint (maybe my nose is blocked). Poured into my favourite Duvel glass, lovely foamy white head and pale couldy colour. Creamy mouthfeel and very hoppy flavours. Hard to say what, very fruity, touch of sweetness with the alcohol very well masked. Excellent beer, think i¬íll be having this again soon.

Maybe the best Tripel, IMHO.
Golden/amber colour, with thick, fluffy white head. Smells wheat, orange and coriander. Sweet taste, but with a bitter ending...very fruity beer, I love it.

awesome aroma smooth after taste and cool stamp love the beer def top ten as of now

Bottle bought from Brugge, Belgium. Hazy orangeish yellow beer with big and beautiful white foamy head. Aroma is sweet and has citric fruit tones with yeast. Taste is also sweet and fruity but not too sweet. Very complex stuff!

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 I first tried this on draft at BXL East several years ago. My original impressions and rating here depicted that I was less than impressed with this beer.  I always felt that maybe I didn¬ít give it a fair shake and wanted to rerate it after I tried it in the bottle. I found the bottle to be vastly superior to the draft pour I tried. Had a 330ml bottle at Brabant.  Poured a beautiful hazy orange with a huge, full white head. Aroma is lots of yeast and fruity oranges. Taste is full on Belgian yeast, spice, fruits and caramel. Finish was lingering sweet fruit. Great overall balance to the beer.  Really enjoyable.

pours golden translucent marmalade orange, decent-sized foamy head, nice layer of retention, lots and lots of active streams. Inviting floral/citrus/tropical fruit nose. Drinks with a bold creaminess up front, 8/10-sweetness, a mix of honeysuckle/honey/banana/vanilla, wheat+mild dryness, transitioning into refreshing light malts, anise, finishing ultra-creamy/lighty fizzy, off-dry malty and clean sweet. Med-high complexity, medium depth, great transitions, good carry, excellent drinkability. Alcohol is creeper, highly enjoyable.

Hazy golden with a thick, solid head - can be quite a gusher sometimes.
Pretty strong nose, slightly sharp in a pleasant way with a touch of sugars.
The taste is definitely hoppy,  packing quite a punch but never too sharp, underlying alcohol and quite a full taste though I also pick up a touch of soapiness. Just the right amount of carbonation.
The lasting hop bitterness in the aftertaste is smoothened by grains
Draught. Pours cear golden with white head. Slightly fruity, flowery and honey aroma. Sweet, malt, grain and a hint of honey in the mouth. Medium body, sticky, weird flowery finish.

Very interesting beer.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with wonderful two inch bubbly head.  So such so it took me four pours to get it all in the bottle.  Lacing was good too.  Aroma was well balanced with sweet apples and honey with some ground spices.  Taste was sweet then surprisingly tart.  Taste that honey and spices with the apple and fruit.  Maybe a little lemon.  Very nice and complex.  Lots of flavor and a huge flavor profile.  Mouthfeel is moderate to thin but nice and also on the dry side.  Fantastic beer.  Drinkable and delicious.  A favorite.  Bought at Olive or Twist in Liberty and drank at home 9/15/12. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours golden with some copper coloring.  Thick white head.  Good carbonation.  Aroma is tropical fruit, bananas, lemon, and vanilla. Taste is yeast with the slight sour of lemon and a bitterness that is quickly scrubbed away by the high carbonation.  A very dry unique taste that was surprising and pleasant.  Enjoyed it very much.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Translucent honey golden colour; Lovely, long lasting big head with off-white foams and very frothy; Oily with very good lacing and very fizzy throughout; Aroma of banana, caramel, light bread and clove. Medium to full body; Pretty strong sweet taste reminiscent of Leffe Blonde, perhaps more so, then followed by subtle caramel and vanilla. Fairly smooth and quite creamy to mouth; Alcoholic character is present but well hidden; Hop presence comes with a mild and brief spike as a finish. The 8.4% abv work up very gradually and is very enjoyable, standard to any good Tripel, with no bad knocks or sudden attack throughout. Slightly dry after taste.

Comments: it has the look and some of the taste of Leffe Blonde, yet it¬ís stronger in abv, a well-managed alcoholic character at the expense of smell and taste - yes, it¬ís rather monotonous compare to the highly aromatic Leffe BIonde and the tasty Chimay White and Leffe Brune - yet its oat-boosted smoothness make up a lot of ground in palate. It¬ís a winner without a doubt, a close second to Chimay White, if only the taste can be further improved.

A bit sickening smell, looks like blood orange soda with soapy foam. Foaming well, smells like fermented peach and kiwi (?). The taste has a strong kick from the carbonation and alcohol; hitting the palate and skating through the mouth until it pops a wheelie in the throatwalls. Less fruit in the taste than in the smell, but as much sweetness: whereas the smell is fruity-sweet, the taste is more like caramel pudding. Good beer, but not a personal favourite.

Sweet, and also a spicy aroma. When tasting, the sweetness remains behind and the spiciness comes forward. Slightly bitter and a nice full aftertaste.

Zoet, en tevens kruidig aroma. Bij het proeven blijft de zoetigheid op de achtergrond, en komt de kruidigheid meer naar voren. Heel licht bitter en een lekkere volle nasmaak.
Bottle from the LCBO, Clear light yellow color, slight foamy head. Nicely balanced, Belgian yeast, bananas and malt.
Had this on tap at Tilia and truly enjoyed the Belgian flavors with dinner. Lots of Banana, clove and vanilla. Overall a great drinking Belgian.

Appearance: hazy golden blonde, thick pale white head Aroma: lemon, citrus, smells good Taste: some malty sweetness, frothy, hint of orange and lemon, hint of bitterness at the end Palate: above average c02 burn initially, leaves a lite aftertaste, dry Overall: very impressed with this beer, pretty complex, has a lot of components to it ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft @ Olympic. Yeasty, citrus and loads of banana. Great beer, and I would gladly drink it again.

Bottle at The Libertijn, Den Haag. Poured a clear yellow straw colour with a thin white long lasting head and broken lace. The aroma is strong Belgian yeast and alcohol. The flavour is yeast, malt and alcohol bitterness. It's surprisingly smooth though given the alcohol content. One of my favourites!

This beer has great mouthfeel/texture. The medium-heavy body is evident from the oat/wheat/barley ingredients. Slight amber haze to the hay-yellow color. The head is thick & creamy. These are all exceptional aspects- but when it comes to aroma and flavor- not so much. Aroma: a malty hard apple cider. And the aspect of flavor: alcoholic cider w/bitter flash.  8.65BD
Troebel goud bier met dikke, witte schuimkraag. Levendig CO2. Mooi complex van aroma en smaak. Pittig, citrus, hop, graan, vanille. Smaak gaat van zoet naar bitter.

Appearance was clear gold with diminishing creamy off white 1finger head, rings of lacing. Aromas are sweet pale, 2-row malts with hints of citrus hops, then fruity yeasts, no alcohol present. Taste are sweet malts of caramel, toffee, candi¬ís backbone with berry, banana, cookie dough like and sublime soft hops. Palate was smooth creamy CO2 with medium body, then lasting balanced sweet, fruity soft warming wonderful finish. A brillant brew.
Blond/yellow color, big white head. This is definetly one of the best beers in this style in my opinion. Taste has a nice balance between bitterness, fruitiness and sweetness.

One of my favorite beers, a very complex palate, sweet but not too much. Drank this one a few years ago and then got a bit forgotten but now I have it back in my cellar and it will be degustated at regulary base...

Another favorite, this beer is great.
Nice clear golden color with white head
little spice, cereal, refreshing, dry, hop and citrus.  very smooth

This beer is one of my favourites, it was the first beer I drank abroad (Brussels ¬í12!) and I was blown away. Pours a lovely thick white head which just looks perfect in the Tripel Karmeliet glass, has a nice misty golden body with an active level of carbonation. Aroma is quite clean and citrus like with slight vanilla and apricot highlights. Quite a light and fizzy mouthfeel, again very clean in the taste, somewhat wheaty and grainy finish with a slight apricot and vanilla highlight. A really enjoyable beer!!

Bottle, very strong but very good. Bananas and bit vanilla flavour,nice palate and head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very good tripel. Yeasty, citrusy. A little bitter at first, but mellows with the second half of glass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 The beer pours an amber / gold, and has a fluffy white head.  The aroma is spicey.  To taste, its peppery, bitter and well carbonated.  The pepper lasts long after leaving an almost prickly heat at the back of the tongue.

330 ml bottle @ Grunerl√∏kka Brygghus
December 22,2012
Pale golden color.
Aroma is hop and citrus.Medium carbonation.A bit bitter finish.

pale gold hazy pour with persistent tight white head. Nose is lemon, malt, spice. Yeasty, spicy, orange peel, slightly bitter, feels almost creamy, and long finish with nice bitterness and ends quite dry. Probably my favorite beer so far.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2013 33 cl bottle. Golden-yellow color, with cream head fastly disappearing. Aroma is very marked, lemon all the way, with some hints of banana and hoppy of course. A triple to the heart. Very refreshing and citric. Medium body and medium carbonation. Dry like champagne. The finish so satisfying, dry and long. If you want a great tripel, just taste this beer.

Bottle at t¬íBrugs Beertje, Brugge - 01/12/12. Thanks to Yvonne for the pour.
Nose is caramel malts, hops, citrus tones, light honey.
Taste comprises hops, light citrus, caramel malts, sugars, lemon.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, bitter finish.
First time I¬íve had this beer in 5 or 6 years and yeah - it¬ís still good shit!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Yeast and slight citrus sweet aroma.  Pours light gold with a thick foamy white head.  Very smooth, light to medium bodied.  Hints of vanilla.  Dry clean finish.  A nice easy drinking beer.

(330mL bottle from LCBO) Pours a clear gold with a big foamy white head that faded fairly slowly but without lacing. Aromas somewhat muted: spice, vanilla, a bit of citrus and faint sweetness. In the mouth this beer comes alive, however. Big flavours of yeast, citrus (especially orange peel), vanilla, lots of spice, complex grainy malt and some herbal hops. Sweeter at the start but never a sugar bomb, with some acidity to it, and fading into a dry and lightly bitter finish that goes on and on. Alcohol was detectable only when the beer warmed. Carbonation is lively and champagne-like to start but settled quickly, mouthfeel was huge, silky and creamy. A complex, balanced and drinkable tripel.

Bottle shared with McTapps. A beautiful and typical abbey blonde one with huge yeast and fruits in the aroma. Very drinkable, strong and full of different aromas. Sweetish, well carbonated and a quality beer at all.
Bottle bought in the Netherlands and shared with MichaelBruch. Milky yellow colour with big and steady head. Taste of sweet yeast, dough, christmas orange and soda. Very delicious and tasty.

Nel bicchiere appare dorata come grano appena mietuto, lievi fragranze di frantoio e alloro. Al palato questi aromi vengono riproposti e amplificati. Equilibrata nella sua dolcezza, mediamente effervescente, completa il tutto un abbraccio di alcol e lievito. Ottima tripel, con tutti i tasselli al posto giusto.

Bottle from Waitrose. Hazy gold colour, medium head. Aroma of spicy vanilla with citrus. The taste is of grain, spices and citrus fruits. There is a warming alcohol taste afterwards that is quite nice. Soft on the palate. A very nice beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Absolutely the best tripel I've ever had. Normally they are way too sweet for my liking but these guys have nailed it, great taste with a nice bite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle. Golden pour, foamy head that quickyl settled down. Aroma is spicy, yeast, vanilla. Taste is spicy banana and vanilla, long bitter finish, alcohol well hidden. Mouthfeel is lively. I can sometimes find tripels harsh, but this one is rich and almost creamy. Very nice.

750 ml bottle. Bottle is a gusher. Pours a slightly hazy gold color with a big white head that soon recedes to a film. The aroma is strong with Belgian style yeasts, lemons, persimmons and some sweet bubble gum. The taste is sweetened citrus in the forefront, with yeasts, grapes and grains following. The palate is full and smooth with lively carbonation. Finishes long and dry. Overall: Very nice, derives its complexity from its simplicity.

330ml bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow body, huge soapy white head with very good retention. Aroma is a bit faded: Belgian yeast, grains, lemon, banana. Taste is much more intense: yeast, lots of bitter herbal hops, banana, tons of spices and a nice woodiness. Lively carbonation, fairly light for an abv of 8.4%.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2015 best in class.  You have to drink it from a tap an not from a can. Extremely fruity and smooth.  It will knock you on your ass if you have more than two.  Make sure it is served in a proper glass. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Absolutely superb Belgian. Great mix of flavors -- banana, citrus, even vanilla -- in a slightly sweet yet dry "base." Substantial mouthfeel. The Belgians know how to make Belgians!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Intenso color giallo oro con un massiccio cappello di schiuma bianca saponosa e persistente. Inconfondibile aroma fruttato, floreale, speziato e lievemente luppolato con sentori di caramello, agrumi e lievito; gusto mediamente dolce con note mielose e luppolate che rendono magnificamente amarognolo il finale. Calda e avvolgente al palato, ma si mantiene beverina e dissetante nonostante il corpo e la struttura robusti, effervescenza vivace. Una Tripel fantastica!
UPDATED: JAN 4, 2013 This was the last of many beers I had that night. I will re rate it later.  All I know is that I thought it was the best Tripel I have had at the time, so my score reflects this

Bottle at home. Clear golden color, big white head. Aroma of citrus, bread, malts, nothing super. Taste of malts, some hops, little sweetness, high co2, little alcohol, citrus. Weird mix of belgian sweetness and lager-like malty body.

Gold, clear, large white bubbly head; aroma of yeast and oranges; a sugary, caramel sweetness, some banana, some spice; well carbonated; light, incredibly easy drinking for the abv; clearly a well made tripel, I just found it to be a little too sweet and it just never seemed to hit the spot.

Finally tried this one. Pours off-gold with a thick white head. High carbonation; I can tell that from before even trying it. Aroma is spicy, some belgian yeast, lots of fruit. Taste is very fruity, spicy, citrus, some wheat, a little bit of a bite to it. The heavy carbonation gives it a bit of a champagne-like quality. Typically I don¬ít like heavy carbonation, but it works here. Glad I finally had this one.
One off my favorites; great blond beer with nice Belgian flavor, crispy & frizz fruity&spicy aroma¬ís

Seen the bottle many times but never got round to tryng till now, did not realise this was the top-rated tripel on Ratebeer. It pours light golden-amber, wth a solid head which hangs around for a while. The aroma is what I would say is normal belgian, it¬ís not really distinct from other belgian brews. What sets it apart is the thick, creamy palate, which gives it an easy drinkability. Nice beer.

Gelungenes Tripel der Karmeliter!
