Looks good in the glass - hazy golden body topped by a thick white head. Scents of spice and fruit juice come through. Soft carbonation. Taste is a big whack of apple, lemon, cloves and stonefruit. There¬ís a light bitterness at the end with a crisp finish. The high a.b.v. is well integrated and doesn¬ít mess things up. Excellent.
Couleur dor√©e avec belle mousse onctueuse, odeur un peu citronn√©, goput un peu mielleux, modeste amertume, un peu banane, l√©g√®rement acide, rafra√Æchissante

330ml bottle.  Pours an almost clear golden tone with a large white head.  Aroma is doughy, with dried apricot, paraffin, lemon, honey, and some grain notes.  The taste has a clean minerality, with more of the dried apricot, faint anice notes, lemon balm, alcohol, over-ripe red fruit, and some light bitterness in the finish.  Yum.

330 ml bottle. Good artwork. Pours cloudy yellow with medium white head. Wheat aroma with notes of lemon. The taste is amazing! A bit roasty, caramelly, lemony, and just the right amount of sweetness. The 8.4% vol are not detectible at all!
Small white head. Cloudy yellow colour. Very wheaty lemon aroma. It¬ís hard to describe, because there is so much happening in the mouth. Roasty, a bit caramelly, but also fruity and sparkling
Floral, bread, caramel, basement aromas, alcohol, vanilla, licorice, rotten eggs, cooked vegetables

Aroma isn't so strong, just a bit of yeasty, citrusy and piney notes. Appearance is a yellow golden, but disappointingly lacking head and almost completely transparent. Taste is citrus and pine with some mild fruity notes. Palate is pleasant but not very interesting. Did not understand the hype round this beer. There are a lot better tripels out there.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Citrus and caramel mainly. Notes of orange zest,cinnamon, banana and crystallized fruits, reminding me witbiers. Very yeasty nose, very spicy and sticking out a lot.
Appearance: Very pale blond, almost white; very clear, with big and long lasting creamy head, sticking a lot to glass and leaving a thick residue.
Taste: Attack is sparkling and very spicy, with notes of orange zest coming back. Alcohol is harsh and sticking out too much; not supporting all other flavors. Alcohol doesn¬ít blend with taste and is giving a little acid taste. Yeast and spice flavors are remarkable but buried by alcohol. A little deception here.

Bottle - decants a golden hued hazed ale with a 3 finger meringue cap. lively natural carbonation, Medium bodied but light spritzy character - probably the result of both wheat and oats in the grain bill. Aroma is ambrosia - sweet toffee with succulent fruits, some citrus, musty yeast tones and spicey hopping. Flavour and mouth feel are lush, chewy malts in front well balanced with sharp hopping and big fruitiness - middle is complex where flavors develop...vanilla, peach, spice, citrus - finish goes dry and lightly bitter with a sharp hop bite at the end then a pleasing warming. Hides its alcohol well. A very pleasant, soothing and drinkable tripel.

3 finger head. Pale light watery yellow to light mabye a bite orange in frunt. Had to put really close to eyes to see veary little carbination. Smell is something I smelt b4 but its sweetness and grains I guess. Taste well some sips the sweetness is light some it¬ís strong. I guess I can taste the grains& I can taste some bannana & vanilla but lightly and proubably the vanilla more then bananna mabye.  I am not into really sweet alcoholic drinks,so if I did complaine it be the sweetness but I am not complaing it¬ís an allright beer. cheers

330 mL bottle. Pours a golden orange color, very hazy with a thick white fluffy head. Lovely aroma of apricot, yeast and sweet spices. Taste is slightly sweet, with a lightly hopped finish, very smooth. Medium bodied with lots of carbonation, a long and clean finish. Really enjoyed this one, a great beer at a great price.
330 ml bottle. Aroma sweetly malty, almost bready, lots of yeast. Taste round and complex. Malt, banana, yeast. Aftertaste a bit on the bitter side.

Aroma is floral with hints of caramel, hay, and citrus. Pours an amber with a large foamy, mostly diminishing, white head. Taste is slightly sweet. Crisp meduim-light bodied with minimal carbonation. Overall, clean, crisp, with citrus notes and the alcolhal is well hidden. A very drinkable Tripel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Csakaj√≥s√∂r (Budapest). Dry and spicey belgian ale flavour and taste. Nice big head. Colour is piddle-haulm yellow. Body is week, too weak for an belgian ale with 8% alcohol. Low carbonation.

Pours cloudy and pale gold with an airy white head. The aroma is of wheat, banana, white wine, a bit of vanilla and lemon. The taste is slightly acidic, quite dry up front, with a clean bitterness and medium body. Nice!

Una de mis favoritas. Excelente sabor, refrescante, ligera y gaseada. Bien servida en su copa es expectacular./ One of my favourite. Excellent taste, refreshing, light and gassed. Well served in its glass is amazing.

Bottle, served in trapense glass. Outstandng creamy white head, golden brew. Complex aroma, citrus lead but also notes of banana, straw and hay. Not so malty as the standard tripel. Very, very, very well balanced taste: a little of everything that shall be present is here, changes along the tasting between the initial bitterness to a delicious sweet finish. Will definitively try again!

UPDATED: APR 17, 2013 If you are a fan of wheat and oats, this is your Champagne. Bananna but not clove phenols, "barnyard" not present in big painted bottle. Fluffy texture, euro pils flavor along with oat/wheat flavors (not a fan) in a pretty light mouthfeel finish super dry. Well attenuated plus no sweet malts = blank creamy canvas for phenols.

Pours a light straw with a big foamy head that has good retention. The aroma is wheat, straw, yeast, banana, lemon zest and alcohol. The flavour is medium sweet, banana, yeast, alcohol, lemon, ends on long dry lightly bitter lemon zest finish. A solid tripel

Pours a hazy orange colour. Aroma is very phenolic, with whiffs of spices and Belgian yeast. Smell is funky too. Taste is of the yeast, bananas, vanilla, and coriander. Lively carbonation. Dry malty and citrusy finish. A very nice beer, reminiscent of summer on the beach.

Bottle. Clear gold ale with a huge white head. Massive coriander nose. Surprisingly sweet in the mouth with tangerine notes and a nice mild coriander. Easy to drink with just a touch of alcohol burn. Some confection flavours. Delicious!

It pours straw coloured, and is very hazy (translucent); the head is off-white and marshmallow-like. The aroma has notes of: hay, lemon-zest, coriander, alcohol, and stewed peppers. The taste is medium sweet that finishes with a light bitterness; there are notes of: lemon-sherbet, coriander, alcohol, and a herbaceous quality (hay and grass). The palate is medium bodied, has a creamy mouth-feel, and a long finish. Overall, overrated but oh so yum.

musty, fruity grains to the nose, along with basement aromas.  fizzy golden body with  some bubbly white head.  full, strong flavored with hints of apple, citrus and apricot with a short-lived alcohol aftertaste. mouthfeel is smooth, well rounded with lively effervescence.

330 cl bottle poured into a Big Tulip glass
App/  golden colour with a big white head (2 fingers) long lasting
S/   malt, wheat, some spices and a little little bit of alcohol too
T /  sweet (touches of banana and pear)  but not in excess, then an amazing appearance of alcohol and herbal hops. 
M /  medium/full body with medium carbonation.  Lon lasting in mouth. 
O/  Very very nice with a great balance and personality.

Bottle from LCBO.  Pours clear pale and golden.  Fruit punch and spices dominate the aroma, with slight alcohol hints too.  Very pleasant spicy taste, but a bit too much alcohol presence for me.  Great Tripel!

Birra bionda di estrema delicatezza ma contemporaneamente di grande portata. Schiuma poco persistente e forse carbonizzazione che fa esaltare il delicato ma persistente profumo di agrumato con prevalenza di arancio che invade i sensi con un retrogusto di lunga durata che ne aumenta la piacevolezza.
Birra complessa di gran classe impreziosita da una generosa gradazione alcolica che ne rafforza il caratttere.

330mL lickbo bottle. Pours a hazy pale gold with a large white cap. The aroma is fantastic, classic Belgian malt characters with some fruity esters and citrus. Flavour is perfectly balanced, offering everything the style should have and just doing it better than most other examples I¬íve had. For a higher abv, this went down pretty fast and quite smoothly. Hard to really pinpoint how, but this Tripel somehow shines where most others do not, and it¬ís a style that can easily turn into a harsh mess.

330 mL bottle from Total Wine in Chesapeake, VA.  Pours pale yellow but looks much darker in the glass with a foamy white head.  Aroma of banana, lemon zest, and a hint of Earthiness.  The flavor is sublime; just the right amount of everything.  Mixes light citrus, banana, vanilla, and Earth with just a touch of spices.  Moderate alcohol warming.  All tripel¬ís should be judged in comparison to this.

Light tripel - tasty and drinkable. Belgian yeast, cereal, alight hay, mild coriander spice. Smells like an Interesting pilsner 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

In a bottle from the LCBO, in my Karmeliet tulip. Pours a clear orange hay colour with a huge amount of head that dissipates quickly and a whole lot of active carbonation. Smell is heavenly, lots of sweet yeasty caramel with a bit of wheat and maybe a bit of honey as well. Palate is medium bodied with a whole lot of carbonation, works surprisingly well. Taste is great, sweet at first but with a nice balance of slight bitterness that rounds out the taste. The aftertaste is sweet but not cloyingly so. An excellent beer that I would have all the time if I could.
caramel, fruity, a bit of honey in the aroma. Golden color, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy texture. Quite a good example of tripel, Highly reccomended.

Tap at Delirium Akasaka. Once again, surprised I hadn¬ít rated this before. Pale blond, white bubbly head. Aroma very grainy, lots it of hoppiness, some creamy sweetness. Taste similar, nicer than I remember it being, quite light and hides alcohol well. Tripel yeasty sweetness. Decent.
Banana-y,cereal, floral smell. Cloudy orangy. Full bodied, alcohol well masked. Well balanced, just not my thing.

Golden and clear (the yeast in the bottle stayed stable on the bottom of the bottle). Nice white head. Smell of honey, caramel and sweet with some floral hops. Taste is again honey, sweet, strawberries, peach and a decent bitterness balancing it at the end. full body and creamy at the palate.

In bottle at The Bow. Pours a blonde colour with a decent white head. Aroma of orange, lemon zest, hibiscus, musty yeast, caramel and alcohol. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. Lovely.

Bottle at Kungsgatan 1. It foamed allot so be careful when pouring.  Very sweet and malty with some fruitiness, also some yeast. A bit boozey after taste but not to bad, could have been worse. Nice beer overall.

Bottle to glass. Golden pour with a thick white head. Aromas of lemon curd and yeast. Excellent, smooth mouthfeel with perfect carbonation for style. Up front, there are flavors of off-sweet malt with slightly citrusy hops. This gives way to banana and finally to a dry finish, typical of a tripel. Very good.

Pours hazy orange with a huge creamy/crispy slight off-white head. Aroma is orange peel, yeasty and some malt, the combination simply screams out what a true belgian tripel is. Flavour follows the aroma tightly, orange, spice and clear malty flavoured in a mellow malty sweetness. Finish is vaguely bitter but more malty and spiced. Very well balanced and still light. Uncomplicated (but not simple) and wellcrafted balance between the spices, malt and the yeast notes.

0.33l bottle. Aroma of spicy banana and orange. It¬ís similar to a hefeweizen aroma. Flavor of banana and some spices. The finish is dry. Noticeable alcohol presence. It¬ís like a mix of a strong hefeweizen and a tripel. I  like it.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2014 Une grande mousse blanche et dense. Le couleur est ambr√©e l√©ger, pres qu?une jaune claire. Carbonation moyenne. L?ar√¥me est de malt et fruits (comme banane), levure et un peu de vanille. Le go√ªt est malt√© et l√©g√®rement sucr√© avec une amertume l√©ger d?houblon parfaitement √©quilibr√©. L?ar√¥me contribue beaucoup √† cette bi√®re pour lui donner une finale similar √† l?ar√¥me. Le go√ªt d?alcool est tr√®s cach√© pour une bi√®rre si forte mais je peu le go√ªter un peu en finale quand il se rechauffe. Selon moi, √ßa contribue √† l?experience.

Bottle from Le Poechenellekelder, Brussels.  Almost clear amber with a head of heroic proportions.  Aroma of orange, lemon and Domestos, with a taste to match that simultaneously burns and soothes.  Long finish and a superb active mouthfeel that fizzes and tangs in all the right places.  The taste is complex but hard to pin down to flavours - more a pleasant combination of fumes.  Great beer.

284ml bootle - a dull looking golden beer with no head, aroma of yeast and citrus. A decent mouthfeel to this, a bit syrupy, but the taste is the hero. Lemony, banana and vanilla ice-cream with pine notes amongst others in a complex beer. I would definitely buy this again.

Bel colore oro chiaro con una splendida spuma bianca. Al naso √® dolce con sentori di agrumi, banana e caramello. Al palato si conferma la dolcezza e diminuisce il componente agrumata. Il corpo √® medio con gusto ricco. La lascia il palato soddisfatto e con una punta di amaro, Una ottima tripel e una ottima birra.

Huge beer. Pale and brilliant golden colour, exuberant perfect white head which lace is close to the perfection. The aroma is complex and it has plenty of nuances: spicy, citric, sweet, hoppy...A festival. In mouth, it¬ís an experience: a perfect bitterness break into the palate to turn into a full flavour of citrics and grain but remaining a sweet touch of bubblegum and caramel. The overall is simply spectacular: longlasting, nor too heavy neither too light, full of body and creating and uncomparable harmony of olfactory and tasty sensations in a perfect equilibrium. Glorious.
Pale blonde, subtle spicy dried apricot smell.  Nice soft mouthfeel with spices.  Very easy to drink, warming on the way down.  So sweet.  I could drink ten of these easily the 8.5% is deceptive.
This beer is liquid heaven, best beer I have ever tasted. I want to go live in the brewery.
Very good, complex, aromatic, well balanced. Gets different shades when warming.

33cl bottle. Served in a trappist glass. Can¬ít believe I haven¬ít rated this one yet - probably my 15th bottle or so. Appearance: Cloudy orange, high carbonation, huge, pillowy snow-like head. Very inviting. Aroma: This is my favourite beer to smell. It¬ís always slightly different. Strong notes of bubblegum, vanilla, banana, orange, cloves. Overall very sweet, fairly fruity, and someone spicy. Palate: medium-thick bodied, smooth, tiny hint of a dry finish (unlike most other tripels). Taste: Sweet, but not as sweet as the aroma suggests it should be. It¬ís rich, but not overwhelmingly so like a barley wine. Slight hints of dry bitterness in the finish, but it¬ís very subtle.

I feel there is no way they could actually improve this beer.

Poured from a refrigerated bottle received from weihenheizen some time ago. Pours a hazy wheaty color with a fluffy white head that easily fills the glass. The aroma is effervescence sweetness with some notes of spiced pear and syrup. Smells wonderful. In the taste I get that spiced pear syrup persona with a rum like warming presence on top of some banana esters. Warm on the tongue and a Tad sticky. Nice all around.

boh? ......per essere buona √® buona, ma le valutazioni mi sembrano esagerate, √® una dolciona troppo carbonata.......naso ruffiano con note mielose e di frutta bianca....bel finale, forse troppo dolce.......

One of my favorite tripels. Very fruity aroma and taste. Very strong creamy head that lasts forever

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy yellow white head and substantial lacing.  Nose is bright sweet fruit.  Palate is very week, tasting of apricots and apples and a lot of sugar.  finish is quite dry.  A little heavier than I would have liked, but overall very tasty.

The color is like German lager but a bit cloudy with a big head with quite big bubbles. The aroma is flowers and herbs and citrus peel. Taste is amazing. The taste has a chamomile character, citrus peel, hay, and herbs. The aftertaste is nicely dry like chamomile tea and citrus peel. This is one of my favorite beer I recommend it to any beer fan.

Pours a clear light orange color with a huge frothy, bubbly head that slowly fades.  Big and very unique aroma.  Getting lots of black pepper, lemons, and vanilla mixed with hints of banana and other light fruit.  Taste is very spicy and potent, lots of banana, lemons, wheat and black pepper.  The dry finish cuts through the spiciness well to provide some balance.  A bit of peppery heat in the finish too.  Very unique beer and I really like it.

Head: some white colored foam. Color: clear yellow golden. Aroma: grain, spices. Taste: some bitter, clove. Palate: smooth, full bodied, bitter finish. Overall: nice.
UPDATED: DEC 1, 2012 Vanille en citrusachtige geur. Fris en romig van tarwe en haver. Scherp en zacht. Licht niet storend bitter. Lekker biertje.

Draught at World Craft Beer Tasting in Osaka. Concentrated sweetness hits the nose, a honey bomb. Brilliant, glowing straw color.Very sweet initial;in mid palate, the sweetness is extended and the balances a bit with the hopping; final is a continuation of that sweet malt, and it tapers off very slowly. Medium body. Sweet but not at all cloying. Great!
Una gran cerveza de abadia, un conjunto perfecto entre especias quiza canela, frutas y el gran sabor de avena, su dulzor me encanta

This ranks as one of my all-time favorite Tripels. An alchemical synthesis of all that is wonderful about truly magnificent ale; malt sweetness, light hop bitterness, citrus fruit, vanilla, spices, warm alcohol, spritzy, refreshing carbonation, velvet mouthfeel, beautiful citrus, yeasty aroma, great body, head and sustained lacing.  All working together in perfect harmony, nothing outdoing or undermining the other.  Any downside? - the bottled version is extremely carbonated, which requires a more careful pour and produces a less smooth drinkability - if you get the chance to try the draft  you will find that the lack of bottle conditioning really delivers all the flavor but with much less of that buzzy carbonation.

From a bottle at huppel the pub in den Haag. Pours a
Cloudy pale gold. Spicy lemon notes in the nose. High carbonation. Floral taste with lingering bitter finish.
Bottle from √ñlkonsortiet Aalborg. poors golden with alarge off-white head. Taste of bread, yeast and candy? (Swedish "skumbanan" that is off course banana!!!!)
ruikt en ziet er zeer smaakvol uit. Romig, vol, maar helaas ook iets teveel CO2 geweld om het volle smaakpallet te proeven. Na 4-5 slokken is de tong verdoofd.

Flaske fra Polet: iflg bryggeriet en oppskrift fra 1679 med hvete, havre og bygg. Under et fantastisk skum glitrer det i gull. Forsiktig humlet med Styrian Goldings, og husets egen gj√¶r skaper toner av banan og vanilje. Citrus i smakenog en t√∏rr ettersmak gj√∏r den farlig lett √• drikke. Beware - a superb tripel with high drinkability.
It makes you happy and smile with every sip, blond, robust, fruity, 3 grain ale (wheat, oat, barley)
This is a prime example of the Tripel style. With wheat sweetness, spices, barley malt, dry finish and bananas in the burp. This is a keeper. Highly recomended.
Lekker bitter. Enorme goede blijvende kop. Prima tripel! Droog met een klein zoetje. Volle smaak met een niet storende alcohol smaak

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2013 Tap @ De Zotte, Amsterdam 09/09/12 Pours a clear, light golden yellow with a white ring of bubbles. Aroma is fruity, spicy, orange zest. Taste is fruity, spicy, herbal, orange zest, begins sweet, turns dry at the end.
(Bottle 15/08-2012) Large white head, slightly unclear light yellow, medium co2, round fresh taste. BB date 24/08/2013.

Bottle not as satisfying as a tap draw, but the flavor reminds me of the sample I had in Brussels. Thick three finger head fades faster than the tap version, but the flavor is right on. Sharp biscuity snap and strong aroma from the bottle poured into tulip glass. Medium body and lingering tingling on the palate. Flavor is full and satisfying...a real experience.

750ml bottle.  
banana, vanilla, caramel, bread, herbs, orange, hazy, sparkling, rocky head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, oily feel, fizzy, long finish,
330ml bottle.  Pours light gold with a large head.  Aroma is wheaty, clove and elderflower.  Taste has lots of elderflower,  clove on the finish.  Full in the mouth, high carbonation, dry finish.

Small bottle. Pours a healthy bronze with foamy off-white head and nice lacing. Aroma of  vanilla, belgian yeast, wheat, spices, caramel malt and soft fruit notes. Subtle, layered taste. Sweet yet savoury; a fine balance. Medium-bodied and incredibly smooth for high ABV beer.

11.2 oz bottle pours a hazy dark golden color with huge frothy white head and some lacing.  Smells of wheat and lemon.  Aroma is the same, with a toouch of spices and dark fruit.  Medium body, average carbonation, and a sweet taste.  A very well-balanced tripel, which I¬íll gladly try again.

Bottle at JAMCaf√©, August 3. Can¬ít believe I¬íve never rated this!? Pours a hazy, bubbly orange with a large lasting frothy white head. Nice lacing on the glass. Very nice aroma, herbal and lightly spicy, along with yeast, honey and some hops. Flavour is yeasty and hoppy along with light herbs & spices and a touch of sweetness. Kind of like a lovely, hoppy Saison -- great stuff!

Pours hazy yellow with a soft, large, off-white head.
Aroma is banana.....sugars....yeast.
Taste is creamy malt, light fruit.
Nicely sweet...light and softly vanilla.
Absolutely wonderful.....

Sharp, citrusy nose with spices, lemongrass, some burnt sugar, and yeasty esters. The taste goes along these lines, being mostly sweet/bitter and mildly tart, and leaves a very pleasant honey-lemon aftertaste. Medium body with a very natural-feeling carbonation and high drinkability combined with lots of flavor.

Amazing beer, great taste and aroma. Clear, light. Drank at the office with colleagues. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2012 On tap at White Orchids in Center Valley. Pale bronze color. Enticing taste, very drinkable for a tripel. Did not think this was 8.4%. I was told this was a saison and I believed him.
Amazing beer that shows that tradition in brewery doesn¬ít mean much always. Triple fermentation with three different grains that give an aroma and taste just perfect.

Poured into a Chimay chalice from a 750. Straw yellow color with a good inch of white foam. Smell is wheat with a little lemon, not overwhelming. Taste is very smooth and balanced. Nothing really jumps out at me. A little citrus maybe. No alcohol taste which is pretty outstanding for a 8.5 ABV. Nice carbonation. Great medium palate. Overall this is a great, easy drinking beer.

(draught) a light golden ale with a crisp thin head.  The flavors are soft at first and then grow in complexity.  There are layers of sweet sugars and dark malty swirls.  A great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap. Pours mostly clear pale gold with thin, fizzy white head; short retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is cloves, Belgian yeast, candy sugar, bananas, bread malt, oranges, and floral hops. Flavor is a great balance of sweet malt, light fruit esters, and smooth hops; semi-sweet finish. Medium body, low carbonation, and medium warmth.

From notes: Aromas of candied orange and orange gummie bears. Smooth and sooo easy to drink. Creamy palate with flavors of honey and spice. Very enjoyable. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2012 This beer is on the border to Champagne.. Very sparkling, light, tasty, different an could be and replacement for dessert vine or champagne at new year. Bitter / fresh / viney sence, pretty drinkable and not sweet, but certainly not bitter as well. A must try. Hard to describe..
Wow... my only complaint is that it finishes a little too sweet.  The champagne of beers  ???

Bottle at the sloany pony, sw6. I remember being super impressed a few years ago but now despite its remarkable complexity this beer left me a bit cold. Supremely easy drinking despite the strength, with a kind of spicy, yeasty nose. Love the subtle character the oats impart, though.

realy popular in belgium. good, recognizable taste, soft, easely drinkable ,... one of my favourite common beers ! 
also THE king of examples how much better beer can be on draft ! this is a big diffrence with karmeliet. if youre in belgium, try this one from draft. it should not be to hard to find !

A: The beer appears a light yellow hue, with a towering ivory head that elegantly embraces the upper half of the tulip glass, leaving a fine sheet of lacing as it recedes. The liquid is clear and effervescent, teeming with bubbles.

S: The aroma is grand, with scents of lemons, oranges, grass, alcohol, and spices. Tripel Karmeliet emits a fabulous floral aroma that adds to an already full bouquet. The beer smells very bold and enticing.

T: A fine brew and a great example of a Belgian tripel. The flavor is strong, forward, and aggressive, yet balanced by a delicate sweetness that creates a delightful juxtaposition. Citrus flavors are quite prominent, followed by spiced apples soaked in alcohol.

M: Alcohol presence is there. The feel is medium in body, with a healthy dose of zesty carbonation.

D: This is a beer to sniff, sip, and savor. One in any given session is plenty for me.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-10-2011

Just want to make it clear that this beer is fantastic. However compared to other tripels I cant at all understand how its number one. Westmalle and la fin du monde blow it out of the water. Just my opinion.
Una de mis cervezas de cabecera.Mi consejo es servila fria e ir apreciando como aumenta el sabor  a frutas y los aromas segun va calentando en el vaso.Una gran experiencia.
Good aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, memorable. Rated from the bottle.
Super good. great. pure white head leaving laceslightly hazy yellow golden colour. a bit sweet. lively carbonation. buttery mouth.. some spices Delicious. very recommendable.

Pillowy header, sweet fruity bubblegum on the nose. Aroma is fruity with hints of light citrus or grass. Some acidity to it. Pale golden colour and a lovely pillowy head.  Rather sweet with some bitterness to it. All well in balance though. Full bodied, with oilyness on the lips and gums. Smooth beer with a velevety long finish.
Pours golden with light white head.  Smells like a great Belgian beer.  Tastes sweet and malty, almost the perfect Belgian beer.  Finishes sweet and clean.

On bottle from Vinonopolet Stovner (BU).
Golden color good foam.
nice yeast influence on aromas, also medium intensity fruity/ floral aromas.
Full body & high complexity.
Some sweetness
Good carbonation, well balanced.
Very enjoyable

Clear golden pour with a large rocky white head that has a lot of thick lace. Nose is peaches, spicy yeast, pepper, bananas and some sweet pale malts. Flavor is nice and spicy with white pepper, herbal notes, sweet malts, more citrus. Great complex mouthfeel with a hint of alcohol in the finish. Great beer.

Very pale and light golden color and slightly hazy with a small amount of carbonation bubbles. It came out with three finger head that is pure white. Few lacing on the glass.

I smelt citrus fruits, yeast, banana, sweet malt in general. Some peppery notes here and there.

Tastes all above, including hints of bubblegum and alcohol. Very smooth and sweet. No hesitation, no agressive. Comprehensive and cozy.

Medium body. Soft/average carbonation enough to balance well the whole. Finishing remains for a while in warming your throat.

Good beer.
one off the best beers only from de bottel! draft is shit! Drink this beer not to cold than you get the best aroma¬ís. The first en the last bottel everytime you have a lot of taste!
Cerveza con trigo de un sabor fuerte e intenso y aroma a fruta. Buen√≠sima!!

Poured crystal clear, almost translucent with a slight golden color.  Seemed almost more like a champagne than a beer upon first examination.  Extremely smooth, with a mild carbonation, though it pours with a thick head.  Banana and vanilla notes, but finishes with an almost citrus note characteristic.  Would recommended to anyone who is a fan of Tripels.

Once my favourite beer. Before I discovered new world hops. Still holds its own though. Bittersweet and sour mix of pears and bananas in both aroma and taste with the latter dominating the finish. Rather too easy to drink for the ABV though. Almost like a good cider. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 15, 2013 Grandissima biretti. Sapori e aromi intensi e un gusto fruttato decisamente piacevole. Io la consiglio vivamente e sono sicuro che difficilmente rimarrete insoddisfatti.

Fruity bubblegum aroma beer thats clear blonde with a little bit of head. The flavor is sweet with a hint of hops  taste not so much bitter, and a bubblegum aftertaste. Wierd combo but not bad.  Its a full/medium body its not a bad brew not much my taste but worth a try.

Cloudy light yellow, with high carbonation (like cloudy urine, sorry to relate the two). Aromas of juicy fruit gum, sour apples, belgian yeasts, and lemon zests. Flavors oh what flavors. Such a storehouse of them. I found banana /lemon esters from the yeasts, sweet spicy zests, slight trace of the vanilla, bubblegum like, and has an all around citrus punch. Sweet, creamy with the carbonation build on the palate, spicy, a little dry and refreshing. After trying many tripels, this one might be one of the top buys for me.

Even uit mijn hoofd.  Meerdere malen gedronken zowel uit de fles als van de tap bij restaurant jagersrust. Ik moet mij aantal ratings even gaan opvoeren om te voorkomen dat ene GSAP me inhaalt ; ) Blond en troebel. Goede kraag. Aroma kan ik me niet meer herinneren. Smaak fruitig en zacht. Goed te drinken maar iets te zacht van smaak, ik mis het bitter wat in dit bier.

Bottle at home. Has a slightly hazy straw-yellow colour with a medium frothy off-white head. Pleasant typical tripel aroma with belgian yeast, something floral and spices. Find much of the same stuff in the flavour with more pronounced pepper. I also taste some citrus fruits, hay and a hint of alcohol. Soft and sparkly mouthfeel. Bitterness = light+. A decent and well-balanced tripel. Feels fresh and easy-drinking.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2012 Simply delightful. Wish I would have tried this sooner. I taste ginger, banana, citrus, and grains. The quality is top-notch and very fresh. A must try beverage.
Absolutely love this beer. Best on tap, but difficult to find. Next best is in the 750ml bottle. Not sure why...but I¬íve almost always found the larger 750ml to be better that the 33cl bottle.

Bottle 0.25l bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that fades leaving very little lacing. Aroma is fruit, banana, hay, earth, spices, wheat, malt, and yeast. Taste is fruit, citrus, spices and some warming alcohol.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Recomendada. Textura suave y sabor intenso, ligeramente afrutado. Una verdadera delicia.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of white fruits, citrus, lemon, cough drop, ginger, malted wheat and vanilla cream.  Hazy straw yellow with a large foamy head that left little lace.  Flavor is very sweet and medium bitter.  Palate is full bodied and oily with lively carbonation.  Overall a good Tripel.
A nice strong, deep golden Trippel. Quite malty, alcohol is noticeable. Well-balanced, strong trippel. Quite nice.

Golden colour, white foam. Strong sour sweet citrus smell. Very fizzy on tongue, still easy to swallow. Strong taste of fruits, citrus, also strong taste of alcohol. One of stronges beers, very warm and strong. Leaves fruit taste afterwards. Very good beer, strong but also very refreshing.
Pours cloudy golden with a white head that fades leaving very little lacing. Aroma is rich and sweet . Taste is fruit, citrus, spices, sweets and alcohol.

25 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that fades leaving very little lacing. Aroma is fruit, banana, hay, earth, spices, wheat, malt, and yeast. Taste is fruit, citrus, spices and some warming alcohol.
Simply the best for me! Strong, intense taste but still refreshing when drunk cool. At least try once in life!

One of the best!  Green apple like nose.  Effervescent and frothy.  Lots of fruit flavors, bananas, honey sweet ripe pears, citrus in the background.  Some tartness mixed into the dry and semi sweet finish.

Bottle in Eindhoven. Pours clear dark yellow with creamy lasting white head. Aroma is malt, oat, yeast, bread, hay and wood with hints of citrus and herbs. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet and light acidic. Body is oily to creamy with fresh carbonation. Finish is long, creamy and bitter/sweet with notes of apples, cloves, lemons/lime and grapefruit peel.

So much going on here. Wow what a beer. I¬íve had this numerous times but never cease to be amazed at how good it is. Never disappoints. Has a ton of carbonation. Truly the champagne of beers. Almost too much. Leaves a huge frothy head on the pour. Has a nose of banana, herbs, some vegetables, wheat, hops, spice, lemon, vanilla. It¬ís everywhere. Tastes citrusy and spicy. Full bodied. Creamy and rich. Damn it¬ís good. A bit overly filling from all the carbonation. Guess I could just swirl it for awhile. Hard to find much to criticize here. Just a yummy beer.

Great looking bottle to start off with! Pours very clear and always a nice fizzy head. It¬ís an explosion of smell and taste similar to a Belgian IPA.  I  can get candy sugar and citrus fruits. It has perhaps a more exciting flavour but may not stand up beside Westmalle, which has a unique flavour. In terms of mouthfeel, it¬ís quite smooth and carbonated but i prefer St. Bernardus¬ís creaminess.

Very refreshing high abv beer, pours a clear pale yellow brew with a 1 finger white head with good retention, aromas has notes of citrus fruits and belgian yeast fruity esters; medium bodied with a good balance, is medium to high sweet and medium bitter, it has notes of citrus fruits(mainly orange), belgian yeast and malt.
Pours slightly hazy golden orange with a nice white head.  Aroma is banana, spice, bread, and citrus.  Taste is very similar.  Prickly carbonation and a very dry finish. Great.

Bottle 75 cl from Total Wine Sacramento. Pours golden with a white head, loads of lively bubbles. Aroma of malt, light yeast, lots of citrus, orangepeel, lemon, light sugar. Taste is malt, yeast, citrus, light sweetness. Medium body, lively, bordering aggrassive carbonation.

Poured from 330 ml bottle at Yangshuo Village Retreat in Yangshuo, China. 

Clear, sparkling bright gold with 1-finger white head and beautiful fine lacing. 

Aroma of spice, cloves, bananas, caramel, cinnamon, yeast, hay and a touch of citrus. 

Taste much the same plus alcohol. 

Medium/full body and high carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2013 hazy yellow in appearance, with frothy later creamy and steady head, light fruity aroma. sweeter, lighter bitterness (or sourness?), longer sweeter finish. 

stronger, but still refreshing.

different to the likes of leffe (blond). 

perhaps the best Belgian beer you can buy even in supermarkets

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2012 Aromas of yeast spice and esters. Not unlike the scent of gin. Hazy yellow with a mountainous unwavering head a ton of effervescent carbonation. Sweet citrus taste reveals the wheat content. Very bitter up front and as it warms one finds the oats amongst sour and salty notes. The overall feel is that of drinking sparkling water with sea salt and sugar. Very profound, especially for a non-hoppy beer.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2012 from bottle. hazy yellow/golden colour with a huge white, frothy head. grainy and fruity aroma, somehow reminding me of soap. quite low carbonation, medium body and a kind of oily texture. the beer has a lot of fruit and grain flavours , but again, there is this kind of weird soapiness to it. quite good beer but can¬ít drink more than one bottle of it due to the soapiness.

Pours a copper brown on tap with a small tan head and decent lacing. Aroma of belgian yeast and fruits. Taste follows suit, with a good malty characteristic. Good beer, but may like it more out of the bottle.

I won¬ít write a review based on geusignostic criteria but on personal taste. So Karmeliet is personally a so unique beer because when you drink it it gives you the sense that you just drank some soap with lemon aroma.

Tap at Byens Kro, Cph. Golden colour with very nice lasting white head. Aroma and taste of bread, fruits, fresh grain. Very complex and balanced bitternes. Much better than the bottled version. Its way more fresh and fruity. One of the best beers IMO.

A big, frothy white head on this one. Color is golden. Taste is mostly of citrus fruits, caramel and raisin. Some wheaty, yeasty, bready flavors as well. A good example of it¬ís type, but not really my type.
Aroma Maravilhoso, sabor suave, colora√ß√£o dourada e turva, espuma consistente e amarga
Karmeliet is really one of my favourites ever. And if you ever get the chanse to drink it of a tap, take it! You won¬ít regret it
One of the best Belgian beer. Quite strong and refreshing. Can be found as tap in certain bars

(Bottle). Pours huge white head, diminishing to a persistent, thin covering. Fine bubbles, good lacing. Clear, light yellow. High carbonation. Grainy, yeasty (distinctively Belgian, pleasant), fruity (bit estery, soft and yeasty) and slightly boozy aroma, bit of citrus (orange). Taste - Very malty, soft, yeasty fruitiness (mostly soft, sweet flavours - a hint of banana, but also some oily, citrussy notes), quite grainy, bit of gentle spiciness, slightly sweet, bready malts, little bit buttery. Short, bitter finish, with some persisting, aromatic, soft fruit and grainy sweetness. Nice, creamy, bit tangy mouthfeel, with nice soft, fluffy sensation from the head. Alcohol well hidden. Not particularly easy drinking, but fairly complex and quite a nice beer.
A bit of heft to it.  A little bitter - but caramel smooth with a bit of carbonation.  First had this at a bar served with their yam fries.  Great combo.

Muito arom√°tica. Excelente forma√ß√£o de espuma. Sabor incr√≠vel. Recomendo pois possui um bom custo beneficio se comprada por uns 15 reais.

Golden body with a giant white head. Smells bread and cereal, with a fruity taste (starts sweet end ends up a touch bitter). Noticed that tastes much better if not too cold. Overall an easy to drink beer, even with a certain complex flavour.
La mejor cerveza que he probado. Comerla con patatas fritas con mahonesa estilo dutch. Un sabor exquisito, con buen cuerpo. EXCELENTE
A miryad of flavour hits the tounge at first taste: Caramel, spice, biscuit. Really smooth caramel aftertaste. Best sipped not gulped and served at room temperature.
My all time favorite,especially from tap and poured into the original glass.Sweet,cereal taste,nice golden color.

Bottle, poured into official Karmeliet glass. Hazy pee-yellow with gigantic white head that dissipates over time. Not much lacing or legs to speak of. Big banana, clove, some vanilla on the nose. Lemon, clove and banana on the tongue, with some pretty great hop bitterness. Sweetens as you sip. Long, bittersweet finish. Powerful stuff.

Beautiful sticky fluffy white head leaving great lacing and not going anywhere. The aroma coming off the head is great as well. The smell alone just lifts you up off your feet, peaches banana, clove, citrus zest, fresh baked bread, belgian yeast, springtime, flowers, the best smelling woman you ever laid your nose on. Tastes similar but different. Honey sweetness, granny smith apple, bread still there, floural still there, some clove I think and that woman, even though she smacked you upside the head for smelling her, is still there as well. Effervescent MF and light on the tongue. A beautiful beer that is right up there with the best of the style. One day I would like to have it side by side with La fin du Monde and Westmalle.

Bottle. Pale golden yellow, thick frothy white head sticks around. Nice complex nose, peppermint, lemon, wheat, coriander spice. Nice rich, soft palate. Peppermint again. Caramel, almost honey, lemon notes, with a hint of hazelnut. Interesting. Peppery dryness, hint of vanilla on the finish.

Pours pale yellow with a huge white head. Nose is ginger, cloves, hay and good ol Belgian candy sugar. Taste is sweet with a good bitter presence. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean. Light body and big aftertaste.

Pours a nice light golden color with a big frothy head that laces out and sticks around for the ride.  Aromas are boozy sweet fruit, apple and honey with touches of bubblegum.  On the palate its more vibrant than I assumed through the nose with a nice earthy yeast presence to counterbalance the heavy fruit and caramel undertones.
Very fruity sweet and spicy but the strong alcohol aftertaste detracts from the taste in my opinion.

33cL bottle.  Aroma, appearance, and carbonation all perfect for the style.  A little on the syrupy-side of Tripels. The taste is complex and delicious - fruity and spicy, lemon peppermint, and hazelnut.  Something to write home about.

trappist glass. yellow cloudy color very tall head but clears out quick. Aromas are farm, hay some grass and some citrus. taste is light in the sweetness up front lots yeasty in the  middle and finishes with a medium bitter taste. Light and easy to drink

Tap. Pours yellow-gold mostly clear with a large frothy white head that eventually dissipates with good lacing. Aroma is of yeast, fruit, bubblegum and coriander (thanks to Mike for identifying that for me!). Taste is yeast, bubblegum, coriander, almost buttery with warming alcohol and faint bitterness in the finish. Smooth and silky in the mouth.
Pivni Galerie Praha, tocene. Inzerovane ovoce jsem necitil. Melo ale prijemnou chut karamelovych mlecnych bonbonu - prirozenou, ne chemickou.

Bottle @ home. Pours golden with a white head, loads of lively bubbles. Aroma of malt, light yeast, lots of citrus, orangepeel, lemon, light sugar. Taste is malt, yeast, citrus, light sweetness. Medium body, lively, bordering aggrassive carbonation. 060612

Color marrone torbido, schiuma abbondante ma di media persistenza, al naso √© fruttata con sentori di coriandolo. In bocca √© giustamente gassata, all¬íimpatto √© leggermente amara, poi escono fuori i toni fruttati e maltati per un finale dolciastro godibilissimo. Grande birra!

Lemon and orange peel sans sweetness.  Very zesty citrus like.  You are basically standing in a spruce farm with a fan blowing your neighbors? citrus farm on you.   Sports a characteristic cloudy golden color; surprise, surprise.  Taste is  medium-bitter and finishes equally, although nothing close to IPA bitter.  Doesn?t seem so priclky on the tongue in terms of carbonation with respect to its own breed, however it is a prickly brew.  Overall it is an enjoyable brew, but the clash of prickly carbonation and pine-citrus taste will always be the achillies heel of Belgian golden ale. Btw, if you disturb this thing the slightest, the cork will become a high velocity projectile when you unwind the cage.

Bottle. Golden yellow with a nice white head. Big apricot aroma, some citrus, light yeast esters and slightly metallic in the background. Tastes a bit different to the aroma, yeast more prominent but still quite fruity and slightly resinous. Crisp and dry. Pretty nice but i prefer the American interpretation of this style
Makes an excellent first beer. Mild, with some of the complex Belgian taste that I like, but not too heavy to start off with, and without the alcohol burn that darker beers usually have.

A beer I respect, but not one that will make it into my regular lineup. I find it too cloying. The head is the headiest head that ever head(ed) so 5/5 for appearance because it was a lot of fun. Palate also gets a 5/5 for being so darn interesting, with twists and turns the whole way through. So all in all this is probably the highest score I¬íve given a beer with a sub-5 rating on taste.

Pours cloudy gold. Beautiful four finger head.fruits on the nose, but a crisp refreshing and slightly bitter. Delicious brew.

Citrus, hop, spice and yeast aromas. Banana, spice, orange and yeast.  Overall an awesome triple.

Pours light gold with a thick white head. Aroma is clove and banana (the banana really comes through). Taste is awesome. It begins with light malts & banana overtones tranforming slowly into something sweet & grainy with maybe a little black pepper thrown in. Really good.

Bottle.Hazy yellow colour with a huge rocky white head, that doesn¬ít disappear. Strong aroma of coriander and citruses, mostly orange, wheat, barley malts, vegetable. Very sharp with a lot of carbonation. It¬ís hard to define first feel - it¬ís seems  like combination of everything to me; sweet/acidic/bitter, while the aftertaste is kinda sweet. Texture is creamy and the alcohol is not too obvious.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 Large white head. Golden beer with some citrus and sweetness. Taste is also sweet. Body is full.

Very blond colored with a decent two finger head.  Very sweet flavor, reminds me of citrus and has an herbal flavor as well. The taste lingers long in the mouth. Very good beer during a nice sunny period!

Crazy intense nose. You know what it is? It's cinnamon and nutmeg!!! It sticks with you even as an aftertaste. Creamy nutmeg, this beer should be called. Or clove? Beer people say clove. 
Ok also banana. Huge head that dissolved quickly. Golden but not cloudy.

medium sweetness, bread, citrus, herbs, vanilla, pale, sparkling, white foam, lightly bitter, lightly sour,
Really nice tripel with some grainy, sweet flavors and aromas to it. Sweeter than usual for the style, but also just really nice. Almost buttery at times.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2012 Bottle. Pours cloudy straw yellow. Head retained throughout plus lace. Aromas of clove spice bread yeast floral rose hay. Taste light sweetness, but refined. Finish is near cloying sweet, but complex on finish.

Bottle. Pours cloudy straw yellow. Head retained throughout plus lace. Aromas of clove spice bread yeast floral rose hay. Taste light sweetness, but refined. Finish is near cloying sweet, but complex on finish. Tastiness lingering.

Tasted this at the Drug Opera bar, Brussels in April 2012. 33cl bottle. Pours an opaque amber with a thick white head. Floral dusty notes in the aroma with hints of Askit powder. Resiny mouthfeel and good lacing. Pale malts deliver a sweet fruity note of overipe honeydew melon with burnt caramel evident. Strong grain notes in the slightly bitter aftertaste which is very short lived. Pale malt present in the dry fruity finish with sweet fudge and honey flavours full in the mouth. Recommended but there are far better examples of Abbey Tripels out there though.
Pale yellow color, nice white head. Nose grapefruit, flowers, grass. Taste acidic, medium sweet, slightly bitter, caramel.

Golden straw color that has a slight haze to it, with good lasting white head.  Strong alcohol content is masked by wonderful flavors.  Falvors intensified as this warmed slightly.  Slightly more carbonated than most Abbey Tripels I¬íve had.
Pale yellow poor with frothy white head that hangs around nicely.  zesty orange flavours with a yeasty background dominate the beer but don¬ít over power the flavour.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2014 (draught 0,4l)
Sweet malty, spicy aroma. Clear golden color. All time white head. Medium sweet, spicy flavour. Medium-full body. Nice astringent, light warm finish.(7.4.7.4..16=3.8)
(tap 0,2l @ Picollo (Opava))
Aroma : Sweet, fruity, tropical fruits (mango), flovers, unusual.

Draught at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Clear gold with a fleeting white head. Aroma is wonderful: smells like banana and bubblegum. Wow. Those elements eventually burst forth in the taste. Mouthfeel is thinner than I expected, but it¬ís nicely clean and crisp. I swear this almost tastes like toothpaste at times... something minty about it. A beer full of surprises it seems, and a good experience.

Bottle at Metro Vino In downtown Portand....thanks Ryan!

Excellent ... I am usually NOT a blond fruity beer guy but this one blows me away...sour initial taste but so smooth...

Enjoy in moderation...there¬ís a goodly amount of booze hiding in here

750 ml bottle. A hazy dark yellow beer, with a huge, frothy, fizzy, mostly lasting white head. the aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted bread), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers, grass), lightly yeasty (dough), with notes of coriander, banana, lemon with hint of honey and peach. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.  Medium to full body. velvety texture, fizzy carbonation, long finish with medium bitterness, lightly to moderately alcoholic. A bit oveerated, but pleasant by any means. Fizzy and spicy, with well hidden alcohol. Pretty good.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2015 Bottle from Pre?porsk√° pivot√©ka. Heavy white airy head. Hazy yellow colour, fizzy carbonation. Aroma of grass, hay, light citrus fruits (grapefruit), caramel. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter, perfectly balanced. Taste is light to medium sweet, light bitter. 8 4 8 4 17 Rerate at Pokhoi tasting. Honeyish, spicy, flowery. Very nicely balanced, strong sweetness, moderate bitterness, very light sourness. Very clean and delicious.

Brown 33cl bottle, best before Jan 2009, drank June 2007. 

Poured into my magnificent ¬íJudas¬í glass (it¬ís huge). I love the proper glass and must get one.

The body is an old gold colour with loads of carbonisation ripping through to replenish the large foaming head. The head began to shrink about half way though the drink, which was a shame because it looked fantastic at the start of the session. 

The aroma was of yeast, sour apples and mixed spices, as the beer warmed, they intensified. 

The alcohol is there foremost in the taste, but not overpowering enough to put you off, the other flavours of hops, yeast and apple-pie spices see to that. 

Spices and a little citrus taste arrives in the mouthfeel, very pleasant. 

Overall a very good beer, I have a soft spot for the Belgian Tripples and this is one of the best without a doubt.
Strong tasting, flavour is sweet and tart, clean on the palate, a very good beer

330ml bottle, poured in its own glass. Cereal aromas everywhere, with some fruits. Dark gold colour, clear, witha really nice thick head, long-lasting (almost till the end), good consistence and lacework. Tastes really malty and somehow spicy, but no hints of the high abv present. Really smooth and well balanced. Long warm finish.
A classic that never lets you down. One of my favourite ones when only belgian and german ones were available in Spain, have drunk it for many years, but still have one from time to time.

330ml bottle, poured in a tulip (would¬íve preferred a Trappist glass but I didn¬ít have any ).  Aroma is malt, a bit citrusy, and cereal (leaning strongly towards wheat; I did not perceive oat nor barley very well).  By the way, alcohol content is really well hidden.  I don¬ít know why, but the first time I smelled this beer the first thing that came to my mind is "wow, that¬ís a classic".  Color is a clear, albeit a bit darkish golden.  It produced a huge white head when poured and persisted until the end.  It was looking a bit strange in that tulip of mine, again I would¬íve preferred a Trappist glass. Taste is really balanced and perhaps it¬ís what makes this beer the best trippel I ever had.  Slight bitterness.  Body is medium-light with a thin texture, carbonation is a bit above average.  Overall an outstanding beer.  Despite its 8.4% alc content, for me this could easily become a session beer.

330ml bottle. Amber color. Very nice white thick head, lasts forever. Sweet citrus, lime, wheat dominate aroma. Very well balanced body. Grain all over, citrus, fruits, butter, smooth sweet finish. All my senses exploded, very good beer.
Sampled at Casanovas.  Pours a nice gold shade of dark gold with thick white head.  Aroma is fruity from yeast, flavor is fantastic.

pours a golden hue with a large white head that is mostly diminishing
aroma of spices, malt, yeast and tropical fruits
flavor is spicy with some barnyard in ir
medium mouthfeel with light carb....
Poured from a bottle into a trappist glass, it pours with a nice head which stays for the duration, the carbonation is good and not sharp, very floral, nice tartness, nice mild warmth after

5th July 2009Hazy gold beer, thick white head. Dry palate. Rich tangy malt. Spice and a touch of banana. First had this beer some years ago but remember it being better than this. No matter I will always be fond of this beer as one of those that got me properly interested!

Huge head.  Very pale with a slight cloudiness.  Aroma is solid.  Not overly cloved or banana.  Great mouth feel.  Taste is spicy but balanced.  Finishes with a great balance.  Once of the best Belgian Tripel beers I¬íve ever had.  Well done.
Bottle from Theatre of Wine, Greenwich. Golden pour with a big, fluffy white head. Pineapple, banana and lemon sherbet nose. Sweet spice, banana and mango flavour. Sweet, fruity finish.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2014 Bottle from bierzwerg. Clear golden colour with great looking head that lasts. Aroma is coriander, fruity, yeasty. Flavour is bit sweet, coriander, yeast, floral hops. Great tripel!

Floral honey and easter bread aroma.  Golden yellow with a very slight haze.  Tall, foamy white head.  Sweet initially but dries out in the finish.   Very smooth and creamy mouth feel.  Hint of clove in the finish. Only a hint of hop flavor.  Very nice.

Bottle. Pours a lightly unclear yellow, with a thick airy head. A somewhat sour, hoppy aroma of yeast, lemon and wheat. Flavour is also quite crisp, with yeast and lemon, and some notes of alcohol and barrel oakines.

Originally reviewed Dec. 20, 2006: first poured. head is clean white. airy and minimal in open base and mouth glass. after 10 minutes, head was light skiff, with carbonation spots. colour is dark amber. scent is apple-y and other fruity fregrance. can smell the alcohol. not over-powering. very smooth taste. ¬íbout all i can comment on at this point.
Noticed the floral aroma. Just the right amount of sweetness and balance with the taste.  Only average on the appearance, but where it matters -- a good tripel.

Was surprised at how clear and golden this beer was when it was poured. It has a pleasant aroma of bananas and bread, with a hint of melon.  Bready, yeasty, floral...it goes down smooth like liquid gold; this beer shines.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Golden hazy, massive white head. Smells of malts, belgian yeast esters, spice and herbs. Just delicious. Taste is super malty, heavy sweetness, very fruity and spicy. Full bodied, nice oily feel, soft carbonation. Finish has nice medium bitterness, complex hops, some grass. Totally this beer is awsome, also very drinkable for a high abv beer

Gold / straw color with a medium white head that disappears quickly; good fizzy carbonation and good lacing; aroma is caramel and butterscotch with some hint of lemon; taste is dominantly sweet and tangy with strong hints of licorice, caramel, banana; light bodied with a crisp finish, aftertaste of strong melon, banana, and wheat
Bottle at Huppel.  Golden pour with a white head.  Aroma of citrus, fruit, bread and spice.  Flavour of fruit, malt, yeast and spice.  Some alcohol in the finish.
Golder colour, white head. Yeasty wheaty aroma. Taste is sweet, spicy, fruity, yeasty. Excellent tripel
Una de las mejores cervezas del mundo, entre las Rochefort y las Sant Bernardus.

Bottle from Tomlinson Beer Shop
Very pale yellow, clear, massive frothy head, very good lacing, beer retains some head to the end of the glass 
Aroma of soft spices, soft wheat, hint of orange, belgian yeast,  complex yeast esters, alcohol almost unnoticeable, very fresh smelling, soft sweet malts, light floral, complex aroma, subtle but wonderfully fragrant 
Taste - soft smooth belgian yeast, light orange, soft sweet malts, light orange and lemon zest, soft peppery hops, floral esters, slight hint of cake mix, very well balanced, soft spicy herbs - coriander? ,very complex , lovely fresh flavour 
Palate - moderate to high carb, light to medium body, very smooth silky texture, soft spicy zesty tangy palate. Finish as main flavour, cleans well leaving a lingering light complex flowery esters. Warming alcohol comes through more with the drinking in the finish
Overall - It¬ís the best Tripel I¬íve tried.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2012 One of my favorite beers of what I?ve tasted. Aroma of citrus, dough, spices and caramel. Hazy, pale apperance in the glass with white head that stays forever. The taste has light bitterness, medium sourness and heavy sweetness. The belgian yeast is very distinctive part of the taste. Together lively carbonation and the long, sweet finish, this adds up to the most perfect beer I?ve tasted yet.

Lovely aroma and flavor of hops, citrus, fruit, yeast, wheat, spices and warming alcohol. A really good and delicious Belgian Abbey Trippel, somewhat of a "role model" for this type of beer. Highly recommended!
Draft to tulip. Looks like a Budweiser. That¬ís where the similarities end. Good stuff, especially for the abv.
Una delle triple migliori mai assaggiate se non la migliore. Punto e basta

Clear golden color. Highly Effervesscent with a beautiful floral nose. Medium bodies with some coriander and an array of apple and pear flavors. Paired beautifully . Some sweetness, but balanced with fresh flavors and mouthfeel. As good a tripel as I¬íve had.

Somewhat hazy darker yellow beer, with big lasting foam head the way I like it. High carbonated, not too high. Sweet bitter taste, some fruity taste but not overwhelming, just right. Nice alochol content. Will keep drinking this beer.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2012 The first trippel, heck the first Belgian I ever tried. It was delicious go and try it if you haven¬ít
Tried both 33cl and 75cl. 75cl is better but rare. Top quality oats and lemons, smooth and creamy, perhaps the triple all others will be judged against. Superb.
Great fruit aroma (bananas) with a soft and sweet taste. Feels extremely light for the ABV. It was my introduction to Tripels and it became one of my favorite beers.

Bottle from Waitrose, Billericay. Pours a beautiful pure golden straw colour with a billowing cloud-like white head. Dry crushed coriander seed as well as hints of clove and a touch of grassiness is present in the aroma. A nice medium-bodied beer over the tongue, there¬ís an initial dryness followed by a honey sweetness before flavours of banana, peach, subtle toffee and a little coriander seed again form in the mouth all wrapped up in a wonderfully tart package. There¬ís some honeyed dry bitterness in the aftertaste which lingers in the mouth like a ghostly reminder of the beer that was there moments ago before slowly fading. An absolute delight..

Pours effervescent hazy blonde with fluffy white head that collapses  to a lacing. Spicy wheat and banana toffo yeast esters on the nose. High carbonation, honey malt, spicy wheat and smooth oats combine with a warming esteric finish. nice

A huge head. Best in class? I¬ím not sure about that. I love a good high alcohol wheat beer, but the bananas in this just don¬ít sit quite right for me. Don¬ít get me wrong, but flavour, tasty, but high in carbonation too for my taste. Glad I tried it though, a nice one. I¬ím a contradiction!
Bottle, pours bright yellow, aroma is light, the flavour is very smooth and easy drinking. not much bitterness. Very easy drinking . good stuff

Bottle pours clear yellow gold with lasting bubbly white. The aroma is light fruit with a soft sweetness. It is a very bright taste with a dense refined grain covered in fruity sugars. There is a canned pear concentrate and apple flavor, followed by a little banana with the wide range of grain flavors. The wheat is the most notable behind a lot of barley. It finishes mostly dry but with a very strong carbonated sweetness and a familiar hay hop and musty Belgian wheat. Enjoyable and classic but not the best tripel out Belgian ever.

Nice easy drinking Belgian, but too much carb. Aroma is largely banana, with minimal spice and a nice mix of grains. Flavor is very light and well balanced. Good introduction to tripels for a doubter.
Heady pour. Sweet taste but not overwhelming. Surprisingly light for the ABV, but common among Tripels. High Carbonation nips the tounge. Slight aftertaste but pleasant.

Balanced, smooth, beautiful Belgian. Aroma froths out on pour, fruity and juicy. Banana and citrus. Sugary sweetness balanced with strong but smooth maltiness. Creamy and quaffably smooth yet sippingly strong.

golden color, aroma of banana, orange, spices, grain, flavors of banana, orange, apricot, small grass hops, coriander and other spices, candy sugar, slightly bitter, creamy with a full body, best tripel I¬íve ever had
Golden yellow hue with a lot of carbonation.The smell was very fruity. Taste is fruity with some citrus notes and some sweet candy sugar notes as well. Very good drinkability.

Bottle 330ml. 2009 ( 3yo).
Pours hazy bond, with white head. Good retention. Aroma is of alchool, malts, spices (faint) and some hops. Taste is sweet, with faint spices. Well balanced. 7/4/7/3/14_________Bottle 330ml. (2010 or 2011?) Pours hazy blond, with white head, good retention. Aroma is of spices, rhubarb, herbal, fruits, citrus. Taste is spices, alchool, citrus, sweetness. Well balanced, maybe a little too sweet. Definitively better fresh.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2012 Bottle from Aligros. Classic tripel appearance with yellowish colour and thick white head. Hoppy, spicy aroma, complex flavour, some sweetness, some bitter, some spice. Very well balanced, a great beer.

Vertical tasting.

Bottle 330 ml [2010].

Aroma: Citrus, herbal/floral.
Taste: Fruits, floral, citrus. Maybe a bit watery.
Overall: Nice tripel. well balanced and refreshing.
[Ap. 3/5, Ar. 8/10, Ta. 7/10, Pal. 3/5, Ov. 15/20, To. 3.7/5]

25cl glass on tap. Clear dark blonde beer, small fine white head. Grainy and fruity nose. Flavour is an explosion of maltiness and lots of wheat grains, less noticeable when used to it but impressive ad the first tasting. Nice fruity tones, not overwhelming, maybe some orange and apricot. Quite spicy too, with a hint of amaretto. Hops side is not strong, but the malts sweetness is well balanced with a soft bitter end. Tasty brew, medium carbonation, alcohol isn¬ít so noticeable in tasting but sort his effect shortly after. Full bodied, smooth texture, nice one.
golden, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, creamy, long finish,
Great fruity aroma of orange and coriander. A yellow/gold pale with great taste. One of my favorite beers ever!

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2015 33cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear yellow with white head. 
Aroma citrus, yeast, spice, floral, banana, caramel. 
Taste caramel sweet, spicy citrus biter. 
Mouthfeel thin, average carbo. 
Great tripel.

Wow what a wonderful spring day beer for southern Spain.  Pours a hazy gold with quite the fluffy head.  Poured from a corked 75 cl bottle into a wine chalice.  Best by date of 27/05/13.   Smell is fruity and honey like.  Taste is sweet and fruity with light medicinal quality.  Wonderful effervescence. Could drink this all afternoon but should probably eat.
