Taste ob fruits belgian yeast, very crisp. quitecarbonated, very enjoyable

From the tap, the long stemed glass held a beautiful clear, bright brew with light white head. Aromas of banana, and hints of cinnamon, and bubble gum. The flavor was full bodied with a little more malt than hops.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2012 Pours blonde/gold with decent white head, fairly lively carbonation. Aroma is heavy on the grains and biscuit malt with citrus notes and that distinctive and fairly herb/spice belgian yeast strain complexity. Taste is again full of the 3 grains, a lovely smooth biscuity maltiness coupled with the chewiness of the oats. A citrus tang and a peppery spiciness working on the palate too. A very refreshing tripel.
Bottle. Just wonderful aroma of malt with hints of honey. Astonishing taste of malt with more pronounced wheat, bit sweet and a bit bitter. An exceptional beer, one of my all time favorites.

Blondie girl with a huge white foam head (then 0.5cm persitent).
Aromas: malt, yeast, coriander, reductive profile, herbs. 
Palate: very round, mouthfeel, well balanced.
Taste: spicy, cereals, esters ! Like a mix between strong Ale and German Weiss ... do you think it¬ís weird? I taste it wonderful !

Hazy orange pour with a light head.  Strong citrus, fruit and spice smell.  Wow that is good.  Initially sweet but grows slightly tart finishing off sweet again.  Lots of citrus and fruit with just  touch of spice.  My only complaint would be that it may be slightly too sweet.  Not quite clean finish, here¬ís where a bit of that 8% alcohol burn comes in.  Really enjoyed this.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2012 Prendete la falce √® tempo di mietitura!! Il giallo dell¬íetichetta ricorda i campi assolati di cereali in giugno e sono proprio i cereali a far da padroni in questa birra, che siano crudi o maltati. Buona la corposit√†. Agrumata. Il luppolo c¬í√® ed √® presente in giusta misura. Ottima.

Bottle. AROMA: citrus, herbs, wheat malt. APPEARANCE: pale gold color, cloudy, huge head that slowly goes away leaving a delicate white lace, lively carbonation. TASTE: crispy malt flavor, alcohol note, lightly bitter PALATE: full body, thick feel OVERALL: a very good and refreshing beer, one of my favorites tripels

Bottle. Pours opaque golden color with huge white head that decompose slowly. Aroma of wheaty malt, citrus fruits and alcohol. A little sourness in the beginning, fruitness and sweetness at the end. The taste of alcohol blends with other flavours. Very nice beer.

Pours a caramel golden color with a huge head that recedes slowly to a thin lace across the beer. Taste is champagne, bready, coriander, caramel sweetness. Effervescent carbonation. The alcohol is present, but blends into the overall mouthfeel which is rich and balanced nicely. Very good beer.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2013 aroma: bread, cereal, caramel, floral, 
apparenza: golden, cloudy, frothy, 
gusto: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
palato: medium body, lively, long finish
√® stata la birra che mi ha fatto appassionare al mondo della birra(di qualit√†). √® una birra beverina dal gusto fantastico,√® dissetante e il finale lungo e di amaro medio lascia spazio ad un altro sorso.. 15/02/2013 la sto bevendo alla spina (grande serata di spillature a monteluce)..la cosa che pi√π mi ha colpito √® la schiuma,una tra le pi√π persistenti e compatte nel mondo della birra..come diavolo fa ad essere cos√¨ persistente e densa???assolutamente micidiale..aroma fruttato,vaniglia,cereali..gusto dolce e amaro superbilanciati..ragazzi..la TRIPEL KARMELIET!

Bottle pours a straw yellow with a foamy white head. Smells and tastes of bread, floral, citrus, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, not bad kind of fresh in my mouth clean taste. Not bad flavors bit fruity bit yeasty.

Hazy  pale golden light with frothy big head. Aromas are citrus, orange, grape, wheat, fruitiness. Body is medium full, texture slick, sticky, carbonation is smooth and soft. Palate little tart and refreshing. Aftertaste is warm from ABV, little sweet and dry with some earthy or leathery flavour. No noticeable hops or bitterness. Overall quit a good tripel, the aromas tend to promise a bit more.

Bottled, 0.33l. Clear pale golden color, huuuge frothy white head and lively carbonation. Grainy aroma with strong note of floral hops and fruity citrus scent, too. Starts with sweet and crispy malt flavor, then followed with alcohol note and finished with warm mouth-coating feeling. Full bodied, oily texture and lively carbonation in palate.

/From notes.  First reviewed 12/19/2008.

Let¬ís go to Dendermonde.
Poured from an 11.2 oz bottle into a snifter.

The appearance is a perfect, slightly opaque golden ale with a huge head, which recedes nicely to leave patches of white lacing. Perpetual internal carbonation. Wow. If allowed to let settle and poured carefully, some small yeast particles will be visible and it will be less opaque. 

The aroma is very subtle. A delicate blend of crisp apples, honey, apricot, some lightly roasted malt, and some bready notes.

First I am hit with some crisp, lightly toasted malt, which moves into a light honey taste. After half a second I sense the crisp apples I smelled before. This is slightly syrupy, which is probably the only reason I have to take off half a point. A slight alcohol presence is warming and pleasant towards the end of the sip, although not too powerful, even though it is 8.00% ABV. The hops are very understated, barely scratching the palate but trying to gently balance out the malt. The yeast adds a light biscuity flavor throughout. This yeast provides a nice third leg for this beer.

A high amount of carbonation in this ale, combined with the light apple taste make it very crisp in my mouth. 

This tripel is crisp, light, and smooth. There is not much more you could ask for than an easy-drinking tripel.

AROMA: citrus (strong), herbs, floral, 
APPEARANCE: pale, clear, sparkling, frothy disappears quickly
TASTE: medium sourness, lightly bitter
PALATE: full body, thick feel, fizzy, long finish quite refreshing
OVERALL: a very good beer, I just do not like some of the aromas and the very strong aromas.

Draught.
Quick rating.
Hazy dark golden, creamy thick head.
Fruity, spicy, banana, yeast, coriander, cloves.
Bottle - huge thick head, medium straw/golden color, excellent Belgian yeasty complex aroma and flavor
Had from a 33oml bottle, pours a hazy blond bubbly head that wisps away to white lacings.  Aroma, bread, floral, grass, barnyard.  Crisp and smooth on the palate with a lovely aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2012 Pours a fairly clear golden with lots of carbonation. Some grain on the nose...sweetness and a bit of booziness in the mouth. All of flavors work together very well. Excellent beer.
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2015 Hazy yellow, big white head. Yeasty taste with some citrusfruits and a little sweetness. Soapy texture, good carbonation. Nice tripel.

Tap @ 5p. Clear, golden with a slight head. Orange peel, malts, citrus liquor, flowers on the nose. Complex taste, like nose but with a floral note. Strange, a bit perfumy. Excellent tripel. Not too sharp, a bit sweet even.

(Flasche) Es hat eine gl√§nzend, goldgelbe Farbe, es hat "Schlonz" und einen feinen wei√üen Schaum, der wie eine Eins steht. Das Aroma ist sehr fruchtig (irgend eine tropische Frucht) und etwas "spicy" im Hintergrund. Der Gerschmack ist typisch belgisch, etwas erdig/schwer und ein bisschen wie das Aroma. Es hat keine Bittere und ist zu stark karbonisiert. Zusammengefasst; ein gutes Fr√ºhst√ºcksbier.

¬øcomo puede ser que haya gente que a√∫n no la ha probado? Increible.
La mejor de su estilo.

Slightly hazy pale yellow with copious white head.  Baked banana bread, floral citrus, yeast, light booze.  Rounded malt sweetness, nectar, banana, dough and ending with bold, but not overpowering citrus and light acidity.  Absolutely no alcohol flavor.  Ultra-smooth and silky from the oats.  Some residual sweetness, lightly dry.  World class.
Just a hint of hops and perfect full body taste.  Nice creaminess which is what I like in a Tripel.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2013 (33cl bottle from Ma Poule @ Torvehallerne) Pours a richly carbonated, clear golden with frothy, white head. Good lace and retention. Aroma is pleasantly complex - malty with green, fruity notes and other hints of yeast. No detectable hop in the aroma. Oily texture, full body, almost sparkling with an astringent and alcohol smooth finish. Complex taste with tart as well as caramel impressions, notes of apple and only a little bitterness on the closing end. I didn¬ít really find a tripel I appreciated before this one, which is very pleasant and definitely merits further study.

Pours a cloudy and light golden color with about a finger of white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is subtle banana and clove esters typical of belgian yeast. Taste is very fruity and refreshing with some slight malty notes. little bit of warmth to this beer as well even though there is no distinct alcohol flavor

Clear draft white head. Off skunky aroma and taste. Grassy and astringent, bitter. No hop, no malt. I might have gotten a bad pour looking at some of these other ratings, I¬íll try it again and re-rate this, but overall, wasn¬ít a very pleasent tasting expirence.
la tripel karmeliet ha un aspetto fantastico,una schiuma corposa e persistente,un sapore caramellato e molto piacevole.
Densa e bem alcoolica, sabor adocicado, lupulado e √°cido, muito bem equilibrado. Uma cerveja muito diferente das outras mais comuns.
Pours light golden with a high head. Aroma vegetables, belgian hops. Smooth medium body, high carbonation. One of the classic belgian beers. Not Bad.

03.02.2012. 0,33l Bottle. 8,4% abv. vinmonopolet.no. Hazy and unclear yellow colour with white head. Very lively carbinated. Sour aroma. Notes of sour or wild yeast. Wheaty flavours. Medium body with strong notes of alcohol. Very refreshing beer with very good flavours of aromatic floral hops.

750 ml bottle into chalice, best by 3/29/2011.  Pours slightly hazy golden straw color with a nice 1-2 finger dense off white head with incredible retention that reduces to a thick cap that lasts the entire glass.  Decent lacing on the glass; with extremely ample carbonation streaming up and keeping a dense head going.  Aromas of big pepper, clove, lemon zest, grass, coriander, biscuit, orange peel, herbs, and yeast spices.  Fantastic and well balanced aromas.  Taste of big pepper, herbal, lemon zest, clove, biscuit, coriander, orange peel, grass, and yeast spices.  Fairly dry finish; but some lingering notes of herbal, citrus peel, biscuit, and yeast spices on the finish for a bit.  Medium high carbonation and medium bodied; with a slightly creamy and slick mouthfeel.  Fair amount of prickly carbonation initially that dies down in the glass.  Very smooth and drinkable for 8.4%; with only a slight alcohol warming on the finish.  Overall this is an incredible Tripel, as I was expecting it to be.  Fantastic and unique flavors; with great balance, complexity, and smoothness.  It has taken me far too long to finally try this one.
Hazy yellow orange, small white head. Fruity yeasty aroma. Mildy cloying Belgian yeasty taste. Citrusy and grainy. Highly carbed. Citrus alcohol finish. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2014 Tasted both on tap and bottled. Very good belgian ale, with a sweety taste, which gives a very balanced palate. Classic!
Fantastisch Tripelbier!  Kleur: goudgeel met een zachte grote schuimkraag. heel fruitige geur en een licht zoetige en en fruitige smaak en een lichte honingtoets maar met een bittere nasmaak.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2012 0,33l bottle from Csakaj√≥s√∂r, Budapest. Hazy golden color with big white pillowy head. Sweet floral, herbal, a bit cheesy odor. Amazing aroma with vanilla, alcohol and some aroma hop. Heavy sweet taste with some bitterness. Medium body with lively carbonation and creamy silky texture. Strong and long alcoholic finish with all the aromas which appears earlier. Fantastic beer, delicious, strong, but not disturbingly alcoholic. I swear, the Belgians work wonder with the grains.
11.2 oz bottle poured into a pint glass.  Hazy pale color with a nice white head.  Nice citrus aroma and taste.

330 ml bottle. Pours a pale hazy blonde with a creamy, persistent, rich white head. Smells of grains and spices. Taste is delicious: sweet, spicy, fruity...quite a lovely mix. Leaves a lingering yeast, flour and bready taste after a few gulps. Body is thick and creamy. All I could think of while drinking it was "wow!".

11.2 to a chalice.  Pours lightly cloudy golden with big white head.  Floral hops with some citrus and grain.  Taste is sweet with some very mild spice--white pepper?  Decent finish.  Not as good as some tripels, but very drinkable.

33 cl bottle. Gilden colour. Huge white head, containing big bubbles. Heavy carbonation. Strong citrus nose, yeast and some bananas. Taste is a little sour in the beginning. Very fruity. Finish of hops and light bitter. Some alcohol. Creamy mouthfeel. 
Very Nice beer, definitely different from other tripels.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2012 Color: Light amber. Champagne like color. 
Aroma: Some lemon, yeast, 
Body: Malty sweet, a lot of wheat flavors, some sourness
Finish: Long, more sweetness
Over-all/Mouth-feel: A little to much sweetness for me.

fles 33cl.
Kleur: helder goudegeel met een flinke witte schuimkraag.
Geur: zoet en fruitig.
Smaak: Zoet en fruitig. Sinaasappel? Licht bittere nasmaak. Prikkelend. Flink wat koolzuur.
Erg lekker!
33 cl. bottle @ home. Golden with a white head. Strong floral. fruity, yeasty smell and taste with some spicy notes. Great tripel!
Caramel, smoke, earthy, woody, roasty, nuts, vanilla, barnyard, resin, floral, basement aromas. (22/01/2012)
Sweet, but not excessively so. Marshmellowy. Some coriander and mild stale hop spice, but overall an odd balance of flavors.

Spice and yeast aroma, a lot of head, so good head retention because of the oats, some hazy yellow in appearance. Very good carbonation. Yeast and wheat are very present in the taste, barley not noticeable at all, anyway it is a good one.
cereal, citrus, basement aromas, cough drop, amber, cloudy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, sticky, full body, flat, long finish,

Small bottle.  Clear golden pour, light fluffy head, though with big bubbles.  Light malty aroma with apricot, with a light maltiness and a bit of sweetness, followed by a touch of hops.  Refreshing and pretty good, but not to the level others have rated it.  I assume I had a less than optimal one.
the best Abbey Tripel beer  . blond ,fruity,and smooth .very complex flavours. excellent carbonation.

Pours hazy gold-orange with thick white head. Subtle aroma of floral and fruity hops. Flavor is very well balanced with a lot of subtle flavors including fruity hops and bready malts. Nice carbonation makes it pleasant to drink. Not as "bold" as a lot of strong beers I like but this is  one I could come back toto over and over.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 Beer in Chimay glass...the pour tests your patience.

Aroma: Strong orange peel, coriander, very floral, cloves, citrusy and grassy. 
Appearance: Hazy bright yellow with a fluffy white head which reminds me of the puffy clouds seen on that picture perfect sunny day.
Taste: Sweet and sour citrus fruits, wheat, quite hoppy....kinda like taking Westmalle Tripel and Schneider Hefe and blending them together. 
Palate: Pretty crisp and refreshing. Drier than I remember from the first rating. Carbonation is fantastic.
Overall: Amazingly complex and better than I remember. Good beer, gotta clone this.
750 mLbottle in a snifter.  Well deserving of it¬ís place in the rankings!  Have been looking for this one for a while and finally found it in Florida.  Excellent aroma, flavor and palate.

tried 20 dec  brussels sprouts bar singapore   Golden , cloudy. Good white head. 
Smells a bit like a wheat beer.  High carbonation very frothy in mouth. Many complex flavours. Semi sharp apples grapes comes to mind with a lingering wit beer taste. Perfumed oranges at the start. Interesting. Mouth juices flow throughout and you are left trying to analyse the flavor notes.  
Overall I think I¬ím a brune kind of guy but the more I sit drinking this the more it challenges your taste buds. Needs to be sampled.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2013 Heerlijk aroma van meloen, appel en citrus. Prachtige volle kraag. Smaak gaat verder dan fruit, met meer kruiden als gember en basilicum, met lange droge afdronk die goed in balans is. #2 bierproeverij @ de Klep 2 juni 2013; tegelijk met Westmalle, heerlijk zoet, maar triple genoeg, geheimzinnig.

Floral hops, a smooth taste of coriander.  The colour isn¬ít the best with a light, clean lager-like yellow with only a little murk and little head, but when the beer¬ís as good as this, who cares what it looks like?  Wonderful triple, lasting alcohol with a light floral sweetness.

Pours to an enormous fluffy head that requires several minutes to calm down--increasing the anticipation. The aroma is something of a trip to the country and freshly mowed fields (wheat, hay, whatever--I¬ím a city kid!). A gentle, sweet taste is dominated by the malts with just a hint of bite from the hops. The taste lasts a long time and is a delight to savor. Truly in the spectacular realm.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2012 Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Pours clear golden color with small head. Aroma of hoppy fruits, spices, hay and caramel. Flavour of caramel malts, hay, spices and ripe fruits. Very smooth and balanced brew from draught also.

33 cl bottle. BBE 11.03.2013.
Originally rated on 20090721. (8+4+9+4+16)
Pours clear pale golden colour with large foamy head. Aroma of fruits, lemon, spices, grass, hoppy floral notes, belgian yeast, herbal notes and mild caramel. Flavour of citrus, apricot, yeast, herbs, mild spices, grass, earth and oat. Lots CO2, bitter palate with a dry finish. Very balanced brew.
3436
330oz bottle pours clear gold into a Karmeliet glass with a huge white fluffy head. Deliciously complex aroma and flavor including numerous fruit, grain and spice notes.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2012 Clear light yellow tone, with a pretty big nose. Spicy peppery apricot aroma, with some coriander, and a hint of banana. Taste was just as peppery and coriander forward. Light banana on the dry finish. Dry citrus rind with some crisp light "tripel" malts. Tasty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Golden with a white, fluffy head. Delicious tripel with aroma of Belgian yeast, wheat and floral hops. Very pleasant in every way. Deliciously refreshing and very well balanced. Alcohol is very well integrated. My favorite tripel!

Notes of peach, orange, coriander, rose and yeast.  Bubbly.  Slightly tart.  Mild bitterness with a short sustain.  The nose has a faint skunkiness which disappears after a few minutes.  A little more delicate than I prefer, but still very nice.  Reminds me of a La Chouffe, but not quite as intense in flavor or aroma.

Bottle.
Straw yellow with a fluffy white head.  Aromas of fruit, grain, clove, banana.  Taste is quite complex - fruity and slightly dry.  A delicious Tripel.
Golden body with a modest off-white head. The nose is somewhat alcoholic and musty with spicy, coriander-like notes featuring. Taste is grainy, with a long acidic finish. Mature mouthfeel.

330ml bottle. Beautiful golden yellow color with a huge pillowy white head. Lost of bubbles streaming from the bottom of the glass. Fantastic complexity in the aroma and taste: clove, banana, herbs, citrus, hay, peach, mango, cereal, grass, spruce, floral hops, and sweetness. The oats and wheat make this smooth and delicate on the palate. A world class Tripel to be enjoyed by all.

750 ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a beautiful full white head.  Aromas of citrus, wheat, and light spices.  Medium bodied, very complex with a great balance between hop and malt.  Outstanding.
Great tripel! Has more of everything compared to other tripels i¬íve tasted. More honey, more citrus, more richness and son on. Very good beer
Fantastic hazy yellow color with a big white head. Lots of spices, flowers and fruit (peach?) in both aroma and taste. My favorite tripel!

I tasted this beer in Louvain, in a place plenty of students of this beautiful city. Cloudy golden pale colour, with a white creamy head that remains for long, long time, almost until the end of the beer. It is a pleasure for your eyes. Fresh and fruit aroma, very intense and complex, spice and flowers notes. In palate it is complex, confirming the nose notes and with a delicious long finish very equilibrated. Full body. I tasted from press (not bottle) and I want to try it in bottle again. One of my favourites.

Pours a very light yellow with a huge frothy white head. Aroma is quite yeasty with citrus fruit and malt. Taste is also citrus fruit with yeast, malt and some spices leading to a modest bitter and warm alcohol finish. Mouth feel is very bubbly initially then softens. Lovely beer.

Golden straw color with a nice banana fruit aroma.  Not much carbonation with no visual head after a few minutes.  Very complex feel on the palate that very few beers can offer.  One of the best tripels in the World.  The alcohol kicks in towards the end.

fantastic
pours a thick pale golden straw.
aroma of juicy pears, cloves, sweet malts and honey
taste of apples, bananas and all of the above.
to be honest pretty much every sip offered xomething a little different from the last.
a complex yet fairly light tasting beer with wonderful aroma.  always worth having to hand.
bottle : beerritz

330ml bottle. Pours an amber apricot skin colour with a very fine white soapy foam, a little dish waterish. Fairly well carbonated with aromas of plum, peach, cinnamon, pear and spice that waft towards the nose. Looks a little thin in the body but the strong flavour and smooth mouthfeel save this one. Almost spritzy in the mouth with similar flavours to the aroma, soice and fruit. Pops and crackles in the mouth and leaves a long lingering aftertaste that is pleasant. Carries the high alcohol content well. Attractive and eye catching lable. A good well constructed and complex abbey tripel. Well worth the price.
Very complex with a long finish.  Creamy, and bold with notes of banana.  Less carbonation than most tripels I¬íve tried.  Solid effort.
Nice golden colour, head disappears quite quickly. Very easy to drink, smooth citrus in flavour, hides alcohol well. Good one!

750 ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden yellow colour, thick white head. Aroma of wheaty malt, citrus fruits and spices. The flavour is malty, peppery, citrus-fruity. Warm and spicy finish. Lively, foamy mouthfeel. Balanced and delicious.

Very fruity, nice aroma, hides the alcohol taste very well. A lot of CO2 made me burp a lot and a head dissappears quite quickly. Very light color. Lively beer. Can recommend for summer, it¬¥s easy to drink.

Deze tripel is op korte tijd uitgegroeid tot een Belgische klassieker. Erg fruitig en zoetig, en mist daarom toch wel wat pit. Als liefhebber van IPA en Brits bier voor mij uiteindelijk te zoet, wat niet wegneemt dat het een aangenaam en mooi bier is.

This poured a semi cloudy bright yellow color with a white head. Aroma was some sweeter malt, lots of candy and fruit, some light coriander spice and  grainy too. Flavor was even better than aroma, very fruity, light hair salon, great balance of spice and fruit while not being cloying and hiding the alcohol very well.

50/50 mix of draught and bottle @ Bishops Arms: √ñrebro on November 26. Got my glass filled up from a bottle since the keg ran out. Pours hazy yellow with a huge white head that slowly dissipates leaves some trace on the glass. Smell is sweet, spicy and very floral with some dandelion, cilantro, plums, peaches and yeast. Taste is sweet, floral and fruity with lots of esters and spice dominating the palette. Very nice!

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 pale cloudy yellow with a frothy white head and a sweet, fruity aroma. taste is really well balanced, smooth, sweet, spicy and fruity. there is good carbonation, and a long interesting finish. a hint of bitterness tops everything off. very nice tripel.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2012 This was 8.2-8.6% ABV, certainly nor the 8% listed. Caramel, wheat, alcohol. Gold body. Large white head. Bitter with a sweet finish. Some harsh alcoholic burn. 8 5 8 3 14 Pale gold body, massive white head. 4 Wheat, fresh hops, aromatic flowers, syrup, alcohol, fruity, champagne, foam bananas. Sweet. Well carbonated. Dry finish. Looks like champagne and tastes rather champagney. A New Year¬ís Eve beer perhaps? 8 5 7 3 14

Bottle. Pours a clear golden amber with a large soapy white head that dissipates to a soapy film. Aroma is bright citrus lemon and rind with a bready yeast all around. Taste is biscuit and lemon pepper and orange peel and a peppery bitterness. Palate is thin to medium feel with plenty of carbonation and finishes crisp and dry.

750ml bottle, shared with my family before Thanksgiving dinner. I wanted to expand their craft beer palates, and I asked the guy working at Dutch¬ís for a good Belgian. He said everyone he knows that¬ís sampled this beer has enjoyed it. I was not disappointed. Pale, only mildly hazy yellow color (the last pour was much more hazy). HUGE foamy head, takes up the majority of the tall, skinny glasses we served this in.. Splotches of lace, naturally. Almost no carbonation at all, very smooth and creamy texture. Wheat backbone, but wonderfully fruity and estery. Spicy, but not overspiced... The whole thing is very balanced, everything about it. Sort of a sweet taste, maybe some savory balanced with the perfect amount of spice... it¬ís a complex taste, with a soft, round zest. Really nice and interesting.
Most tripels are too sweet but this beer is perfectly balanced. There¬ís a bit of lemon and floral flavors that would be more indicative of a farmhouse. Great beer for this style.
Fruity and sweet taste and aroma. Straw color with big head. It¬ís a special beer. As with all trappist beers (in my opinion) it goes well with meats and cheeses...

Stunning Abbey Tripel I picked up at the local store.  Beautiful straw colour with strong aromas of bananas, citrus.  It is very smooth to drink and the fruit carries through in spades,  with medium carbonation.  I really didn¬ít want it to end but always leave wanting more.

I look forward to my next encounter.

What a beer! Smell of malt, belgium yeast, vanilla, caramel and spices. Obvious coriander and orange peel there also. Pours a beautiful clear golden colour with a white lasting head. I¬íve never had a beer this strong before that hides the alcohol so well, i can hardly taste any. Sweetness, barley and yeast followed by slight hops, probably saaz. The coriander and orange notes coming through as well. And soooo smooth! Phenomenal beer!
I¬ím an absolute fan of this beer. The smell is wonderfull, the aroma is o so nice and it looks verry nice.

33 cl. bottle. Slightly hazy light golden colour with a big, white head. Fruity aroma, mangoes and light citrus, with lots of Belgian yeasts. Complex taste: Sweet from exotic fruits, like apricot and spices like vanilla, but also a apple-like sourness. The flavor makes this beer highly drinkable, with no alcohol traceable. Lively carbonated, with a oily texture, almost butter-like. Full body  with a finish that goes on forever. One of the best  triples I¬¥ve ever tasted!
Draft pint, foggy yellow color. Very light and subtle citrus. Refreshing and no sign of a high abv. It¬ís a calm tripel that is enjoyable and not going to blow away your tastebuds with hops.

Super tripel smell when opened,one of the best, but it lost its mojo as the longer it was in the glass. Pretty yellow too with a constant glossy thinnish white foamy head. Nice taste, sweeter and probably cleaner than Westmalle Tripel but in compatison its far simpler with little real individuality in comparison. Needs more complexity and development but still a nice intro in the world of the Tripel.
Bottle. Hazy straw yellow with a white head. Alcohol, fruit, sugar, sweet malt, some yeast.

Thanks so much to Bridget who replaced a bottle brought to me by David, which I so sadly watched explode when I dropped it in my kitchen. Pours with huge off white head over lemon-yellow hazed body. Very pretty, sharp peppery lemon-citrus wafting off this. Lemongrass, honey, pepper. Sharp, spritely body with rich sweet alcohol, coating body. Quite sweet, lemon candy, maybe toffee. Head rush, very tasty and precise. Yum

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2012 Bottle from lokal alco store in Odijk (Utrecht), Holland. Slightly hazy pale yellow colour with a white head. Fruity aroma with a lot of hops. Sweet fruity taste with a lot of hops in it. An amazing lovely aftertaste. Medium carbonation. This beer was one of the best I have had in a very long time. Suprisingly well balanced, tasty and fresh.
Silne a chutne polotmave pivko. Mel jsem ho tocene v centru bruselu. Jeste ze jsem dal jen dvojku, velky bych na lacno nezvlad.

Frothy straw coloured head. Aroma of yeast, citrus, pine. Well balanced, sweet throughout, flavours of orange, honey apple. Great tripel!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl. Golden straw color and nearly opaque with haze. Huge spongy-meringue head. Nose is spicy citrus, peppery resin, and lightly soured bread yeast. Medium body is smooth and sweet, but balanced up nicely by plenty of tingly acidity. Tastes of zesty orange, lemon, pear, honey, and evergreen resin. Some wheat on the finish as well. Very nice.
Poured from 3.3cL Big white head with pils color. Sweet berries, and piney hop smell. Tastes like it smells, sweet and bitter. Light body, but malt complexity. A very special beer.

Pours a pale yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma has delicate spice, a bit of sweet candy sugar, and some spicy hop notes..  flavor follows suit...nice clovey notes and yeasty fruitiness.  Finish is dry ans spicy...medium silky mouthfeel.

bottle saq A: floral, peppery, apple, pinneaple. App: clear blond white lasting head. T/P: body is medium finish is bitter medium long. I get some warming from the alcohol in the finish. Carbonation is medium.  O : nice like the different levels of aroma.

Much better than i expected! Chocolate and grass aroma, chocolate, citrus and cherry flavour, slight "wheat" taste, nice cloudyness from the sediment, fairly well carbonated, pours with a 1cm head, reduces down to a thin head with no lacing, a very nice beer!
pours a light yellow with a strong fruit aroma.  light, airy body.  taste is mild citrus (lemon, sweet orange) - finish is quite similar.  extremely well-balanced.  A fairly impressive offering.

My second favorite Belgian beer. Wonderful aroma and easy to drink. Must have!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank on tap in Several places. It pours Hazy and golden orange with a densely packed foam. It has a sweetish and very slight malty aroma. It tastes exceptional with a big mouth feel this beer isn¬ít watery at all, it is a drink to be savoured.

I nice tripel. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus and some bread. Rather strong smell (in a good way). I also smell a little caramel. A nice and soft smell. Wheat in the taste and some sweetness. Something fruity in the aftertaste. A little alcohol is apparent in the taste. Overall a good beer.

Now this is one delightful tripel! The carbonation keeps the flavors lively on the palate! The flavors in this brew are abundant and very well-balanced. Slightly heavy on the ABV, but definitely a brew to enjoy in the evening a couple of times over! Great as a dessert brew but one that I would also pair up with a creamy/cheese chicken-n-pasta meal!
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2012 bottle at f√°bulas, lisbon, portugal. Fruit and caramel aroma with lovely foam. Medium sweet taste, creamy texture and lively carbonation. Overall OK.

On drught. Blonde with white head, good lacing. Aroma to caramel, malt, citrus and cinnamon. Taste is sweet, alcoholic, not very hopped, caramel, with a long and sweet aftertaste. Smooth and oily texture, with good carbonation, full bodied.
Super malty tasty tripel. Has quite a bread thing going on but in a good way. Not as refreshing as I would like for a Tripel but perfectly pleasant nonetheless

Hazy orange-golden beer with yeast sediments and a frothy, but slowly diminishing white head. Intriguing sweet fruity aromas with notes of belgian yeast, preserved red berries and candied orange peels immidiately hits your nose, once your open the bottle. Taste is complex malty sweet with lots of spicey and fruity notes. Body is medium, carbonation is average, texture is oily, finish is slightly bitter. Very wellbalanced indeed.

Hazy yellow-orange with big, foamy white head. Orange, coriander, citrus, and spice in the aroma. Sweet, somewhat acidic taste. Full of all sorts of flavours my palate can¬ít quite distinguish too well... I¬ím fairly new to the style, but this seems to accomplish what it¬ís going for!

Pour foggy yellow, with a big white head.
To be honest, it idoesn¬ít to anything good on the nose, however theres a lot of flavour, of both citrus, grass and other fresh fruits. 
Has a bit of heat to it, and a big aftertaste.

750 ml bottle shared with friend Alex. Pours out a bright enticing golden hue and produces a thick head. Aromas of fruits yeasts and spices. Tastes light for the level of alcohol smooth and lively on the tongue. Finishes smooth with a  pleasant lingering belgium yeast taste. This ay make it to my top 10 tripels.

How do they do it? I¬íve been drinking my way through the beers of Belgium, and I haven¬ít met one like this before. It has all the balance, smoothness, long finish and full flavour I came for, with a bonus of fruit and spice sitting atop the this-is-a-superb-beer base. If the archangels came to judge the human race, I would offer them this and Trappist Rochefort, and the angels would stay on earth to drink with us.

11.2 oz. bottle thanks to Carlson. Drunk in the backcountry during sunset. Pours a pale yellow with a large white head. The aroma is apricots, lemons, light rye, and oats. The flavor is very sweet, with faint sourness in the end. The palate is light and effervescent, crisp, and refreshing, with a smooth, mellow finish. Overall, this is a subtle, very complex, and thoroughly well made beer.

Bottle 33 cl. A cloudy golden colour with a creamy off-white head. An aroma of malt, citrus and spieces. The taste is sweet and light bitter. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a long finish. A nice complex yet well balanced tripel.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 A: Golden-straw colored body. Just the slightest bit of cloudiness. Massive fluffy white head which had a fairly long life and left behind nice clumps of lacing.

S: Bright lemon. Yeast, bubble gum, pear, clove, corriander, a touch of pepper and bread.

T: Richly layered. Soft fruits like pear, apple and lemon play on top of a light bready/hay body. Accented by pepper, clove and corriander. The yeast also gives off a pleasant bubble gum character (not crazy like Gumbalhead, though). Prototypical tripel flavors.

M: Smooth, medium bodied brew. Solid, clean carbonation. Just the slightest hints of booze on the palate. Semi-sweet finish with just a little lingering sugar.

O: A top notch tripel that ranks right up there with my favorite, St. Bernardus

330ml bottle - $3.99 at Total Wine & More in Alpharetta, Georgia

Appearance: Pours a hazed, dulled golden body with a very tall, meringue-like, white head.

Smell: Lightly tangy, faintly grainy malts with a coating of ground spices and a spritz of potent spirits trailed by notes of blendered fruits and zestful herbs.

Taste: Starts sweet, quite sweet, actually, with a taste of sugary honey candies. Tangy wheatiness, then a variety of flavors cross the tongue, including: ¬ínanas, green apples, lemon juice, orange marmalade, chopped coriander, and a light pinch of white pepper. Restrained floral character midway. Slight, subtle bitterness. Some heat from the alcohol as you arrive at the drying, fruit finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-high carbonation, lively and a bit fizzy at times.

Overall: A very solid, well-made representation of the tripel style.

Pale blonde pour lots of fizzy white head light sticky lacing ... aroma is citrusy and fruity yeast ... taste is citrusy lemony wheat and fruity yeast with a little spicy citrusy bite and sweet malts .... dry malty finish with a little bite as it warms the malts and grains come out more ... a nice brew abv hidden very well

Appearance:  pale straw gold, active white soapy head, strong carbonation jets, soft lace curtains.   Aroma: fresh cracked pepper, grass and hay; smells almost pilsnery.   Taste: notes of bubblegum, green apple, peppercorn, coriander, lemon sorbet.  Finish: tart, a little spicy, with lingering citrus; almost like lemon meringue pie with sea salt sprinkled over it.   Notes: Wow.  I almost didn¬ít buy this because the clear green bottle made me worried about a skunked beer.  I hadn¬ít heard of this, so I had my doubts, but I¬ím really glad I grabbed it.  Smelled like a hoppy pilsner, tasted like a traditional tripel, only spicier.  Palate is lively, but creamy.  This may be my favorite tripel ever.  Magnificent.

Flavor is fantastic, with hops present but not terribly noticeable. Very smooth drinking, a new personal favorite. Didn¬ít notice the high alcohol content at all, nothing to interrupt the smoothness. Had on tap, with very large tap.

Aroma is hoppy and I was worried it would be too bitter. But the flavor was great. Pretty sweet with proper fruity and malty notes and just the right amount of hoppiness. I know I¬ím not breaking any news here, but it¬ís outstanding.
Bottle. Delicious. Sweet and dry Belgian yeast. Fried raisiny sweetness. Fantastic produce.

11.2 oz bottle. 8.4 % ABV. Pours a hazy yellow-orange with a medium white head that collapses into a blanket. Leaves a little lace. Spicy nose--peppery, banana too--but it¬ís all a little muted. Taste is sweet and meaty and a bit dry; somewhat tart in the finish. Carbonation is medium and the mouthfeel is creamy. Fantastic.
Translucent gold with nice head. Aroma is dried fruits, bananas, malt and yeast. Flavor is fruit, yeast and nuttiness.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2011 Bottle and draught tasted at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Slightly hazy yellow / golden color, huge white head. Smell lightly bitter with a slight hint of sourness. Average, ordinary taste: some bitterness, alcohol and slightly fruity. Expected it to be better. Way too much carbo. Medium body.

Klar och gyllengul med lite skum. Doftar s√∂t frukt och lite alkohol. I smaken k√§nns den s√∂ta torra frukten som balanseras v√§l av alkoholstyrkan s√• att den inte blir f√∂r s√∂t. B√∂r nog ha lagrats l√§ngre. Samtidigt en lite syrlighet som √§r positiv.
Decent beer, not a big fan of the whole banana, bubblegum. But this beer was very balanced. Notes of hay, floral, banana, bubblegum and some coriander.
Looks like champagne. Doesn¬ít taste like champagne. Smooth. Tons of head, this was challenging to pour.. Not too spicy. I like this a lot.

Poured a slightly hazy yellow color with a medium sized stable foamy head.  Strong aroma of lemons, yeast, and herbal hops.  Taste is very crisp and dry.  Quite spicy with coriander and pepper.  Lots of grain flavors with some wheat.  Some slight tartness with apples and lemons.  Finish has a perfect amount of hops that give it a nice clean aftertaste.  Carbonation is slightly too much.  Aftertaste also has some interesting yeast flavors that add to the complexity.  Overall a really nice beer.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 Bottle from Uttobeer. Pours perfect amber and surprisingly is pretty clear. Nose is the best I¬íve ever had on a Tripel. Deep fruity malty and yeasty. Lemon and orange peel, lighter touches of strawberry and raspberry. Lemonade and lemon sherbert sweetness. Taste is slightly disappointing. Yeast, bit of lemon and spice. Sour bitterness on the finish. Fairly crisp and not too much complexity. 3.7 Re-rate 29/03/14 - bottle from Dranken Pawels. Clear golden amber. medium white foam head which dissipates quickly to almost nothing. Nose is very rush. Bubblegum yeast, crisp perfumey Brett yeast, alcohol, light pale grain husk, some lemon, banana and strawberry fruit, vanilla, spice. Beautiful nose. On the taste I¬ím getting the bubblegum and strawberry sweetness, crisp Brett, banana, lemon. It¬ís quite dry, with lingering yeast esters. Very good beer. Re-rate 7/3/15 - same bottle batch from Dranken Pawels. BB date on bottle is 25/09/15. Ageing has clearly worked its magic on this beer. The aroma is now rich orange blossom, deep floral, clean and creamy like buttery white Burgundy, tangerine, lemon. Taste is lovely deep rich floral orange blossom, creamy. Crisp and clean finish, like white Burgundy/chardonnay. Stunning beer! Body is also richer amber, little more oily in glass.

Bi√®re blonde dor√©e, col g√©n√©reux, toutefois √©ph√©m√®re. √áa sent la bi√®re belge en un peu plus complexe, j¬íy d√©tecte une odeur de c√©r√©ales; sucr√©es et d¬íagrumes. √áa go√ªte l¬íalcool, les c√©r√©ales auxquelles on a rajout√© du miel, avec une amertume discr√®te et soutenue. Un go√ªt du vieux continent.

Pours light gold with a big head. Sweet, with a lot of fruit on the tongue, especially strawberries. Nice and malty and I picked up a touch of walnut in the pleasantly bitter finish. Wouldn¬ít think it was 8% - excellent beer.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2011 On tap at the Cerulean Garden in Winona Lake, IN.  Pours golden with off-white head.  Aroma is coriander, orange peel, and belgian yeast.  Flavor is coriander, orange peel, belgian yeast.  More of an imperial white than a belgian tripel.  It¬ís good but I¬ím a bit disappointed.

Bottled. Aroma very complex, spicy and complete. A nice gold cloud.  medium sourness, 
A reference. A sweet bunch of spices.

pours hazy golden with a thick lumpy white head and a bit of lacing.  aroma is sweet candy sugar and yeast.  taste is complex with more candy, yeast, mango, citric hop character and a dry, warming finish.  Very nice.

Hot blimey! This is love in a bottle. It¬ís aroma of yeast, honey and some slight alcohol are a pure delight. Pours in a nice thick golden color with white foam. It¬ís palate is very good and the beer evolves in your mouth. The smell is fruity and sweet. Wonderfull abbey tripel.
Yeast and citrus in the aroma.  Sweet taste with some citrus and spice.  Very easy to drink for an 8% beer.  Great beer.

33cl bottle, Duvel glass. Orange/ dirty yellow colour, great foamy head. Nice floral aroma, fruity and almost sweet aftertaste, not too long, with citric notes. Refreshing and soft for his 8,4 %. Unique and fabulous beer

On tap @Quartiere Latino - Follonica. Very easy to drink, fruity and sweet it doesn¬ít seem to be a tripel. The alcohol is not noticeable too much in the taste. Low persistence froth, golden clear colour.

Pours an almost opaque yellow body with a thick fluffy head. Mildly sweet aroma with pear, orange, malts. Taste is full-bodied with balancee fruit aroma, little estery, soft spicy hops. A well balanced beer, better than I¬íd hitherto thought.
Pours a mostly clear golden yellow with a medium pale head. Aroma is of marmalade. Taste is quite sweet - honey, sugar and orange marmalade with no detectable bitterness.
330 ml bottle from Stockmann, Tallinn. Pours hazy light yellow with a white head. Flowery, citric aroma. Flowery and fruity notes in the flavour.

Poured a slightly hazed gold, surging white head that falls to a nice, lasting, white foam.  Peppery, spicey aroma, softly malty with sweet pit fruit and a touch of citrus zest.  Sweeter than I expected and rather lemony, finishing herby with hay and more spice.  This is a very lovely tripel.  I opened this after having to abandon an undrinkable bottle of wine, and it was a perfect mood lifter.

Serving 330 ml. Bottle.  It pours a heady light gold color with a tall white head. The nose is belgian yeast, a little anise, coriander, and a touch of sugar. The flavor is a mix of yeast, a slight grain note, a touch of licorice. Very light in body with high carbonation. A very nice Tripel.
Ample carbonation with a frothy white head; spicy, grainy, earthy, rooty nose; crisp slick mouth feel; spicy and fruity flavors emerge; superb.

330 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a hazy golden yellow with moderate-sized, lasting white head.  Aroma is floral and yeasty with lots of fruitiness and spice.  Flavour has citric and lightly tropical fruits with some spice and a sort of spruciness.  Modest bitterness in finish.  Alcohol is rather subtle and carbonation is fairly fine but reasonably lively.  Impressive.
Bottle. Clear yellow in appearance. Nice lively carbonation. Cheddar cheese and wheat aroma. Nice wheaty taste. A touch of spice. Very good. Goes down easy. Pleasant.

Hazy blond with a tall white head. Aroma of flowers, yeast, spices. Taste is sweet, fruity, but ends dry and leaves a pleasant alcoolic aftertaste. Very well balanced beer, you don¬ít really feel the alcool it¬ís in there.

A - Fruity and spicy
A - Light, slightly cloudy with ample white head
T - Light sweet spicieness with controlled dry finish
P - Medium with soft carbonation
O - Classic great triple
Pours golden blonde with a big white towering head. Aroma is malt, grain and wheat, even a bit dusty. Bit disappointing as it lacks something to counterbalance all the graininess.

Appearance is golden brown with minimal white head. Aroma is of spices, yeast and some malt. Flavor is very distinct in spices with an added pine like flavor that really set this one apart from other Belgian beers.
Smells Good, Looks good, Tastes Great, I like it now or later.  All I could ask for, is more...

Great pour...super thick white head that wants to stick around. Clings to the glass for dear life! Absolutely clear golden with tremendous carbonation. Aroma of fruit, earthy, alcohols, musty, and malts. Taste is mild for a tripel, but extremely well balanced. Malts are subtle. Medium bodied appropriate for style, and a nice sweetness to counter-balance the 8% ABV. Tasted from the bottle @ 68F.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2012 33 cl bottle (8,4%), BBE 11.03.13
Very fresh aroma with citrus and orange peel and hints of spices. A bit too much CO2 on mouthfeel when sipped right after pouring. Flavour is dryish with orange peel, caramel, citrus and some spices. Citrus steps forward while the end of glass is approaching. Lovely tripel, not too sweet and hides alcohol very vell. Paired fine with belgian fries + dijon mayonnaise.
The keg version is much more sweet and sticky with more caramel.

Clear golden with a moderate foamy white head. Aroma of pale malt, Belgian yeast, some spice and citrus, and Heineken....weird, but not enough to do damage. Yeast and pale malt dominant in the taste; sweet with a slight bitterness at the finish. Medium bodied, a touch dry, and a touch fizzy. Good beer, but the the Heineken-like aspect of the aroma doesn¬ít make me crazy. At least there isn¬ít any of that in the taste. Good beer, but kind of dull as far as tripels go.

33 cL bottle: Appearance is golden brown with minimal white head. Aroma is of spices, yeast and some malt. Flavor is very distinct in spices with an added pine like flavor that really set this one apart from other Belgian beers.

Date: July 30, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Lucia¬ís, St. Paul, MN Appearance: Orangish gold with large amount of head. Aroma: Citrus and yeast. Flavor: Consistent with aroma, little bit of alcohol, slight carbonation. Other: After the La Trappe Quad, this was kind of a let down, a good beer but just did not do much for me.
Pours cloudy-gold with a nice head and lacing.  Taste balances well between malt and bittering.  Clean and refreshing, worth seeking out.

Whole Foods Market, DC 75cl ($11): Pours a fizzy golden color with a prodigious white head. Aroma is spicy from the corianders, very fruity, banana, a couple hops, and pepper. Taste is pretty much up the same alley. It is a little funky, moderately sweet, and the carbonation digs the taste into your mouth all proper like. Some citrus and the finish is rather much on the dry side. I thought it was a good beer, but then again I like tripels.

Bernsteinartige Farbe mit viel co2. Gleichzeitig steigt der typische Geruch eines Tripels in die Nase: medizinal und vielleicht auch etwas nelkenlastig. 
Geschmacklich gibt es nichts zu meckern: sch√∂n ausgewogen malzig mit einer karamellig-nussigen Note pr√§sentiert sich das Karmeliet Tripel. 
Einziger Wehmutstropfen: der starke Alkoholbeigeschmack. 
Insgesamt aber ein noch recht vern√ºnftiges Tripel.Test vom 14.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

One of the most refreshing big beers ever made--works as well in the summer as it does in the winter. 
Aroma is bready with a citrus twang.
Appearance is a cloudy hay color with a boomer of a head.
Taste is refreshing but full.  Excellent balance for the palate--not too malty or hoppy.  Just right.
Overall this beer is a real treat.

To much koriander!!!!!!! Sweet blond triple, not my kind of beer.
Heard it has much more koriander aroma and taste then in the early years.
I think it had to much attention and it becomes to commercial!
Not my type of beer at all. I found it to be light, uninteresting, over carbonated. I really don¬ít know where people come up with some of the accolades they give this beer.

Classic tripel pour: big bubbles, soapy, bubble bath style head. Color is dark gold. Pours thick and then descends a bit. Aroma is warmth, alcohol, funk, fruit, sweet. Palate has plenty of bounce; very bubbly. Alcohol flavor is present, but in a good way--adds depth, actually. If you had to pick a beer to define the style, this is a great candidate.
Bottle from Bierzwerg. Originally rated on 9.10.2010. Good, slightly sweet and fruity tripel.

Pours a light yellow with a huge fluffy white head.  Lots of carbonation in this one.Aroma is a light clove spice.  Very light taste throughout, finish is very sweet with a fruity sticky finish.  Alcohol is very well hidden.  Would drink again.

Clear light yellow tone, with a pretty big nose. Spicy peppery apricot aroma, with some coriander, and a hint of banana. Taste was just as peppery and coriander forward. Light banana on the dry finish. Dry citrus rind with some crisp light "tripel" malts. Tasty, but a bit too dry and Belgo-spicy. Still a great Tripel.
Pours a slightly cloudy yellow on tap at the map room. Fruity banana aroma. Foamy texture and nice finish. Sour encore.
A pale golden color. Nose is full of nectar, clove, and spice. Medium body with lingering malt sweetness and alcohol.

Draft @ Sunset Grill and Tap, Alston, MA.  Served in a Trappist glass. Nearly see through light gold color. Small thin head with light lacing. Taste is a light, smooth subtle Belgian spice. Belgian yeast and lots of floral notes. As it warms , you get a boat load of perfume and floral notes. The ABV is well hidden and can creep up on you if you are not careful.  A solid Tripel. And something tells me it would be real different in a bottle.  Well worth the money.
Draft. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Fruity and spicy aroma, with floral and peachy notes. the flavor is fruity and spicy, with some anise-like notes. Good stuff.

Bottle at gr√ºnerl√∏kka brygghus. 
Hazy golden body, big white head. Sweet aroma with honey, caramel malt and apples. Taste is also pretty sweet, with more caramel, yeast and several fruits. Body feels very thick, and the bitterness is nice.

Pour - bright golden yellow body looks almost like champagne. A thick two or three fingers of dense white head. Tons of carbonation.

Aroma - sweet and fruity with a predominant lemon fruit and light spicyness and light bread malts. No hops or alcohol detected on the nose

Taste - the middle is sweet and the lemon taste comes through huge with a tangy and lasting lemon almost akin to lemon pledge cleaner. The malts are light and sweet with a subtle spice blend of cloves and coriander. 

Palate - incredibly silky smooth texture with medium body and good carbonation. 

Overall, one of the best tripels around and that lemon taste is outstanding.

0.33l bottle. Pours a clear champagne-golden body with a medium sized off-white creamy head. Aroma is yeasty and sweet with notes of nice sweet dried fruits, spices and candy-sugar. Lively to aggressive carbonation, full-bodied and has a oily to sticky texture. Tastes really nice with Belgian yeast, light malts, sweet candy-sugar and has a good bitter and light spicy finish with a longlasting warming, almost burning alcohol-note in the aftertaste. Really nice tripel.
I am not usually a fan of Triples, but this doesn¬ít taste like a regular triple and has to be one of the best tasting beers I have had to date.  Definitely ¬ícase-worthy¬í
Bottle at Guusjes, Utrecht. Nice hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of malts, spices and citrus fruits. Malty fruit taste combined with yeast and malts, nice alcohol balance. Love this triple!
Olut on kullankeltainen ja sen valkoinen vaahto on runsas. Tuoksu on huumaavan hedelm√§inen, simainen ja hunajainen. Maultaan olut on hieman kirpe√§, hedelm√§inen ja aavistuksen mausteinen.
Hazy golden with a white head - aroma of malts, some spicy and fruity yeast - tasted of malt, some citrus and a good and spicy yeast note - this was very good and very tasty

Drank a glass of this from tap at Monk¬ís Pub on 6-17-11.  Been a short while so I don¬ít remember it too vividly.  But this was a great beer.  The three grains worked well together, providing a full satisfying mouthfeel.  Color was great and the head retention was very nice.  I remember the lemon character strongly, which accented the complex malt character.  I remember flavors of medium honey and some yeasty character as well.  Also had some very nice fruity ester character.  Wonderful brew that I should revisit sometime.
Golden beer with big flakes of lee and nice collar. Aromas of fruit and spices. Mainly malty fruit taste. Refreshing even with 8% ABV. One of my favorites

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2012 On tap at the Doerak, Delft.
Not much cream head.  Pale golden colour.  A lovely smooth triple.  One of the best.
Had this from the bottle and from the tap. The bottled one tasted a bit better to me. Quite a unique taste, and the glass is one of the best.

This is one of the most beautiful beers I have ever seen. Lemon yellow with an enormous fluffy white head. Too much head? I¬íll just let it sit for a few minutes thank you. This doesn¬ít have smell, it has scent: of lemons. barley water and lemon curd.
Sharp lemon citrus initially and it spreads into generous bitterness and herbaceous gorgeousness. Tasty, there¬ís more notes going on, but this is fluffy, tangy and like a favourite niece.
UPDATED: JAN 13, 2012 With a light and wheatie aroma and a golden yellow apperance with thrawfy head this tripel is a nice powerful summer beer.

Draught at the Blue Monk Buffalo. Pours a gold/ copper colour, with a ring of white head and some spotty lace. Smells sweet and a little yeasty. Tastes tangy, sweet and bready. Really really nice and smooth.

Sehr fruchtig-hefiger Antrunk, der keine R√ºckschl√ºsse auf den Alkohol schlie√üen l√§sst. Komplexer Mittelteil, in dem die Fruchtigkeit weiter wichtig ist. Die Hefe wird st√§rker und aromatischer, das Bier ist spritzig, sehr getreidig. Zum Nachgeschmack hin deutlich malziger, was von dem Getreide getopt wird, auch die Hefigkeit ist weiter pr√§sent. Lecker! 	 
Test vom 25.12.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 13,13,12,12,13,12 - 12,30
Pale gold in appearance and the aroma is spicy and yeasty.  The flavor is heavy on the yeast and has a strong banana flavor as well.  Very nice Belgian ale.
Bottle. Pours a golden yellow with a white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, citrus and some spice. Flavour of Belgian yeast, dry orange peel, spice and citrus. Sooth yet bitter.
A true gem! Perfect beer for a hot summer evening. Great fruity taste, this is a real fresh beer!

Pour golden yellow white head good lace. Aroma spice, pepper, Belgian yesst, floral hops. Taste sweet malt, mild dark fruit, spicy yeast, pepper. MF easy drinking medium body fizzy carb. Solid super easy to drink brew excellent thirst quencher.
33cl bottle at home. Pale yellow with white head. Yeast, fruit and wheat. Coriander, clove & citrus. Fresh! Lively carbonation. great filling and a long pleasant finish.

02-JUN-2011, bottle @Sonni, from "Fish & Beer". Large bottle served in flute.
Gourgious high white head that really coats the glass. Body is orange golden and hazy.
Nose is very yeasty with all sorts of fruits, banana, peach, but also spices.
Taste is much the same but also some charamelly malty stuff.
This must be the best tripel I have had. Thanks, Sonni.

Good aroma with hints of caramel and citrus.  Fruity-spice!  Nice golden color with a pretty good head.  The taste-caramel, spice and fruit.  I was so impressed, I bought a Tripel Karmeliet glass!  For some reason, the big green bottle has a better taste than the smaller.  One good Belgian beer!!!
Pours a gorgeous creamy dark blonde, very fruity nose.  Tastes of cirtus, cream, with an aftertaste of spice and a great bittering finish.  The palate is thick.  Overall this is an excellent beer!
Ale Belga piacevolissima, molto fruttata e dolce al palato, ottimo aroma con sentori di caramello, veramente ottima .

330 ml bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Brewed by Bosteels. ABV is 8.4%. The glass fills completely by an enormous foamy head, and the golden beer below appears only slowly. Strong and attractive aroma of spices, Belgian ale yeast and some fruit. The flavour is also spicy and yeasty with some fruit, notes of white kandij sugar, but the sweetness is not too much. Moderate hops in the finish.

Pours a clear bubbly yellow into a tulip glass. The head is thick with sloppy trail lacing. Aromas are floral and tangy of yeast, citrus and barley. The flavor was bright and spicy. Notes of yeast and malts, with a nice bright citrus behind the carbonation. There is a nice bread-like undertone that provides a good backbone of flavor here. The light warmth of alcohol is very nice, and appetizing. This was a bit of a different tripel, but a satisfying one nonetheless.

Seriously refreshing taste, full of citrus and soft spices. Aroma has lemon, lime and fresh grass. A wee bit of orange and vigs. And there is the glass.. wow.. The beer just looks awesome in it¬ís glass. Big, huge foamy head that fills up the uppper part of the glass and stays on for quite some time. Really good beer."

Golden pour with large billowy head. Aroma of candied fruit. Taste of caramel, cloves, and banana. Had this on tap for the rating, but when I had this by bottle before I remember it being much more sweet. Very good beer either way but there was a noticeable difference between tap and bottle.

Bottle. Pours orange-blonde with sticky white head. Aroma is of sweet fruits and yeast. Taste is amazing lots of flavor here... banana, clove, sweet fruits. Very smooth drinking brew and the alcohol is masked very well. This is one of my favorite Belgians

Pours a light hazy yellow with a tall, pillowy white head that is extremely dense. Aroma has sweet nose with a light tartness. Flowery notes, light bready notes, very fruity with notes of light cherry, tart apple, light pear and finishes with some light grainy notes. Flavor has a mild coriander spice to it with notes of orange, apple, light yeastiness and very light grainy notes at the tail end. Body is light, slightly crisp and a lot of carbonation provide for a very pleasurable brew. Beer is slightly sticky as a few drops got on the table and make my glass and hands pretty sticky. Overall a fantastic beer. Flavors are well balanced and compliment the nose perfectly. Fantastic mouthfeel on the beer. Alcohol is virtually not detected with all the other flavors and feelings going on in the brew.

14/05/2011 33cl bottle @ home - BB: 29/10/12 (2011-206) 
Pretty cloudy dark yellow beer under a white creamy head that¬ís pretty stable and a little adhesive. Aroma: lots of citrus fruits and grapefruit, almost like cleaning product, lemon zest, candi sugar, bit of grains. MF: good carbon, full body, creamy texture. Taste: some sweet malts, citrus, sweet ripe fruits like apricot, bit of banana, grains. Aftertaste: sweet malts still, some gentle hops, bit citric.

Fairly clear light golden body with big white head. Fruity aroma, mango and light citrus, with yeast. Mildly carbonated making it smooth. Taste not as sweet as expected. A light apple like sourness first. Aftertaste has a clear alcoholic tone, almost cider (apple wine) like. Tasty beer that¬ís not as boring as some Belgian ales. (33cl bottle)
C¬íest une tr√®s bonne bi√®re avec des bulles assez fine qui roulent en bouche, elle a une tr√®s belle couleurs et un go√ªt bien √©quilibr√©.

Tap at Bier Stein. Clear and bubbly golden pour with a massive cap of white foam. Smells of cinnamon, pepper, coriander, some light bread. Quite complex and well melded aroma. Taste of grain, pepper, wheat, light oat, lemons and maybe a little dried fruit. Tasty beer, would drink again.

33 cl bottle.
Pours hazy, sparkling, yellow with a white fizzy head that turns into a rim. Notes of peat, spices, barnyard and spicy Belgian yeast on the nose. Sweet, light alcoholic and bitter with more of the spicy notes coming through. Dry mouth. Medium body. Lively carbonation.

11.2oz bottle in a Tripel Karmeliet glass.  Pours golden with a thick, lingering, off-white head.  Aroma strong of the different types of grains, Belgian spiciness, and floral hops.  The grains in this beer give it a pretty complex flavor with the hops and some light fruit notes balancing it out.  A really good beer.
Draft @ Dilly Deli, cloudy lemon w/ heavy foamy pristine white head, aroma is heavy pear, fruity esters, some grappa, smooth, sweet, and rich, with more pear and a pleasant warming petina, delicious
Bottle from Cracked Kettle in Amsterdam. Poured clear golden in colour with fluffy white head. Fruity and malty in aroma. Flavour similar.

Bottle...  Poured hazy golden with a thick white head.  Nose had some hop spice and yeast funk going on.  Lots of carbonation, slightly dry with earthy spices, cinnamon, orange peel, hop bitterness, and a creamy malt balance.  Finished clean, short, and refreshing.
Tried this beer at the Casanova Beer Cave Festival (2011), had a nice color and pleasant taste.
Servida en The Drunk Monk (Matar√≥). Siempre he sido un gran amante de las tripel y esta es excelente. Quizas un tanto afrutada pero muy buena.

Aromas of bread, hops, and some grains and spice, yum.  Pours a murky golden color with an ample white head that sits very nicely on top for a while.  The taste is very easy drinking with slight spice notes, and almost perfect balance between malt and hop.  The beer is slightly sweet, but not overly so like many Tripels.  High carbonation and light body.  Overall, a very nice Belgian, albeit a lighter version than expected.  Not bad at all.

Golden blond beer with a firm white foam head.
Beautiful aroma of hops, floral, some citrus and spice.
Flavour is sweet, good bitter hop touch, orange, spice and pronounced malts. Dry finish, spices with a nice hop touch. Nicely balanced. I didn¬ít drink this beer for a while since a very disappointing bottle a few years back, but this one makes up for it again and then some.
(From bottle)
Nice spice notes on the nose. Pours a golden yellow witha thin white head that rapidly dissipates. Nice warming quality although the mouthfeel is a little thin. Does have some linger to it.

18 April 2011, bottle. yellow, slightly hazy w/ occasional bubbles. nice, soft nose. lemon meringue. and alcohol. and i almost want to say it smells fizzy, if that is possible. i kind of want to say some kind of lemon cleaner aroma instead of lemon meringue. and there is a faint barnyard hay element in the background. med/full body and moderately fizzy. taste is a lemon/lemon meringue tripel with an alcohol component that i wouldn¬ít think was 8%.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2011 Re-rating - much more intense on the taste this time and this is reflected in an increase in Taste and Overall marks.  
Original Rating 18/04/11 (8,3,7,4,15)
33cl bottle. Poured initially clear but then turned a hazy yellow. There is a little head and it hangs around. The nose is lemon meringue, 100%. The taste has more creamy lemons. The palate has a big structure, a very creamy texture and it finishes with a clean zingyness. Overall, a lovely beer!
One of my  favorite tripels... A nice hint of fruity flavor, yet not overly sweet. Good looking golden color. Can drink this every day.

In bocca la Tripel Karmeliet ha una carbonazione vivace, e, specialemnte al primo impatto, colpisce con un tocco amarognolo; successivamente per√≤ si sprigionano i toni fruttati, la pesca e la mela su tutti. Il retrogusto ricorda il th√® alla pesca ed in bocca, al contrario del primo impatto amari, rimangono toni zuccherini. La Tripel Karmeliet √® una birra piacevole da degustare come dessert, capace di stupire grazie al suo gusto fruttato ed alla sua dolcezza di fondo.
Had it on tap in Paris at Vieux Chene and Mayflower, and in bottles from Monoprix.  This one delicious beer.  Sometimes you are lucky and it tastes like Fruity Pebbles.

Shared 75cl. green bottle at a group tasting event. Have seen a few of these bottles near top shelves exposed to a lot of store lighting, so I was somewhat worried at first. Poured a hazed, straw/light golden hue, with lasting, small bubbled, white head foam, and waves & spots of lacing. The aroma was light yeast, soft grain, citrusy/lemon, light fruit, and a touch of spice. The flavor added to these, light sweetness, a little tartness, and pleasant, but softer carbonation than I would have expected. Panic averted, and a very flavorful brew.

big boy bottle - pours honey in color and cloudy with lots of white head.  Aroma is fruity and roasty.  Reminds me of some pastoral scene.  long finish.  Tastes a little sweet.  Aftertaste is a tad stale, making me wish I was coupling this with some food.
Hazy golden with a big off-white head. Aroma is malty, fruity, yeasty and spicy. Flavor is medium sweet. Dry and spicy finish with a little alcohol. Nice and complex tripel. 070909

Same bottle as pictured poured into Karmeliet Tulip. Amazing floral notes with a little citrus with some grian. Taste is very similar. Mostly yeasty and floral. Excellent beer. I hope to try again soon.
On tap (purchased in Vegas).  My favorite beer for cheese pairing, great mouthfeel and spicy/strong taste.

Corked bottle from Knightly Spirits! Nice brew indeed, as I have long wanted to try this brew. Poured a nice golden amber color with a lot of huge white head. Nose was full of yeast and wheat/grain with citrus. Taste was yeast/fruit heavy. I like this one a lot. My buddy got a skunky bottle and this bottle changed his mind on the beer.

I had passed by this beer many many times until I came across it on here and realized it was a well reviewed, highly rated beer. How could I miss out? The beer poured a hazy golden color with a fluffy, bubbly white head. Aroma is full of yeast, fruit notes, spices, grain, banana seem to be one note that took me a moment to catch on to. Flavor is great! Fruits, spices, notes of booze. Woah! I¬ím getting this one often.

It pours a very bright gold that is clear with a nice white head, minimal lacing. 

It smells very sweet and hoppy, notes of citrus.

The tatse is surpisingly sweet with notes of fruit and hops.
bottle.  A nice classic triple with great aroma.  Nice bannana taste.  brownish color with a decent head.  smooth for a triple.

Old birthday gift I finally opened.  Highly carbonated with a frothy white head on light, copper/yellow beer.  Aroma is clean oat and wheat with a light clove and stale lager influence.  Taste is clean sweet malt up front followed by light raisin, an off-fruit tinge, and a very dry finish that leaves some sweet malt/raisin lingering.  Light and somewhat dry in the mouth.  Nothing mind blowing but extremely drinkable with a great mouth feel.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 Re-rate / new rating.  2 * 33 cl. bottle @ home. BBF 14/09/2015. Curious about this one, it has been a long time since I have had this & in the very beginning this used to be my favourite beer. Pours clear, paler cheap cider golden, bubbles rising & white head fizzes away very quickly. Nose is cheap lemon lemonade, air refresher, bit DE profile, white sugar, sweet cornflakes, hint esters. Taste is cornflakes, white sugar sweet, sweet lemonade (lemon), almost hint radler, light esters, cleaning products, zest, citrus, sweet, yeast which seems more DE than BE for me. Carb. is very high. Wow, this was quite a disappointment for me & quite different from what I remember it being. So much so that I almost feel certain that this is not the beer which I had 5 or so years ago. Feels to compromised, cheapened to make as much as possible. Went from 4.7 to 4.5 at some point. Going to give it 4.1 for a mix of both ratings, I feel like giving this 3.5¬Ö A downer.

Aroma has nectarines and hops.   Appears a light gold and slightly hazy with a very small head.  Taste is very sweet with hints of underripe bananas and butter.  Very clean feeling with heavy carbonation.  Overall, a very refreshing tripel.

The best part of this beer is the aroma- cloves, banana, light fruits, and fresh bread. The beer has a HUGE fluffy white head. the flavor is a little astringent, and has an incredibly fizzy mouthfeel, this is like a classy, organized Duvel. Bottle from Moon Wine and spirits in Nashville, TN.

LIVE RATING. On tap at Gollem Proeflokaal, Overtoom, Amsterdam on 17th March 2011. Bright gold with thin head quick to leave a ring and hardly any lacing. A spicy sweet and partly hoppy aroma. Liquid is hoppy, with some honey sweetness and a delicate smoky touch which I love. Touches of cheese. Rich earthy pungency late leaving a honeysweet yet also hoppy, aftertaste. Mouthfeel is smooth and dry. Very interesting beer, would happily drink again.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2011 birra complessa!color oro con schiuma abbondante di media persistenza.
aroma di cerali alcool, frutta fermentata(mela) e buccia d¬íarancia!carbonazione ottimale molti gusti sono presenti!dal dolce del malto al fruttato e anche una nota speziata!retrogusto lungo all¬íinizio sembra volgere verso l¬íamaro e fruttato  poi torna il forte sapore di cerali!

Birra gi√† diventata leggenda. Non copre i miei gusti, ma comunque un bel prodotto semplice da bere. Sia in bottiglia che alla spina va servita e versata con attenzione visto che togliendo troppo co2 diventa eccessivamente sbilanciata verso il dolce.
The aroma is sweet of candy and a hint of caramel. The appearance is a clear yet oily gold with a thin whit head.  The taste is sweet and of bubblegum.  Overall very nice.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2012 Incredible beer. Pours yellow with a small white foamy head. Beautiful hop and floral presence. Fruity, flowery, sweet in all the right places. Notes of yeast, vanilla, grass, cereal. taste is medium sweet. Full mouth with lively carbonation. Alcohol presence beautifully muted for a tripel. Like a fine, sweet champagne.

On tap in Paris.  Very tasty! much better than out of the bottle.  I bought some bottles at Monoprix.  One tasted like Fruity Pebbles, and the rest were less interesting.  But on tap, it¬ís certainly a winner.
2011 - 03 - 04 330ml bottle. light yellow colour.  BIG white head. floral taste. smooth dry palate.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 This is one of my oldtime favourites. But the competition is hard and i decrease my rating by 0.5 points. Still good and going strong. But there are way much better beers these days. Thanks Karmeliet. You are one of my teachers.

Pours clear golden with a large frothy white head. Aroma is nice and fresh with a grassy and spicy hoppiness, honey, hay, perhaps hints of blueberries and fresh fig. Slightly alcoholic as well. Taste is malty grainy with a good yeast component. Honey and flowery, maybe a hint of cantaloupe, bread crust, hints of caramel. And some inexplicable taste component which reminds me a lot of the hay harvest image on the label - spot on with the taste. Lively carbonation and a decent medium body. Very good, one of the best tripels I¬íve had.
Outstanding tripel beer from the folks at Bosteels. Anyone offering you one is a friend... always.

Bottle, Rehills, Ncl. Sweet, malty and wheaty. Pale and lively, with a foaming white head, a fine lively beer. The aroma is fresh and flowery, banana sweet, but balanced, with a bitter tingle on the back of the throat. Pineapple cubes and a sweet, sugary finish, the alcohol hides well amongst the myriad flavours. A cracker...

330ml Bottle.  Pours a yellow to golden clear color with fizzy, medium head.  Aroma is citrus, particularly lemon, with some hints of spice.  Taste is heavy on the lemony citrus flavor with some hints of clove and grassy hops.  Bitterness is very mild and only evident in the finishing.

Bottle. Pours a light fizzy white head that leaves some lacing on the glass. Nice golden color, but more clear than most tripels   (possibly more filtered). Cereal grains and lemongrass in the nose. Semisweet with a slight sourness balanced well with a slightly astringent crisp finish.
bottle. Pours a yellow/light orange color thats very light. Taste is almost like a saison but the booze makes it more of a tripel. Lemon, citrus and honey. Delicious
Good beer with nice thick white head. Clear golden yellow color. Champagne mouthfeel because of carbonic acid. Taste is good with a little vanilla?

A thing of beauty.  Pours honey-colored with a thick champagne head.  Nose is full of yeasty pilsner notes.  Light on the tongue with lemon zest, raw dough, and faint spice notes with cinnamon and cloves. Well balanced, resfreshing, yet bold.  Heavenly.

Absolutely loved this beer. There is a traditional light complexity on the nose and the palate that is absent in the world of bland belgians/belgian style on both sides of the ocean. Spices and fruits on the nose, nice tartness on the palate, very highly recommended

Pours a bright gold with lively carbonation; Big foamy head.  Sour citrusy aroma; lemon.  Taste is fruity, citrusy, and yeasty.  Has a decent malt backbone.  Actually gets more malty and less sour as it warms.  Somewhat of a soapy aftertaste.  I like it, don¬ít love it.

On draft in a tulip.  Pours a blond cloudy color with a fluffy white head.  Good retention.  Aromas of yeast and fruit.  Lots of yeast funk.  Spices and fruit detectable.  Medium body.  Very good.  Alcohol difficult to detect.  Easy to drink

(draft, 5/27/10). Gold color with light cloudiness. Medium off white head. Moderate sweet malt aroma, with light citrus. Sweet malt flavor with light alcohol. Avg duration. Light alcohol finish with light dryness. Slick texture. Moderate carbonation. Fair lacing.

Hazy golden yellow in the glass with a creamy white head. Fantastic aroma of citrus, flowers, cereal grain, and tiny hint of yeasty spice. Fine carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel, medium body. Citrus and grain (wheat?) notes extend into the generous finish. Superb.

grass, citrus, orange aroma; golden, cloudy, frothy appearance; light sweetness, medium bitterness,medium body, lively carbination,slight bitter finish, overall a well made lighter looking beer that drinks abit heavier than it looks. slight bitterness is the predominant flavor that knocks the balance off slightly.  enjoyable but not a revelation.

I don¬ít think I gave this a fair shake the first time I tried it, I will have to revisit. IT pours a deep gold with a  big white head. IT is light and subtle with the Belgian yeast and malt bill filling out the taste and smell.

Hazy yellow hay coloured body, white head. Leaves lots of laces. Aroma has banan, wheat bread, yeast and some clove. Flavour has nice smooth belgian yeast, little alcohol, fruits and soft malts. Mouthfeel is smooth and floury as supposed to be.

Lemonade looking beer with a frothy, white head. Aromas of fresh citrus, wheat, and something peppery. The taste follows the nose, tastes like an alcoholic lemonade. An imperial belgian wheat beer. Very citric, and with a dry/peppery finish. Not bad, but this seemed a bit artificial. Light bodied, and very drinkable.

The bottle looks simple, but good. The beer in the glass very zippy, nice head. Starts strong, a bit soapy-sourish, also fruity like lemon. Finish a bit moldy, but well balanced, fruity like apricot. Nice!
Beautiful color.  Great aroma.  Floral crispness on the palate.  my favorite triple in the world.
Very smooth, nice fruit, well balanced. I always been particularly fnd the color on this one.
Carmel-y, spicy aroma. Slightly cloudy with thick white head. Light sweetness with bigger body than I expected. Almost peppery aftertaste. Get this if you can...
One of my favorites. It¬ís not as good from the bottle and truly needs to be a draught pour to fully appreciate it.
Poured a golden color, medium head.  Fresh sweet aroma, grapes,maybe.  Lite to med sweetness with some dryness at end.  Lite body, med carb, slick.    Overall good stuff.  Im glad I tried it.  Yum.
Pours golden with a beautiful white foam. The Nose is gorgeous fruit with hints of banana. The palate is incredibly balanced. Hop notes with citrus and banana. Awesome.
Bi√®re forte de 8.4 % d¬íalcool. Tr√®s long col au versement, aspect c√©r√©alier important. Go√ªt sucr√©, surprenant, l√©g√®rement fruit√© par moment. Bonne bi√®re froide.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Golden coloured brew with an smooth sweet taste and an slightly sweet bitter taste. Just an good version of the Duvel-style.
Gold looking clear beer with three grains. Nice but with a slightly sour taste.
good belgian blonde..the barley and oats really fccome out at you sooth and a little fruity taste great

Very refreshing beer.  The only knock I have to give it is the carbonation is a little much.  Almost more of a champagne feel, not really what I¬ím looking for in a beer.  I¬íd like to try it again, because I was a little under the influence when trying this one.
Golden pour with a big fuzzy head. Aromas of malt, yeast, fruit, honey and spices. Flavor is frutiy, yeasty, and slightly sweet, but not overpoweringly so.  Nice.
Pours a fuzzy yellow with good amount of head.  Aroma of citrus and spices.  Good carbonation.   Triples aren¬ít my favorites style but I¬íve had better.  Nothing memorable here

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2011 E la Karmeliet √® proprio unica, √® veramente particolare. Si presenta molto bene con colore dorato pieno e una bella schiuma bianca persistente. Aroma di luppolo, agrumi e cereali. In bocca sapore unico, quasi medicinale.

I sampled a 750ml corked and caged green bottle, available at Whole Foods.  This beer has an eye-pleasing light orange/amber body and an enormous creamy white head.  Upfront, t\here¬ís a satisfying honeysuckle aroma that also reveals some alcohol and the 8.4% ABV of this tripel.  Belgian sugars dominate palate entry, but quickly reveal fruity mix of cantaloupe, citrus and banana, and the expected clove spiciness of the style.  A very nice finishing hop and alcohol dryness completes this outstanding and dangerously drinkable beer.  I paired this one with an outstanding Uniekaas Reserve aged Dutch Gouda.
