Una grande tripel,sembra di bere uno champagne con un perlage dato dalla rifermentazione in bottiglia. La mia triple preferita

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2013 33 cL bottle from Beers of Europe, poured into a Karmeliet glass. Looks like a proper beer, with a good presentable head and great amber colour.  The aroma is zesty and enticing. Its a smooth as anything, an ultrasmooth rocket fuel!  Beautifully rich and sweet.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2011 Aroma: Citrus and floral hop notes with hints of banana.
Appearance: Cloudy orange-gold with a thick white head which dissipated much too quickly.
Taste: Heavy sweetness, with a surprising light saltiness at the finish.
Palate: Medium to full body, with a creamy, almost sticky, texture, fizzy carbonation and a long finish.
Overall: This is certainly an exceptional beer, with a lot to praise. Not my absolute favorite, because I found it a tad too sweet, but definitely a keeper. Everyone should try a bottle of this at least once.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2011 Pours with a big white head. Body is cloudy and amber in colour. Aroma is citrusy, and resembles a floral perfume. Very smooth texture, amazing sweet flavour, can notice the yeast, very good and lasting aftertaste. A flawless masterpiece. (10/5/10/5/20)
Beautiful hazy golden colour with a big creamy head. Amazing floral and yeasty aroma with lemon, orange, honey and spices. Full body, incredibly easy drinking. Excellent sweet spicy flavour.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2014 Pours a hazy golden with a white a white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, bread, toast, citrus and orange. You get the same stuff in the taste along with some caramel malts and some hops. A pretty dry mouthfeel overall.

TOP - cerveja especial. Aroma excelente, frutado e com tra√ßos de alcool. Colora√ß√£o alaranjada e espuma ambar cremosa e de boa forma√ß√£o. Forte. Frutada. Bastante complexa. Tra√ßos de alcool bem ancaixado. Densa e cremosa. Bebi no ano novo de 2011.

The sweetest beer I ever loved.  I still marvel at the way fruit sugar is suspended airily in the lively carbonation and evaporates upon swallowing, making for the dry finish leaving the palate totally clean for the next sip.
This was my first tripel, and still by far my favorite after half a dozen others.
Pours a straw yellow color with no head.  Aroma of vinegar and yeast.  Sweet flavor with bread and some fruit and yeast.  Quite disappointing.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2013 330 ml bottle, into tulip. Appearance is a great hazy golden pour with a white head. Wonderful rich blond brew that has tons a depth. Aroma is light a fruity and refreshing sent. Y

Bouteille de 33cl. Blond pale, fine mousse qui tient moyennement. Un go√ªt vraiment sp√©cifique, √† nul autre pareil. Une pointe d¬íacidit√© √† l¬íattaque avec des notes de citron, puis arrive une vague fruit√©e et √©pic√©e mais assez am√®re pour finir √† nouveau sur une pointe d¬íacidit√©. Carbonnation assez importante. La premi√®re est succulente mais les suivantes peuvent vite devenir √©coeurantes, un √©lixir √† consommer avec parcimonie! Trouv√©e √† Vanuxeem - Plogstaert.

Pale golden with medium head.  Aroma citrus, orange and clove.  Medium body with lots of carbonation and alcohol not prominent.  Fruity floral flavors with faint spices, pretty sweet.  It¬ís not really bad but don¬ít think I¬íll seek it out again.

Champagne-looking beer. Hazy yellow, some lacing. Spice and fruit aromas with undertones of acidity. Surprisingly watery body with more spice, some apples and malt. Hot alcohol burn in the finish. A bit too one dimensional.

750ml bottle. Pale golden with a nice head. Aroma has flowery notes, bananas, grapefruit. Taste is perfumey and fruity. There¬ís grapefruit-like hop presence and some sweet berries in addition to the mellow oat and wheat backbone. Very nice, maybe just a notch too thin.
Very smooth! Great Ale for year round pleasure! Not as filling as some of it¬ís bretheren! Overall an exceptional choice!

pours hazy golden with a frothy head and nice lacing. 
aroma is of malts, wheat, apple, pears. not overly bubbly, average carbonation for the type. citrusy and slightly floral hops. exquisite and distinctive yeast.  no tongue tingling here - silky and warming. 

a true masterpiece. chEERS.

Tasted on tap at the Cheeky Monk in Denver, Colorado. Hazy light yellow orange appearance with a big fluffy pearl white head. Lemon citrusy and a bit yeasty aroma. Sweet yeasty Belgian Tripel flavor that¬ís pretty citrusy. Nice lemon yeasty finish.
Mmm, malts abound. Sweet and fruity and a hint of spice. Creamy body and so easy to drink. Lots of flavours from apple, banana, berries, clove, spice and honey. Great bitter bite at the finish.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2012 750 ml bottle. 8.4%. From Sweden. HHOK8. Courtesy of Brandman.
Hazy yellow colour with small white head.
Very fruity (balanced between tartness and sweetness) aroma with Belgian yeast, lots of banana, some sweetness, sugar and malt. Flavour is Belgian yeast, heavy fruitiness, sugar and lots of sweetness. Very fruity and incredibly balanced.
Arome exceptionnel , Tristement elles ne sont que sur commande , ma femme est une amateur de bi√®res et elle en raffole
Thick white head, light gold in appearance. Spicy, malty aroma. The spiciness carries over into the taste, quite carbonated. Interesting aftertaste. Would highly recommend.
hazy golden colour with large white head. Very malty smell. Nice carbonation. Sweet beer with a very faint bitter finish. nice.

It was a saturday night in Brussels and I didn¬¥t know what to order. A nice bloke at the table next to me told me to try this one. I am for ever grateful to this young man. The best beer I ever had? Possibly
On tap at KnB.  Pours a golden color with decent amount of white head.  Smells slightly floral, very Belgian.  Sweet taste, some fruitiness.  Drinkable, but not my favorite in this style.

Pours a pale, creamy light golden with a decent-sized white head and some good lacing. Smell has some nose Belgian esters alongside some citrus. Taste is similar. Quite smooth and nothing terribly intriguing, but overall quite good. Medium body with some nice carbonation and a bit dry. Very well done. Overall, not nearly one of the best tripels that I¬íve had, but still a solid offering.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-10-2010

330 ml bottle pours a wonderful rich blond brew that has tons a depth. Aroma is light a fruity and refreshing sent. Appearance is a great hazy golden pour with a white head. Full rich and very smooth flavor accents this beer with an amazing palate. This is a beew that has something for everyone, rich full bodied brew that packs a punch of flavor.
Mine¬ís in a green bottle - unlike the photograph here.  Light orange w/ a really thick head.  Tons of spices in the aroma and the taste along with some citrus too.

Please purchase this in the smaller format, brown bottle. The larger green bottle can get sun-struck very easily giving this brew off-flavors. Aromas akin to Fruity Pebbles but a flavor profile of extreme pleasure and balance.

Sweet, malts, not a lot of bitterness or hops. Bit of banana and cloves, not as much as some other tripels. A big smell and taste of bubble gum. Nice to have one of every once in a while, but not more than one in a session.

750ml Bottle ; Pour is very light, a touch cloudy golden hue. Very modest white head - it retains itself only very lightly around the ring of the glass. Aromas are grains and barley with a hint of sweet florals and honeydew - This brew is impressive! I¬ím so happy to be drinking this one right now - I haven¬ít been impressed with the Tripels. Until now that is. Wonderful palatability on this one. Grains, Malts are fused with sweet honey floral notes, citrus, while a lingering hop bitterness is present yet finishes not bitter but light and sweet. There is a lively carbonation in this bottle - Excellent!

Had this beer on tap at Monk¬ís in Philly. This beer was awesome! Unbelievably drinkable on tap for a triple. You could not taste the 8% at all. Full body, yeasty flavor with a bit of floral in the nose. Perfect summer/post-run beer. Great to kick things off with!
Bi√®re 3 grains: froment, avoine et orge, de 8.4% d¬íalcool, beau collet de mousse, blonde, cors√©, douce et fruit√©, go√ªt de levure un peu trop important...saveur ressemble √† la fin du monde.

From bottle. Clear blonde body with a white frotty head that lasts. Spicy clove nose with ginger, citrus, herbs. Very complex. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness.Medium body, creamy, lively, long finish. Wonderful Tripel that hides its alcohol content with an amazing complexity of aromas and an incredible lightness in mouth. A must-drink!

18-11-2010
33cl bottle at home. Golden coloured, lightly cloudy beer with a nice white frothy head. Taste is fruity and sweetwith quite complex notes. Finish is very long.

Nice, relatively fluffy head.  Golden to bronze color.  Incredible fruity, estery, flowery aroma. Add banana, lemon and coriander to the taste.  Finishes incredibly balanced - a light wheat, the smoothness of the oats and the semi-dry finish all make this beer really work out well in the end.  I am a huge fan of this and Kwak!

bottle.  Pours cloudy golden blonde color with big frothy white head.  Aroma of wheat, lemon, spices, clove, fresh grain, hay.  Palate is highly carbonated, smooth, refreshing, yet still packed with flavor and 8.4%.  Nice soft fruitiness, pear, apple, honeysuckle, on the flavor, with a dry, spiced finish.  As it warms up a little the honey really comes out, with a subtle lemon sourness, almost like lemoncake.  Fully enjoying this, one of the nicer ones I¬íve had in awhile.

Bottle from Bierkompass. Poured golden with a huge frothy white head, nice lasting lacing. Aroma is sweet with yeasty notes and very spicy. Flavor is similar, citric and slightly sour. Some alcoholwarmth as well. Finish is sweet.  Very refreshing. What an excellent tripel!

33 cL bottle at 1410 World Bier Haus in Calgary, served in a Trappist glass. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. The head remains and leaves lots of fine white lace. The nose has notes of clove, yeast, citrus and spice. The flavour is a bit sweet, but well balanced with hops. It is medium-full in body with a smooth, milky texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a nice malty tripel. 2010-11-10

Hazy golden amber beer.Nice smoothy head.Amazing aroma,tangerine,apple,lemon,malts,flowers,light caramel,bergamot.Taste medium sweet,bitter,hops,alcohol,spices,citrus,caramel.Wa bittersweet finish.An amazing beer.
Nose of sweet yeast, late sugar, feel is mild, carb is weak, taste is hay, sugar, soft late bitterness

Tasted from 330mL bottle at Lush West Town.  Pours clear yellow with a massive white head that slowly settles into fluffy lace.  The nose is full of spicy yeast with lots of black licorice and a dry malt aroma.  The flavor starts off with the sweet malts and then moves onto a whole bunch of black licorice and bready yeast.  The body is medium plus and very sticky with lively carbonation and a long black licorice finish.

Pours clear (after half glass pored the yeast sediment to get that taste as well) golden with fluffy white head leaving very nice lacing on the glass. Carbonation is intense with plenty of small champagne like bubbles in the glass. Aroma is intense of sweet malts, alcohol, hops, fresh hay and yeast. Crispy sweet mouthfeel. Flavor is sweet malty and hoppy, citric, acidy sour. Very refreshing. Acidy crisp sour palate. Sour hoppy bitter, slightly sweet short lived finish.
A great beer,felt like a trappist,smooth and exciting aroma,full body.The palate was amazing,with a sweet finish.

Det √§r en ljus och skumrik v√§tska i glaset. Det doftar h√§rligt av vete, banan och gr√§s (en liten annan doft k√§nde jag ocks√•.. men √§r os√§ker p√• vad).
Den har den klassiska belgiska ¬ìstr√§vheten¬î och en del kolsyra.

Smaken √§r mycket frisk och h√§rligt njutbar. Det √§r faktisk s√• att jag utn√§mner denna till den b√§sta trippelen hittil

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2015 Pours a nice golden color with a big white head. Nose is fruits and alcohol. Aromas of citrus, white flowers, spices, malts and fruits (banana, apricot). A great balance between sweetness and bitterness. Fizzy carbonation, smooth texture and a long balanced finish. Really great Tripel!

On tap at Dad¬ís house courtesy of Chuck¬ís Beverages.pours a pale hazy blonde.mild carbonation and thick white head.not a ton on the nose.Belgian yeasts and grass.quite crisp,honey sweetness with a thicker wheat texture.very nice

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2011 33cl Bottle @Bir&Fud Beershop (Rome). The appearance is ordinary, pale, light golden. Aroma of fruits (banana?) and malt. Nice taste, grain, malt, quite sour. Good body, but very good drinkable. A classic beer.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2012 New rating when knowing that it is one of my favorites. Bottle pours with creamy white head. Cloudy yellow/citron color. Citron fresh smell. Suprisingly strong abbey taste with dry after-taste. Feels a bit sticky in the mouth with full body.
Great ale. Really enjoyed the intense fruit in the aroma and palate. I¬ím drinking more.
Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet malt, fruity citrus, spice, and yeast. Flavor is sweet, fruity, light spice, bitter finish.
750 shared with BarZigKin. Hazy yellow with light head. Aroma is skunky, banana and clove. Heavy carbonation with a flavor of banana, clove and hay.
very cassic one, i find it very strong in tasting, rude bodym fruity and grain. non my kind of beer but great
Pours a dim but solid gold with a rich and frothy head. Richy spice, citrus and yeast nose. Very floral and yeasty taste with a fair amount of sweet. Slightly dry in the swallow.. Good brew.

Bottle/330ml - Pours a clear golden amber in color with a small white head that fades quickly to a thin covering over the beer.  Aroma is thick with bready Belgian yeasts, spices and some citrus.  Flavor is slightly sweet with plenty of bready yeast and fruity esters.  Finish lingers with yeast and spices...  Very good.

Attractive appearance with a hazy golden colour and a frothy, whipped creamy and laceing head beside fizzy carbonation.
Alcoholy and fruity smell, very malty aroma of fruits (orange, mandarin), grain and spice.
Flavour is alcoholy sweet and bready, the light (herbal) bitter and long finish is spicy, citric and the well hidden alcohol is warming up, which remain in a spicy (coriander) and moderate tart/resin-liked aftertaste.
Texture is slick, body¬ís full, but in spite of that it¬ís very good drinkable.
Misses some balance, apart of that overall an excellent brew.
On tap at Stone 9/17/10.  Super light pale hazy yellow.  Big bright thick champagne head.  Reselient.  Nose high and light lemon/citrus.  Taste minty light to late creamy sweet.  Not great.

Appearance: Pours a vibrant yellow gold with a thin white ring.

Aroma: Vanilla, banana and honey.

Taste: Vanilla, honey, spicy fruity yeast.

Mouthfeel: Thick and syrupy.

Overall:  A very enjoyable Tripel. It didn¬ít have the typical earthy spicy tones I associate with classic Tripels.
In bottle; great aroma of citrus and floral. Taste was similar with orange peel and floral notes (A little too floral for me personally). Overall a good beer.
Had this one @ The Congregation in LBC Great selection. Perfect for Sunday afternoon. http://www.congregationalehouse.com/

Bottle. Pours a dim but solid gold with a rich and frothy head. Richy spice, citrus and yeast nose. Very floral and yeasty taste with a fair amount of sweet.  Slightly dry in the swallow.. great brew.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2010 Tap, fluffy little foam, effervescent.  Golden straw color, very clear.  Sugary floral taste, floral like some clover, yummy clover juice.  Malty, a little grassy.  Super yum yums.  Eatery high nite, grape skins, and lightly sweet-bread.

Pours from the bottle a clear, light yellow. Medium head, moderate head. Whoa, this is fruity. Pretty good, this is my second bottle...seems a bit overrated in my opinion. I doubt I will buy it again.

Color is somewhere in between lager and dark lager. Head tells that this beer is strong in alcohol, but it¬ís proper and lasts decent time. Allmost no smell, which is small surprice, only a bit of citrus and sweetness. Taste is complex mixture of weisen like aromas, sweetness and some light sourness. Overall this is great beer.

Pours a pale gold colour with slight greenish tinge. Stacks of head, which is constantly refreshed by stacks of micro fine carbonation. Smells glorious. Sweet wheat, a stack of spices, porridge and some husky malt lingering. The palate is rich, rewarding and satisfying. Sweet and spicy wheat and malt initially, that fades to savoury soy, ginger, honey and spices. Great length and a superb spicy aftertaste. World class. I¬íll have to buy another Westmalle to try it again, but I¬ím thinking that the Karmeliet is almost reaching into the dizzying heights that Westmalle achieves.

Pours a brown color with a fairly large white foamy head.   At first smell, I get plums and cherries.  It also smells of sugar and some wheat.  Taste is fairly sweet, sweeter than I initially expected.  I taste plums and pear mixed in with the sugar.  Some figs and spice round out the taste of this one.  A pretty solid beer much to my delight!

330 ml bottle at The Royale on their Tripels night.  Pours a cloudy gold color with a two-finger thick, foamy bone white head.  Aroma of Belgian yeast, honey, floral hops, lemon citrus, white grapes, candi sugar, apricot, and grainy malts.  Flavor of Belgian yeast, candi sugar, white grapes, wheat, honey, and floral notes.  Medium-bodied, with a yeasty mouthfeel and frothy carbonation.  Just a little tartness kicks in late.  To me, this is one of the best examples of a tripel out there.

330 ml bottle @ home.
Pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a big and foamy white head. Leaves a decent lacing. Aroma of citrus, malts and flowers. Sweet taste with notes of honey, fruits, wheat, spices and mild hops. Medium bodied, oily texture with low carbonation. Decent.

Draught at the Broad Street Tavern, Wokingham during their Belgian Beer Festival. Pale gold with scummy looking thin cream head; coriander aroma; rich, buttery texture in the mouth with apricot fruit flavours, served rather too cold to get the full depth of flavour; the finish is dry with more coriander. Excellent.

Bottle:
Nice white foamy head.
Clear orange color.
Smell lots of fruit, malts, sweets, sugars, hint of hops and spices.
Taste is a pefectly mix of fruits (pear, peach), malts, sugars. Also hints of spices, herbs, honey and yeast. 
Bit creamy, perfect carbonation (lively enough), not really bitter, more sweet and a great glass this beer comes in.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Just got curious and decided to try some new stuff and was told this was pretty good. Definitely on my "top beer list".

Bottle. Pours an elegant, clear golden body with foamy, rich white head into my newly-purchased (and equally elegant) Karmeliet tulip glass. Nose is complex and beautiful: sweet blossomy honey notes with hints of Belgian yeast, citric aromas and candy sugar. Taste is mellow candy sugar, yeast, grapes and wheat. Smooth flavor, albeit with a slightly tart finish. Warming alcohol. Body is medium and well-balanced. Nevertheless, it somehow lacks something of that undefined "extra" that would make me go down on my knees. Very, very solid tripel, though, and definitely among the top of my list.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2013 Clear golden pour. Lively carbonation creates a large frothy white head. Crisp lemon with a hint of herb and spice aroma. Crisp bite. Banana and clove flavour. Refreshing texture.

11.2oz bottle. Pours a clear orange-golden colored body until the last bit of yeast is added making this a hazy, deep orange with a finger-width, dense and frothy, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves lots of lacing. Aroma is sweet orange peel, banana esters, Belgian candi sugar, honey-wheat, bubble-gum, yeast, and coriander. Flavor is similar. Fairly sweet with a good amount of wheat, banana esters, and lots of florals. Some honey bubble-gum with a light coriander spicing. Finishes dry and balanced with a light bitterness. Fairly lengthy aftertaste following a medium-light, all-around smooth, soft body and higher, creamy carbonation. Overall, a pretty solid tripel. Very soft, smooth, and creamy with plenty of fruits, sweet spices, and pleasantly dry. Wonderfully balanced and tasty.

I¬íve just emptied it and it was the best beer in my f***in¬í live!
I wish I could buy it here in our local store but ... nothing! -.-
Una birra che puoi amare o odiare ma in ogni caso un prodotto che ti colpisce. Bellissima nel calice, se correttamente spillata, ti colpisce immediatamente per il suo bouquet ampio e persistente.
UPDATED: SEP 26, 2016 The missus loves this. An excellent beer. Spiced/sweet/tart/sour like other tripels but this has definite drink-ability that others can¬ít match.  Serving: Bottle and Tap

Hazy golden with dense white head.  Aroma provides a hint of mustiness as well as candy sweetness.  Candy sweet and spicy, lingering Belgian yeast flavor.  Sweetness is not over the top and certainly to style.  For some reason I held off on this brew and not sure why. This is really tasty.

Served on draft at World of Beer in Carrollwood, FL.  Pours a clear golden colour with a foamed white head.  Tons of yeast, sugar and sweet malt in the aroma.  Very nice flavor with a dry mouthfeel.  The 8% is well-hidden.

great head. nice blond colour. aroma: grassy and citrus notes upfront are complimented by yeas and bread notes. Big grain and cereal aromas fill the glass and lees and vanilla round out the nose. Palate is nice rich round on the first sip. Lees flavours dominate the palate. I found it had a fresh cream profile. Slight grassy bitter notes on the finish. A fantastic brew. One I could enjoy again and again.

330ml bottle. Pours bright blonde with white head that leaves good lace. Very complex nose of fruit and spice with a hint of smokiness. A touch less interesting in the mouth with the same elements showing and a slightly sweet finish that lasts. Superb.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2013 A light yellow beer with a beautiful, very big and blonde head. Aroma is great and aromatic, lot of fruits, orange skin, parfum and tight spicyness. Taste is also fruity, parfum, spicyness, some honey and caramelly sweetnes. Aftertaste is not dry, some herbs and spices. Alcohol is totally hidden, cool. Medium palate and nice to drink, high but smoothcarbonation. Complex and very aromatic, sweet, but balanced Tripel.
My favourite Belgian beer. The oats are an unusual adjunct and they add a lovely smooth flavour. I¬ím not sure this is travelling too well from some of the transatlantic comments.
Pours a golden yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is yeast with a bit of mary jane. Taste is sweet yeast. Sweet grapes and caramel. Palate is good with a decent finish. Overall a pretty good beer
100 subtle tastes combined in one unctuous liquid, that leaves you wanting nothing but more.

Bottle from SAQ. Pale gold clear pour and white dense head. Aromas like yeast pear spice and... petrol? Taste some petrol and coal notes, like heating oil, over a fairly fruity and peppery-spicy flavor profile. Some light bubble gummy flavors. Glad I have another bottle to re-try.
Poured a massive massive head (overflowed the glass) however it was very sparse, like soap bubbles.  Usual wheat beer/hopped aroma.  Taste is good but nothing special.

Bottle. Pours light straw coloured with a small white head. Fruity spicy aroma,citrus and acidic green apples. Taste is full of flavours, more malty oriented, moderate sweet citrus and fruits. Lingering aftertaste, spicy and acidic as well, quite a good one for my 1000 rating.
Typical strong abbey Belgian beer.  Taste is maybe a little less complex than other beers (Duvel, Chimey etc.), but some people may like it better.

Bottle. Honey aroma upfront, malty taste underlying. Lightly spiced with a nice finish - no real bitterness. Gorgeous. Would like to rate the brew on draught at Paters in Antwerp next time I get back. Very smooth.
Typical European beer aroma.  Hops and a bit of cereal malt.  Slightly cloudy lemon yellow color.  Earthy yeasty flavor.  Overall its OK, I had higher expectations for this one.

In my personal history of beer, this is such an important beer.  This was the first beer that I ever tasted, and thought, "Wow, beer really is delicious."  Before that, I was either forcing myself to drink beer, or tasting things to humor my boyfriend.  After trying this beer, my interest in trying beers to see what else was out there was sparked.  I first had it in some place in Philly, where they do beer and cheese pairings.  From the first sniff of the sweet, citrusy, fruity nose, to the first taste of the perfectly carbonated, golden brew, it was love, as the flavors of banana nut bread, honey, and cloves revealed themselves.  And any time I am in a bar, and I can¬ít decide what to get, I know I can always count on this beer to be delicious.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2012 Golden with nice head. Aroma sweet fruit, apricot, light malt. Taste sweet fruit apricot jam, candymalt., Medium body, text  thin, carb fizzy, hidden alcioho,finish short. Well balanced, easy and drinkable. But somewhat neutral or sublim, however it¬ís powerful. Gets more character  with some aging.

Bosteels Brouwerij--Karmeliet Tripel--1999 11.2 oz. Bottle.  8.00% ABV.  (3.5 / 5.0)  Big head.  Light pellicle.  Clear golden color.  Belgian yeast ester front is restrained and tasty.  Clean smooth malt body mellows yeast somewhat.  Finishes lightly sweet  with minimal hops.  Sampled 12/20/1999.

Bosteels Family Brouwerij, Buggenhout, Belgium--Tripel Karmeliet--2008 Corked Green 25.4 oz. Bottle.  8.00% ABV.  10 IBU¬ís?  (4.75 / 5.0)  Belgian Ale--Blonde.  Foamy white mild lace head.  Fizzy clear bright thin peach gold color.  Delicate wildflower mild fruit ester front.  Fizzy creamy mildly tangy complex Barley Oat Wheat Bottle Conditioned mild sweet fruit spice rich body.  Cloying mild clove refreshing end.  No Belgian Yeast Ester.  Sampled 8/23/2008.  1 @ $11.99.

Slightly hazy golden pour with a nice white head.  Nose of yeast, citrus, wheat, light booze.  Taste is yeast, with plenty of fruit, spice, light booze, grain.  Mouth is light and carbonated.  Overall, a nice tasting, solid tripel.

Rich Golden Color

Coriander, Spice, Honey, Almond

Nutty Malt, Almond flavor, Creamy finish. Not acidic. Slight bitterness but pleasant with the creamy finish. 

Creamy, medium bodied.

The carbonation factor in this one makes it a sipper.
Nice tripel , aroma of fruit, candy, banana, vanilla, citrus something like butterscotch or raisen. Sweet flavor but not overly so. Nice pillowy  mouth feel and good finish.
A surprising, skunky smell that belies the beer inside. It¬ís a light, cloudy yellow look. Has a round, slightly bitter taste with a nice hint of citrus. Very good.

Fruity aroma, thick bubbly head that does not subside quickly. Hazy golden appearance. Slightly sour in taste with a fruity finish. For a first time foray into the abbey tripel style this beer did not disappoint.

Blond hazy color with rich white head. Nice fruity and malty aroma along with a fine taste of caramel- some fruits and alcohol. A very nice beer if you ask me. A little expensive( at least here it was around 4 euros) but I¬íve paid more and this one was worth it.
75 cl. bottle. Clear golden color with a generous rocky head. Bananas with some grainy malts in the aroma. Phenolics come through in the taste finishing off dry.

Pours a mostly clear amber with mondo head that dissipates into a thin film skimming across the surface.  Faint aroma of yeast and malt, with very slight fruitiness (apricot)  Thin mouthfeel with ever so slight effervescence--about what you¬íd expect for the style.  As with model tripels, taste is kinda funky--yeast and malts predominate, slight fruitiness (banana, apricot), with little hint of alcohol and practically no hops.  A fine tripel.

Beautiful blond-gold colour with a loose white head which rises high but falls quickly, leaving behind only a little lacing.  Highly carbonated and effervescent, this beer is best drunk below cool on hot days.  Fresh aroma of hops, light caramel or white sugar, butter, and some softly fried onions.  It is joined by a tart yeast presence and a touch of lemon.  Mouth feel is fizzy at first, but this calms down to a good creamy texture.  Taste is much like the aroma, but the hops come into play and there¬ís more of that lovely Belgian yeast.  Sweet, but not sickly.  Overall it¬ís a very well balanced beer - a main stay really, and one that it is very hard to find too many faults with.  As it warms the malts widen to give off the taste of the three grains.  Good stuff.

nice perfectly clear light golden colour. nice legs, too, with a white frothy head and thick, crunchy lacing. a truly mixed bag of tastes, here -- cotton candy, bubble gum, banana, fried plantain, cinnamon sugar, maple syrup over pancakes. wow. quite sweet, but the alcohol lightens it up enough that it doesn¬ít come off as saccharine or too heavy. nice tripel, well worth trying for the crazy melange of flavours. even nicer on draft.

Bottle from grocery store in Schipol airport. Hazy golden blond with moderate carbonated head. Doughy belgian yeast common in triples is obvious, with aromas of coriander and some spice. Tastes a bit acidic and sweet. A bit oily on the tongue. It seems to be lacking something, the flavor just doesn¬ít seem intense enough for me. Not bad by any means though.

WBF Richmond: Rich coriander nose. Clear yellow, thick head, constant streams of carbonation. Coriander flavor with apple notes underneath. This tasted more like an "Imperial Wit" than a classic tripel. Decent if not true to style.

Bottle - enjoyed immediately across from the Mannekin Pis while watching the France/Mexico World Cup game.   Dry mustiness, rose and barley malt aroma.  Clear yellow color with giant white head.  Sweet peach and apple malt flavor with lightly dry finish.  Low acidity.  One of the best tripels - don¬ít know how I missed having this for so long.
grass, citrus, smoke,amber, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

33 cl bottle, at La Estaminet, Singapore. Served in a chalice; perfect temperature. Appearance : Poured a beautiful clear blood-orange colour, finger-sized head, not excessive carbonation. Aroma : bread, citrus, floral, banana, alcohol, Taste : Intense, sugary but not excessively heavy. Deceivingly alcoholic ! Palate : Very easy on the palate, lovely fruity notes.creamy, lively and full of flavour. Tried this for the first time, and it¬ís easily one of the best beers I¬íve ever had ! Just have to watch the hidden alcohol kick...it¬ís very unexpected !

I have had this beer in the states and just recently tried it in Belgium. It has been really tasty in the U.S. but the flavors are even more pronounced in its home country. This beer comes in a huge glass and is served with an incredibly plume-like head, white in color.  The aroma is bread, wheat, and cereal, a resinous hop character, doughy, and spicy. This beer tastes like cake. The carbonation is very crisp and sharp but the beer is smooth. The body is full and the finish is long. A must drink.

330 ML bottle in Thailand. Beautiful beer in an even more beautiful glass. Nice, tight head holding fairly well. A little yeasty, no alcahol feel(wich is nice). Very nice full, well rounded body. And there are alot of fruits in the aftertaste. This beer is a little light but still it has that richness.

Slightly hazy golden pour with a monstrous frothy white head. Aroma holds tons of wheat and oat grain, lemon zest, spicy yeast, and dough. Also some nice candy sweetness on the nose. Flavor is, definitely, a top notch tripel right off the bat. Awesome complexities in the yeast character, with dough, spice, and sweet fruit, along with refreshing grain presence. Palate is light and crisp, obscenely drinkable; you get could really drunk really fast on beer this tasty and light with an 8% ABV. One of the best tripels out there.

Hazy peach pour with some floaties and a huge white head. The aroma is lemon and orange peel with some wheat grain, doughy yeast, spice, and fruit cake. The flavor is delicious dough with an excellent balance of acidic lemonpeel and wheat grain. The palate is rich and chewy with an excellently full textured mouthfeel and a crisp dry finish.

head: normal , foamy 
colour: gold 
smell: hops, yeast bitter, tad of grains/barley 
taste: strong hopy and alcoholic start , bitter crunch in the mouth slight sweet and spicey end , also a bit dry  jummy !

33cl on draught
Pours a hazy golden color with a big creamy white head that leaves good lacing.
The nose is full of malts and cereals with a nice hoparoma. The palate is smooth and has lots of malts, cereals and a gentle hop taste that ends in a subtle dry bitterness.
A very good triple.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2011 Bevuta alla spina in un pub di Maastricht vicino alla stazione ferroviaria di cui non ricordo il nome. Si trova in bottiglia un po¬í ovunque
"Frumentosa", fruttata, molto saporita e beverina nonostante l¬íalta gradazione. Personalmente la trovo ottima.

Had on draft at Fathead¬ís tonight.

A-slightly hazed golden straw color with a tight creamy white head.

S-the nose is nicely balanced, notes of toasted bread with an underlying caramel malt.  Hints of yeast, lemon, and a nice golden peach in the back.

T-the taste is very sweet and not as balanced as the nose.  light caramel malts and a touch of breadiness up front but faint.  this is overtaken by sugar and golden fruits.  pear, peach, lemon with a touch of grassy hops in the back and a hint of bitterness.

M-smooth and creamy medium body with a great carbonation giving it a good balance on the feel with a crisp, slightly dry finish.

D-this is so sweet, it is tasty but just too sweet.  the nose had a good balance that was missed on the taste.  too much sugar; but hid the 8.4 alcohol.
Malty aroma. Pale gold with a white long-lasting head. Light sweetness and lively carbonation with a long dry finish.

Amazing beer! Hazy golden color with a thick white head, which stayed for a while. nice lacing. Banana, cereal, orange, and some floral aromas present. Sweet citrus, spice,  taste with a mild yeasty note. mild carbonation. very pleasant. A+
Bottle.  Slight haze to a golden pour.  Nice off white head.  Aroma of citrus, yeast and other fruit.  Flavor of sweet malt, banana and citrus.  Hides the alcohol well.  Excellent stuff !

Pours a hazy yellow color with a huge, fluffy white head. Aroma is yeasty and hay like. Flavor comes through with a lot of dry fruity tang and esters. Pretty tasty. Finishes nice and dry. Pretty solid beer.

Bottle 33cl. Drink it several times at a nice pub at Cyprus. Always with my dinner. This beer is so good that i can never remember what i had for dinner. 
Fruity aromas, golden color and a big white head in the tulip glass.
Kind of sweet taste but the full boby and the long smooth finish can me smile! 
Wonderful Belgian triple!
UPDATED: MAY 22, 2010 An excellent tripel. Slightly hazy gold color, large white head. Citrusy and spicy. Very smooth, dry finish.

Bottle. Pours golden color with a frothy head. Nose is spicy, yeast, banana, malts. Mouthfeel is smooth, creamy with flavors malty, banana, spice, and finishes dry with a slight bitterness. Great beer.

Poured on-tap at the Pangea Cafe at just below room temp into a Tripel Karmeliet tulip. I haven¬ít had this one before and haven¬ít been drinking Belgian ales lately but decided to treat myself. Brilliantly clear, golden yellow in color and great head formation, retention, and lacing. Bananas, orange peel, and coriander on the nose and much the same on the palate. Not really complex in these aspects. What you see (smell, taste) is what you get which isn¬ít exactly a bad thing but I thought if there was anything lacking it was in these areas. Just medium bodied but still almost syrupy in texture. I found it to be quite drinkable for a number of reasons: relatively low carbonation, the malt is very sweet but very light, the presence of alcohol is nearly undetectable, and the finish is surprisingly clean for a relatively heavy beer.

Pours hazy yellow with fluffy white head, aroma is sweet floral, cereal, banana, bubblegum, and clove.  Taste is sweet banana and bubblegum much more than the clove and spice counterpart, alcohol hidden well.  Nice brew, but on the sweet side for me.
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2012 33 cl bottle, pours clear golden with a nice white head, aroma of fruit, wheat and grain, taste follows the nose, lots of carbonation, medium body, smooth finish.

Had this one at the Bier Markt in Toronto (in 2007). Best before date on label was 18/01/09. Poured a hazy golden colour with a big slightly off-white head. The retention was decent, but had not much lacing. Just a small coating on the brew stayed and a ring around the glass. Came with its big tulip glass too. Wow ! At first smell, it had a beautiful spicy nose. After breathing a bit, it did go slowly away, but definitely awesome at first. The mouthfeel was smooth with a slight stickiness. Alcohol was present in the taste, but was very-well mixed. Mild vanilla with some refreshing fruitiness, like light fruits (apples mostly). Good smooth drinking Belgian brew with a very nice scent.

750ml bottle split with DarkBeerChick from Spec¬ís in Austin.  Pours a golden, lightly hazed body topped with a craggy ivory-colored head.  Aroma is complex and a combination of yeast, spicy, wheat, hints of vanilla and light citrus.  Flavor is lightly sweet, yeasty, spicy (cloves and nutmeg), just a touch of citrus and a very mild hop bitter.  Active carbonation that practically dances on your tongue.  A great tripel and a good benchmark for all others to aspire to.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2010 330 ml bottle that I purchased nearly two years ago. Pours a brilliant, clear gold with significant rising carbonation and a fluffy white head that slowly subsides to a creamy cap and sheeting lace. The nose is of sweet, clean apple and apple skin with a fruity, spicy Belgian yeast note in support. Medium-bodied and velvety soft with abundant fine carbonation and a mildly spicy, dry finish; very, very nice. The flavor follows the nose with a seamless blend of the sweet/fruity (apple) and dry/spicy qualities. This beer is so well balanced and constructed, I will be amazed if I ever find another "traditional" tripel that I consider its peer.

Hazy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, citrus, some clove, & subtle fruit; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, fruit (notably bananas), spice, citrus, and some hops; Finish is dry; Nicely balanced & complex; Overall, a great tripel - I did enjoy it.

Why-oh-why must she come to me in a green corked 750ml bottle?!


There is a fine dusting of yeast at the bottom of her green champagne bottle depths. Bottle-conditioned? I would say so. According to her wire cage, she is good until December 2010, more than enough time to mature a bit in her glassy confines. Of course, I¬ím all for trying a beer fresh also which is exactly what I did not too long ago. Clear golden grains freshly harvested from the fields gather neatly in my glass below fluffy white clouds. A brilliant stream of bubbles burst their way through to the surface, pushing the clouds aside and releasing a delicious nose. Sweet and rich, ripe tangerines release tantalizing esters as I peel their skins aside, sticky juices tracing their way down my wrist and arm. Orange and apricot marmalade is slathered generously atop freshly toasted hunks of white bread. Honey straight from the comb joins her juicy marmalade friends for a purely selfish indulgence of toasted bliss. Lemon skin and pith plays in the background while lavender and sunflower esters drift along a warm spring breeze. Tripel Karmeliet exudes spring, when Mother Nature starts to breathe life and glory into her winter-weary children. White pepper and grains of paradise spice up the picture, but more in the background then the foreground, complimenting the lemon zest already there. I don¬ít know about you, but I¬ím thirsty so without further ado¬Ö Smooth with a mildly effervescent mouthfeel. Fresh honey and homemade orange and apricot marmalade kiss my lips with delightfully sticky nectar while whole loaves of soft white breads are removed from time-worn brick ovens. Soft oats abound, a testament to one of the three prized grains used in the brewing of this particular Tripel. Crunchy white water crackers offer a pleasant contrast while only a gentle kiss of dryness lingers after each quaff. Floral and honey esters tinge my breath even as lemon, white pepper, and grains of paradise refresh my weary body. A bottled spring day spent lazing about golden fields of grain while a flower bed sways lazily in a gentle spring breeze. Take that long moment of Zen, bottle it, and call it Tripel Karmeliet.


I really wish she didn¬ít come in a green glass bottle, but what¬ís a gal to do. Thankfully, my brew suffered none of the potentially skunked fates that can await a beer bottled in anything other than brown glass. I understand now why Tripel Karmeliet enjoys a cultish status of sinfully delicious quaffability. Much like Duvel, so easy to drink made all that more dangerous by her generous ABV.

750 ml. bottle from Mac¬ís on West Peachtree. Light orange and dark yellow appearance. Translucent brew with a foamy head that seems to be fading away rather quickly. Bubblegum, yeast, sugar, light banana, clove, and a touch of grass provide a very nice nuanced aroma. Light spicy aroma as well. Wow, I¬ím very impressed with this aroma; U.S. versions of the tripel seem as though they¬íre starting to become more artificial-smelling and tasting. This beer is too carbonated. Mother fucker, I am sick and tired of tripels drinking like soda-water for God¬ís sake. Spicy notes are hitting the taste buds. I¬ím also betting that yeast, sugar, and bubblegum. The clove and banana aren¬ít really coming through as they were in the aroma. The flavor is relatively nice, but I can¬ít understand how or why someone would come to the conclusion that this much carbonation is necessary for a beer. The carbonation is caustic and just biting the hell out of my tongue and mouth. There are some nice flavors here, but the carbonation just kills a lot of what could be considered a stellar tripel.

Pours clear golden with fizzy, 1/2 finger white head.  Effervescent, and gorgeous.  Lots of apple and pear notes in the nose with mild bread.  Dry and tart with apple and pear, slightly grainy with very little bitter.  No noticeable alcohol  A great tripel.

Beautiful beer, golden with a nice white head. Smells lovely with lots of spice. The spiciest beer I¬íve ever tasted, enormous flavour, much more than your average tripel. Cloves and herbs in the lingering aftertaste, and it prickles your tongue as you swallow. This is a GREAT beer.
Fresh and sweet...cookie dough aroma.  Golden color.  Sweet with light (lemon) citrus/crystal maltiness.

75 cl bottle. Pours a fairly pale golden color with a large white long lasting head.  It has a wonderful fresh hop smell to it with some herb aroma. This is a absolutely wonderful beer.  It has a grain taste, a floral taste, some herb taste and a just transcendent creaminess to it.  This was one of the best beers I¬íve had in my life.

33cl bottle to tulip glass. Appearance is hazy straw yellow with champagne qualities. Two fingers of loose foamy head that retained throughout, surprisingly. Aroma is yeasty and sweet - a little caramel perhaps. Mouth was sweet with a slight hint of vanilla. Palate is earthy with a nice malty finish. Wow, this beer was impressive!

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2015 Bottles from Beers of Europe & Drygate. Pale yellow, massive foamy head. Banana yeasty clove aroma. Yeasty clove boiled sweet flavour. Sweet herby aftertaste. My palate must have changed as I didn¬ít like it when I first had it.

one of the best tripels ive had, it seems like there are a few at the top of the list, and they are all fantastic, allagash, st bernardus, westmalle, etc. this one looked, smelled and tasted as a tripel should. hid the abv very well and was extremely enjoyable, and I was actually glad I got the smaller bottle instead of the 350 ml, felt like I had to enjoy it while it lasted.

33 cl bottle. Pours a medium golden color. Big foamy head. Looks highly carbonated. Strong, slightly sweet yeasty aroma. A little spiciness and maybe a little alcohol. Grainy flavor with a taste of alcohol. A little sweetness to go along with the yeast and spice.

On tap at Yardhouse. Pours a clear orange golden with a small frothy white head that diminishes quickly to nothing. The aroma is clove and yeast with bubblegum.  Medium mouthfeel with a  sweet fruit malt with a nice clean finish. Hides the alcohol well making it easy to drink. A very impressive abbey tripel.

A-Light hazy golden yellow body that pours with a 3 finger creamy white head. Head slowly fades to 1/2 finger. Decent head retention. In the end a thick collar is all that remains of the beautiful head. Plenty of lacing left behind in the glass. Body is translucent with a nice haziness all around and tiny bubbles constantly rising to the top.

S- Sweet, Spicy, and Bready. Lots of spicy yeast with a dry, fruity balance of pears, apples, and citrus.

T- Citrus, pears, and apples upfront with a bready/spicy yeast background. A slight sweetness emerges with the initial taste. The finish adds a touch of hop flavor to compliment the dry fruitiness. What lingers is a big spicy and sweet bready yeast taste along with a hint of alcohol bitterness.

P- Light carbonation and light body. Very smooth and creamy from the yeast.

O- This is a wonderful Tripel. At 8% ABV it has a slightly lower alcohol content then most. ABV is also very well hidden here which makes it all the more drinkable. Aside from that this brew is light, crisp, complex, and very tasty. Something that I will definitely pick up again

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-21-2007 16:29:14
--
Bottle. Bright golden color with a rich white head. Aroma is very grainy. Wheat, spice, malt, and touches of fruit on the mouth, with nice bitter finish. very nice beer.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2011 Bottle 330ml. Ugly but good. Aromas of orange, bread, and champagne. Taste is sweet and long-lasting, with a dry finish. Palate is oily and lively, with a full body. Dark yellow, with a frothy head.
een zeer mooi helder donker goudachtige kleur. een zeer fruitig aroma en ook bij het proeven komen er smaken van fruit vrij maar ook granen. een zeer zoete smaak ook zowel als de afdrong.

On tap at the Lava Lounge, which by the way is about to become better than pretty much any bar in Des Moines..... big up to Waterloo. Pours a hazy sunny blonde color with a good head and lace. The aroma is floral and perfumery with some sweet orange peel, some raw grain, some bread dough, and some banana. The flavor is very doughy with some spiciness, some lemon and orange citrus flavor and some banana, it¬ís sweet but not cloying at all. The palate is very full.

Pours very light blond, looked kind of like a urine sample. No head. Smells of sweet malts. I think this is a neat beer and that comes through in the taste and palate. The oat serves to mellow out the beer and provides balance. The wheat then adds a nice hop component. Finally the taste has a big malty sweetness from the barley. Really neat and I was excited upona firt tasting to see the beer develop like this. Didn¬ít notice much from the hops save for  a little bitterness here and there.
Bottle pour at The Porter Beer Bar in Atlanta.  Beautiful color, yeasty and citrusy notes.  A classic Tripel.

33cl bottle, 8.4%. Billowed from the bottle after popping the cap and poured an effervescent golden orange colour with a mild haze and a huge, lasting frothy white head leaving an OK lacing. Light, estery, lemony fruit notes, smooth orange juice and herbal, yeasty hops on the nose. Estery, Belgian yeast flavours, a good lemon sharpness and spicier hop tones, ending with a late and short bitter hop bite. A good upfront juiciness finshing with a delicate dryness. On the lighter side of medium in body, remaining crisp and refreshing with a medium carb sting and a bit of warmth in the throat.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 Bi√®re blonde aux reflets d¬íor.  Le collet est blanc et reste longuement coll√© aux parois du verre.  Forte effervescence.  Parfum de c√©r√©ales, d¬í√©pices et de fruits.   En bouche, picotement sur la langue, saveurs de fruits, m√©lange d¬í√©pices, levure, touche de miel.  En finale, liquide moelleux, l√©g√®re amertume et  assez bonne pour avoir envie d¬íen d√©boucher une autre!*****Mille bouteilles depuis sa fracassante sortie.  Une robe jaune, finement voil√©e et √©rotique.  Une t√™te blanche qui r√©siste et qui laisse une dentelle d√©licate.  Un nez de bl√© et de malts blonds, avec des bananes, des poires et des notes citronn√©es qui se font touch√©es par des fleurs de houblons vibrantes comme la sublime voix d¬íAstrid Varnay dans le Lohengrin de Wagner.  Des saveurs coh√©sives.  Des c√©r√©ales complexes, des houblons per√ßants et une levure p√©tillante et fra√Æche comme la voix de Jess Floyd Thomas.  Une bouche cr√©meuse, grandiose et impressionnante.  Une finale comme une v√©ritable mosa√Øque.  Une rencontre avec le sublime.

Very nice.  Bottle pour to trappist glass gives moderate golden yellow clear with thin white head.  Aroma sweet and fruity.  High carbonation.  Taste fruits, grains, citrus, spices, slight alcohol.  Finish very clean.

330mL bottle, 8.4% ABV.  Pours clear pale gold with a fluffy white head that eventually disappears.  Spicy, earthy and slightly fruity aroma.  In the flavour a citrus oil-like sharpness is quite strong when cold but balances better when it warms up, and some fruity sweetness and acidity.  Oddly enough, it¬ís much tastier near room temperature than at the recommended 6-9¬∞C.  The alcohol presence is well masked throughout.  Light-medium bodied, lively carbonation and very creamy with a drying finish.

Awesome Beer! Bought it at the Rockland Food Service in Rockland, ME. I saw the Rate Beer rating right there in front of it and had to try it. I was so glad that I did as a huge Belgian beer fan. This has made me an Abbey Tripel lover! I have a feeling that this will become a constant classic for me.

This brew pours a light brown to golden yellow in color with extremely heavy carbonation. A large white head forms quickly and then fades into a small one finger wide ring. The aroma is of heavy pine, light fruits (grapes, orange, bananas), and hops. The initial taste is found to be a bit weak and includes notes of lighter hops, earth, and sweet fruits. Hides the alcohol very well, but besides that not much else is going on. Taste is lacking a little, but the texture and complexity is right there.

Big bottle. Poured a mostly clear golden color with a relentless everlasting Belgian head. Smelled notes of skunky orange peel and dough. Tasted coriander, plenty of basement aromas, and a slight spicy spruce flavor. Active yeast and carbonation in the mouth. Overall a very worthy trapist beer!

Pours a bright golden yellow color. Active carbonation throughout the session. Aromas of hops, fruit, and a little yeast. Has a light fruity citrus taste, with some yeasty notes, and a good hop flavor.

06 vintage 750ml poured into a karmeliet snifter. pours a fuzzy opaque pach color with a lively off white head that is sparse and quick to fade. has a nice funcky layer underneath of a sweet estery  nose. the taste is to match, nice and complex. layers of sweet bananas, peppery cloves and funky tart notes unfold in every sip. good stuff, nice and balanced, and a good level of carb.

Bottle served in an oversized wine glass. Lightly hazed pale gold pour with a head that quickly fades into a small capping. The nose is lightly sweet with notes of bubblegum, floral, chamomile, and coriander. The flavor mimics the smell with the absence of the floral aspect and chamomile plays a larger role. Very easy to drink and not quite as complex as I had imagined it to be.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2010 Refrigerated bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours a mostly clear golden color with medium white head that leaves pretty quick.  Lacing is really nice.  Taste is earthy fruity citrus, spicy hops, and finishes dry.  Really good beer for the style, but I prefer Allagash Tripel.

Whoah, head, stop, stop!! It slowly started going over the glass, even after a modest pour into a flute glass. I guess this one¬ís more of a chalsice beer. Great head, as mentioned, clear gold colour. Heavy aroma of hops on the nose and little else. Taste is a satisfying mix between hops, citrus, wheat. Decent mouthfeel. Pretty good Belgian.

This beer is a long time favorite of mine. It pours with a golden color and a thick white head that lasts. It has a complex, dessert-like aroma with lots of grains, citrus, honey, and a hint of banana. Tastes moderately sweet with light hops in the aftertaste. Medium carbonation in a medium density body. Alcohol is well blended. It¬ís a smooth, very well balanced, and outstanding tasting beer.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2010 Pours golden with a big foamy white head. Nose is quite sweet with the typical abbey hints of belgian yeast and dry-added hops. Flavor is very deep and represents one of the best balances of strong, wheaty-but-sweet malt (with touches of candied sugar) with spices and moderately strong hops. Finish is long and bittersweet and, frankly, delicious. Alcohol is well hidden. Probably my all-time favorite beer and worth every penny of the high price.

Bottle. Hazy yellow with frothy white head. Aroma of various fruit (banana, light strawberry, light orange peel), yeast, nutty malt and spiciness. Taste is awesome and what a tripel should be - light fruity character, complex malts and a backbone of spices. Palate is very carbonated and refreshing.
Cloudy, golden pour from bottle.  Fruity, soft alcohol nose.  Medium mouthfeel, with some sweetness and orange marmalade.  Smooth palate, with a nice warm finish.  Big thumbs up.

Pours a pale golden yellow, nice white head with long lasting lacing.  Aroma is of banana, bubblegum, bread, earthyness and yeast.  Taste is sweet with the aromas coming through...reminds me somewhat of a hefeweizen.  Light mouthfeel with a nice finish.  This is a beer that could be drank for breakfast its so tasty.
Drank this, yet again, last night. Just a wonderful beer, perfect example of just how fantastic belgian beers are.

11.2 bottle.  Pours a nice cloudy head.  The aroma is filled with grapes and oranges.  A bubbly mouthfeel with a hints of wheat and bananas.  This has a dry malt finish.  Very drinkable for 8.4.  This big beer would be great to start a summer day.

33cl bottle from BC Liquor. Golden and very light white foam. But the Aroma was some lemon, cilantro, and orange. Also with notes of yeasty, spicy and slightly bitter. Also a slightly sweet, spicy and bitter finish with some apple aftertaste.

Bottle.

A - Creamy and hazy gold with a large white cream colored head. Decent amount of lacing left over.

S - Variety of sweet smells, including lots of fruits (peaches, apple, pear, mango, apricot, lemon). Also some honey and some sweet malts. These are paired with some spices (clove, pepper, coriander, cardamom). Belgian yeast too.

T - Similar to the smell. Fairly sweet with lots of fruit and a decent amount of honey. Fair amount of malt. This is contrasted with the spices and a bit of alcohol heat coming through. This prevents it from being too sweet.

M - Medium body with a decent amount of carbonation. Quite creamy. Fairly warming too.

D - Not the most drinkable, with the sweet/spice/alcohol it isn¬ít the most drinkable, and definitely is meant to be sipped. However it is one that I will drink again.

Notes: Good mix of sweet and creamy with some spice and alcohol to cut it. Really nice beer.
From the tap poured a slightly hazy golden color with a fair amount of head.  Nice smooth light malty flavor with a quick finish.

Pours a nice gold with a big white head. Nose is light malt: banana, cloves, light bubble gum, spices, light fresh hop character, lemon zest. More of the same in the mouth though the bubble gum character sticks out more as well as light fruits like pear and apple, molasses cookies, sweet on the follow through with light citrus zing on the swallow with hint of alcohol. crisp and refreshing.

Clear golden body, with plenty of small bubbles and a very frothy white head. Good lacing and head retention.

Caramel sweetness, rich fruit notes, and some floral hops in the nose. Quite wheaty, too.

Quite a robust taste. Loads of fruitiness from the yeast; apple, pear, and lemon notes. Sweet, yet slightly acidic. Some champagne-like hints. Some solid hop presence, which lingers into the after-taste. Some dryness in the finish, together with some wheaty breadiness.

Medium body to it. Loads of carbonation at first, quite crisp overall. There is some booziness to it, and I was able to feel it quite a bit.

This is a proper, flavourful Belgian tripel, but I think Chimay White is more drinkable, if you¬íre looking for something you could enjoy more of.
Bottle at Spinnerstown.  Sweet candied/citrus aroma.  Golden body with tall fluffy head.  Very sweet and smooth, hints of wheat, banana, clove and citrus. A great Tripel

750 ml bottle.  Very pale, slightly cloudy, straw color.  Huge, bubbly head.  Almost no lacing at all.  Aroma is light, pleasant, citrus, hint of cloves.  Taste is interesting ... first fruity, but slowly is taken over by spice.  As I continue to drink this it has evolved into a very enjoyable experience.  Easy to drink, but causes me to pause and suddenly notice the variety of almost conflicting tastes going on.  Yet it¬ís all so well balanced.  Medium body, thin texture and fizzy.  Very unassuming, but long finish.  Subtle, but intriguing beer.  Not the style that I normally drink, but I would come back to this one any time.

33cl bottle: Light orange colour with a bright white head. The aroma is really interesting, muscat grapes and lemons with a hint of acidity from the high carbonation. Delicate honey-like sweetness on the palate, flavours of alcohol (prunes) and spicy hops. Subtle yeast character, pretty good.

Poured straw color with a huge rocky head and the aroma was sweet with caramel notes.  The flavor was dry with sweet caramel notes and the palate was nice but mostly dry.  Overall a very good and tasty beer, excellent.  Would definitely drink again and again.
weizen and fruit aroma, golden, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, slick feel, lively, very heavy robust beerlong finish, fantastic blonde beer...thand Dita from Ghent
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft @ Toad in the Hole. Pours a very bright, deep, clear golden color; thin, tiny-bubbled white head with solid lacing; attractive pour. Very pleasant honey, cloves, and Belgian sugars in the aroma; seems well-attenuated for the malt complexity; hints of white pepper. Medium full body: beautifully cream, fluffy texture; loads of honey, complex esters, vanilla, and toasty malt character lingering underneath; hugely drinkable, creamy and nuanced as all get out; lovely tasty core. Long finish of mineral bitterness, toasty malts, and hints of honey and vanilla.

Draft in Ommegang glass at Toad in the Hole.  Gold with diminishing white head.  Recessive aromas of ripe tropical fruit and dough.  Flavor is wonderfully rich and sweet up front with ample pils malt.  Rolls off and deconstructs to a mostly dry finish with just a kiss of... hops?  I was excited to have a chance to try this well-known beer without its having to suffer through green bottle hell.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 Bottle at home. Spicy/fruity aroma¬ís. A bit weird, but nicely balanced. Dark gold, almost orange, substance, nice white head. Nicely balanced taste, fruity and spicy together. Nice long aftertaste. One of the better, more tasteful tripel beers i have tasted. Only maybe a bit to sweet.. The taste reminds me someway of delirium tremens. But way better balanced.
Nice overall tripel, good flavors and good classic abbey approach. Again best on tap or larger containers....
Bottle.  Cloudy golden pour with white creamy head.  Citrus, floral, fruit, oat and spice.  Very smooth with a lot of dried fruit, caramel, and cream.

How have I not rated this yet? Bottle. Pours amber with a thin white head that quickly reduces to a persistent skim. Solid lacing. Nose is extremely floral, with sweet malt (oat?) notes, plus lovely yeastiness, stonefruits, candy, spice. Great palate, plenty of malt and yeast character, with candy, peach and whipped cream. A very feminine and complete beer.

750-ml bottle Marcello¬ís Lafayette,LA - Aroma: citrus, apricot, pepper, malty; Appearance: cloudy, golden color, white head, laces; Flavor: sweet, salty, coriander, pepper, clove, citrus; Mouthfeel: medium bodied, creamy texture, lively carbonation, fruity finish; Overall: amazingly fruity and smooth beer with a wonderfully froth and creamy that has a sweet-fruity finish.  Amazing beer that I would love it even more if attenuated more, however this beer is so good that even my wife likes it.

bottle - slighty hazy orange beer with a nice white head. Fresh and yeasty, fruity aroma with some smoky hints. Flavour is complex. Some maltiness with a cereal and caramel finish. Medium bitterness. Lively carbonation.

[bottle from bierkompass.de]
Vinous, white grape, musty aroma with some caramel and pineapple. Clear gold with a rocky, white foam on top. Very well balanced flavour that is not sugary like may trippels and had a perfect bitterness level. Caramel flavour with a complex mix of dried and fresh fruit. White grape and pineapple notes. Medium body, medium to high carbonation, clean finish.

11.2oz bottle from grape & gourmet. pours a beautiful, clear, light yellow-gold with a tall, bubbly, pure white head that reduces to a nice half-inch with great lacing. aroma is very nice with mild, fresh citrus notes of lemon zest and orange peel, belgian yeast, clove, and soft, slightly sweet, nutty malts with hints of vanilla, dry grass, and wheat. flavor is truly outstanding with dry citrus notes of lemon and orange, sweet orchard fruit notes of pear and red apple, and a hint of spice balanced by sweet, doughy, belgian yeast, mild caramel, and a hint of dry cedar. palate is medium bodied with crisp, bubbly carbonation and a lingering, sweet, fruity finish. overall, a wonderful fruit forward tripel.

A tad sweet, but overall pretty solid offering.  Clear golden pour with minimal pure whitebhead(the heads got bigger after my initial pour). Aroma of sweet maybe barley, a little corn.  Flavor is heavy on sweety malt, big notes of alcohol.   Nice, but not top 99 percentile.
Pours a beer with an amber appearance and a yeasty aroma. I like the hops, but there is a sweet flavor that is a bit too dominant to my taste. Overall it¬ís a  nice smooth tripel.

Big bubbly white head, golden colour.
Ar: Yeast, spices, lemon, oranges, Corn?
F: Rich malt presence, accompanied by a laid-back bitterness, yeast, lemon, spices and again corn?
M: Lively carbonation, but not overpowering.
T: This was a pleasant surprise!

Bottle. Pours a very light golden. SLightly hazy with a very rocky white head. Disappaears very quickly leaving minimal lacing. Aromas are amzing. Initially aromas a quite citrusy with plenty of grapefruit and lemon. As the beer warms slightly vanilla and wheat start to come through. Some spice, hops and perhaps a slight acidity. Very subtle but at the smae time very complex. The wheat start to show through more in the taste with some spice. A little alcohol on the finish. Not quite as complex as the nose. Mouthfeel is quite thin though it definately suits this beer. Great beer
On draft. Very smooth. Medium bodied. Lots of yeast, with very light earthy malt flavors. Some floral hops, but not much. Mild spiciness. Good, but not the best tripel out there.

Pours a mostly clear, golden orange colour with a frothy white head. The aroma is of various fruits, spice and some citrus hops. The taste is sweet and spicy with a little alcohol and a nice bitter finish. It is quite smooth on the palate. Overall a very nice brew.

330ml Bottle. Pours a golden yellow with a yeasty malt aroma. The taste was light, with very mild bitterness. It had a lively carbonation, which produced a large white head that kept the bubbles flowing.  The finish was long and tasty. Over all this was an nice Tripel.  I¬íve got to try more of these.

Tripel Karmeliet is a slightly hazy and very sparkling pale yellow ale with a thick, fluffy head that has great retention and lacing.  It has a doughy and fruity aroma with notes of banana, pear, apple, peach, cherry, nutmeg and clove.  It¬ís light bodied and very lively.  It foams on the tongue.  The finish is crisp and clean.  It¬ís perhaps a touch sweet with a barely detectable bitterness.  It tastes very fruity-- almost cider-like.  All of the fruit present in the aroma is in the flavor.  There is perhaps some bret at the finish.  This comes off as pretty light fare, but it¬ís pretty complex.  It¬ís very refreshing.  (I was shocked when I read the ABV later!)

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2010 330 ml bottle. Poured a clear gold with a big rocky head that stays some time.  Aroma was fruits (grapefruit) and hops. The taste was a bright mix of hops, fresh fruits and spices with a nice bitterness at the finish. Overall I thought this was a great Tripel: very bright flavors with lively carbonation.
Re-rate: Had this again and was blown away: Poured a dense, cloudy yellow with gold highlights (almost opaque). Large foamy head. Aroma: very floral, fresh fruits, mild funk. Taste followed the aroma very well. This is a world-class beer! I think this and Westmalle are the 2 standards for this style. Original rate: 4.4.

750 ml. green corked bottle. Served in a chalice glass. Golden colour with a bit of haziness and quite a good head, that leaves a crown and lace. Malty aroma of fruits, honey, some spice, vanilla, orange peel. Sweet silky and liquor like flavour. Taste of honey, oranges, banana, maybe apricot, coriander... Both smell and taste have everything so subtle and integrated that is hard to tell exactly what anything is, and that can be  good and bad at the same time. Great, really great stuff. Sweet!
pours orange/yellow with large white head. aroma is malty and fruit with a bit of hay. drinks very smooth and clean with sweet malts, light fruits, yeast, and candied sugar.

Bought in Brugge Supermarket. Hazy orange color with a nice and fluffy hear that keeps a thin lace until finish. Aroma is citrus, spice fruity. Flavor is quite citrus bitter but some sweetness comes out right after it. Medium carbonated and long dry citrus and yeast finish. Awesome.. So cheap in Belgium. In Brazil should cost 10 times more!  I loved Brugge.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2011 Personally my all time favourite abbey tripel. (Yet)

Golden brown with orange glow, large and dense off white lasting head.
Deep floral, citrus and fruity hops aroma, hint of grains, sour fruits and spices. Very nice.
Intense grains and sweet fruit flavour with a nice bitterness to tone it down of fruity hops, some citrus and spices ,very full and long lasting. Slightly yeasty aftertaste with hint of spices and a touch of trappisten quad liquorice fullness. Very wide range of flavours. Every time I drink this I discover some new flavours. Awesome tripel.

Bottle.   Poured pale lemon yellow with much too thick white head.  Lot of lacing.  Funky spicy aroma, much tang of the earth, grainy, citrusy.  Full flavour, the grain shows up well, full mouthfeel.  Yeast in finish, with spice.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: This had a nice wit-like aroma - fruity, yeasty with some zing - but then the wheels fell off.  Slightly foggy green-yellow with a big white head.  The beer itself was overly floral, and it was those nasty bulb flowers (paperwhite, narcissus) that it reminded me of. Lightly sweet, all kinds of off under/overtones.  I split this with two other seasoned beer drinkers, and we agreed that it was pretty much undrinkable and made one want to spit.
750 ml bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma light sweet and spices malts and some fruit taste light sweet beer with hints of spices and fruit and some bitter nice beer

Bottle. Huge off white foamy head over a clear pink-gold body. Floral aroma of stonefruit-apricots and spices. Taste-coriander, floral, with an emerging bitterness in the finish. Medium bodied, spicey, smooth, warm. Nice.

330ml bottle from Julio¬ís Liqours in MA. Pours a fantastic, gorgeous and superbly clear blonde color with a tremendously inviting head. Easily the best looking beer I¬íve seen in a while. Aroma is pleasant but not overwhelming. The taste is almost perfect - a really great combo of alcohol, crisp citrus and banana. It reminds me of Piraat but without the uber-alcoholic smack in the head. What a phenomenal beer.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2011 Poured into a tulip. Barely hazy orange; lovely quivering dome of a white head.  High bead. Dry, orange zest aroma with some white pepper, juniper and allspice. Honey  and apricot sweetness with some esters. Some bitterness and ?strawberries on the finish. You can feel the alcohol but it didn¬ít register separately at all. Indeed, that nothing really registers separately is what¬ís most noticeable about this beer: everything¬ís very well integrated. Best triple I¬íve had by some distance.[3.9}Bottle. Almost clear gold, white head. Fruit, complex light sugars, strawberries, insistent but gentle bitterness. Malt character draws you in, but just bitter enough not to get tiring. Deep and lovely.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy, blond color with a very large, dense white head.  Lacing is strong.  Aromas of malts, bananas, and citrus.  Mouthfeel is lively with a crisp finish and nice banana aftertaste.  Flavors of bananas, oranges, and malts.  This is a great beer!
Fresh hop and grain aroma. Clear golden color with a large white head. Light bitter taste throughout. Hints of sweetness at the end. Very carbonated palate.

(750 ml bottle from Kappy¬ís, cellared for 10 mos. after purchase) Pours cloudy apricot with a finger of whitish head that recedes to a lasting layer. Aroma of citrus, caramel, yeast and a bit of Band Aid initially. Mouthfeel is buttery soft and smooth. Flavor of ligthly sweet citrus and caramel with a  peppery finish. A little bit of alcohol burn but overall pretty well-integrated ABV.

Bottled.. can¬ít believe I haven¬ít rated this.  Poured brilliant lighter golden with a majestic, sticky cap of white head.. spotty lacing followed it down.  The aroma picked up sweet banana-ey yeastage and black pepper over soft bready malts and a touch of honey.. spicy and warm.. hit the style well.  The flavor found more honey than anything else at the core, surrounded by black pepper and medium-skinned fruits.. the banana esters from the yeast hit every part of the palate.. finished spicy and warm  with residual honey sugars.  Medium-bodied and well-carbonated on the palate.. balanced well, but it was a touch watery on the middle.  Very good stuff as usual.

Bottle at home.  Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow with an extremely thick near white head of about four fingers.  Smells of lemon and orange zest.  Bright on the tongue and nicely carbonated.  Tastes of hints of banana and lemon with slight touches of vanilla and sugar.  Balanced and refreshing.

Beer pours golden with a huge white head and lots of bubbles. The aroma is a mix of Belgian wheat and fruit, very inviting. The flavor is very similar with lots of lemon and other citrus dominating. You also get the Belgian yeast and malt character you expect from a world-class tripel. The beer has a light mouthfeel and is very carbonated. Very refreshing.

Source:750 mL bottle.  Rated and then paired with cheese, crackers and a summer sausage. 
Glass:Tripel Karmeliet tulip...what else.  This might be the best glass in the world. 
Appearance:Slightly hazy pear colored pour with a three finger, fluffy white head.  
Aroma:Sweet malts, berries a slight skunked aroma and a subtle earthiness. 
Flavor:Sweet caramel buns, berries, toast and a mild closing bitterness. 
Palate:Medium body with active carbonation.
Overall:The aroma kind of ruined this beer for me.  The flavor was absolutely excellent and the bubbly carbonation made the palate.  Love this paired with food.  Dry enough not to overwhelm and lacking palate destroying bitterness.  This would have been a mid 4 beer if the aroma was better, and hopefully its just this beer.  Will drink another and revisit.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2011 bottle from SAQ. poured into tulip. clear gold colour with a big head that lasts throughout the beer. aroma is sweet and fruity, strawberry and raspberry, some woody notes with herbs and spices in there too. soft and bubbly on the palate. taste is sweet, with some floral notes. not as much hops in the finish as i expected from a Tripel. very tasty.

Pours light yellow into a tulip with a decent off white head.  Aroma of lemongrass, little bit of hops, bit floral.  Interesting taste: lemon,  bit of malty sweetness, bit of spice, pear, orange peel.  Medium bodied with a fizzy mouthfeel; surprisingly drinkable.  Tripels are often some of my least favorite beers, but this was quite lovely.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2010 bottle. pours a beautiful blond gold beer with a good head. fruity aroma with typical belgian beer hints. very nice taste with fruits and great wheat hints. full mouthfeel. great beer. one of the best tripels I¬íve had.

Bottled. The 3rd to last beer in my (rather simple) quest to rate all the top 50 most rated beers. This was one I passed up for far too long, merely because it was so readily available but slightly pricey. However, a $4 Belgian that was way too expensive a few years ago is now not a bad deal at all.

This pours initially a very clear gold with a nice, large bubbled head that fades pretty fast. An addition of the yeast (which was deemed critical after my first smell and sip) made it quite cloudy and nice, with some lacing that lasts in the glass and minor, actively rising carbonation.

The aroma is at first fruity and sweet, highlighting strawberry and pomegranate, and transitions to a more herbal, woodsy profile as the beer breathes and warms. While mostly licorice and alcohol when still, agitation provides a welcome complexity. However, the nose is a bit too sweet to me and lacking in a forward, doughy yeast that I always hope for in the best tripels. 

The flavor is calm and inviting, displaying a mild sweatiness through with notes of egg, thyme, and mild tropical fruits. The carbonation is quite low and rather soft; I could do with a bit more here. There is a short, sweet finish, which leaves a bit of sugar on the lips, but there is a lack of complexity that I find disappointing. 

In the end, I must say this one was a disappointment. Tripels to me are a theoretically fantastic style, yet I can find so few examples that truly impress me. With the very high rating on this one I expected an undiscovered (to me) gem that I¬íd been passing up for way too long, but instead was let down by a fairly straight-forward, too sweet (marginally) beer that differs little from most else out there. Guess I¬íll have to keep looking.
Great beer!  Golden color, with fruits -strawberry?- and carmelized sugar.  Not overly sweet or sticky, but very nicely balanced.  A tripel to rival Chimay as my favorite.
Very lively beer, lot of things to look at. white foam, lots of it. Has that pale tripel look.Very complicated and interesting flavor, slightly bitter finish but with some white chocolate?
Bottle (green bottle, really?). Pours golden with a big foamy white head. Sweet sugar taste with apples and floral notes. Best tripel I¬íve tried to date.
UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 apple, then leather, hay and hops, floral taste with hints of vanilla. A rather sweet taste with enough bitterness that has more lenght then intensity ending in a field of roses.
Good tripel.  Sweeter than most if my memory serves me right.  Big head, and easy to drink.  Right up there with Unibroue and Westmalle.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2014 750 mL bottle.  Golden pour with a huge white fluffy head.  Aroma of malt, grass and bread.  Medium body with a taste of bread, Belgian yeast, slight hops and malt.  Great dry, malty finish.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy light orange with big fluffy off-white head. Aroma is very nice, some spice, citrus peel, a little funky, some barnyard, lemon grass, some grassy hoppiness, earthy, light malt, faint banana, a little alcohol spice. Flavor is very crisp and the same as what I mentioned above with faint tang. Mouth feel is light-medium body, very high fizzy carbonation....Overall, this beer is incredibly tasty and very easy to drink....Would be refreshing during the summer and will warm you up during the winter....A perfect all season beer!

Great looking beer golden in colour with a beautiful white head on top. Aroma is sweet, malty and cookie like with a crisp hint of herbs. Taste is bready with touches of peaches and banana. Aftertaste is sweet-malty with a fine touch of hops and pepper in the end.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2010 Lucent pale gold, ^co2.

Aroma: bright, pear, grass, pale malts.

Taste: fruity T1, spicy malt T2, citrus T3, bitter orange Tf.

Pours a clear golden color with a foamy, thick, white head. Very lovely aroma of lemon, coriander, wheat and something peachy. Taste is slightly sweet, spicy and hoppy, moving to a long bitter finish. Really well balanced. Enormous amounts of carbonation gives this a creamy texture. Lovely beer.

Bottle, pours a hazy orange golden body with a huge often exploding yellow white head.  Big yeast y notes, and spices are overly abundant even domineering within the head itself.  Spicy pepper tones, cinnamon, and leather y fruit notes.  Berries, with a tart apples and citrus tones.  A fantastic Ale.
Pours light golden with a nice off white head.  Aroma is banana and lots of spice.  Flavor is a nice blend of light malts, banana, light fruits and lots of spice.  Good stuff.
Golden blond, nice foamy head. Smells yeasty with a little spice and fruits. Tastes some caramel, peaches, citrus, some banana. a very well balanced tripel.

On tap @ Judges Bench-Ellicott City Md.-Light golden color w/a moderate white head. Sweet, dry hop aroma. Flavors of grass/grain/hay, banana, spice, reminded me a little bit of a Hefe. Light, dry, easy drinking brew. Very enjoyable; alcohol very well hidden, no Idea it was this high. Long dry finish; good brew!

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2010 Great beer.  Great balance, great on the palate.  Finish is almost perfect which prevents me from giving it the top rating.  I must disclose that I am not big on the more fruity beers, so that is what moves it down a notch for me.
