This is the best beer in the world! Those celibate monks up in Belgium sure know how to pack a wicked punch in this mighty beer killer. It has a fruity, rose-like taste that is unlike ¬íconventional¬í beers. Cordon bleu stuff!
Bottle from the Eastchase Majestic.  Hazy yellow pour with tons of white head and tons of black chunks.  Lots of citrus, some spice, and banana aroma.  Alcohol, banana, and spice!

Golden blonde pour into thick white foamy head that dissipates into melting lacing as carbonated bubbles rise from the bottom of the glass into a swirling pool of foam. Aroma of sweet yeasty bread, malted grain and grassy hops. Initial flavor of wheat bread and sweet banana citrus fading into a buttery finish with hints of peppery spice.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2009 Bottle courtesy of Fratto. Hazy yellow pour with very apparent sediment in the pour.  Spicy smell of lemon and citrus.  Dry wheat.  A bit of cilantro can be found also.  Taste is spicy cilantro and citrus.  A slight bit of black pepper.  Finish is slightly sweet.  Some bitterness.  Flavorful but rough.

Had this for the first time last night...came from the tap in its own glass.  Had a tanned blonde color and soft head.  I had a somewhat difficult time picking up the scent...I don¬ít know if it was where I was, or if my nose wasn¬ít working.  The taste was fantastic though.  It was hard to pick out an individual flavor, but it was a nice fruity blend that seemed to have a slightly peachy taste.  In addition, I could sense a nice sugar lingering in the background.  Overall, a great beverage that I want to try again...this time from a bottle.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2016 Poured from 750ml, beautiful light golden with medium off-white head.  Sweet nose, with fruits and yeast.  Little banana, nectarine.  Taste was excellent; smooth, sweet, and dry.. Overall an excellent Tripel.

33cl Bottle. Pours a golden yellow with a yeasty malt aroma.  The taste was light, with very mild bitterness. It had a lively carbonation, which produced a large white head that produced lively legs, the finish was long and tasty. Over all this was an excellent tripel.

25.4 ounce bottle purchased at Nugget Market in Woodland, CA.  On sale for $9.99.  Green bottle.  Opens with that uncanny smell of DMS and skunked hops from the fucking green bottle.  This dissipates to a degree, leaving a bet of an ester aroma.  There is a fair amount of peppery spiciness present in the nose of this thing, too.  All in all, not an overly striking aroma.  Transparent golden body with a fizzy white head that leaves decent lacing.  Bright carbonation to start, which becomes a little sweet with some honey notes towards the middle.  Banana yeast flavors then come through.  Rounds out with a bit of a spicy, herbal finish with some lasting skunky hops and some metallic hop flavors.  The green bottle really detracts from this beer.  I¬íll have to go to the Trappist sometime and have this and re-rate it from the tap.
330ml. bottle from the S.A.Q.. The color is a hazy honey with a thin beige head. The aroma is malty and fruity. The taste also of malt,citrus fruits,spicies and vanilla. This was an excellent triple.

Pours straw yellow, kind of cloudy like a nebula in your glass with a huge foamy head that continues to grow out of the top of the glass. it looks great. The aroma is slightly yeasty, but mostly smells like candy. The flavour is smooth and floral with some citrus notes. It tastes like candy. Very well balanced. A great beer! The best triple I have ever had.
Golden en couleur with white mousse. smell is sweet and malty too. There is honey and some spices in it i guess. taste is very nice and long in the aftertaste. like this beer very much.

This is good. 300ml bottle served in a tulip. Wheat blonde in color. Slight haze. Massive head of tight bubbles. Sweet belgian aroma. Complex wheat notes. Flavor is sweet wheat. Quite carbonated. Slightly slick mouthfeel with a long, oily finish. I felt like a belgian tonight and this certainly satisfies.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2010 Bottle, 33 cl. Blonde-golden beer with huge white lasting creamy head. Smell is very unique: a fantastic grain smell! However, I drunk this one from a Vondel-glass (similar to the Duvel glass) and there the aroma was less strong than in the Karmeliet-glass. The taste is also great and fantastic: a beautiful full grainy taste in your mouth, with a long and enjoyable finish. Drinking this beer is just relaxing and enjoying the whole time! (Hint: don¬ít serve it too cold, as is destroys the good taste you have).
I had this after a long day and got a headache immediately after drinking.  Not sure why, this beer was decent and sharp.  Will try again at a different time.

large frothy white head. good lacing. mostly lasting. sparkling thick dark yellow body. aroma: light yeasty, banana, apple, honey and fig. if: moderate sweet and light bitter. ff: light sweet moderate bitter. average duration. palate: medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, metallic finish. corpo transl√∫cido, dul√ßor frutado, agrad√°vel, bem menos enjoativo que de outras do estilo; esconde bem o √°lcool(que aparece no final do gole, harmonizado, como em um vinho branco, onde se sente o √°lcool de uma forma agrad√°vel e refrescante), encorpada refrescante, feita com 3 cereais: trigo, aveia e cevada; quase t√£o encorpada quanto uma heizen; toques de banana e figo no paladar; 110s

Nice clear golden with a huge dense white head. Aroma is sweet malty, lightly fruity with notes of vanilla powder and caramell. Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth and delivers flavours of toffe, vanillapowder, refreshing apples and Bosteels very characteristic sweet malt character. Sweet but still manages to be refreshing and balanced.

Bottle.

The color was cloudy light yellow. Large white head. Citrus, vanilla, detergent, soap, and yeast in the aroma. The taste was pretty sweet and tasty. Citrus, spices and detergents. Stable in every way. Dry finish with a quite strong alcohol presence.
Super pale yellow color with a big voluminous head. Slightly skunky, raw hop aroma

Towering white head on top of a hazy golden beer. Aroma of oats, grain, spice, fruit, and caramel. The flavor is thinner than expected with a lot of oats and vanilla. Somewhat fruity and spicy. Enjoyable, but something seems just slightly off. The finish is nice. I¬íll try this one again when I can really obsess over it.

Bottle. Golden colour with a huge white head. Malty aroma with notes of lemon and clove. The flavour is sweet, malty and citric, notes of clove and yeast, slightly bitter finish. Clean and smooth mouthfeel.

Poured from tap into Tripel Karmeliet tulip.

Mostly clear yellow-gold with thin head and slight lacing.

Aroma of sugar, vanilla, citrus, Belgian yeast and spice.

Pretty sweet with lemon, vanilla, orange and slight spice. An overall wheatiness becomes apparent at the end through the aftertaste. Bitterness is very low, and I would have preferred a little more.

Creamy full body with relatively low carbonation. Not as effervescent as other Tripels I have had, but good nonetheless.

Nice sipper, and the alcohol is not very apparent. While this was very nice, I personally prefer a Tripel with a little more hop bite.

Great beer. Had some from the tap at Rattle n Hum. A nice, sweet malt aroma with notes of fruit. Flavor is also sweet, and powerful, an admirable blend of spice and alcohol. Finish is smooth and pleasant, with a warming mouthfeel.
My new favorite Belgian beer - taste is somewhere between Leffe blonde and Hoegarden. Too bad it¬ís quite expensive - 2,60 ¬Ä for a 0,3L bottle here in Slovakia is a bit too much.

bottle from midway in denton tx.  poured gold with a white head.  aroma was banana, spices, lemon, and maybe some juicy fruit bubble gum.  flavor was very spicey and dry with a strong alcohol presence.  body was light-medium with high carbonation.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 11.2oz bottle into a chalice. The back label has a best before date of 03JJ and it was sampled on 6-23-09.

Appearance: The body has a golden color with a cloudy haze. Inside there are little bits of tasty yeast floaters. The head on top is tall, long lasting and bright whit in color. As I drink it leaves some spotty lacing on the glass.

Smell: Right from the pop of the cap the aroma creeps out of the bottle. It has a bright nose with hints of lemon zest, fruity and funky Belgian yeast.

Taste/Mouth: The flavor has sweetness up front with complex grainy malt flavor and a hint of clover honey. The middle sees fruity and funky yeast and mellow warming alcohol taking over and drying out the overall character. It then finishes bone dry with only a hint of herbal hops. The palate is medium bodied with good carbonation.

Notes: This is an outstanding example of the style and a very satisfying beer.

I have a cold and it even smells good! Malt and yeast combine to create a plesant aroma that tells you this is going to be good. It¬ís clear, quite clear for a tripel. Great lacing and head, the bubbls contine  to rise from the glass throughout the beer. The malt and yeast flavours are so well balanced that you can¬ít tell the alcohol is there in such a high percentage. Very nice, I should like it even more with a proper functioning nose.

On tapp at Tre sm√• rum G√∂teborg, 20091014
Lovely amber colour and aroma, fruit, syrup, yeast and a bit alcoholy
UPDATED: FEB 25, 2010 330mL bottle - pours a hazy golden colour. Flavour is sort of sweet, with fruit, hops and strong yeast. A classic tripel.

Bottled: Huge foamy head, hazy dark golden color. Aroma is fruity, yeasty with intensive notes of apricot, citrus and honey. Flavor is medium sweet with grainy and intensive fruity notes. Notes of apricot, almonds, some alcohol and apricot pancakes. Finish with herbal hops and hints of vermouth and a very dry finish.

bottled, pours medium golden with huge bright white head, apple/citrus notes with subtle bread background, sweet very calm malt flavor with mild citrus tones, slightest hint of hops in the end, no warm alcohol notes, very clean/crisp palate

33cl bottle from SAQ. Pours clear pale yellow with a medium head that is very short lived. Nose is yeasty fruits, very citrusy. Hints of honey and bana maybe. Carbonation is very lively. Taste is yeasty, estery and citrusy. Some alcohol but not that much. Finish is very dry and quite bitter. Interesting finish. A bit dusty. I¬íve had better bottles of this.
Beautiful taste of sweet citrus  and bitter hops.  Aroma is fruity and yeast.  Just a pleasant beer to sit and enjoy.

Dark yellow, golden colour, good carbonation, white head (non compact, medium lasting). Aroma: floral, alcohol, fruity. Flavor: sweet (honey), citrus. Nice bitterness. Good beer. Bottle 330 ml @ supermarkt in Utrecht.
Pours clear yellow with a large white head. Aroma is caramel, fruity, banana. Flavour is caramel and fruity. Well balanced.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2009 Prima impressione.. Che strano colore, un ambrato tanto acceso da sembrare arancione. Schiuma finissima, un dolcissimo profumo e un sapore che rispecchia pienamente ci√≤ che gi√† il naso ha potuto cogliere.. Certo, una birra da meditazione, ma √® talmente particolare che penso risulter√† difficile accompagnarla ad un qualsiasi pasto.
Prezzo: 13,50¬Ä per un litro.
An outstanding beer.golden color with a sweet malty aroma.Nice mouthfeel. recommended.
Great beer...I taste this beer in Brussels Grand Place in the Beer weekwnd... Simply irrestible on tap.Great flavour and perfect beer.My favorite

Always enjoyable, I don¬ít like them it with too much age on it though. Easy to drink for the alcohol content. Aroma is sweet with some mild spice and grain. Flavor is nice and sweet, reminiscent of a barleywine with a nice citrus aspect with the sweet grain and spice. Very good.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2009 Bottle from Sam¬ís; poured into Duvel glass.  Pours bright, deep, hazy golden with huge white head that recedes but maintains.  Nose of bananas, citrus, coriander, yeast, honey, honeysuckle, apples, and lovely floral notes (but not at all soapy). Bit of white pepper. Perhaps a little on the sweet side for a tripel, but finishes nicely dry.

330 ml bottle - pale yellow with thick, eggy white head; steady csrbonaton with tasty aromas of honey, sweet flowers, yeasty spice, apples; fizzy texture with sweet, fruity mouthful and dry finish; hazy gold with soft, delicate flavors of honey, lemons, grass and malty sweetness; just an amazing brew all around; lovely on draft but doesn¬ít do as well in the 750¬ís as in the 330¬ís IMO
bananas coriander orange flowers- great mouthfeel - thick - smells musty at first than like light orange floral - golden color - starts dry than sweet super delicious - spicy aftertaste

On tap at √òlbaren. 
Pours clear yellow with a big fluffy white head. 
Aroma is perfumed and sweet with notes of orange peal, coriander, caramel and spices. 
The flavour follows the aroma closely but has a sweet honey note and even more coriander to it.
Very nice and spicy beer but also a little to sweet.

A faint nose of grass, cucumber and soil. Taste is of yeast, soil, grass and citrus. There is some saltiness and the alcohol is well hidden. Easy to drink, but otherwise I¬ím not a big fan of this one.

Bottle at redlight redlight.  Good solid tripel.  Golden in color and crisp on the palate.  Nice subtle funkiness that nicely compliments the notes of bread and fruit.  I would write more, but I have to go because my girlfriend is tired.

Weak aroma of grass. Apperance is yellow with white head. Flavor is sweet with hints of herbs, yeast and maybe citrus. Overall this is good for a tripel however tripel is not a my favorite beer style.

There is a sweet, spicy, and boozy aroma that blend together perfectly. The appearance is as described, blonde and robust. The flavor fully fills your palate and the mouth is tingling with spices, and slightly sweet in the blonde ale tradition. This is one of my favorite beers ever. This is the definitive idea of a delicious Belgian Brew to make the country proud to be the best beer producer in the world

750 ml bottle.  Popped the cork and was hit with a skunky and musty aroma.  I had heard that the big green bottle was very prone to light damage and I was a bit worried at first that it was a skunky bottle. Pour was a clear golden with a big head.  Once I actually got my nose into the glass there was a mix of spices and fruits.  The actual taste was a nice surprise, yeast, banana, pear, and light toffee.  Not at all what I would expect from the look of the beer.  You get a bit of warmth in the finish, but not a harsh alcohol burn.  All in all a rather complex beer that had me guessing from beginning to end.

Bottle - Pours yellow with a nice white head. Smells skunky and musty up front, with sweet fruit underneath. I actually thought this bottle might be a little lightstruck, but the flavors underneath make me think twice. There are some apples, pears, and earthy flavors in there. Taste is fruity and complex, with wheat and smooth grain adding some balance. It¬ís spicy and hoppy, with some lemon notes on the finish. Warms a bit as it goes down the throat, but that¬ís the only indication of the 8%. The carbonation is dialed up a bit too much, but overall this is pretty nice. It¬ís sweet, fruity, and a little hot.

750 ml bottle. Spicy musty aromas, very saison-like, sweet malt, honey, sweet bread, spicy, grassy hops on the nose.  Pours blonde with a solid white head.  Dry, spicy, malty, mildly funky, with spicy, grassy, earthy hops, great funky flavor, one of my favorite tripels!

I¬ím very new at the Craft beers, but this one has left a lastinng impression on me, exceptional taste, especially to the untrained palate... mild (to my nose) aroma, finishes very crisp leaving  a plesant aftertaste.  My absolute favorite craft beer so far!

The beer pours a clear, light golden color with tons of bubbles and a thick white head.  Unfortunately, the beer that I drank smelled a little skunky.  I¬ím not sure is that is how this beer always smells or if I just got bad one.  Fortunately, the skunky smell did not carry over to the flavor.  This is a rich, malty, sweet carmel and light in the mouth.  The aroma kind of killed my rating on this beer, but otherwise it is an excellent beer.
Cloudy yellow beer with mild sedimentation.  Well defined, powerful, malty aroma.  Complex, flavor with nice mouthfeel.
I ¬íve got nothing new to say about this excelent tripel. One of my best beers in general and one of the top 3 tripels ever.
33 cl. @ Home, pours deep golden, medium white head. The head vanishes rapidly. Nose is very fruity, and malty. Nice fruity, hoppy aroma. Medium Long finish, nice beer!
33cl bottle. Deep golden body with big white head. Flavour is fruit, caramel, sweet and hops.
@La Brasserie Cathedrale, Liege. Deep gold colour with small head. Malty aroma. Fine flavour, but quite aggressive palate with acidic carbonation. Nevertheless a fine and filling beer.
UPDATED: AUG 31, 2009 Great Appearance with an inviting nose, very easy to drink trippel that leaves you with strong taste to open the next one ... my daily "slaapmuts"

Pours golden pour with quite possibly the biggest head I¬íve seen. Very bubbly. Strong aroma of yeast and malts. Flavor of orange peel, malt, and a bit of spice. Nicely balanced and a good mouth feel. Finish remains balanced between sweet and bitter. Very nice beer overall.

( 330ml bottle) Pours clear yellow with a huge head and a foam that coats the glass. A very effervescent beer. Nose of pepper, grass, oats, and spicy yeast. The taste is an oily, sticky, sweet nectar of the gods with mixtures of white pepper and grains. This beer is very carbonated in a great way, and just delicious. One of the world¬ís best tripels.

750ml bottle shared by my brother in law. Pours a bright golden color with a white fizzy head. nose is lightly sweet but with a dry yeasty note mixed in as well. Light straw and grain also present. Palate is smooth with a light dryness; crisp. Flavors of the light sweet malt note and yeast show up and there is a nice crisp feeling. It is not overly syrupy nor overly dry, but both aspects are present.

From a 750 ml corked and caged bottle purchased from Paul¬í Grocery in McCall, ID, this poured a cloudy apricot color with a big long lasting off-white head and very serious lacing rings. The nose is of ripe fruit with apricot dominating.  Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Flavor is very complex with ripe fruit, caramel, spices, and citrus. An exceptional beer.

330 mL bottle from Grape & Gourmet in Virginia Beach, VA. Pours a hazy peach color with lots of carbonation visible and a few very small white floaties. Large head with good head retention and lacing. Bready, yeasty aroma with light fruity notes. Taste is bread, caramel, spice, light fruit and nutty notes. Full bodied. Slight alcohol warmth. Good beer.

Bottle. This is one of the best tripels I¬íve ever had. Pours dark gold with a fluffy white head that is short lived. Aroma features a bit of caramel and - I think - spongecake? Honey comes through strongly in the flavour as well as malt, caramel and a touch of heather. This is a smooth, full bodied beer that has just the right amount of sweetness. Great stuff.
Fantastic!  Delicious and surprisingly smooth and mellow... every lover of Belgians should probably seek this out.

Julio¬ís Belgian Beer Festival. Sample. This was one of the highlights for me of the festival. Very impressed with this tripel. One of the few I really liked. While it has all the characteristics of a typical belgian triple this one was unique. Predominent taste I remember was lemon. Will be buying more of this.

Golden orangish poor,  Big fuzzy white head that disaptes very quickly. Aroma is a bit lemon zest, ripe bannans, bit of floral. Flavor is still a bit bannas at front, very effervescent and  yeasty in the middle finished a bit dry. Overall very nice.

Golden pour, fizzy offwhite head.  yeasty, tart strawberry, malty, very complex.  medium mouthfeel, sweet dried fruit upfront with some tickle of carbonation.  middle is sticky malt and it finishes sweet and a bit spicy.  Great

My wife says dead girl is spot on but that she caught some apricot in there as well. I agree with the wife that its a pretty beer to behold in the glass and it has a unique taste for a tripel (still I don¬ít like it) and she enjoyed it alot! The rating is all hers...

33cl bottle. Pours a clear golden colour with a huge creamy white head. Finely lacing and fully lasting foam. Aroma is quite complex: light malt with some grain, lots of hops with flowers and herbs, and some alcohol too. Flavor is a bit disappointing: bitterness and acidity in the initial flavor, bitterness and alcohol sweetness in the finishing flavor. Light alcoholic and spicy end. Medium bodied with creamy texture and fizzy carbonation. To me, best of this beer is the wonderful aroma of flowers and the incredible head: never seen something as beatiful as this. A better and more complex flavor could make this beer one of my favourites.
Overall, one of the better beers that we have in Belgium. Combined with the great glass, it¬ís a full package!
I drank it out of a 1.5 litre bottle and that made the beer taste very good!! It¬ís really one of the best blond beers I ever drunk

UPDATED: APR 29, 2010 On tap at George Keely¬ís (NYC): Pours crisp and light like a pilsner or lager... but the taste is anything but! Light carbonation- tastes of lemon, coriander, a hint of pepper, grapefruit, strawberries, banana bread... but definitely big on the citrus notes. Not comparable to other tripels I¬íve tasted. It¬ís different- tart, sweet, and the alcohol is extremely well hidden. This is good. #086 on 07082009, DG.

Bottle. 8.4% at the back-label. Medium gold with little, but dense white head. Very unique fresh lemony, appleish aroma with coriander spiciness.
Bready malty initial taste with intense clove and coriander edge. Fresh sipcy, citrus based, lively carbonated, mouthfeel with well hidden alcohol. It should be served colder than cellar temperature to get the whole range of flavors.
It¬ís not a typical tripel, very unique.

1 pint 9.4 fl. oz. bottle purchased at QFC in Harbour Pointe/Mukilteo, WA.  Pours a sunny golden color with a white head.  Aroma: Fruit and fresh baked bread.  Flavor: Tangy, with a hint of citrus, dry finish.
Nice head.  Grapefruit, raspberry nose.  Yeasst, white grape flavor.  Fizzy carbonation.
Gold hazy beer with an active white head, aroma is strong with fruit, mainly strawberries, flavor is super malty, slight tang, good amount of spices, finishes soft and slightly bitter.

Bottle: Effervescent golden with a huge fluffy white head. When sediment is disturbed the beer develops a nice glowing cloudy appearance. Great yeasty aroma with a light pale malt sweetness as well- has a spicy phenolic character, honeyish herbal notes, freshly baking bread, wheat- full of nuance. Voluminous effervescent body. It has a hearty flavor with a crisp wheaty base and a hearty oat like presence. Has a bit of yeast character as well. Very dry with spicy phenolics- a bit peppery as well with an herbal balancing hop character. Quite spicy on the back. Everything a Tripel should be- dry, spicy and filled with nuance.
Golden pour with white head. Spicey, sweet grainy aroma. Flavor is floral, sweet, some caramel. Mouthfeel is nice, a bit of a spicy finish. Nice beer.

Poured from a 11.2oz bottle in to a tulip glass.  

Color is clear golden with a nice head that lingers.  

Nose was of banana, clove, and yeast. 

Light to medium mouthfeel with a bit of carbonation.  

Taste of fruity malt and spice.  Very smooth.  

Very enjoyable to drink.  One of my personal favorites.
bottle.  Tres belle couleur golden.  Bonne au gout,  produit de haute qualit√©. Malt√©, spices. Rafraichissante, pas forte au gout en alcool.

Amber body with big white head. Thick island of head stays in glass after the rest of the head left. Only disappointment was in the lack of sediment. I love the look of these kind of beers with sediment. Smells of lavender, oranges, cinnamon, sugar, and malt. Very nice smelling and a bit perfumey. The mouthfeel is very carbonated and crisp/clean. Tasted notes of orange, spice, slightly metallic but not in a bad way. A ton of lavender and melon. Very nice beer.
Didn¬ít get much head on my big bottle (wine bottle, corked). Taste was more like a pilsner than a tripel. Not sure about whether it needed more aging, or just wasn¬ít quite my thing.

non √® il mio genere di birra preferito,ma riconosco che √® un ottima birra!
il colore √® di un bellissimo biondo oro,a livello olfattivo √® davvero intrigante,si evidenziano note tendenti al fruttato.risulta una birra poco amara,e dal gusto bello complesso,ma secondo me troppo dolce!!!!

Bottle. Pours golden yellow coloured with a lasting huge foamy egg white head. Beautiful lacings. Floral aroma with notes of malt, spice, orange fruit and hops. Sweet and fruity flavour with notes of peaches, oranges, pale malt, cereal, yeast and hops.

Holy crap!  This poured, from the little 330 ml bottle, an explosive HUGE foamy light tan head.  It had to be the biggest I¬íve ever seen, but it eventually faded away to almost nothing.  The aroma was mostly fruity with some floral undertones, and the colour was a cloudy medium gold.  The taste was again fruity with some caramel lurking in the background.  A truly marvelous beer.
Bottle 33 cl. Apperance; Light golden, hazy with a small sparkling head. Aroma; hoopy, caramel and a bit sour. Flavor; light hoppy, and a sweet caramel taste. Lots of sparkling and taste, very good!

Bottle at Six Acres. Nice aroma that I can¬ít describe. This is a really sweet beer. Slight taste of brown sugar & spices.Fruity. Nice malt taste. Not too hoppy. For an 8.4%, the alcohol is masked very well.

Pours golden with decent head that disappears fast. The aroma is very peachy, & floral scents. Taste is floral with light fruit taste. Seems a little light & thin for the amount of alcohol, which is a good thing. In fact the alcohol is very well hidden.

Traditionnelle tripel de haute qualit√©. Tr√®s bien balanc√©e et raffraichissante. Offre de meilleures saveurs lorsque pas trop froide, on peut alors plus facilement percevoir les notes de fruits (poires) et de houblon.

Pours clear golden color with a small foamy white head.  Aroma of sweet vanilla, clove,  slightly rubbery banana, and a lemony citrus.  The taste is unbelievably smooth.  The clove sweetness comes through huge with a nice bitterness to balance.  A subdued fruitiness to it.  Not really clear what fruit, but kind of artificially.  A great balance to it.  Lacking in carbonation, but very quality body.  A spicy semi-dry finish.
UPDATED: JAN 24, 2011 One of my favorite tripels...citrusy, refreshing.  Goes great with most any food.

Draught @ Cafe Duvel. Bottle. Golden, big white creamy head. A little of everything really. Sugar and spice and all things nice... citrus, vanilla, caramel, orange... all in perfect balance. Very smooth.
Pours a light yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is of yeast and lemon. Flavor is strongly lemon and honey with some background malts and fruits
Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Lemon and yeast aroma. Pleasantly sweet taste of lemon and spices.
I just bought a single 11.2 oz. bottle for $5.69.  Not inexpensive but I think worth every penny.  Very good and 8.1%!

bottle, one of my old-time favourites, altough from the tap this is a lot better, from bottle it¬ís still pretty good; golden medium misty liquid with medium head. fruity wel balanced, alcohol well masked a tad bit sweet, but excellent nonetheless. well above average belgian tripel.

Had on draft at the Dilly Deli.  A quintessential Belgium Tripel that was yeasty, fruity with golden raisins that had some honey and crispness to the finish.  A truly flavorful, complex yet refreshing tripel. The finish is strong with a definite presence of alcohol.

bottle 750 ml EXP 26/02/11 bought from Pater Marcus bar 7440Ft  Budapest during weekend trip. Golden yellow color bit honey in scent very strong floral perfume like aroma, spicy lemon. Alcohol well hidden. Pleasant floral aftertaste as well Oh no I should travel soon again ;)

Pours out the standard orange / amber clour. Ha! I¬ím getting an endless supply of bubbles out of my Karmeliet goblet that only helps feed the colossal off white crown that was produced on the pour. The lacing is average but this is kind of misleading as half my glass has been filled with beer foam...even a light swirl starts the bubble factory up. The aroma is of sweet orange, nice floral hops (my brain tells me it has noticed the faint aroma of roses), a low ammount of spice from the yeat and some alcohol heat that slightly burns the nostrils. The taste is caramelly, orange, lightly spiced yeast with the alcohol not quite hidden in the background. It did come across more mild that I expected. The mouthfeel was smooth and a bit dry with a solid deep alcohol burn but lacks a defined finish. 

Looks like a re-review is in order.

Green, WTF?, 750 ml bottlefrom Spirits RB. Aroma had way too much skunk going on from being in a God Damn green bottle. Also noted were lots of earthy grassy notes, some lemon pepper and solvent.....pretty much heading towards the yuck category. A huge fluffy bright white head sits atop a brownish/gold crystal clear body with sporadic carbonation. Medium bodied, medium to strong carbonation and a slightly dry finsih, not bad there. Flavor of grassy earth notes, citrus, light dry candi sugar, fruit. I honestly believe that the green bottle dragge this rating down by one whole point, I mean geen bottle...WTF is this the the stone age or are you a closet Heineken lover?

Wow, whata great tripel. Pours a perfects  golden with a nice big head that stays around for a while. Amorma is spicy with hints of yeast and fruirt (banana and some lemon). Taste is great and well rounded and balanced. The grain is mixed well and allow the beer to be smooth yet robust. A very nice beer. Highly recommended
This beer is all but perfect.  It¬ís got a lovely colour, it holds a lovely small head well.  Its taste is well rounded, with a nice amount of spicyness.  Definately recommended.

Bottle. Poured with a fairly large, white head. Dark yellow, hazy body with very good lacing. Very nice aroma - average yeast, with hints of various fruits (definitely some banana in there). On the palate, the body feels medium-full, with a thin-yet-slick texture and lively carbonation and a nice, even finish. Great flavor, lightly acidic and bitter, but with the fruit and yeast present as well, and a good duration after you¬íve finished sipping it. A great tripel that will always remind me of Belgium (it was the first beer I tried there)... very glad it¬ís available in North America.
Tap at Sunset.  Really enjoyed the rich fruity and spicy notes in the aroma.  Taste did not keep these notes up though and kind of died on me.  Ok though overall.

amazing trippel! this is the best i have had. this is so tasty and smooth! the houblon dobbelen ipa is too funky to really enjoy so this takes the top spot for me. really exemplifies what a trippel should be!

33 cl. bottle. Pours a thick, rapidly shrinking white head, over a slightly cloudy, yellow (SRM 5-10) body....nose of spice (coriander, allspice, slight clove), fruits (lemon, banana), bubblegum.....taste initially slightly sweet gradually evolving through the spice flavors mentioned ending in medium bitterness.....mouth feel is medium. the overall spice is present, more sweetness than some, carbonation is higher than I like. That complaint registered, I like it.
I bought this because it was advertised as a "98 point Rate Beer" beer.  A decent Trappist beer with a smooth taste.  Not the best in the world, but worth the money.
33cl bottle, clear golden colour, medium white head, yeast and malt aroma, spices and fruity notes, sweet flavor with citrus notes, medium to full body, dry finish with spices, really big tripel

11.2oz bottle.  hazy yellow pour with a small white head that leaves a ring.  aroma is understated but nice blend of spice, lemon, banana and pepper.  taste is sweet candy up front then hints of banana, clove, coriander, bready yeast, floral and honey.  good all around balance of the many flavors.  tingly medium texture.  sweet bready finish.

Straw to golden in body with a good sized cap that lasted a few minuites, lacing spoty at best. Creamy and smooth aromaostly yeast and wheat and a touch of alchol. smooth and tasty, yeast, banana, zero hops not to much in the rilm of spice. very good beer very tasty

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2010 Clear yellow pour, makes budweiser look thick. Awesome nose, mainly banana but a strong underscent of citrus specifically lemon both of which you find in the taste with an all-so pleasant sweetness probably from the winter wheat. Simply the best triple I¬íve had IMHO

D√©gust√© avec Pyrozoid.  Explosion lors de l¬íouverture.... Faites attention.  Apparence or brumeuse avec une belle mousse blanche qui tiens bien au verre.  Aromes de coriandre, bananes, apricots, citron et pur√©e de pomme.  Tres douce, cr√©meuse, jolie effervescence en bouche avec un corps bien rond.  Moyenne amertume avec un petit cot√© sucr√© bien balanc√© et finition sec.  Gout de coriandre, bananes, gruau au peche.
On tap @ Cafe Centraal, Milwaukee. Rich creamy head. Lighter in color, but has a heavier taste than expected. A bit bitter, as well as sweet tones. Somewhat dry after taste.
bouteille de 330ml. 8,4% alc. bi√®re blonde, peu de mousse, douce au nez et en bouche, agr√©able go√ªt, pas tr√®s cors√© ou longue. l¬íalcool ne se fait pas sentir.
Sampled at the Alexi TN distributor¬ís tasting; thanks Jim Bird!  Above average for a tripel. All the typical flavors and aromas but just a little on the creamy side.  Nice.

Achet√© √† la SAQ du casino en format de 341ml et d√©gust√© dans un verre de westmalle avec glandine. Apparence blonde ambr√© avec un moyen collet de mousse. Ar√¥mes de grain malt√©, de citron et de pelure de banane. Go√ªt de pain liquide avec un peu de citron et d¬íhoublon. Bonne carbonation et bon corp. Une bi√®re m√©ritant un l√©ger repos dans un cave pour quelques ann√©es......
6 year old 3L bottle sampled at DLD ¬í09.  Chunky orange pour with a thin white head.  Sour yeasty aroma with lots of citrus and some caramel.  Honey flavor up front with some yeast and tart fruit.
Bottle. Golden coloured pour with a thick white head. Floral, citrus aroma with some malt. A complex tripel that tastes of apple, banana, orange. Quite sweet and lively. A damn fine Belgian beer!

Pours a beautiful golden color with a full thick head.  Lively carbonation makes this beer rather "sparkley".  Smells of sweet fruits, complex spices, and some hints of yeast.  The tastes of sublte yet complex spice is first and foremost followed by a bit of banana and other sweet fruits; somewhat citrusy.  A decent ¬ífresh bread¬í flavor comes through as well.  The finish is nice and slightly tart.  Fantastic!
On tap at Delirium. Poured a gold with a white head. Aroma is fruity with a bit of malt. Flavor is complex dominated by a combination of fruit and spices.

Poured a clear golden color, with some nice active carbonation streaming upwards to a full, creamy white head.  The aroma was yeast, malt, light spice and fruit.  The flavor was light yeast, banana and malt.  Effortless mouthfeel.  Well put together, just lacking personality.
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2010 This was a very good tripel, but I still feel that Chimay is better. It just didn¬ít smell or look as good as Chimay White does.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2009 MERCI AUX GENS CONCERNES A LA SAQ!  3,70$ for 33cl bottle. Rich, sweet and fruity citrus taste.  Some spices in the taste but is this added or a result of those 3 grains?  Anyway, it is very tasteful, probably the best tripel I had.  A reference.

Lovely beer from the first sip!
The head stays quiet a long time before dissapearing. golden colour.
The aroma smells overwhelming: a lot of wheat and floral hops and a bit of orange. Taste is almost the same as the smell: whea and fruity and very sparkling. My favourite triple? Perhaps?

Bi√®re d¬íun jaune clair surmont√©e d¬íune fine mousse blanche cr√®meuse qui s¬íestompe rapidement. Ar√¥me de malt, de sucre candy, d¬í√©pices, de houblons floraux et herbac√©s et d¬íagrumes. Saveur de malt, de bl√©, d¬íalcool, de levure, de pomme, de sucrer candy et de houblons herbac√©s. Gaz√©ificatioin intense compos√©e de tr√®s fines bulles.

75CL bottle from Holiday Wine Cellar (Escondido, CA).  Had real difficulty getting the cork out of this one.  Pours a cloudy yellow/orange with a giant and very white head.  Very carbonated and has a rather champagne-like essence.  Sweet and slightly musty aroma of yeast.  Some spice and fruit in the nose -- apple, banana, and light citrus.  Complex flavor of earthy yeast, banana, spices (clove and pepper).  A very nice level of sweetness that never turns cloying.  Alcohol is completely hidden -- be careful.  Light mouthfeel with a great level of carbonation.  A really fantastic tripel.  This is the main one that turned my ex-girlfriend from a wine lover into a beer lover, too.  Forget Miller -- this is the real "Champagne of Beers."

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2009 Orange/amber pour with good clarity. Half-inch persistent head.
A lot of wheat on the aroma, as well a perfumy orange blossom, soft alcohol, some spicy and floral hops and a bit of lemon.
Flavour is quite similar, but with the expected doughy belgian yeast coming through. 
Highly effervescent, very prickly. Some alcohol warming on the palate.
The wheat put a spin on things, but otherwise this is just a typical belgian tripel, albeit quite a tasty one....

Bottled, tnx to Viktor! Color is hazy yellow, with thick creamy slightly off-white head. Nice lacing. Nose is fruity and slightly alcoholic. Aroma has fruits, malt. Flavour is dominated by sweet hops and alcohol. Carbonation gives it a pleasant mouthfeel and hops take care of the aftertaste. Nicely brewed triple, but I can¬ít see the many 4+¬ís. Alcohol is too much dominant for that.

Bottle from jessup plaza. poured a nice reddish yellow color with a huge fluffy white head. Aroma was nice and spicy with lots of sweet malt and some clove. Taste was nice and refreshing with lots of sweet malt and clove. Very drinkable and good.
My favorite Tripel so far.  Golden color with nice carbonation. Great finish with hint of alcohol. Great mix of flavors.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2010 Il colore √® giallo dorato uno sfocato,con una testa bianca compatta e spessa. L¬íaroma fruttato dolce,di lievito.Gusto dolce e fruttato.Finale un p√≤ amaro con lievito e una lieve punta alcoolica.Eccellente tripel.

33cl bottle poured into a Chimay Trappist glass.  Nice golden color with about one finger of head.  Smells like spiced apples.  Tastes spicy and hoppy with a some fruit undertones.  Very well balanced beer.  Great brew.

Classic Belgian yeast, clover like and a light hop floral aroma. Color was golden, with a creamy low carbonation head. Flavor had mostly clover, with some ripe apple and perhaps even pineapple. Palate was creamy with a light alcohol tinge at the finish. Good stuff, but not spectacular.

Shared by a friend of Bobby91W at DLD--Matt maybe?  From a 3 liter bottle that was ¬í95 vintage I believe.  This was reallyy incredible.  Soft yellow pour.  The aroma was light with yeast, and caramel scents as well as a bit of lemon.  Really refreshing flavor.  Lightly sweet fruits, apples, pears, with a hint of citrus.  Great brew!

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2010 This by far to this date is the best damn triple I have ever had sampled at DLD from a gaint bottle from some generous soul  poured yellow and hazy with tight carbonated head of a million bubbles aromas of banana,,spices,citrus and malts the taste was sweet from all of the above just a truely out standing triple
Is there a better tripel than this?  Not for me.  Straw color, fluffy head, banana/clove in the nose, great sweet candy flavor, and tons of good alcohol.

The pour is extremely carbonated, straw-to-golden, with lots of rather thin foam. It diminishes to a finger, then to a film, but leaves decent lacing as it goes.
The first smell reminds me strongly of Westmalle, with really nice round ripe fruit (lychee or peach perhaps, with some citrus zest) and some peppery spice. Very effervescent. As it calms down, there¬ís some herbal/grassy and some hay-like notes in there, but the fruit from the yeast dominates. In the mouth, it is round and full at first, with the ripe fruit from the aroma, almost like a sweet white wine; then, you feel the carbonation, and perhaps a bit of leafy hop astringency. The bitterness is assertive, definitely enough to dry out the flavour. It strikes a nice balance between sweet and bitter, fruit and spice, roundness and effervescence, what have you. Worth the price of admission.

330 ml bottle. Clear golden with a big, foamy white head. Aroma is citric fruity, spicy and floral. Flavor is sweet, relatively light, but still complex. Malt, citric fruit, spicy and balanced bitter. Very nice indeed.
Bottle 33 cl. Creamy head, Aroma a bit yeasty. Teastes spicey, a little sweet. Finish bitterly, long, tasteful.

On tap. Yeasty earthy aroma. Light gold with barely a head. The flavor is sweet and sour with a typical Belgian yeasty flavor. Hints of fruit and spice round out the complex flavor. Medium to light bodied with an average carbonation. A very good Tripel that is incredible light and smooth for its alcohol content.

I¬íve been eying this one for a while now and finally decided to try it out.  Has a nice foggy light golden color.  Smell is full of malty hops.  Hints of barley, yeast, and citrus.  Has a citrus and malt flavor.  Not too carbonated.  Some yeast in the flavor.  A little bite in the end that is nothing else but pleasant.  Overall this was a good choice.

33cl bottle into tulip glass. A cloudy golden ale with a decent white head and nice lacing. Spicy warming yeasty aromas with orange peel predominating. Full bodied with complex flavours of honey malt, oranges and spicy/perfume hops with a very satisfying dry bitterness to the finish. Very well integrated with a smooth drinkability despite the ABV. I have not tasted a better Belgian Abbey ale than this.
Bottle. Golden- orange  colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, citrus, banana, malt, spices. Flavour is fruit, malt, citrus, banana, spices, alcohol. Full bodied nice beer.
One of the best tripels ever, no doubt. Fruity, spicy and yeasty, full bodied and just world class.

Pours crystal amber with large white long lasting head nicely lacing. Refreshing spicy and yeasty aroma with a sweet malty flavor combined with a complex spicyness. Full body with a sweet and rather sour finish.

On tap @ Deluxe. Pour was gold with 2 fingers of a nice white head. The aroma is that of an orchard plentiful in apples, strawberry, and some citrus. The taste starts off with a lot of fruit and follows through with a nice spicy/yeasty finish. Overall mouthfeel is pretty light but not flimsy. A very easy drinking beer and quite refreshing!

Tasted 4/1/09.  750ml bottle.  The first pour was relatively clear with a golden hue.  Layer of white head.  Aromas of apples, melons and citrus.  Belgian candy sugar yeast and pepper.  Medium to full bodied with bright effervescence and big citrus notes.  Candy, chalky and perfumy.  This is how a tripel should taste!  Peppery with a faint cherry nuance.  The second glass was activared and produced a slightly hazy hue.  Spicy chalky finish with just a kiss of hops.  Mild bready malt character.  This is the style personified!

Bottle. The aroma started sweet, but then it gets dominated by some sour aromas which are well hidden in the background. Also some light aroma of apples. The head is normal large, white and creamy, the duration is long. The body is clear and orange. The taste is very nice, started light sour and spicy, later on it gets sweeter, the finish is also sweet. The body is creamy, light to medium with a lively carbonation. A really nice beer!

Pours a lighltly hazy golzen yellow with a average white head.  Malty sweet aroma.  Hint of alcohol.  Taste is heavy on the spice.  Little bit of citrus.  Good flavored beer.  Fizzy carbnonation.  Kind of like champagne.

Great Tripel. Nice fruity aroma of berry and yeast. Flavor is slightly acidic, with notes of berry and citrus to provide a great balance. Also some subtle hints of hops. Quite carbonated in the mouthfeel.

Tulip glass on tap at Ground Control in Goodyear AZ.  Nice 2-3 finger head.  Cloudly yellow hue. Solid yeasty belgian aroma.  Tastes super smooth slight-medium sweetness with a nice like clove spice kick.

Location: 750 from Gilly¬ís, Feb 09


Overall Impression: 
Really nice, drinkable beer. Fruity and sweet, but not overly so, definitely enjoyed this one, As far as flavors go, its not the most complex Tripel out there, but definately enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2009 Golden light yellow with large white head.  Absolutely wonderful nose of coriander, bready malts, lemon notes,  flowers, hops and more. Light thin body, rich with flavors of coriander and orange/lemon peel.  Was very citrusy and loved the spice finish.  Bready malts and citric flavors are prevalent.   Wonderful brew.

Had on tap at Delirium cafe in Brussels, Belgium. Drinken from Karmeliet glass whose tulip shape seemed to hold on to the head for longer than expected and result in moderate to heavy lacing. 

Beer had a beautiful golden brown color and gave up hints of wheat and barley. Upon tasting, the most noticeable characteristic is the sweetness, which is quite strong for a tripel, but pleasant nonetheless. The beer tastes of light honey, minor nut, and some vanilla.

The beer lingers for quite some time and leaves a sweet coating on the tongue and light floral or clove tastes in the back of the throat.

An overall very good beer, probably best drinken on the colder side to prevent unintended similarities with weaker meads.

Pale and hazed with no head.

Banana, yeast, melon, petrol and booze aromas.

Orange, carrot, melon, mango and other tropical fruits with sweet malts and slightly sour/bitter finish.

Smooth and easy.


Deep and complex for its colour.

I drank this alongside a Gruyere and Parmesan souffle. It was lovely with the rich cheesiness and it¬ís caramel flavours and sour notes played well with and slightly bitter cheeses.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2011 bottle, the head fades away in less than one minute, golden colour, hazy, complex palate,grainy, sweet, loyal, subtile, fruity, soft acid. Great smell. But by far too sweet. May be a bit overrated?

Had it on tap at Rattle n Hum in NYC. Strikes me as "tripel light" - I am surprised to read other RBers¬í ratings! Probably the most "reserved", lightly flavoured tripel I¬íve ever had.. which is not a good thing in my opinion. Would definitely drink again, but wish there was just more there.
Drank at JK Odonells.  Absolutely delicious with a bold finsih if smooth yeast and hops.

Pours blonde with an overflowing head. Aroma was a let-down; very dull and vague. Flavor is quite tasty, of apricot, bread, and a lot of spice, coriander. Overall, very good, although perhaps a little overrated.

330 ml bottle from a trade with hobbersr. pours clear golden with a steady white head. aromas of floral fruit, hops, light yeat notes. the flavour onthis one is so layered and subtle. its very well put together and almost perfect for the style. more hops and a bigger nose would make this my fav triple. top notch stuff, thx Riley!!

33cl bottle. Lemony yellow, firm foamy head leaving tight lacing. Nicely wheaty aroma, soapiness, interesing minty spices and citric fruits. Smooth wheaty flavor, spices, grainy malts, white pepper and hint of alcohol. Strongly carbonated, refreshing lively palate. Probably my favourite Tripel so far, love those witbier notes.
Beautiful, clean and dry finish. The flavor is subtle, but there is a lot going on here. Sets a new standard for belgian tripels.

Great Tripel. Nice fruity aroma of berry and yeast. Flavor is slightly acidic, with notes of berry and citrus to provide a great balance. Also some subtle hints of hops. Quite carbonated in the mouthfeel.

Thanks for giving me a taste, bro.  Pours a crisp golden color with a large soapy head.  Aroma is floral, citrus, honey, and some spicy yeast.  Taste is much the same.  Very well balanced with some smooth bitterness, and an abundance of citrus, floral, and spicy tastes.

Never really liked blonde beers until a classmate recommended this one to me. Has an awesome herb-aroma which lets you think of fields in springtime. The taste balances betweens honey, citrusfruits and herbs. One of my all-time favourites.
750 bottle. blonde and fizzy. many flavors that all blentd together perfectly. would have to consider this one of my favorite beers. great beer to turn on non beer geek friends.
nice amber yellow color.interesting flavour of honey,fruit and maybe citrus.fantastic yeast aroma that gives value to this excellent beer.appreciable consistence.excellent with meat and barbecues
Poured a medium, hazy golden/yellow with an averaged sized head. Taste and aromas of fruit, flowers and spices. Just a hint sweet.
Bottle pours hazy yellow with a big head.  Big yeasty aroma! Sweet body with a dry swallow.  Some fruitiness but more subdued than other tripels I have had.

300 cl bottle (big!) at my 40 years party - shared with yngwie and 50 others. A bit hazy golden/amber color, white head. Aroma is most of all fruit and yeast. Flavor is fruity, sweet, malty, yeast and hints of citrus. Lovely.

Served 2/22/09 @ 35 F in chilled Czech Pilsner.  Aroma of hay, herbs dough, leather.  Appeared golden hazy.  Taste of light sweetness, light bitter, moderate sour.  Medium body think texture, lively carbonation.

I live nearby the town where this excellent beer is created. I like the tripel karmeliet in the summer while enjoying a nice barbecue. The taste is a bit sweet with some hints of vanilla, citrus and honey.
Poor white head. Disapointing palate.Strong citrus/honey taste at first, smootly replaced by pears/floral yeast taste. Good, but far away from good typical belgian tripel.
Straight forward, clean, dick-in-the-dirt tripel.  Very effervescent and smooth.  Delicious.

Bouteille de 330 ml. Nos yeux observe une bi√®re de couleur or-cuivr√©e et un col de mousse imposant et durable. Au nez on respire des ar√¥mes de bl√©, de fleurs, de fruits (p√™che-mangue) sur un fond subtil d¬íalcool. En bouche le corps est rond avec une effervescence faible-moyenne. On go√ªte des saveurs de c√©r√©ales fra√Æches, de levure fruit√©e et de houblon floral. La finale pr√©sente une l√©g√®re pr√©sence d¬íalcool qui enrobe le fruit√©. √Ä noter qu¬íune effervescence visuelle intense et visible. Alcoolis√© mais l√©ger. Une bi√®re d¬íune grande finesse.

In bottle at Brasserie Beck in DC.  Pours medium-amber with a thick white head.  Fruity flavor with hints of honey and banana.  Strong taste, medium-bodied.  Well-carbonated yet smooth and easy to drink.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2009 On tap at Uber Tavern.  Pours golden with a sizeable white head.  Aroma is not too powerful, mostly sugary yeast.  Caramel malts and honey in the taste.  Nice mouthfeel and finish.

Bottle, 33cl, in Trappist goblet. Pours golden, with short-lasting white head. Off-citrus on the nose, and disappointing on the palate, perhaps under the shop-lights too long. Pale shadow of the best Triples, but I¬íll give it another chance again, but for now, a poor imitation.

golden amber pour with a 1 finger thick white head.  smell of sugar, dried fruits and musky yeast.  very nice on the palate with a heavy fruit flavor backed with a musky yeast flavor.  well carbonated and a good finish.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2009 This is one of my favorite tripels out there.  Hazy golden color with a thick white head.  Good tropical fruit aroma with a little sweetness, decent hoppiness.  Some yeast.  Taste is yeasty with sweet malt, wheat, candi sugar, and light fruits.  Medium-bodied and very drinkable.

Noticed the yeast inside the bottle and know that it would be a great beer.  It pours a golden orange with a nice foamy head that would quickly settle to a thin white lace head.  Its aromas are malty with an orange smell.  Its flavors are strong of a nice blend of orange honey and malty.  A little sweet and present yeast with a good carbonation.
A very tastefull beer with lots of caracters.

2008 750ml green bottle.  Pours with a foamy to nearly fizzy white head that fades quickly over the clear burnt yellow body. Very little lace, and not really appealing compared to just about any other Tripel I have ever had. Aroma of banana esters, dry fruit, honey pear, apple, candi sugar and alcohol. Taste is sweet on the mouth with a light and smooth character. Juicy ripe pear that lingers and a bit of cotton candy, alcohol and bread in the finish. Thinnish mouthfeel and dry with lively carbonation. This beer lets down in appearance and mouthfeel, but its classic Tripel taste and aroma make up for it.

Pours a gorgeous light golden color, with an amazing head.  As beautiful as the head was, it didn¬ít last at all. Aromas of clove, coriander, maybe vanilla too. Flavor is very fruity...apple, banana and pear. Awesome beer...I¬íll be buying more.
Pours a wonderful golden color with a small foamy head. Very strong flavor.

WTF, this beer gave p00tz tha hiccups. Smells like candy, and the name makes p00tz think of the best food in tha world, the veggie parm. Parmeliet, yo! Seriuosly, it¬ís got the fizzy flava and enough of the stank. p00tz can get wit this one.

Pours a golden marmalade with a large head.  Quite well carbonated, found the same as Nathan, head didn¬ít last long enough.

Fresh clean lemony aroma.

Would never pick this beer as an 8.4%ABV it tastes so light.  Thye flavour is very clean with spiced citrus and a dry finish.

Really liked this, I think its one I¬íll end up buying again.

(bottle) pours a clear golden colour with a small, foamy head. aroma of peppery, citric hop spices, honey, banana and light tropical fruits. flavour is the same, with peppery spices in the foreground and some grain. medium-bodied, with fizzy carbonation and a dry finish.

Bright golden yellow color with a creamy, fluffy white head. Looks great in a nice snifter. Aroma was really strong yeast with hints of bananas and citrus. The citrus flavor was much more apparent in the taste. Very lively on the tongue and finishes clean and crisp. Highly recommend!

Draught at TJ¬ís:  Aroma of grassy hops, light yeast, pale malts, and floral hops.  Very fresh scent.  Poured gold/yellow in color with a medium-sized, foamy, white head that lasted throughout.  Hazy.  Not sparkling.  Flavor is lightly bitter.  Tastes of fresh hops, pale malts, grass, grains, pollen, and flowers.  Light body.  Thin texture.  Average carbonation.  Hoppy, grainy, finish.  8%ABV is undetectable.  Very easy to drink.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2009 TAP: at the Bulldog (St. Paul, MN) on 1.31.09. Pale gold pour, some alcohol on the nose, along with some spice and mild fruit. Malty mouthfeel. Flavor of candied fruits, yeast, spice - quite good.
Very nice Belgian Blond Beer.  Great Color and Aroma.  Have had several times before.  Better on tap, however, still very good in a bottle.  Does not have the feel of an 8% beer.

Aroma is moderate and complex, like a typical Belgian blond base with a whole second layer over top. Appearance is a nice thick gold, but it looks a little musty. Very light-tasting on the surface, with sunflower seed, refreshing yellow pear, very soft wheat and yeast, oat, hops, grain. Some very faint citrus and vanilla. Found myself very disappointed when the bottle was empty. Will definitely and gladly buy more.

Few appear to acknowledge the disparity between contemporary and previous strengths of this beer. Well, I have a bottle of it from some years ago, which is 8.0% and new bottles of 8.4%.  I presume I am imagining it to be sweeter than it was (but unlike many I don¬ít see this as a bad thing...on the contrary....). This is a delicious beer, and I feel I have been harsh on it, but I have to travel a long way to get it now. Why have strong Belgian beers all but disappeared from our supermarkets? A joy to drink, I recommend it. Cheerio!

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2009 Moderate orange appearance with yellow highlight, semi-transparent, thick white lasting top. Strong smells of yellow pears, white wine and mild spice. Tastes of caramel, pears, toffee, sugar, zesty lasting after taste. lightly carbonated. A memorable tasting. Refreshing on a warm day.
gold blond coloured little sparkling body with a white head a spicy hoppy fruity aroma a spicy fruity hoppy grainy sweet taste with a mettalic spicy bitter finish nice one

On Tap at NachtBar.  Not a big fan of this style but this stuff was very impressive.  It had an awesome glass too!  It was a hazy golden yellowish color with a white head that held pretty well.  Don¬ít have many notes on flavor and aroma, but I certainly recommend this brew.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2009 1/5/09 notes: on tap, Wurstkuche in LA.  Pours orange gold with a fluffy head.  Aroma of wheat, sugar and candied fruit.  Flavor strongly reminiscent of apple cider vinegar.  Overall, this was a tasty beer, but I tried it side-by-side with Gouden Carolus Triple, and found the latter more complex and balanced.  Great brew nonetheless.
update bottled version 7/28/09: aroma is very yeasty, with balanced sweetness (vanilla, light-colored fruit), some floral fragrance, mixed grain (oats?) and a touch of hops (grassy, herbal primarily).  This is just a very well-rounded beer, it gets a bit sweeter towards mid-palate, and that yeast profile is so distinct throughout.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2009 750 mL. Pours a beautiful cloudy blonde with a two-finger white head that has great retention. Lasts and lasts. Aroma is at first citrus, flowers, floral hops, vanilla and maybe a hint of macro lager graininess. Taste is nicely carbonated and fizzy upfront with nicely balanced flavor of floral hops, coriander, whipped cream, white grapes, and Belgian yeast. Lots of candied fruits. Nice clean and crisp finish. Awesome. Best tripel I have had to date.
Pour is a clear gold with a big fluffy white head.  Lots of carbonation.  Nose is fruity yeast, straw, and spices.  Flavor is crisp, clean, and very nice.  Much like the smell.  A quality brew.
Poured golden with a nice big head. Citrus aroma with some spices. Soem fruitiness, but not too sweet.  Smooth and enjoyable.

330ml bottle. Pours hazy golden orange with bit white head. Aroma is fruity, citurs, yeast and bread. Flavor is lemon, pears, other citrus and light fruits, yeast, some bread and a little hops. A lot better that what I thought it was going to be as I really do not like this style. Well made brew.
Hazy blond coloured beer with medium white head and only few carbonation. Fresh granny and hoppy aroma. Full palate bit sparkling, little creamy. Finish is bitter and herby. Top beer.
Dark golden in color. A bit cludy, very fizzy. Pretty malty, somewhat sweet and strong tasting. Somewhat overcarbonated.

No 659
Rated 28 12 2008
Bottle brown, 330 ml, alc 8,4 percent, 
Appearance pours beautiful golden to amber honey body colour, carbonation of the body is soft, body texture is murky and very blurred, head is white, initially huge, slowly decreasing to small, very firm, leaving a nice lacing, really beautiful beer, 
Aroma very pleasant, perfectly sweet, flowery hoppy front, notes of sweetness from highly aromatic hops denoting iris flowers, coriander, vanilla, raisin, whipped cream, for sure there are those three grains present such as wheat, barley and oat, banana, gently leavy hops, a perfect combination of an aroma of a good and assertive Wheat Beer with its coriander, orange peal and perfumy hoppyness together with mature, oily, wheaty, leavy and herbal Abbey Tripel profile,
Flavour front is sweet with flowery boom in your nose, especially iris flowers, than coriander, clove, ginger, many other spices like myrrh, vanilla, cinamon,stick, whipped cream, yeast strains, white wine grapes, gentle alcoholic warmth on palate, very herbal, oat, wheat, barley, corn and other cereal, gooseberry, raisin, pine tree wood, orange, clementine, lime, candid sugar, powder sugar, almond, very sophisticated, complex and assertive, wonderful expirience for a rater, THE BEST BEER I VE RATED SO FAR,
Palate body is full, texture is very complex and apart from being oily it seems quite dry, carbonation on palate is medium, finish feel is very astringent with gentle alcoholic warmth
A lovely, cloudy golden body with a white head, citrus aroma, and a big well rounded taste.  A winning tripel.

Poured clear and golden with excellent white head. Smell of oats, cereals, and honey. Taste was sweet, with a bit of a bitter finish, cereal, herbs, and a nice fruitiness. Slightly oily on the palate, nice carbonation! Beautiful tripel, well balanced.
UPDATED: SEP 30, 2009 Golden amber colour, aroma of orange ,friuty and full flavoured ,sensational beer.
Awesome beer. Golden orange color. Very nice aroma. Sweet with fruity flavor. Extremely smooth with complex aftertaste

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 Hazy golden yellow with white ice cream cone head.  Aroma of dusty overripe lemons and pears.  Lemony, yeasty flavor with bitter hops and spice throughout. A prototype of the style.

This was a golden orange with a nice white head and lacing on the glass(bought the glass too, very nice).  This has a good clean crisp flavor with fruits and malts and yeast on the end helping the beer be smooth.  The alcohol content seems to work perfectly with the taste and neither overwhelm the other.  This is as good as some of the trappist beers.

If you have read my comments you know I am a huge Trappist fan, but this beer rivals the best of them.  Typical Belgian strong ale aroma and appearance, but the drinkability is outstanding  This is in the top five of my favorite Belgian beers.  No disappointments on this one.

From Tap, Great beer with light orange color with smooth head, aroma of fruits and spices with high sweetness, stronge flavors of fruits with malts and complex pleasant aftertaste, really really nice.

33 cl bottle - Pours a slightly hazy orange color with a large white head.  No lacing, but has some floaties in there.  Aroma and flavor is bigtime esters with a touch of yeast.  Medium body.  A good beer.

Dark orange colour with a big lasting head. fruity aroma with notes of orange, lemon and pear. Flavor is fruity as well, bittersweet, hoppy, a bit yeasty, with little presence of alcohol. Meidum body, very well balanced. Pleasant alcohol finish.

12 oz. bottle compliments of Rolf Carboni.  Pours a medium gold, slightly cloudy. Aroma of light citrus and hops.  Flavor is very smooth, slight citrus with hints of lemon, and slightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2011 750ml bottle-pours a big white head and yellow gold color.  Aroma is dry, spice, grassy/lemon.  Taste is smooth, dry, spice, grassy/lemon, yeasty.  Some Euroskunk.  Good effervescence.  3.4  *110124- on tap-pours a retaining white head and yellow color.  Aroma is sweet light malt, yeast.  Taste is sweet light malt-bready, some grassy hops, yeast.  3.8

A beautiful golden amber ale with a super thick white head. A sweet brown sugar and honey aroma, a bit oxidized, with berries and vanilla. In mouth, a sweet vanilla malt with coriander, oily mouthfeel, medium bodied. This bottle is BB17/11/06 and was tasted Dec. 6 2008, so 2 years pasted its prime. Signs of ageing. Sweetness comes out more intense with the Swedish Farmers cheese.
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2013 Thanks AgentSteve.  C02, Hazy golden yellow, malty, citrus, yeasty, spicey, slight hops, dry finish.

corked 750:
Pours a clear gold colour with a massive pillowy white head that fades pretty quickly.
Aroma is sweet malt, light honey, lemon and  some green apple and grassy tones as well.
Flavour was initially quite crisp and fruity, malty sweet. Light peppery spice to it. Some grassy bitterness in the finish.
Very tasty and very drinkable.
Huge gusher - about a quarter of the beer. Pours hazy light orange with a massive but fading white heat that is somewhat lacy. Toffee, fruit and spice nose. Medium body and carbonation.

Bouteille de 33 cl. Ar√¥mes de levure √©pic√©e. Robe dor√©e, tr√®s peu de mousse (un peu d√©cevant pour le style). Belle rondeur en bouche, la levure √©pic√©e accompagne un malt l√©g√®rement sucr√©. Finale l√©g√®rement am√®re de houblon europ√©en. Une bonne triple classique.

On tap.  Pours a slightly cloudy golden yellow with white head.  Sweet malts, candy sugar, banana, lemon zest, spice, clove, and bits of pepper and bread.  Mostly sweet and fruity.  Very nice, quite good.

Bottle, pours hazy gold with a medium white head.  Aroma is malty with some sugar notes.  Light hop aromas round it out well.  Taste is slightly sweet with a lemony bitter/sour flavor that ends dry.  Strong and excellent tripel.

Rating #1000.  I finally tried this beer.  Golden pour, big fuzzy head.  Aromas of malt, yeast, fruit, honey and spices.  Flavor is crisp, frutiy, yeasty, and pretty damn delicious.  Was even more fun to drink it out of the cool as hell TK glass.  beer god?  Hardly.  Beer lover?  Hell yeah baby!!!
11.2 ounce bottle purchased at Case & Keg Boca Raton, FL for $4.50 Excellent.

Enjoyed at Dressels Pub.  What a good beer!  Pours a clear florescent orange with a small but lasting light head.  Amazing lacing, more like window shades in that it covers the glass all the way down as it was emptied.  Aroma was so nice.  Lots of spices particularly clove.  It was also very crisp.  Clove also lead the flavor along with fruit, pepper, yeast, and spices.  There was a distinct dry flavor that I couldn‚Äôt put my finger on.  Plenty of alcohol, too.  A delicious and amazingly well crafted beer.  This is not a ¬íbig¬í beer and not an imperial but it is just amazingly good.

On-tap at Stone. Awesome brew.Pours clear, golden yellow with a thin, fizzy white head. Smells sweet malty, slightly floral with some honey. Tastes of honey and light sweet malts, slight alcohol zing on the finish. Some coriander and citrus spice on the finish as well. Medium body, good carbonation.
I tasted this beer before I got my account with ratebeer, so I can¬ít really remember all the flavors.

Pours a light and slightly hazy golden yellow with a big billowy white head. Aroma is very grassy and floral with a nice bit of light citrus fruitiness. Lots of wheat and malty. Flavor starts out with some sweet and candy like sugar. Also a lot of coriander and spices that stay through the finish. Finishes a bit bready with wheat and floral but a bit of alcohol as well. Medium body and lively carbonation. Very nicely balanced abbey ale that is smooth from start to finish

Bottled served in original glas @ Akkurat.

It is brewed with three kinds of grains, in my oppinion the wheat dominates he flavour.
THis baby is a hit, it was nice in every aspect, a worth to keep for more than two years on the cellar.

Pours a semi-cloudy golden colour with a large white head. There is a nice yeasty citrus aroma. On the palate it is very nice and light. Flavor is Of oranges, other soft fruit, spice, and a bready yeast.
My favorite beer.  Amazing complexity....I‚Äôm often in awe.  Amazing golden color smells of spices and light orange.  Goes down so smooth.  Alcohol is non-existant.
Golden colored beer. Fruity and malty notes. Some coriander and cura√ßao. The finish is more spicy with some alcohol notes

(Bottle) Pours an amber color with a copious amount of white head. Sweet aroma of wheat malts, clove, and candy sugar. Creamy mouthfeel imparts a fruity character. Dry malts and noticeable alcohol gives a prickly sensation at the center of the tongue. Fruity and dry finish. Quite good!

Slightly cloudy amber beer with large, very lively head. Good carbonation. Malty notes with some bitterness lead to herbs. soda and then on to unappealing blood-like metallic finish. Complex but ridiculously overrated.
really nice beer!  Golden, sweet, fruity and acidic.  Only slightly bitter

Bottle at the 2008 pre-Brewers‚Äô Jam Warmup. Pours gold with large off-white head and vigorous bubbles. The aroma is coriander, honey, rose, and sweetish bread. The flavor is fruity and floral with banana esters and some high alcohols. The finish is a touch sugary, but leaves a spicy, somewhat alcoholic aftertaste. Good stuff.

Bottle shared by lithy at the Pre-Brewer‚Äôs Jam Tasting. Poured a light orange with a fizzy white head that settle to a ring. Aromas of clove, wheat, and citrus. The flavor found spices and some fruitiness. Medium body, lively carbonation, dry. Nice!

Pours gold with a 3 finger off white head that fades to .5 finger then sustains with carbonate from the beer. 
Aroma is belgian yeastiness with banana, bubble gum, and that tangy fresh sourdough bread note. Also in the nose is a notable coriander and nutmeg spice, plenty of citrus, soap, and malts are not absent with a wheat sweet bread note that is quite inviting. 

Flavor is spicy at first, coriander, black pepper, cloves. Then the fruitiness rolls  in sweet orange glaze, lemon zest, raisins, candy spiced plums. The yeast is notable coming in with the fruits with a bready banana, nutty, clove bite. 

FInish is spicy, with some honey, oat and wheat sweetness that comes to a very clean and crisp end for a Tripel.

Palate is thick but not so much so for a tripel. Oily, then astringent on the palate, then sticky on the lips.

Overall a pretty decent tripel. It may trade a little heft and complexity for ease of drinkability but is really very enjoyable despite that fact.
Clear gold, loose foamy white head. Very yeasty aroma, with banana and bubble gum notes. Very "Belgian" flavor, musty and fruity, and a crisp, white winey finish. Tasty stuff.

Bottle from Regional. Pours slightly cloudy golden with a thick smooth white head. A sweet nose on this one, smells like a tripel should! Aromas of clove, citrus, corriander and sweet wheat beer character. Aroma is dominated by clovey citrus. Flavour is full of citrus and clove, with a sprinkling of corriander, spice, and a sweet malt flavour. Spice lingers with the sweetness. No alcohol detected at all, this drinks so easily and at 8% you¬íre feeling quite nice at the end of the glass. This is the closest thing to the original Westmalle Tripel I¬íve found yet. A simply first-rate beer. When tasted next to a Westmalle Tripel the flavours are much more pronounced with a far longer aftertaste in the Westmalle. Tripel Karmeliet is the perfect introduction to the Tripel style of beer.

75cl. corked Bottle. Pours verry bubbly which carries over to the taste. Excellent smooth belgian wheat taste, and I say that even though I am not a huge fan of belgians. Not a whole lot of character, flavor, or happenings beyond the wheat, but I will note that this smells like a bowl of lemons, and has a slight lemon taste as well. Decent.
Pours a hazy yellow with a full white head that laces the glass.  Smells of citrus, oranges.  Tastes smooth with citrus and coriander.  A great tripel.

Pours a hazy, straw color from 330 ml bottle, forming a white foamy head that quickly dissipated.  Aroma of cloves, malts, hops and black pepper.  Flavour of banana, yeast, malts, spices and peppery pears.  Extremely smooth and crisp, lemons and coriander give a nice character that makes this beer awesome.  Tremendous, would love to try on tap/cask version.  

Bought at Pricilla‚Äôs in MHC, NC.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Comes highly recommended by the mystical Drbayern.  Pours a blonde somewhat hazy yellow.  Head disipated to nice lacing on the top.  Good carbonation.  Nose was malt and clove, with banana.  Mouthfeel was very nice, coated my tongue and mouth.  Cloves and bananas prevailed.  Not sure what some of you were drinking!

Crushed with Jakebra on tap at Fat Abbey‚Äôs.  Wow this is rated high.  I was not impressed.  My notes for the night just say: kinda sucked.  Could be my palate was raped by the Third Coast Old Stock I had right before however.

Hazy gold with a giant frothy head that left a solid film and very nice lacing. Fruit and honey aromas with an earthy yeastiness clearly evident. Complex flavor profile featured citrus fruits and a warmong alcohol feel. Some spice, pear and pepper are in the background, and all is gently offset by a hint of hops bitterness. Strong carbonation, medium mouthfeel, a very crisp and dry aftertaste. A wonderful beer, the epitome of the style.

It took me until now to rate this beer.  
Aroma is skunky.  Straight up sulfur.  Stop using green bottles, please.  
Even with the hour or so of being open, the sulfur has not dissipated.  
That aside, the zest of lemon, coriander, caramel, and yeast make up the taste profile of this beer (if only it could make up the aroma too).
Taste-wise, this is the best tripel I have had to date.  Aroma-wise, the worst.  
The finish on this beer lingers, yet does not cloy despite it‚Äôs sweetness.  
Very, very good beer, but bottling could use some work.
From bottle.  Poured yellow with abundant head.  Aromas banana, oranges and citrus spices.  Classic Tripel in every sense,
Sampled in Adeliade, Australia. Good quality beer. The glass was awesome! A very smooth brew that is certainly worth a try if you get the chance. Top quality.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2010 (Draught at Bull & Bear Inn, Stockholm) Poured golden and lightly hazy. Head was medium sized and white. Aroma contained fruitiness and honey. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, mildly grass, sweetness, honey, malts, lightly yeast and mildly bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and fruity. Well balanced beer.

Old rating: 7-3-7-3-14=3.4

Enjoyed in a Tripel Karmeliet goblet at Delux Burger in Scottsdale. Served extra extra cold on draft. Unfortunate that it was so cold, awesome that it was on draft. First impression was very negative...almost Budweiserish. However, it improved significantly as it warmed up. I could really pick out the oats, wheat, and pilsener. Very little Belgian yeast character compared to most of the style, which was a bit of a disappointment.

Pours a hazy golden color with lots of chunks snowing in the glass and a thick, rocky, white head. Strong presence of yeast in the aroma, there‚Äôs also some citrus and some cereal/grain. The flavor is very solid, there‚Äôs a fluffy presence of yeast, some sweetness, citrus and cereals. The body is medium with a creamy texture and lively carbonation. I like this beer and been drinking it for a while, I never got to rate it, but now the job is done.
Malty and sweet, lots of caramel and chocolate, nicely carbed.  Still light enough that you don‚Äôt need to sit down to drink it.  I loved this brew.

Bottle courtesy of fonefan pours hazy golden with thick white head. Aroma is sweet dark fruit. First taste is sweet and strong carbonation burn. There is slight alcohol but it very well hidden and balanced. Some alcohol linger but pretty good tripel.
Excellent golden color, with just the right amount of alcohol to still be refreshing in the heat of summer, overall a very good tripel.
Slightly strong alcohol finish, but overall a very nice tripel. Very clear, highly carbonated. Otherwise well balanced. Also slight lingering bitterness.

Gold with a small white head. Soft, gentle nose of yeast, orange, pepper, real minor alcohol. Flavor is never aggressive like so many tripels, and instead is sweet and a little dusty with orange, pepper, and a nice, soft malt. A little sticky but quite refined, Karmeliet is a balanced, nuanced tripel.

Poured a burnished golden orange with a slight (but thick) head.  Hints of both orange peel and pepper.  Smooth and malty with a dry peppery finish.  Carbonation was perfect.  Deceptively low alcohol notes.  Overall, one of my favorites by style.
Biere de couleur Or avec un bon collet non-collant. Arome de zest d‚Äôoranges, raisins, bananes, alcohol, gomme balloune. Gout tres sal√©, avoine, bananes.

Pours a hazy straw color from the bomber with a thick off-white head.  Very yeasty, almost skunky, to the nose with a frothy mouthfeel and a sweet candy sugar taste.  Improves as it warms, especially once the alcohol becomes noticeable on the finish.  My favorite Tripel.

Good beer with nice thick lacy white head, decent retention. Clear golden yellow color with consistent carbonation. flavors of clove banana with a punch of alcohol at the finish.  Refreshing drink for a high gravity beer

Vibrant orange gold with big white fluffy head. So much fruit in the aroma. Vanilla definitley there, sweet malts. Dusty hops. Such a full mouthfeel. Sweetness first with biscuit and summer fruits, pithy, honey.  drying out quickly with a crisp green lingering bitterness. Alcohol shows up briefly. Cracking.

I love strong belgian beers! Damasc in the aroma, along with orange peel already got me going. The colour was quite nice, some opaque golden to orange. The carbonation, though, didn¬ít got me up. The foam was nicely white with little beige on it. And the flavor, mamma mia, all those fruits, citrics, little banana, the wheat esters, the oat esters, the oat, and the sweet barley touch. That beer made my day!
Pours a clear golden with a fizzy white head. Aroma is sweet and yeasty. Champagne mouthfeel that tastes of belgian spices with floral notes.
750ml bottle. Pours clear golden in color with full foamy white head. Aroma sweet, yeasty and spicey. Taste sweet, malty and yeasty with dry finish.
Bottle.  Hazy golden with a small head.  aroma is bready yeast and light malt.  Flavor is light sweetness.  Modereate cargonation, nice feel, short aftertaste.  Nice.

A beautiful pour!  Gold body with a very thick white head that lasts quite a while.  Excellent lacing results from the foam.  The aroma is light, but there‚Äôs some vanilla, spice, and malt noticeable.  Very soft, smooth mouthfeel with mild carbonation.  The flavor is complex.  Malty sweetness with notes of honey and vanilla melds nicely to a warming alcohol finish.  There is some sour citrus in the nice aftertaste.  A very tasty brew.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2013 Brought the 75cl bottle back from Belgium in Sept ¬í05, drank July ¬í07. Deep golden color with a orange tint. nice creamy head. Lacing afterwards. Sweet, fruity aroma with vanilla and spices. Very fragrant, somewhat flowery. Full malt taste. very rich. lots of fruit, tons of citrus. Amazingly malty. Sweet, but not overly so. Tangy. Superb balance. One of the best beers in the world. 

This beer was aged for 2-3 years. It was much more flavorful  than the fresh beer, which is also great, but slightly lacking integration.

Pours gold with a a thick, lasting white head.  Lots of lacing.  Aroma is slightly hoppy and mild yeast.  Flavor is mild banana and Belgian yeast with some earthy tones and spice.  A unique tripel.  Very smooth drinking with a slightly dry finish.

750ml Green bottle - nice printed label. White rocky/foamy head - a shade dark of straw color, mild lacing lots of bubbles. Noble hop flavor, spicy but not too strong, smooth, sweetish, honey, low bitterness, warming and strong. A fine beer but a little sweet for my tastes. I liked it better on tap.
