This is extraordinary.  Aroma is malt, oranges, apricots, and straw with a touch of spice and hops.  A big long lasting head with tight bubbles. Balance is excellent with an incredible mouth feel.  flavors of malt and fruit dominate without it being too spicy.  A nice lingering sweet finish of fruit complemented by a slight hop flavor and grassy hint.  Spices remain in the background as does the alcohol.  This is one of my favorite ales period.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2009 Bottle 33cl. 
Re-rate.
Pours a clear golden colour with a huge head and good carbonation, too bad the head doesn‚Äôt last very long.
Strong fruity aroma with some sweet and sour fruits there mixed in with th yeast.
Taste is very pleasant, well balanced flavour of many different sweet fruits with a hint of the alcohol there too.
This yellow cloudy beer is very suprising its full of flavour and very tasty. Smells like a White Beer but  the end is very long fruity, malty and floral. Carbonation is soft, very interesting beer.
Tap, poured a clear blonde with little to no head. Nice carbonated and dry with some nice spice notes. Finish was also dry with lingering spice flavor and slightly bitter.

Bottle. Dark golden with a big fluffy white head. Looks fantastic in its own glass. Aroma is malty sweet, fruity, a little yeast. Flavour is malty, sweet and fruity, alcohol warmth. Slight sour finish, lots of carbonation. Very soft mouthfeel. Excellent tripel. Not nearly as good from tap though, which is way too sweet.
Hazy golden colour with medium head.Aroma is sweet with taste of Mandarin and apricots.Has a high carbonation but still and nice mild finish.

Pours out a brilliant golden orange.  Sweet aroma, almost like candy and ripe fruits, apricots maybe.  Very sweet flavor topped off by lemony zing.  Very balanced and enjoyable, very drinkable due to being very thin in the mouth.  Very good Tripel, definitely tasty.
At an gall & gall, hazy golden, medium no lasting head, full fizzi fruity one, with sharp boddem, very nice tripel.

Aroma is full of yeast and sweet malts, and some dark fruits.  It‚Äôs appearance is golden color, with a light head.  It‚Äôs flavor is full of medium-dark malts, some sweetness, and sweet fruit.  It‚Äôs a bit to sweet, but otherwise a fine brew.
very nice aroma, sweet fruity bitterness from alcohol takes my rating down, but it‚Äôs a great brew.
Golden hue, sweet yeasty and  somewhat thin, sweet = carmel characteristics, above average.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2013 This is another tripel I¬íve always felt was slightly overrated, mostly because it continues to strike me as too thin and too sweet. Certainly the latter is probably what some folks dig about it. But for a beer of this strength, I want more balance instead of one characteristic dominating. Not bad by any stretch, and certainly it is an attractive beer in some ways. Just not my cup of tripel.
Update: 10/1/2011. On tap at Milltown, sampled on the recommendation of emacgee, I was really pleasantly surprised by the balance and complexity I didn¬ít find in the bottled version. YUM.

Forl√¶ns&Bagl√¶ns, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 090808.
Golden with large head. Aroma yeasty. Flavor of malt, spices and a hint of caramel. Medium bitterness and high carbonation

[Tap] Poured a clear golden color with a large, rocky, off white head. Aroma is lots of banana and clove from the yeast, a little bit of bread, and some slight hops and candi sugar. Flavor matches quite well, and the alcohol was never noticed at all. Not much tartness from the wheat, but the earthiness is there. Overall a very drinkable, dangerous tripel.

750 ml bottle. Poured a golden straw color with a fluffy white head that lasted the entire way. Sweet, slightly malty aroma with a hint of caramel.
Biscuit malt flavor with a bit of cider and fruity esters thrown in for good measure a long with a hint of hop bitterness and alcohol. Although noticable, the alcohol flavors were not overpowering. Excellent mouthfeel made this a really fine, complex ale.

7/5/08 at the Seattle International Beerfest. Aroma is banana fruity with substantial pepper for a tripel. Appearance is clear yellow with a low white head. Flavor is sweet sugary fruit with moderate bittering. Mouthfeel is low bodied with a medium carb texture. Overall, delicious and complex.
primarily orange and wheat, dry.  lacks the typical belgian carbonation level.  Pretty nice for a trippel, but would have more bite if carbonation were higher.

This beer was worth every penny, definately a refresher after the last few beers i tried weren‚Äôt that great. Pours a vibrant golden colour with a large white top. Carbonation is excellent, awesome retention in the head. Aroma is slightly sweet, and somewhat floral with a little bit of carmel undertones. taste is fabulous- acidic, citrusy- lots of tropical fruit- orange, lime, and a faint peach.

On draft at the Dilly Deli
Pours a light gold in color with a huge two inch frothy head.  It was served in a Tripel Karmeliet glass as well.  Smell is citrus and spice.  Taste is light fruit, some spice and lemon zest.  Mouthfeel is full and creamy.  This is an absolutely delicious tripel.

This one is possibly the belgian tripel ive enjoyed the most. Pours very golden , head is quite big and looks creamy. This one has a huge lot of spices, really over my head to disntinguish them all. Non fermented malt makes this beer quite sweet, but thats not a problem for me. Theres definitely some orange there. Wheat can be felt in the aroma and maybe in the finnish too, and alcohol is quite present, but not a show stopper.
A superp beer, if you ask me.

Bottle. Clear golden colour with a big white head. Very fruity aroma with lots of sweet spices. Flavour is sweet malty at first. Then the spices arrives and makes this tripel something special. Very refreshing.
A really good Belgian Tripel. Good white head ,pure golden colour.  Plenty of malts, a little fruity, with some nice spice thrown in.

Lightly hazy golden straw.  Huge thick creamy head.
Spicy, malty, lightly sweet aroma - playful.
Rich, spicy, peppery flavor.  Refreshing and complex, light alcohol notes but evasive.  Drinkable: my thirst for this is unquenchable.
Lively and full palate, quickly fades to a lingering spiciness.

A single from Woodman¬ís Oak Creek.
A nice fresh very flavorful Abby.Creamy, good carbonation. 
sweet non-fermented malt, coriander, and a lot of other spices
33cl, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex brew, good balance, hazy, rocky head, very good brew, one of the best blonde Belgian ales, a topper!

Taste 7/8 bottle (07 I H) In my Tripel Karmeliet glass. Looks: Caramel, with a nice white foam. Aroma: Orange, wheat, florals. Very nice aroma. Taste:  Spicy, orange, plum, nice little alcohol tinge. Creamy, good carbonation. Nice ratio of sour to malt body and hops finish. Oats add a nice silkiness and body to control the sweetness. Very good beer.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2008 Here¬ís a beer of many flavors.  This deep gold brew, with traces of pomegranate edges, speaks softly and carries a big punch.  A thin soft head, butter, mandarin orange, wheat, peach, apricot, all-spice and graham cracker for a nose, this thing is everything but pungent at first.  But the Tripel Karmeliet is a highly, highly carbonated brew.  So much so that I have to wait for its temper to settle.  Once I do, I get a heavy graininess with pinches of clove again and a bit of the orange dryness.  A bit too furious for me.

August 18th Update - The Tripel Karmeliet is a lesson in perfect balance and harmony.  I don‚Äôt always comment on the balance of a beer, and when I do it‚Äôs usually in regard to an unfortunate imbalance.  But the Triple Karmeliet is remarkable in that every sip was a proclamation to the art of hitting the sweet spot in a beer - the Tiger Woods shot in golf that sings.  This beer sings, and sings beautifully.  A thin, tan head swells from the beer, leaving behind trails of spaced lacing as it urgently recedes back into the glass.  The richly orange and muddy beer underneath is a willing receptor for the retreating foam, giving off a wonderful perfume in exchange.  The sweet and estery aromas that give the trippel style its signature scent reach the nose first, with a well-hopped body and a well weighted floral component and banana touch sanding this beer‚Äôs jagged edges into a perfectly smooth curve of balance.  The oat taste and ester-sweet aromatics draw me quickly to the glass.  The flavor seems watery, but paradoxically, not weak.  The balance of sweet and dry really shines.  In my notes I write, "Good, great, GREAT balance!" as the paramounce of what‚Äôs been accomplished in this beer take on its full weight.  A white wine taste covers both ends of the spectrum, with the grains pairing against a deep honey sweetness.  It‚Äôs not an intricate flavor, but it‚Äôs good, and again, balanced within microns of perfection.  The Triple Karmeliet would put the Hubble telescope‚Äôs manufacture to shame.  As the Triple Karmeliet warms, the alcohol becomes more prominent, bringing with it ever greater tastes if grain.  A testament to proper yin and yang.  BUMP IN SCORE

Bottle at √Örhus √òlfestival 2008. Pours a clear clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is flowery and yeasty.
Flavour is sweet, flowery, fruity and yeasty.

Golden pour with a full fluffy white head.  Aroma of coriander, some orange peel.  Flavors include sweet non-fermented malt, coriander, and a lot of other spices, maybe cinnamon?  Also some notes of oats and wheat in the finish.  Good carbonation.  Alcohol is also well hidden.  Good brew.  Would buy again.

Bottle at Quinns, 26th April 2008 with Mes and reakt. Golden with a good white head. Grainy aroma and a standard sweet, soft citrus-tinged flavour, but enlivened by a great aniseed and fennel hit at the back of throat. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2009 12oz bottle. dark golden pour, huge white fluffy head, even after chilling for some time. carbonation is high, slight cloudiness is enjoyable for the eye- visible yeast floaters too. flavor is nicely balanced; fruity and also spicy with a nice hops presence. Overall, a great beer I wouldn¬ít mind enjoying again, even at 4.50 per bottle!

On draught at the Map Room in Chicago.  Golden yellow color with big frothy white head.  Nice aroma of sweet sugar and citrus and spices.  Sweet taste with floral accents.  Fizzy, sticky mouthfeel, very smooth.  A great tripel!

On tap...lemony yellow pour with a natural sweetness and citrusy aroma.  Flavor has a decent level of spice...slight banana and yeast.  Palate is right down the middle...not thick or thin.  A good beer that I wouldn‚Äôt mind having again.

Appearance: Golden. Lots of head. Very fizzy/bubbly. Slightly cloudy.
Aroma: Grain/wheat. Bit of fruit. Banana.
Taste: Hopsy. Ripe fruit. Bit of malt. Bitter.
Info: 330ml bottle, 31/7-2006, 139/300, 73/500

(reviewed by my wife) I can¬ít describe the aroma... smooth refreshing crisp. pours like liquid gold with colors shimmering in the light like prisms in the sunlight. Flavor smooth and rewarding and lind lingering like a lovers long kiss.

I¬íll add: Spicy and fruity.Very drinkable not too yeasty and not too much acohol flavour like some tripels.
cloudy scent is of fruit and citrus with some spices as well.  there is a hit of correander.  alcohol is pretty well hidden.  finish is of citrus and spice.  Very nice beer.  I will buy this again.
On tap at Toronado in San Diego. Aromas of funky sweaty socks. Yeasty flavors common of a trippel but a little more mellow then I expected. Still nice.

Nice golden color out of the bottle with a finger-width head that is maintained by heavy carbonation.  Quite a sweet, flowery aroma with a bit of honey.  The flavor continues with honey along with alcohol and sour maltiness.  Not a bad beer but won¬ít make my top 10.

What a beaut this is. About a full hand¬ís worth of head in my slightly wet tulip glass. Pale, slightly hazy straw colour. Some pepper, honey and malt scents, matching the taste with some citrus and yeasty dryness in the finish. Incredibly full, rich, pilllowy body, despite the fact that so much of it had transmogrified into head. Tastes like tradition in a glass -- a comfort beer. Marvelous.

Tripel Karmeliet
Tarwe, Gerst, Haver

Appearance:
Golden yellow, clear, big fluffy head LOTS of bubbles

Aroma: 
Sour apple, bright fruity yeast

Flavor:
Bit of alcohol on the back of the tongue, a fruity sour... doesn¬ít seem a bacteria sour though, definitely esters from high fermentation temps.  A solid bitterness, very sharp and clear.

Mouthfeel:
Extremely carbed: per style, crisp and dry.

Overall:
An excellent example of the classic belgian pilsner.  Very strong in flavor and evolves well as it warms.

75cl bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Tampa, FL). Pours a golden yellow with one-finger white, foamy head. Reasonable head retention. Aroma is sweet, syrupy, candy sugar, yeast, and malt. An interesting grain aroma is present as well. Flavor is candy sugar, grain, syrup, and a slight spiciness at times. Very carbonated. One of the best tripel style ales we have experienced.

75 cl bottle - Golden amber color with a nice thick and large head. Aroma is very typical that of belgian triples. Lots of fruits and sweet orange marmelade. The beers maltiness dominates the flavor blended nicely with the belgian yeast created sourness and spiceness. More complexness would have pushed it up to my top 3. A beautiful beer all in all.

Pours apple golden yellow with a foaming white head. Creamy texture. Complex nose with fruits like banana, apple and peach. 
Sweet palate, like caramel.
An excellent beer.
Visited Bosteels Browerij on ¬í07 summer and must say everyone should get there and enjoy a bottle of Tripel Karmeliet and a Deus as we did with the Bosteels family while having a great conversation about beer, wine and food. Fantastic time with great people; Belgian hospitality. Thank you

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2008 Really? This beer is just terrible. It tastes like a bag of dead feet. Some bread that tastes like dry, rotten sour-dough and some raw-egg tastes overwhelm anything that could possible be good about this beer. It looks nice, it smells nice, but I poured out a $10 25oz bottle of this after the first three sips. Just absolutely awful.

Golden yellow with airy bubbles.  Aroma of fruit, coriander, orange and sweet malts.  Taste of banana, fruit and alcohol.  Smooth body with a medium carbonation feel and a dry finish with a fruity aftertaste

Pours a very nice cloudy gold with a huge, but quickly fading soapy white head. The nose is bready, with the wheat really coming through, also some fruit and floral spice. The flavor is excellent; wow, very well balanced. Lots of fruit presence, but its nicely restrained - apple, grapefruit, orange, grapes. This fruit character is nicely coupled with a wheaty spice, and a light, but bready malt backbone. The mouthfeel is pretty similar to thick champagne, with a sweet dry finish. This is an excellent beer.

Pours a bright golden color with a big white head that is both foamy and fizzy at the same time.  The head dissipates fairly quickly.  Nose of malts and fruits with some very subtle floral notes.  Taste is complex and beautifully balanced with notes of apple, grape, citrus, hop, and spice.  Champagne like carbonation on the palate and a sweet, dry finish like white wine.  This is a thouroughly enjoyable brew.

Pours orange gold with a substantial white head.  Funk dominates the aroma, but there are detectable notes of caramel and citrus.  Very heavy carbonated.  Delicious.  Starts out with notes of sweet malts and funk, very bready tand spicy hrough the middle, with a spice finish.  An excellent beer.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2008 Looks like Orval, a murky orange with a pillowy white head that dissipates.  Noticeable carbonation bubbles in the glass and an amazing aroma it took me a while to pin it down but it smells like pineapple.  Also quite the fragrant soap smell too it, intriguingly unlike any tripel I¬íve had before.  Light and tingly on the tongue and very little spiciness like other tripels.  A fantastic beer. 8/4/8/4/16: 4.0.
Re-rate: Suttree‚Äôs 2008 Pre-Brewer‚Äôs Jam Tasting.  Sample from a bottle shared by me.  Same look, this sample from a 750mL instead of a 33cL seemed spicier with more citrus notes of oranges and lemons.  Couldn‚Äôt pin down any pineapple this time and the body was much spicer with the same satisfying dry finish, still very good, but needs to come out of the 4 territory for me.

Pours apple juice golden yellow with contrasting white head.

Nose is complex with fruits such as peach, apricot, and apple.

On the palate the malt comes through with ample sweetness, with this ale having a rather candy like flavor. White licorice, cardamon, faint cinnamon, and light pepper are here as well.

Finishes lengthy and candy sweet, and all too easy to drink.

Pours a bright, sparkling, slightly hazy gold, not unlike most saisons I¬íve had. Long lasting white head. Aroma is slightly metallic (from the corked bottle I had), but fresh, yeasty and a bit sour. Little bitterness in the taste. Overall bready and a bit sweet while still cold, quick finish. Easy to drink and pretty tasty.

what an amazing beer.  It was full in body  with a good amount of head.  The flavor was complex and delicious.  You could taste the flavors of yeast, fruit, and some spice but they blended together so well.  This beer embodies everything an abbey tripel should be.

[1158-20080301] Tap. Wheat yeast bread aroma with a bit of sweet leafy hops. Clear, golden yellow body with a medium-lasting creamy white head. Wheatie yeasty bread continues in flavour with some perfume characteristics. Medium body is smooth. Rather drinkable, good.
(ZBF 2008; Sint Niklaas, BE)

on draft @ Maproom, Chicago. Great tripel. Pours a beautiful slightly cloudy blone with nice full fluffy head. Aromas of spice, fruit & citrus. Great creamy mouthfeel full of spice, light maltiness 7 sweetness. Very good beer
Sample at Aarhus beerfestival. Nice head with good duration. Color is pale golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruit and notes of citrus.

Golden pour,thin head. complex flavor, citrus, fruity.
Remains highly enjoyable.

[330ml bottle from Sainsbury¬ís, Reading] ABV seems to vary - have seen it at 8% and 8.1%, but this bottle was 8.4%! Fresh herbal/ floral small with some malt. Very warming in the mouth - the alcohol certainly comes through.  Taste is orange and coriander (both the herbal leaves and the spicey seeds come through seeds come through).  There¬ís definitely something sweet and tropical in the background that I couldn¬ít quite pin down - maybe mango? Some pepper in there too, but the over-riding feeling is freshness, like an easily quaffable golden ale for the summer (a dangerous taste indeed given the strength!).  Some slight bitterness in the aftertaste, along with more pepper and an odd syrupy mouthfeel that doesn¬ít quite work with the rest of the beer. Overall though this is top-notch stuff.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a pale golden with a small foamy white head and fresh aroma of ripe citrus fruits. The flavor is sweet with a sticky mouthfeel, bt very pleasant. A long sweet and spicey finish to round it off. I usually don¬ít like tripels, but this one rules!

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2008 0.33l bottle.  Pours clear amber colour, with a good thick off white head which dissapears very quickly to leave it looking like cider!

Very drinkable fruity pale ale, spicy taste and a pleasant sour aftertaste with a mild hint of alcohol.

Very good beer.
UPDATED: AUG 15, 2008 33cl Bottle. Really spicey aroma . Flavor is really fruity and spicey with notes of apples and peach. Really good Tripel!

750 ml corked bottle. into chalice.
Nice  looking hazy wheat golden ale, with a lovelly large thick and bubbly white head.
Fantastic nose on this beer. all the usual Belgian style yeast, malts and spices but ampliphied. Very fruity, pink apples, red plums come to mind.
All the flavours mentioned in the nose are present  a little banana and a tinge of alcohol added in the end.
Fantastic palate, great mouthfeel, smooth silky yet carbonated very well.
Very good beer. Will have again.

Apple juice colored.  1/2 inch white head only lasts a few minutes. Light sweet and sour flavor. Light fizzy texture. Body is medium heavy though. Flavor is overall a little malty, sour and fizzy. Finish remains spritzy for a while. It comes across as somewhere between a champaigne an a beer and hides its alcohol well.

Bottle: light copper color with a small head that dissipates quickly.  A smooth softly sweet Belgian that is not over the top with any flavor, but is quality and nicely representative.  Alcohol taste was not noticeable.

Bottle. Clear and golden wth reasonable, although short-lived, white head. Beautiful complex aroma with spice, fruit and malt. Smooth mouthfeel, full bodied with good carbonation. The flavour is excellent and quite complex. It starts with some fairly clean fruit and malt tastes and then some spiciness kicks in. The main spiciness is coriander. It ends with a fair amount of hoppy bitterness and alcohol and some very long lingering fruity (banana) notes. Overall an excellent beer and a somewhat unusual tripel; not very complex and with a fairly bitter finish.

0.33L bottle. Small quickly disapearing head, deep darkish golden colour with some sediment at the end. Aroma of fruit smoked meat (maybe bacon) and a touch of malt. Carbonation is extremely strong, almost abrasive.
Flavour of peach,  melonand cremy vanila with a strong sweet alcoholic presence. Aftertaste is fruity, long and lingering.

A clear yellow colored beer, with a huge white head. The glass for this beer is huge too. The head head disappears quite soon. The aroma has nice coriander, spices, malts and some fruit. The taste is malty too, sweet with nice fruits and malty tones. It¬ís not to complex beer, but very tasteful.
Good, strong flower smell. There is a great fruit taste on the back end of the flavor. Good aftertaste but leaves quickly.
Beautiful golden color with thing large bubble head.  Nice floral and fruity aroma and very smooth high quality feel.  Fruity aftertaste that is a little sour.

Poured a light hazy straw gold with a very thick and profuse, creamy, off white head. The aroma was sweet and sharp, some spice, not as up front as expected. The flavor was spicy, warm from alcohol, dry hopped it seemed.

nice aroma of spice and pineapple. Pour is a bit disappointing with large bubbles and thin head. Flavour is great, range of fruits and some breadiness that finishes with a long bitter finish. Very good beer indeed, the alcohol does not interfere on the flavour profile.

Poured a hazy golden yellow tone with fierce carbonation and a densely packed creamy white head that lasted throughout. The nose was well spiced and sported a wheaty maltiness overlaid with tropical fruits, lemon zest and a peppery spiciness. The taste started with white bread maltiness and wispy yeast notes. A great blend of fruity sweetness like apple, papaya and mango counter the bold spiciness highlighted by the flavors of lemon zest and white pepper balancing it nicely. Zippy hops pop in the finish with a surge of alcohol for good measure. The feel was medium/full bodied with a nice velvety texture. This is a tripel¬ís tripel, a masterful blending of characters that make it dangerously quaffable. One of the finest examples of the style.
750 mL bottle.  Slightly hazy yellow with fizzy white head.  Earthy, bready, barn yard aroma.  Bright lively palate.  Sweet pear, green apple, and earthy taste.

Poured from the bottle into one of their nifty gift pack tulip glasses. Pale clouded tea color. Nose was vegetables, straight fresh greens. Head is small, 2 cm and very little lacing left on the glass. Light carbonation, very alcohol-heavy feel. Taste was the same, sweet greens and alcohol. The fermentation floats about in the mix the whole time which I found really fun. Some of it even floats up into the head. Very very unique tripel, quite brilliant.

33 cl bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a Tripel Karmeliet goblet.
App.:  Clear golden with a formidable white foam that dissipates quickly.
  
Aroma:  Yeast and dough, citrus, honey, stone fruits, floral perfume, quite sweet.
  
Palate:  Medium-ish body, moderate effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Yeast/dough, grain and cereal, lighter fruits than the nose, still floral honey, a bit of citrus, alcohol comes through; on swallowing, there is more honey, vanilla, some light floral notes, a bit more alcohol and light citrus to finish; fairly sweet, a touch bright and only very subtly bitter.

Not a style a really dig.  This is a nice example, but doesn¬ít have characteristics that make me love it.  Great glass though...

For my money tripels don¬ít get any better than this.  Very robust in the nose and on the palate, but still quite creamy with just enough effervescence.  The fruit that comes across in this, lots of rich honeysuckle, pears, and peaches, lemon zest, with some herbal grassy hoppiness that kind of bitters out the finish.  Lovely.

330ml bottle. Hazy deep golden body with dense sizeable white head. Rich nose; grainy malt, honey, lemon, pepper, ripe fruit complexities. Fantastically creamy body, efferescent carbonation, smooth texture, sticky sweet but by not means cloying. Remarkable flavour, honey sweetness, balanced tremendously well with lemon zest and pear, grassy notes and pepper, ginger warmth, cinamon and apple, unimaginably complex and delicious. Quite possibly the nicest blond beer i¬íve ever tried...fantastic!

22oz bottle poured into a Chimay glass. Towering Fizzy white head. Nose of honey and yeast. Good but unremarkable in that respect. At first sip I did not understand why this was so highly regarded. Taste is mostly yeast with hints of honey and citrus poking through. But then comes the finish, probably one of the best finishes in a beer I¬íve had yet. Starts of with hints of honey and lemon and a slight alcohol burn. Then a short hoppiness tempered by a strong dose of vanilla following with a huge caramel note that seems to linger forever. Fantastic and remarkably balanced. Should also be noted that as this beer warms more interesting things come out up front. Spices such as coriander and clove and some strong malt. I think I even detect some anise and ginger. Really worth of its rating.

Bottle. Rich golden orange colour, huge gently fading white head. Sweet vanilla malt aroma. Flavour is full bodied with plenty of fruit, lots going on as this break dances on the palate. Incredibly well balanced. A top class Belgian !

Bottle 33cl. Pours a golden coloured tripel, slightly cloudy. White head that disappears quickly. Average carbonation. Broad malty taste, strong ethylic aftertatste. The composition of ingredients seems to fit, round taste overall. In my opinion much better than Westmalle Tripel

UPDATED: APR 16, 2011 A great tripel... not what you¬íd expect from your everyday Belgian.  And this is a fine example.  Solid, almost cloudy gold color with an airy white head.  A fresh, soured fruit aroma.  In the mouth... more like a wine cooler!  Very light, spritey, and slmost like a pilsener in hop profile and bitterness.  The carbonation sticks with the beer as it downs, almost distracting you from the finish.  Makes me burp!  Hard for un-fans of Belgians to stomach, but good.  I suppose.  Wholesome body, handsome head, sweet and malty, with noticeable coriander.

Bottle. Golden color with some small floaties, lots of carbonation, and a big and rather stable white head. Aroma of yeast, fruits, spices, some malty notes and hints of hops. Sweetish flavor at first with some malt, a bit of caramel and some oatmeal character, then turns spicier and drier with yeast and some hoppy bitterness in the finish. Medium to full-bodied. Dangerously drinkable.

Orange pour,thin to no head,carbonation willing.Aroma clove,orange,wheat,sweet smell of barley,figs.Flavour coriander,wheat figs,cloves,grain flavours particularly good.Cloves have amagic about them.Ginger is there,finish spice,malt,grain full flavour,slight sourness.
Bottle at home. bread, spruce, golden, hazy, aminimal head, light sweetness, light body, lively,

Clear and light in appearance...moderate sweetness that does not overwhelm. Flavors of pear and white grapes. Dry in finish, not bitter. Pretty standard tripel here, but more complex than the American comparisons.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2008 Orange gold big, foamy white head / Delicate nose of bananas, apples, lemons, and spice / Medium body, aggressive carbonation, some malt oomph, crisp acidity, and good, lasting, semi-sweet finish / Tart flavors of green apple, banana, lemon, orange, caramel, and coriander / Terrific.
this is my favorite triple at the moment....great estery nose.....bigger body then alot of the other examples...but great fruity flavor and clean maltyness finishes up great....awesome stuff

(cleaning out my beer bottle collection as pictured in my profile and utilizing ratebeer.com)
As I recall, this was very good.

stark white cotton head rose up and out of the tulip glass quickly, oops.  easy, restrained dusty yeast aroma has hints of lemon and wheat.  theres a sweetness to the oats, a dry character to the wheat and the foggy abbey yeast throughout.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2009 Sampled from a big 750 ml corked bottle. Pours a golden color, pretty clear not as hazy as I was expecting. Nice frothy head which leaves a lot of lacing on the glass. Aroma is bananas, vanilla and maybe a little grassy or hay-like which remains nice even after the bottle breathes a while. Smooth, pretty easy drinking but with a full enough mouthfeel. The flavor is much of the same; citrus, banana, vanilla with a little bit of a tangy tart alcohol presence. Somewhat spicy flavors which balances it nicely. Flavor doesn¬ít necessarily jump out at you but it¬ís very good.

De couleur or et orange, donne une bonne mousse blanche qui dispara√Æt assez vite pour laisser une fine dentelle. Parfum de c√©r√©ales, surtout le bl√© ferment√©, d¬í√©pices, de citron, de gingembre et de r√©sine.

Bottle. Pours a golden amber with large white head. Malts and spicy aroma with strong taste of alcohol. Medium bodied, I found this one a little too sweet.
Copper in color with a large head that quickly disappears.  Strong smell of alcohol and sweet malt.  Three different grains give it some character.  Strong is taste with a warm alcoholic burn.

bottle (750ml) from the beginning of 2007..... pours a semi-hazy and sprite golden brown with an overflowing fluffy white head..... light citrus, bready esthers, and a general sweet malt profile make up the nose..... flavors lended to an overwhelming amount of sweet candied sugar that was too much for its own good. a lively mouthfeel provided little escape to cloying sweetness.... i can¬ít say that i¬ím a big fan of this beer.

white forming head, nicely carbonated, smells fruity with some spices with a hint of honey, taste is very honey like and smooth, goes down easy and has a great refreshing alcoholic finish to it, an all around great beer
Bottle. Pours golden with thick white head. Aroma is sweet fruit mixed with some spice. Taste is slightly spicy nicely bodied. Nice beer.

1000th rating for this one.
pour is a clear light orange with a huge off-white head, good lacing.
smell is faint, sweet fruit, yeast, some banana.
taste is tangy, somewhat sweet, apple, pear, some banana, some yeast, a little spice.
overall a strange mouth-feel and aftertaste.
Drought at 3-sm√• rum G√∂teborg: Clear golden colour, nice head. Aroma of fruity,cidery,sparkling nose(?) Flavor is is fruity,citrus,flowers, orange, yeast, and a werry nice fruity finish.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2008 Cloudy golden goodness, with a wispy white head. Lemon, straw, and watermelon bouquet. Soft, velvet texture. Taste, subtle sweetness, sort of like a push up (frozen thing you eat), but with some hops on it. Great brew! Want more.

Beautiful in the glass, pale crystal clear, beautiful fast disappearing head.  Wonderful nose, very floral, some fruit and munich? malt, slightly doughey.  Flavor is wonderfully complex yet straight forward.  Floral notes from nose carry over into flavor.  Also fruity, light citrus, unique maltiness.  Wonderful moughfeel, very lively.  Overall a joy to drink.  A real treat I¬íll have again.

Bottled.  Pours a nice little golden color with a medium head. Nice foam and some long lasting bubbles inside. Aroma is sweet citrusish. Taste is carbonated with nice little hops bite, easy drinking for a Trip.

Now this is what a tripel is all about. Man, what a great beer. Suprised at how easy the 750ml bottle went down with me and my brother. If there was anything to be nitpicky about this this beer, it was the sludgey chunks at the bottom. Man that stuff looked like it belonged at the bottom of the Okeefanokee Swamp. But with some cafeful decantation, that sludge stayed where it was supposed to stay. 

The beer pours out a beautiful honey golden color with a big bright head with slow dissipation. Aroma of honey, apple juice, cloves, dust, roses, even some slight pepperyness to it. I could go on smelling this for a long time and continue to find new aromas. Mouthfeel is near perfect, not overly carbonated, but just right. Slight stickyness to it. Flavors were just as complext as the aroma. Grassy, yeasty, light fruits, cotton candy, pepper, vanilla, and floral. The alcohol reveals itself with a final nip towards the end and it finishes on a high note."

Golden with a very dense and high head in the beautifully crafted glass. Frutiy-sweet aroma that reminds me of a complex Duvel. The flavours are spicy with notes of orange, citrus and herbs. The alchol lingers for some time, but not in an unplesant way. A great beer!

750ml - Best before 12/04/09 -  Aroma of funky yeast (almost like a saison), light juicy fruit and spices.  Pours transparent gold with a huge white fluffy head and great lacing over cascading bubbles.  Flavor is more doughy yeast than funky from the aroma.  Still fruity and spicy.  Palate is creamy and effervescent with no alcohol bite whatsoever.  A fantastic beer all the way around.  My non-craft beer drinking in-laws loved it.

Poured into a Duvel glass.  Pours a nice straw/amber color with a huge frothy head that breaks down after a couple of minutes.  Leaves some thin lacing that also disappears after a short time.  Aroma is earthy.  Flavor is interesting with malt and sweet fruity flavors.  Some very earthy flavors with plenty of spice...kind of peppery actually.  Nice mouthfeel with plenty of carbonation.  Nice way to bring in spring...very refreshing.  New to the style...I enjoyed it.

Draft @ Eulogy:  Awesome beer!  Great on Tap!  Poured a dirty blond color with a nice amount of head.  The aroma was very sweet with slight apples.  The flavor was yeasty, malty, complex but extremely well balanced.  Overall, one of the best beers I¬íve ever had.

Pours a very clear gold (slightly hazy towards the end) with a tall, frothy white head. Aroma of yeast and citrus. Wonderfully smooth beer. No one taste overwhelms, it¬ís almost like a lightly caramelized piece of fruit. Sweet and malty. The body is very fizzy and gives a very refreshing sensation.
Golden color with a decent head. Aroma ids aof sweet malts and apples with some yeastiness. Flavors of malt and very spicy.

Dumped it inot a tulip glass since it was all that was available and thie is not a beer to drink out of the bottle. There is thick foamy head with a cloudy orange color and some suspended particulate matter in the liquid. The nose is full of honey, oats, and roasted barley. You can really distinguish the belgin yeast on the nose as well. the initial flavor is full of orange zest on top of honey and biter hops and spice. The booze is well hidden initially but not in the finish. The finish is full of lemon zest and pure alcohol.

Bottle. Light, straw colored, with a light haze, huge head. Aroma is very complex, sweet, malt touch of spice. Flavor is also fairly complex, malty, light fruitiness with hints of honey and spice. Touch of yeastiness. Smooth and silky, refreshing.
Pours very light with nice head.  This tripel has very fruity flavor with many enjoyable spices.  One of my favorite triplels.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2009 Bottle. Poured into trappist glass.
Pours pale blonde with a white head.
Aroma of hops in the smell, wheat citruspeel aroma.
Bitter taste, creamy palate.
Dry aftertaste.
I¬ím a bit disappointed...

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2008 33cl bottle.   Clear orange-gold with a creamy, lasting head.   solid aroma of banana, yeast, spice, and alcohol.   The flavor is spicy and yeasty with a lot of alcohol, which makes it pretty dry.   I¬ím digging the dryness; makes it very drinkable.   Medium body and smooth carbonation.   This is very easy and nice to drink,   Tripel isn¬ít my favorite abbey style, but this is pretty tasty. (3.7)   rerate: Draught at The Trappist.   Huge fruity pineapple any yeast aroma.   Fruity yet dry flavor.   This really stood out this time.   Great beer.

Golden and clear with minimal white head.  Aroma is cidery sweet with a hint of spice.  Intensely fizzy mouthfeel makes flavors hard to place.  Perhaps this covers taste flaws. This product is really nothing special despite it ratings.

Great tripel grain beer, best taste comes when drank in the original glass. White head with a beautiful golden base. I simply love this beer with its nice fruity taste. The beer tastes quite light aswell! Recommended to all!

Bottle. Aroma of Belgian yeasts, wheat, banana, spices, some faint apple and pear in the background as it warms. For me, the palate was a spice bomb. The base brew, while strong and solid in the mouth, objectively well constructed, lacked any real character for me. Instead, unearthly amounts of spices were added to give it some flavor. Maybe the spices covered up whatever flavor there was under there, but all I got out of it was a pretty bland beer loaded with spice. Not bad, surely, not weak at all or anything, but nothing stunning.

Pours a clear golden yellow with off white head. Strong aromas of Belgian yeast and bananas. Sweet malty flavor with a hoppy finish. Medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and soft carbonation. One of the best tripels I have tasted. Excellent!

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2010 Bottle.  Pours a murky yellow with a fairly sizeable white head.  Aroma of Belgian yeast, some light fruits (apple, pear, citrus).  Tastes of Belgian yeast, spices, and wheat.  Strong mouthfeel, but I felt that the taste was one dimensional.  I didn¬ít really care for this one. 
Update 2/13/10: Lots of Belgian spices in this one in the aroma and flavor with some light fruits in the background but the spices definitely dominate.  The malt base is just not as strong as the other top-notch tripels.  A decent tripel but not at the top of my list.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2008 Bottle: the aroma is both yeasty, spicy and herbal, freshly ground black peper, sage, mint, coriander, cardboard, strawberry flavored bubble gum, some hay, very complex on that department, flavor wise it¬ís malty sweet(banana like) with some herbal hops, weak alcohol notes, weak vinous notes and a nice dry finish, the overall flavor is quite delicate  and quite simple compared to the aroma, it¬ís an easy drinking  medium bodied nice triple.
Beautiful clear golden color, smallish white head. Good, but not amazing.  I¬íd almost characterize it as a light tripel, with a crisp finish.
pours a nice golden color huge frothy white lasting head much like duvel, nice sweet aroma fruit, coriander, spices.. lots of bubbles. some alcohol on the finish, pretty nice beer.

This is a phenomenal beer.  It pours a golden color with a small white head.  It has huge hints of bubble gum/ fruitiness in it.  Very mellow and balanced between fruit and grain tastes.  One of my new favorites.

Realized have never rated this fine brew.On tap at PP C Bad. Nice golden yellow color with a small white head. Yummy nose of sweet fruitiness and belgian yeast. Very luxurious in and smooth in your mouth. Some good mellow spice with citrus fruit and malt. Nice very good finish. One of my favorite tripels for sure.

Bottle poured into my Duvel tulip produced a big billowy head on top of a golden yellow head 

Aromas of wheat and grasses along with a nice subtle spice background and of course Belgian yeast 

Flavors of spices (pepper, coriander and clove) Sweet malt, and citrus fruit, as it warms there is a light alcohol presence as well

A wonderfully light crisp mouthfeel its making me wishes it was summer time while the snow is falling out side   

A great Belgian I can see why it won some medals I wish they would change the bottle color green glass is not cool. Extremely drinkable will gladly seek this one out again

Pint - Pint¬ís & Quarts - Olympia, WA 
Aroma ¬ñ Big Belgian yeast aroma. Fruity and malty.
Appearance ¬ñ Amber color, Nice head and clear.
Flavor ¬ñ Big Belgian flavor.  Fruity and deep malt.  Sweet drips off the beer.  
Palate ¬ñ Nice Mouthfeel, great texture with a nice dry finish. 
Overall ¬ñ A very nice Belgian ale.  I liked this beer it was very nice to drink. Big fruity flavor this beer really hits the taste senses.

750ml. Nicely balanced, this tripel is easy to drink. Appealing, huge white head with a slightly hazy golden body. The aroma is yeast and spicy with notes of corinader and earthiness. Also detectable, but not dominant, are notes of lemon and orange and grass. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet and lightly acidic. A hint of funk earthy moldiness comes through toward the end. The finish has a slight tartness and bitterness to it. Full body with a velvety texture and a long-lasting finish. Lively carbonation. Nice alcoholic warmth. A top-notch tripel.

Tasted from a Gulden Draak tulip.  Pours a diffractive rose-gold color with a moderate off-white head.  Very complex nose:  orange liqueur, orange peel, vanilla, caramel, honey, and cardamom (along with some bubblegum upon pouring) supported by the hearty aromas of wheat and oats.  The flavor mirrors the nose with a core of orange flavors accented by a spiciness and meaty body, again from the wheat and oats.  Picks up aromas/flavors of earth and raisins as it sits in the glass.  A very unique style for a tripel, but delicious and impressive nonetheless.

Bouteille de 330 ml, bu au St-Bock (Montr√©al) le 14/2/08. Blonde dor√©e, un peu de collet. Arome de c√©r√©al croustillant caramelis√©, un peu malt√©. Go√ªt efferversant malt√©, pain crout√© et assez alcoolis√© comme sensation.

750ml.  Spicy floral aroma and the wheat comes through nicely.  Great color.  Really classic and well done tripel.  Nothing bad to say except that it was a little too carbonated, which made it difficult to taste everything.  Solid.

2-10-08 tap 
Orange pour with no real head.  Floral and fresh malty aroma with wheat and Belgian hints too.  Reminds me of the flavor found in many Hefeweizens - the yeasty clove taste in the finish especially.  Thick gauze-like palate - almost absorbant in a way.  Overall, pretty decent but it just isnt my style of choice.

Rich orangish honey colored beer with very little head on it.  Mildly malty, wheaty nose to it.  Light but noticeable belgian yeast in the smell as well.  
Flavor is malty, caramelly and of light alcohol.  Somewhat creamy and tastes of smooth maltiness and belgian yeast.  Decent, but not for me.
Draft at the Bistro; Nose of caramel, yeast, vanilla, and spices; Clear gold with a small off-white head; flavor of cloves, caramel, and pepperiness.
Pours  hazy golden with a hughe fluffy white head. Aroma is fruity and yeasty. Taste is carbinted, lemon spice, remiinds me of soda. A little too sweet.
Golden pour with a white head.  Floral hop and light fruit aroma.  Spices and light fruit in the flavor.  The alcohol is very well hidden here.

750ml.  Wow!  Pours golden with an active white head.  Aroma is mostly sweet fruit with the slightest notion of spice.  Body follows suit with more descript fruit such as banana, apple, strawberry.  Hides alcohol very well.  Very drinkable.  Would probably be a good belgian introductory beer.

33 cl. bottle poured into tulip glass,  wow this is a very good triple, starts off with nice fluffy head that settles down to an opaque film, golden color with very nice aroma and very smooth floral taste, finish is excellent, alcohol is well hidden.
bottle 33cl: nice white head and very fruty and bready aroma. the taste is great. it feels very good in your mouth. this is one of the better beers.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2008 Very light golden wheat beer with tastes of honey. Very enjoyable overall for a beer of its type. I don¬ít prefer it over many other Belgians however. Too light and wheat y for my sensibilities however.

Sampled blind at "Better Know a Style: Abbey Tripel" tasting.  Clear light amber color with dense white head.  Orange aroma with a wierd sort of sprite-(like the soda)ness.  I might as well be drinking sprite as well though there is orange; also it is really sweet and off.  Wierd carbonation that sort of just fizzles out and is without substance.  Awful but deserves a rerate.
Lovely beer, packed with surprisingly fresh malty/ fruity flavours, the alcohol content isn¬ít as obvious as I¬íd expected. Fairly complex, and very slightly sweet, but a cracker nevertheless.

A pretty good tripel.  I¬ím not that big of a fan of tripels though, so I might be unappreciative.  The color is light amber with a fruity, yeasty aroma.  The flavor is light, energetic, creamy, yeasty, and fruity.  I¬ím quite surprised the alcohol content is as high as it is.  If I see this again for a good price, I will buy it.

The only thing average about this beer is the color. Golden with a nice creamy white head, average lacing. Extremely carbonated at first taste. Great sweet yeast aroma, sweet fruity hints. Alcohol well hidden, spiced flavor.. light fruits and yeast. For the price, really enjoyed this triple.

Draught: Candy coated banana aroma, very sweet with nice malt notes. Dark Yellow on the verge of light brown. Nice soft fluffy head. The flavor is easily compared to banana flavored runts: Very sweet to sour over ripened bananas with some sweet raisin flavor in the finish. Full bodied and velvety  smooth.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2008 Bottle (330ml). Bastard of a thing exploded upon opening, the bottle cap hit the roof! ¬ñ literally. Poured a mazy off orange colour with a tinge of brown and a good size, dense frothy head which was mostly lasting. Aroma was of orange zest, some malt, hints of cloves, mild bready notes and light vanilla in the back. Flavor was suburb and a lot more intense than aroma; more orange zest, dried apricots, some yeast, malt, light cinnamon, and a spicy/warming finish. Full bodied with lively carbonation, quite creamy mouthfeel and a great finish. I superb Tripel.

Large 750 champagne bottle. Green glass. Pours a nice golden color with a massive creamy head. Smells like czech hops. Sour skunky nose. Taste is completly different. Honey, yeasty, spice, sweetness, lemon and more. Really a great beer, and its a damn shame I drank it out of a solo cup.

Bottle.  Pours a clear gold with a thick white head. Huge bubbles.  Big fruity (lemony and banana) aroma with yeast and a touch of spice. Fairly sweet, with honey and lemon flavors dominating.  Some malty flavors as well.

Poured this into a tulip glass and was immediately rewarded with a big white head on the beer that gave of a fantastic aroma of fruit and yeast.

Flavor was a bit spice but very smooth.  A nice complex beer that leaves you guessing and wanting more.
Hazy golden colour, big white lasting head. Aroma is fruity and yeasty. Flavour is spicy and fruity. Lots of carbonation. Need to try this one more often!

hazy golden amber with a huge head that practically needs to be fought down. lemon citrus aroma with yeast and the lightest banana note. very soft, creamy body that is medium thin. lemons and honeyed yeast flavor, followed by a light creamy spiciness. dry and almost champagne like. this beer is very smooth pleasant, but full flavored. beautifully balanced and well made.

Bottle. Pours hazy, bubbly amber with amazing retention. Pungent floral, citric-like notes in the aroma, with mediciney yeast and some sweet fruit. Flavor is a melange of layered grain flavors, with citrus fruit, orange peel and medicine overtones. Finish has more citrus, bitterenss and a bit of soapiness. Textured, lively mouthfeel. Champagne-like palate.

Not bad not great.  Nice blond, poured a good head about a quarter of the bottle, noticed when I was checking the brewery and name that there are a mess of floaties in the bottom.  Glad they¬íre sitting down  and the first glass is clear, I¬ím sure the rest are going to be cloudy.

Pours a deep golden color with to big of a head. It seems to have a flowery grassy aroma, maybe even a little woody. When it comes to taste, it just goes to show you...never judge a book by it¬ís cover. The taste for me is exceptional. Not at all what i was expecting from the smell. Seems to drink liter than it sits but still very nice. An easy drinker!

has a yellowish brown body topped off with a slight brown head. Has notes of honey and flowers with a bit of orange.  The flavor is quite sweet with honey and toasted malt flavors and a quite a bit of carbonation. $4 11.2 oz bottle.

An excellent brew. The nose is a citrus, floral, honeysuckle blend, pouring lightly golden with an awe inspiring head. The palate is floral honeysuckle, citrus-orange and grapefruit--coriander, and light pine under tones. Remarkable.

Grood fruity beer. It¬ís a beer i drink one¬ís in a week. Try the bigger bottles, they are so much better. In my country they have 1,5l bottles, and they evalutated better because of the bottle. 
A good triple, but if you let me choose, i¬íll take the westmalle triple!

Fruity fresh, flowery scent. Nice golden color, with disappearing white head. Lively soda-like carbination. Malty, spice, citrus-lemony yeast, sweet. Tingles tonge, but i think its from the carbonation not the alc%. A nice tripel.

75 cl bottle. Has a champagne like pop of the cork.Pours a clear blond hue with a huge fizzy head. Reeks of sweet , freshly cut alderwood mixed with spices. Nice medium body with a lively, tickley tongue feel. Taste is a fairly sweet, spicey, earthy wood flavor. A very mild hop bitterness to finish. 2003
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: One of the first to start my love affair with tripel¬ís. I¬íve found better over time in my opinion but this has a that nostalgic taste for me. Sweet, candy sugar like. A regular drink for me, good beer.
Clear golden with large lasting head. Yeasty and malty aroma with peach, flowers and orange peel. Sweet flavor with flowers, peach, oranges with a mild dry and bitter finish. Fantastic!

Sampled blind at "Better Know a Style: Abbey Tripel".  (From a smaller bottle) Pours clear orange with an off white head.  Piney citrussy aroma.  Charred toffee, caramel, and phenols all over the place.  Phenols dominate the flavor.  Malts, alcohol, lemon, and that damn hair spray.  Spritzy carbonation.  Weird one.  This is our second to worse one out of the 26.

11.2 oz bottle poured into tulip- poured transparent tan-yellow, an off white head formed and quietly bubbled away, some lacing.  Aroma of yeast and various sweet fruit.  Hits the mouth with a medium body, carbonation noticed, somewhat acidic, fruit notes are present but mild, finish with hops kicking in.

Pours bright golden. Very clear until the yeast comes in. Nice head that dies out kind of quickly. Smell is deliciously complex. Very fruity smelling, yeast, pears, honey, melon, candy sugar, apples, bananas, clove, other spices. Glorious!!!
Taste is also pretty impressive. More fruity ala pears, melons, banana, etc....clove, coriander, candied sugar, honey, very quaint alcohol detected when I try to find it. Only 8% abv, which is low for a tripel, but very well hidden nonetheless. The low alcohol content makes this one even more drinkable than it already is due to the flavor and aroma alone. Mouthfeel is above-medium body, definitely has some body to it. Very refreshing. Finish is semi-dry.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2008 the beer has a great smell, Complex flavours of the 3grains and yeast, hops.
the color is orage gold en the head is white

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2008 sampled blind at "Better Know a Style: Abbey Tripel". pours clear golden with white head. nose of green apple, yeasty, windex. flavor sweet awful sprite like taste. lemony, yeasty, awful. i¬íll have to re-rate this because perhaps this bottle didn¬ít hold up to the year of age it had on it. hated at the tasting.1.9. 

8/12/08, finally a re-rate! on tap at maproom. pours clear golden with foamy white head. nose is perfumy and cloves. flavor is perfume, sweet honey and biscuit, a spicy and estery yeast finish. i can‚Äôt stand this style but i must admit this just screams quality brewing techniques.3.7.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2015 Rating is an alalgam of years of drinking this.
Rerate: Tap (Olletek, Tallinn) (8:4:8:4:16=4.0)
This is simply a superb tripel, the beautiful perfumey aromas are stunning. Utterly world class.
Rerate: 330ml bottle (Von Krahl, Tallinn) (8:4:8:4:15=3.9)
Poured dreadfully, didn¬ít even fit into the pint glass I was given!?!? Fortunately the aromas were gorgeous - so perfumey, so floral, the wheat really making its prescence felt. Tasted superb too, just a gently bitter bite. Full and succulent palate. Loved every sip, and went back for a 2nd bottle before I¬íd even finished the first (I couldn¬ít bare to be with an empty glass).
rerate of: 750ml bottle - shared by Janne - thanks! (7:4:8:4:14=3.7)
Gold, small head. Beautiful sweet fruity aroma. Very soft malty body. Some bite of alcohol and hops - tingles for quite a while. Very sophisticated. Wheat and hops in perfect balance.
Rerate of (7-4-7-4-13=3.5)
330ml bottle (Punavuoren Ahven, Helsinki, Belgian Weeks)
Very belgian - yeasty. Palate soft. Hazy light orange. Gentle hoppy taste, light grains. Little bit of almond. Some raw hops too.
Rerate of (6-3-8-3-14=3.4)
Bottle (Bon Vivant, Riga)
Slightly hazy orange, thin head. Fruity esters and some toffee-like malt in the aroma. Soft succulent malty taste, alcohol carries a mellow fruity component too, and the 8.5% is very well hidden.
bottle. Cloudy pale golden yellow, large head. Sweet malty and fruity with hints of spices and lemon, coriander and clove. Slightly hoppy and very full-bodied.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2009 Bottled 33cl. 8.1 ABV. It pours a light golden beer with a big white head. Lively carbonation. A beautiful tripel. The nose is of peaches, cinnamon, mint, cloves, coriander and rosemary with a nice peppery background. Some strawberries and apples showing up too. Quite a lot of coriander, rosemary and strawberries in the taste. Full bodied. Peppery with peaches, cloves and cinnamon appearing. Slightly acidic, but in a good way. Extremely well balanced and remarkably spicy, peppery (mentioning it again deliberately), with hints of lemon and oranges. The mouthfeel is very enjoyable. Rather malty with some lovely flowery hops. A tremendously complex brew. Some berries and lime sneaking in after after a few sips. The finish is extraordinary. Peppery, yeasty, woody with an outstanding lingering fruity touch accompanied by reminiscent licorice. The quintessential tripel. This beer not only has all the qualities of a good, dry and woody tripel, but reveals a distinguished fruitiness as well. Additional comment: Wonderful indeed. The initial score remains. Third rerate (from 4.6 to 4.2): Appearance: Murky golden. Marvellous lacework. Aroma: The nose is mainly of earthy hops, grapefruit, a lot of banana, cork, raspberry and melon. Very good taste with a beautiful hop profile. Wonderfully fruity and peppery. A fine tripel. But it misses the greatness that I expected. Flawless.
Tasted at Uni Canty Staff club tasting 10/12. Cloudy golden, delecate milky thick head. Candy sugar aroma. Dry/sweet, creamy with big spanking belgian yeast flavours.

75 cl bottle. Pours a cloudy golden hue with a thick frothy white head. The aroma suggests apples, yeast, and a nice malt. The taste is great: a smooth fruity flavor most like apple. Also there is the ever present Belgian yeast, which I love. A nice malt presence and spices also. Dry and sort of fizzy mouthfeel. Really nice.

Appearance: blond color. Great head, whitish-yellowish color, rocky and lasting.
Aroma: pale malts and wheat¬ís smells. Intensively aromatic hops. Honey, yeast and fruits reminiscences like banana, papayas and oranges. Herby tones from hops.
Flavor: sweet start from wheat, barley and oats (in this order), that quickly is balanced for the alchollic degree and a light dryness, lasting and herbal hoppy. Like in the noose, there are reminiscences of honey, vanilla, cookies and butter. Fruitiness like blond raisins, orange in syrup, papayas and banana. Warming and some mentholated final. Wheaty aftertaste.
Palate: medium body and an exquisite soft, creamy and semi-oily texture (maybe for the barley and wheat not malted and the oats.). Medium carbonated.
Complex, balanced and an exquisite texture. Tripel in the three dimensions, it this: dry, three grains and high alcoholic degree.

Hazy pale yellow, big foamy head. Smooth fruity bready malts. Yeast and spice also play a prominent role, but don¬ít overwhelm. Maybe a hint of brett in there as well. Finish is gentle and dry. Smooth sipping well made Tripel. Nothing wrong with this one.

750 ml poured a nice thick white head. smell is heavily of yeast and spice. The aroma is fairly strong. Taste is very yeasty with a hint of non-citrus fruit (bananas--more banana bread). The color is a beautiful hazy honey color. A solid abbey tripel.
From a bottle poured a hazy golden body with a medium sized white top.  Nose of yeast, wheat, and spices.  Typical clove and spice nose, dry and fruity.  Complex and well balanced.

750ml Bottle - Pours a hazy gold with a little white head.  Smells of yeast, must, funk, spices, wheat.  Taste is similar to a regular Belgian blonde, but less sweet.  Yeast, clove, banana, very crisp and slightly dry.  Not fantastic, but better than most.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2011 Bottle at the lovely Cafe de Bruxelles in New York City, served in an amazing fat-bellied glass, with a plate of delicious moules frites.  Fresh, fruity aroma and very nice flavor, similar to a blonde.  Hints of clove, banana, coconut.  Very nice!  Had it again a couple of times since my original 2007 rating - the fresh, fruity notes are not always present, but it is still enjoyable.  I did have to take a couple of points off.
Pleasant floral aroma. Dark honey color. Light head retention. Malty intro with full, well-carbonated mouthfeel. Significant alcohol presence in the finish with sweet overripe banana notes.
A very fruity aroma. Huge frothy, white head. Excellent lacing. Mostly lasting longevity. Clear yellow body. Heavy bitter initial flavor. Medium palate.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2009 Bottle, 33 cl. golden, clear, rocky head. Rather sweet but also well balanced. Lightly spiced. It has a medium body and average carbonation. A long finish with alcohol in the clearly present.

Pours a deep hazy gold with a thick tan head.  The aroma is of yeast, banana and raisins.  Swirls around your palette with relative ease, releasing its plethora of flavors.  Creamy banana and yeast up front with a lovely warming alcohol on the way down.  Simply wonderful.

Bottle; poured a rich gold with a large white head.  Aroma was very nice; of yeast, fruit, orange/citrus and spice.  Flavor was very, very good.  Had characteristics of a good hef or wit, just amped up a bit.  Flavor had sweet sugary components; zesty orange and citrus hints; some mild spicing; and a nice banana, yeasty presence.  Nice mouthfeel with some stronger carbonation and alcohol presence in the finish.  A top notch and delicious brew; can¬ít believe I didn¬ít get around to rating this sooner.
Pours a clear golden color with a large head. Aroma of fruit, malt, sugar, belgian yeast. Nice flavor, a lot of carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2008 Wonderful beer from the Bosteels. Big head with an amazing golden color. Very characteristic taste with the grains in the thick sirupy body, nice hoppy-sp√≠cy aroma with honey, moderated carbonation and some citrus in the aftertaste.

Subtle aroma of fruit, yeast, and white wine.  Sweet fruity fruity flavor with notes of malt, spices, and candy.  Very smooth medium body with lots of carbonation.  Finish is alcohol and citrus, giving way to a lasting, sweet banana aftertaste.  Best tripel I¬íve tried yet.

Drunk to celebrate my second year on Ratebeer. Bottle bought at Jumbo Bilbao
Pours a slightly hazy light amber with a medium white fluffy head that diminishes quickly. It leaves a fair lacing 
Aroma is malty/yeasty. fruity with notes of oranges, pineapples, banana, vanilla, spices like coriander, sugary hints of cotton candy and a liquory touch of cognac. Absolutely fantastic cross between a Hefe and a Tripel. You can detect every note so clearly, it¬ís outstanding.
Flavor is strong, intense, sweet with fruity touches of oranges, tangerines, tequila margarita, spices (coriander, pepper & cardamom) and grains... you can feel the wheat & oats. The finish is so huge, spicy and sweet citrusy.
Body is medium, ultra-smooth texture (thanks to the Oats), creamy. High carbonation.... maybe the only letdown of this beauty. The finish explodes with a strong alcoholic touch. The aftertaste remains for a while with a nice cereally taste. A fantastic triple, maybe the best I¬íve ever tried.

Bottle. Moderate smells of straw, lime, perfume, soap, mustiness and light notes of white wine apple, alcohol and and slight hint of clove. Head is frothy, white, mostly diminishing and has fair lacing. Color is clear golden. Flavor starts lightly acidic and a little sour, then finishes moderately acidic and lightly bitter. Palate is watery, light to medium, has a fizzy carbonation and finshes a little alcoholic. Nice refreshing smells lead to a crisp taste and mouthfeel in this Tripel.

Tasted 22. Nov -07. A very good aroma. I found some flowers, apples and maye some pineapples. Poured nicely into the glass. its fruity with some kind of reed berries in the flavor profile. Its slightly dry, but warming and with a long aftertaste.

Bottle from Sainsburys. Deep gold colour with a decent, rocky white head and moderate carbonation. Aromas of yeast, coriander, mace, tropical fruit and grain. Flavour had plenty of sweet malt with more spice, honey and some herbs. The finish was pretty dry. very good.

Bottle.  Pours a clear golden with a massive off-white bubbling head.  Effervescent.  A sour fruit scent with a hidden sweetness.  Tastes sweetly fruity with a sour body and hints of spice.  Extremely foamy, maybe a bit too much with a full body.

Bottle thanks to Muenster. Blind tripel tasting with Allagash Tripel Reserve, Westmalle Tripel, and Chimay Cinq Cents with NachlamSie and Muenster. The pour is a semi-cloudy golden with a pale white head. The aroma is very spicy and smells of fresh green leaves with slight citrus to it. The flavour starts off with a caramel sweetness with some fruits, a combination of a pear, orange, and a little bit of lemon. Spices start to become a little more apparent as the brew passes. Caramel sweetness slowly creeps in the finish along with a nice mixture of a pear¬ís light citrus. This is really good. This tasting has proven to be difficult to rate next to each other. I¬íll have to say I like this one as a close third in the tasting.

In a blind tripel tasting with NachlamSie and BossHossBikes. Pours hazy gold with a foamy white head. Aroma is full of awesome spicy notes, and some sweet juicy fruits. Flavor is very much the same, a very nice spicy/fruit dance leads to a finish that is only mildly warm, but mostly dry. Tripels are amazing.

On draft at Zeno¬ís.  Pours a clear light honey golden yellow with a medium white head.  Perfumy aroma with banananotes.  Taste is fruity with hints of cotton candy, candied malts and banana.  Slight perfumy aftertaste.

A fantastic example of the Tripel style. I¬ím intrigued by the 17th-century recipe making use of oats, barley and wheat. 
It pours a beautiful golden color that¬ís fun to look at, and is *quite* bubbly besides. The nose is incredibly rich: apricot, wheat, snow peas, coriander, Chinese 5-spice powder, and a wee bit of banana. 
The taste brings on a touch of toasted sesame, and the spicy bubbliness keeps on coming. 
Not an every-day beer, definitely a special-occasion, rich, rich beer. Thick, even. It would go well with Vietnamese cuisine (think light, but spicy, noodle-bowls with peanut sauce), but it loves it some balsamic peaches, and also is very happy with romano, ricotta, and a good whitefish like skate. I think this has become my favorite Tripel. An amazing beer.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2008 1PT 9.4oz bottle.  This sucker poured the most incredible head i have ever seen.  So much head that the enticing amber body with bits of debris had trouble escaping.  Nose is spicy and floral with faint notes of sweet apple. 8.1% practically unnoticeable.  Bubbly acidic mouthful with a banana spice grassy finish. Balanced and fantastic, one of my favorites.
Bottle Eulogy Tavern in Olde City Philadelphia- Pours a Amberish coloring with sweet floral aromas and tastes were of noticable fruits and malts.

On tap at Hop Leaf - Chicago, IL.  Awesome Beer.  Served in a large tulip.  Hazy amber-gold. Good nose - spicy and malty. Solid mouthfeel - heavy palate, but light carbonation that balances it out.  Complex maltiness, with some fig, caramel, and light bitterness. My description is not really doing it justice.  Very enjoyable - if you like tripels you should really like this.

(Bottle, Monk¬ís Caf√©, Stockholm, 31 Oct 2007) Golden amber colour with huge, but brief, white head. Fruity nose with candy, dried papaya and mango, hints of black-currant. Fruity taste with notes of sweet candy, dried papaya and mango. Slightly chemical finish. Solid malt foundation gives it a quite chewy mouthfeel. On the sweet side, but the balanced candy character is rather charming. Nice beer.

0.33 l bottle. Poured murky golden body with big fluffy white head slowly going down. Very nice fruity aroma, vanilla, banana, some spices too. Flavor is quite alcoholic, bitter and sweet like it is expected. Pretty full bodied. Finish is sweetish, alcoholic. Great beer, but not the best tripel I had, although I was expecting it will be.

What¬ís up with all these high ratings?! I¬íve had this stuff 3 or 4 times. Mostly in a small bottle. Tonite in a cork top. This is one of those Belgians that if too cold absolutely sucks! Nasty yeast semi skunk. Almost like a yeasty Heinies in aroma. Not much better in flavor. Let it warm to around 55F and it was better. Better yeast,thicker mouth feel, semi fruity. Took it from crap to mediocre. There are too many better Tripels out there to "blow your load" over this stuff.

Pour from bottle into duvel tulip. Massive head quickly subsided with crackling sound from the bubbles escaping. Strong aromas of sweet apples indulge my nostrils with hints of vanilla.

Tastes of mild grapes with a tingling bitterness sustained at the back of my throat. A swirl of the glass and a small head forms. Now a hint of burnt malt enters the aroma.

Theres a lingering scent of citrus that fills my mouth. A great bier that will send you back for more.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2007 Au nez, il est difficile d¬íignorer la puissance massive du citron, de l¬íorange, de la nectarine et de la p√™che confits et m√™me des c√©r√©ales. Il n¬íy a pas √† dire, ce parfum est enivrant et il m¬íest difficile d¬íy √©chapper¬Ö le collet de mousse est blanc, subtil et se dissipe relativement rapidement, jusqu¬í√† ce qu¬íune gorg√©e vienne provoquer l¬í√©parpillement des petites bulles qui remontent jusqu¬í√† la surface, pour mieux maintenir en vie l¬íencolure. Visuellement parlant, cette bi√®re est splendide : elle est d¬íun jaune/orange qui convoite le rubis. Il m¬íest √©galement difficile de ne pas √™tre hypnotis√© par l¬íapparence de cette ¬úuvre brassicole qui me rappelle ¬ñ ais-je la berlue ? ¬ñ les plus belles tartes au citron de ma jeunesse (minus la meringue, et la p√¢te). Au go√ªt, l¬íalcool vient r√©chauffer la langue et la gorge, appuy√©s aussi par la pr√©sence des diff√©rents fruits de la for√™t tropicale, tout particuli√®rement ceux riches en vitamine C (orange, citron, pomelo et mandarine), du chewing-gum, de la coriandre. En arri√®re-bouche, je dois admettre la pr√©sence d¬íune certaine s√©cheresse qui s¬íallie bien √† la douceur qui, pr√©c√©demment, fit r√©gner la joie et le beau temps dans les diff√©rentes r√©gions de ma paroi buccale. La Tripel Karmeliet est d√©finitivement l¬íune des plus belles bi√®res du monde (mais le monde est-il petit ou grand ???)

Bottle.  Pours a somewhat-cloudy golden color with a small white head.  Aroma of cloves, banana, yeast, and malt.  Taste is the same, with banana and clove up front dissolving into vanilla, malt, and yeast.  Very nice, spicy tripel.

Pours a golden blonde with a massive and thick white head due to it¬ís heavy carbonation. Extremely pleasant aroma and flavor. Consists mainly of citrus, lemon, cloves and yeasts. A hint of spice also. I haven¬ít tried too many, but this is by far my favourite Abbey Tripel. It deserves a spot in my top ten. Highly recommended.

75 cl bottle.  Poured blonde but not as light as a wit.  Nice large, white head.  Aroma is bubble gum with a hint of yeast and hops.  Flavor is a mixture of lemon, clove, and banana.  Very nice balance of spice and malt.  A little bitter but the finish is more or less smooth with lots of spice.

Pours a highly carbonated clear golden shade with a massive thick head, that actually grew as it sat in the glass! That was really the only negative to this refreshing, extremely drinkable beer. Fruity, a touch sweet, and clean with a subtly spice finish. Almost zero hint of alcohol. Great warm weather beer for our Indian Summer here in NorCal. Very nice.

Pours out a nice golden/straw color, slightly hazy with a moderate fluffy white head. Aroma of yeast, spice ans slight alcohol. Nice mouthfeel, and very well balanced. Yeast, spice, lemon zest, hop and slight lingering grainy taste. Very complex and well done.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2008 Flaske. N√¶sten synd ovenp√• Struise Mikkeller, men stadig en fantastisk √∏l. Klassisk trippel med en tilpas m√¶ngde alkohol og humle til at balancere s√∏dmen. En anelse parfumeret i duften, men ikke s√• meget at det bliver for meget. Rigtig flot √∏l.

Initially the aroma was mostly skunk which I feared due to the green bottle but that passed and left a sweet aroma of bubble gum and spice.  The tall spritzy head dissipates down to a thin layer of cloud on top of the golden body.  Flavor is mostly sweet and spicy with a light, carbonated palate.
Golden orange with light head. Wonderful spicy aroma with a hint of allspice. Slight alcohol flavor, hints of raisins, cloves and lemons. Absolutely delicious. Indeed a very nice belgium tripel.

Beautiful golden pour with nice lasting head.  Deep and layered scents emerge, including yeasty aromas coupled with hearty doses of spice, fruit and flowers.  The sugary body is well balnced by a wide array of well implemented spices and hops which gives a depth and layered quality to the brew.  The hops did not give it an abrupt crispness but gave a rather syrupy sugared edge. There is a light touch of alcohol in the finish but it is well integrated into the whole of the brew. A very well executed tripel.

Bottle, 33cl. I always thought I had rated this one, as I have been drinking it on several occasions, but finally... When opening the bottle, the beer immediately volcanoed out of the bottle, and leaving so much foam in the glass that it soon flooded. The head soon stabilized and diminished, leaving just a little white lid of bubbles on top of the hazy, orange body. There¬ís a good deal of floaties in it as well. The aroma is lovely fruity, with citrus and some banana, pale malt, cloves and other spices. It is a bit gazzy in the mouth, but it is a full-bodied beer with a good deal of sweetness. The flavor is just lovely, sweet and fruity, with a nice hoppy bitterness in the back of your mouth, as well as coriander and alcohol. Despite all the sweetness, it finishes rather dry. It is a quite warming beer and really lovely, and it irritates me a lot that so much of the bottle ended up on my dining table. (071019)

Bottle from BC liquor store Burnaby:  Pale straw color with a hugh fluffy eggshell white head. Aroma is spicy and peppery. Flavor starts sweet and fruity (apricot) followed by spice (pepper, corriander, clove) and a lightly bitter dry finish. Light-medium bodied and spritzy with lively carbonation.
On draft at Flat Rock Saloon.  Poured clear orangish with virtually no head at all. Weak carbonation.  Flavor of cheap candy sugars.  Alcohol not evident at all.

Bottle, pours a bit cloudy with a large frothy white head. A touch of skunk do to the green bottle, some nice grains, a bit of citrus but not too fruity  or yeasty in the nose. Quite carbonated, a bit of esters, some light malts no hops a bit of fruit and a touch of citrus. Pretty good, especially for a triple which I am not usually a big fan of but this one was nice.
Bottle. Pours a clear golden body with huge head. aroma is of spices, bread. Falvor is of yeast, spices, bready and light figs and prunes. Quaffable but a little too hot at times.

Golden straw pour, slight haze with nice head.  nose is of belgian yeast, and almost peach like fruit.  the flavor is lightly fruity up front, with a touch of alcohol as well.  A well carbonated beer with rich palate to match the flavor.  Overall the beer is complex enough to satisfy experts, while inviting enough to be a great intro to its style.

A deep golden pour with a large white head. An aroma of dusty belgian yeast and a hint of fruit. An almost apply flavor comes to the front. A light hint of abv is there as well. Carbonation is as expected the palate is very solid a rich creamy texture to match the flavor. A very special beer.

Golden, thick white head. Aroma is fruity, yeasty. Not a moldy damp basement-type aroma but rather that of a dusty chalkboard. Let¬ís take attendance: Carmel--present, Fruit--present, balance--present, complexity--present. But, life is too short to spend in a chalky classroom learning lessons... For all the technical brew-master pencil pushing proficiency that was put into making this fermented malt beverage, there is something more. This beer speaks of bright sunny days, cheerful green meadows, freedom, childhood, friends, and yes, love. I would buy this beer again and again and again. Unfortunately, I would have to keep flying to Belgian so this bottle I am drinking now maybe the only bottle I ever have. For those of you who have just uncapped a fresh one. Savor the moment because nothing last forever!

Aroma is a sweet fruity yeast scent.  Color is a hazy golden yellow with very good carbonation and a very big, very thick, tight, white head.  Taste sweet and fruity.  Starting with a medium body it goes down with a foamy feel.  Finish comes in with a mild malt flavor that is backed by a sweet fruity yeast taste.  There is a mellow bitterness on the end and the yeast flavor lingers a bit with a faint alcohol feel.  This is a great Belgian Ale.

A very nice tripel. Aroma of yeast and sweet malt. Pour was a medium gold with a lot of bubbles and a nice 3 finger white head. Taste was sweet and fruity with hints of stale malt and a strong pepper element. Burns the mouth and throat as it goes down. In the top tier of tripels.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Pours light golden with a medium white head.  Yeasty fruity aroma with just a bit of skunk coming thorugh.  Not a fault of the beer but the green bottle and place I bought it from.  Suprisingly the beer overcomes the skunk with its profile.  As usual with this style, too much carbonation for my taste.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2011 Golden-orange body. Little hazy. Bubbly big head. Aroma got banana, hops and grass. Also little peppery. A strong powerful palate. Nice malty sweetness in the flavor. Also fruity.

Cloves and dates in the nose. A rich burnt brown colour with some carbonaton. A toasty and nutty taste with raisins and cherries evident. A lovely medium body and a refined bitterness in the aftertaste. A great beer.

Bottle. Pours a nice golden colour, head is large and white. Aroma is fruity with strong smell of banana coming through. My only gripe with this beer is that it¬ís far too sweet, becomes cloying after about half a bottle. Although its not bad, I¬íd advise trying some other tripels before this one.

On tap at Galway Tribes, Like WoW...Light golden, very hazy, with a massive white head that is fluffy and long lasting. Banana and clove aroma with a touch of bubble gum and wheat. Yes malty, with over-ripened banana esters very prevalent. Velvety and soft mouthfeel -  smooooth  robust...X balance, quite excellent tripel.
Excellent Tripel! Upon opening the cork exploded out and the beer poured like Cristal Champagne. Flavors of fruit, especially berries - finished by a pleasant sweet hoppy flavor.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with huge frothy white mostly lasting head. Fruity aroma. Sweet flavor with alcohol finish.

Bottle, poured into trappist glass. Has the rich head of a champion. Hazy golden opacity. Heavy banana and practically tropical aroma - this caught me off guard. Much more fruit forward than expected. The slightest hint of caramel and greater alcohol feel as it warmed toward the end of the glass. I¬ím suitably satisfied with it but not overwhelmed with praise. Very enjoyable.

330ml bottle 
8.0% 
I tried this beer on September 14, 2007 at ¬íThe Beer Bistro¬í in Toronto.  The beer poured a hazy gold colour with a large fluffy white head that lingered throughout.  A high amount of effervescent could be seen.  The aroma was surprisingly hoppy and perfumey and had floral tones.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied with high carbonation.  The flavour was malty with some citrus hints.

As I uncaged this baby, there was an explosion, as the cork shot up at the ceiling and almost took off my head.  A small gushing ensued...but I took care of it.  I poured it into a trappist glass to reveal a perfect golden color with a huge white, frothy head.  The head stayed the whole time.  The scent was of cloves, malt, strawberries, gum, yeast and spice.  A perfect play on the palate with a complex taste and mouthfeel.  One of the best tripels I have tasted.

<Thanks to Beerbiker>
Clear sparkling golden with a fine dense white head. Aroma is very soft malty and powerfull fruity along with spicey wheat. Flavor is broad aswell. First stickey sweet, then turns into a nice mix between fruity sweetness, warming alchohol, nuts and grain. Very complex and balanced.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a foamy, lasting head. Aroma is fruity and sweet with bananas. Flavor is bananas, bubble gum, and a brief spice kick. Very good tripel.
