UPDATED: OCT 15, 2007 A lovely looking tripel, with light to medium gold color and a medium, slightly off white head.  Also, notable amounts of carbonation make this beer attractive.  The nose is very nice as well, with a balance of malt, yeast, and spices, but I wish it were a bit more pronounced, as it¬ís a little light on the nose.  However, the lack of power in the nose shouldn¬ít take away from the fact that the nose IS very nice!  The flavor is incredibly delicious.  It¬ís fairly light, fruity, spicy, and a little sweet, with a nice dryness in the finish.  This is a superior beer and a superb tripel that is probably the most enjoyable of the style that I¬íve had, to date!

Grainy, malty and sweet aromas laced with esters.  Golden colour, thick white rocky lacy head.  High carbonatioin.  Rich complex flavour. Notes of alcohol and light grain present.  Rich dense ester and phenolic notes give a spicy presence.  Alcohol otes are less discernable with time. Rubust tripel. Smooth perfect finish.  Excellent beer.

Chewy vanilla, oaty with hints of banana and light spices.  Served on tap in the Karmeliet glass at the Hop Leaf in Chicago. Outstanding rich complexity, letting soft citrus fruits come through towards the very  finish.  One of the finest glasses of beer I have ever been served.

A slightly hazy, golden color with a huge white foamy head, with an incredibly complex aroma. Exotic spices, like the kitchen of an Indian restaurant. Grains, Fruit, Flowers....Oats, Prunes and Rose petals to be specific ¬Öall of these and more. Delicious spice flavor develops more as it warms. Sweet, warming¬Ö.lip smacking for sure. I will be back for more of this one for sure!

A deliciously sweet tripel with great finesse and complexity.
Wheat, barley and oats are all used in their raw and malted form to create both a light crispness and creamy sweetness. Gentle
bitterness and the bananas and vanilla character of the house yeast meld perfectly with the grains to create an exceptionally
well rounded tripel.

Nearly identical scores here and for the Deus by Bosteels - this is a frightfully clear and spicy triple with enough star anise to blind you. Peppery, too. Delicious and it would never get too sweet on you. This is really nice.
Very large white head. Golden colour. Incredibly fruity/perfumy aroma. Sweet taste with a slight acidic edge. Very pleasent - one of my favourite tripels.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2004 Rerate 10/22/2004: 750ml corked bottle: I don't know if it's the bottle size or what, but the second time around was quite pleasant with this beer.  Not as highly carbonated as the smaller bottle and it seemed more complex and balanced. Nice sweet Belgian malty flavor and bready palate throughout.  A good tripel.

6/17/2003: 330ml capped bottle: Very lightly clouded golden color with a large fast-fading white head.  Aroma is mostly sweet caramel with some pepper.  Tremendous carbonation throughout.  Perhaps a corked version would have been slightly less carbonated.  Flavors are hard to detect through the fizz, but sweet buttery caramel toffee lingers in the finish.  A little too sticky sweet and definitely too much carbonation detract from this otherwise good Belgian tripel.

Very nice Belgian.  Pours up beautiful golden with huge white frothy head.  Head remains as does a steady stream of bubbles coming from the bottom of the glass.  In fact when I opened this beer, I had to double check to make sure I hadn't grabbed a bottle of Champagne by mistake.  Massive cork POP!  Delicous fruity aroma with lite yeast.  Flavor is wonderful with lively carbonation, hints of apples and spices, light hops and yeast.   Nicely complex.  Very good.

I guess I have to put this one among my favourites.  This is the perfect brew in a perfect and elegant package. It¬ís glass is probably the most beautiful of them all.  In the nose the sweet fruity bouquet with hint of banana, oranges and citrus dances around and makes you feel so good.  In the mouth the beer just makes love with the taste buds.  It is massive, spicy and a bit hopy with citrus, banana, and hint of vanilla in the end.  A gourmet beer !

Yeast, lemon aroma. Golden amber, medium sized with large bubbled white head, some lace. Zesty yeast, and musty pears flavours. Full bodied, almost a sour drying finish, good tongue tingle. Quite an offerring!

5/16/03:  bottle. nice sunny orange body with a full amount of head and some lacing.  sweet honey belgian aroma.  plenty of activity--carbonation.  hints of lemon with lots of belgian flavor (malt and hops).   hops are a bit stinky.  typically, i¬ím not a fan of this style, but i kinda liked this one.  (am i finally coming around)?

Initial pour of 3 inches resulted in all foam.  After letting it rest I was able to get the rest of the beer in the glass and was it worth the wait.  A slightly hazy honey color with lively carbonation and a large uneven creamy white head.  Sweet ripe dried apple/pear aroma with malt, vanilla, honey, and hints of bananna and toffee.  The head is incredibly lasting in its fullness, much like a drink with whipped cream you cant help but get some on your upper lip, it does make it difficult to taste the beer itself but enhances the overall effect of drinking the beer.  Taste is slightly sweet fruit, hints of spices and oak with an acidity cutting the sweetness some.  A honey dry finish.  Excellent.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2006 This was consumed with ice cream blended with the beer and apricots. I don¬ít think it was a good mix as this is a lively beer that is more suited as a palate cleanser. A light aroma with a vigourous light yeastiness. In context it started and maintained an acidic finish. Too fizzy for the meal. Still a good beer in the right setting. 

RE-RATE: and about time too. Sincethis early rate I have had this beer a number of times and question what I was thinking when I gave this such low marks. A delightful beer that satisfies in any season of the year. Silly me.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: Light orange-cloudy color - very fruity and yeasty. and I mean yeasty!  Fairly smooth - alcohol is masked behind all the citrus flavor. Good stuff.

Fruity, yeasty aroma, some honey, pear, melon, just a hint of must.  Golden in color with a very thick, creamy, long-lasting head with massive lacing to match.  Flavor is sweetly malty, lots of tangy fruitiness including some apple and faint pineapple.  Finishes sweet, honeyed, slightly citric, yeasty and with some acidity.  Very effervescent palate, but maintaining a pleasant mouthfeel.  Easy drinking Tripel.
nice frothy head with a light sweet fruity aroma. Clear light golden body. Citrusy flavor with abundant spiciness. Subdued but evident. A great refreshing brew.

Normally i'm not a big fan of tripels. However, this one kicked some ass.  Huge frothy white head. Aroma of orange, lemon, and other citrusy fruits. Sweet , smooth delicious flavor with some spiciness in the finish.  Wish i could get more.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2003 Golden straw color.  Nice white head.  Taste was sweet and extremelly smooth with perfect carbonation.  Finish was dry and delicious.

[75 cl. bottle] Orange colour, cloudy appereance, HUGE head, really lasting. The aroma is fruity (citrus and apricots) and yeasty. Smooth flavour, fruity (peach, apple and apricot), quite sour and yeasty. The finish is spicy (pepper) and sweet, with a good oatmeal taste that lasts in the mouth. One of the best Tripel beers.
Beautiful nose that developed over time like a fine wine. Light amber appearance.  Lingering sweetness that dominated other flavors. Liked  the hint of spices and banana.

Large white head that really lasts!Fine laceing that wont quit.Big citrusey,lemony,candy nose,with some earthiness also.Medium bodied brew.Sweet up front with the fruityness and also some notes of pepper in the slick sweet finish.Nice brew.

Slightly hazy golden body w/a  wispy white, long lasting head.  Initial aroma of cloves, pepper, slight bubble gum, fruit(maybe juicy fruit gum), sweet maltiness, and even a little earthy and leathery; The yeastiness if fairly subdued.  The head on this beer just does not want to go away!   Malty version of a tripel w/ some green raisin flavors, cloves, a slight hop aftertaste, but balanced toward malt.  Very highly carbonated for an explosive sensation in the mouth w/ a medium light body and smooth mouthfeel, not harsh or astringent; Alcohol is barely noticable, but slightly warming.  Very fine beer w/ more complexity of aroma than flavor, but very well made and extremely drinkable in quantity so be careful with this one.

This one pours a deep golden color with a medium sized head that lingers. It has a wonderfully potent aroma of yeast, spice, pepper, peaches, and some mild hop character. Medium body with full carbonation, the flavor is wonderfully malty and full of spices and honey. The finish is sweet and lingers. Excellent! I highly recommend this fantastic tripel.
A fantastic good taste, a little bit sweet, but a very spicy aroma. Nice head and a good body. I like this beer !!

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2005 Yummy, perhaps the best smelling beer I¬íve ever had.  Cloudy golden with massive head that looks like swiss cheese and never diminishes. Floral, spicy aroma, sweet and sour flavor with a smooth finish.
yeasty/wheaty nose, amber hue with a very large head, very sweet and very wheaty, traces of oranges, medium palate, slightly dry finish

Blonde/orange color. Medium head. Aroma is malty, floral and fruity (peaches and bananas). Malty, yeasty and bright. Herbal hoppiness. Touch of barnyard. Touch of dryness. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet. Nice beer.

Gold with irritatingly abundant fluffy white head; it loses a couple overall points for taking so damnably long to pour an appreciable amount. Somewhat sweet malt, with Belgian earth and vinous notes. Some floral hops. Well-balanced and complex, excellent except for the overly enthusiastic foam.
A veritable garden of floral excellence.  I have now had one dud and two bountiful harvests.
Bottle Conditioned. Golden cloudy beer with yeasty beige head. Plenty of cereal in a pleasant way, nicely spiced like an apple pie with cloves.

A rich golden color. Massive head, very carbonated.  Lots of pepper upon the first taste, along with some spices and yeast. A very interesting almost hot peppery aroma on this one. Very strang belgian, very strange indeed.

Rich and spicy nose of alcohol, pepper, fruity caramel and earthy yeast.  Pours a light golden.  The large white frothy head is mostly diminishing with fair lacing.  The brew is sweet and sour, warm and spicy, overall very rich and complex.  The acid level is high, and the finish is fruity.  The palate is light and dry and possibly the fizziest brew I've sampled to date.  The finish is dry.  Great aroma and flavor, but I'd not drink again simply because it is far too carbonated for my liking.

Hazy golden color - almost like hay - with a nice white head.  Dry aroma of grass, hay, yeast and light fruitiness.  Sweet, dry flavors.  Floral and sweet with honey, spices, oranges and tart, green apples.

You should have seen the looks on my friends faces when I showed up drinking this when everyone was drinking Keystone Light from a keg in a trash can filled with ice.  A couple of people even asked if I was drinking champagne.  This had a light aroma, a little yeasty.  Soft mouthfeel.  Quite a bit of carbonation, but soft on the palate.  This was a tasty brew.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2003 Pours a definite hazy blond and is full of carbonation. It is full of vanilla taste as well as a hint of apple. Has a carbonated spritz in its finish. This was on draft. Very good.

Poured a golden orange with largy sticky off white head. aroma was a wonderful mixture of yeast, coriander,and citrus. tasted of fruit, with a nice bit of coriander and other spices, alcohol well hidden with a very plesing mouthfeel, very drinkable, a very nice tripel

Pours light gold/yellow with a big foamy white head. Smells of spices, cloves? banana, yeast, mmm. Fruity, yeasty taste with hints of coriander, clove. Dry almost sticky palate. Lovely drop, alcohol very well disguised.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2003 Bottled: Light golden coloured with a medium head. A bit spicy in the aroma. Can't quite read it, but a little sweetish and yeasty. Flavour is sweet and spicy and wellrounded. Has a smooth pleasant aftertaste.

Pretty good beer... fairly drunk at the time, but after the final absolution, I was very happy to get something with a body to it; spicy yeast aroma and flavor, with the rindish fruit flavor expected, with a slightly sweet, roasty (imagined? I don't know) malt taste that surfaced every once in awhile. Good stuff

750 ml caged and corked bottle. Pours deep hazy bright  golden orange in color, has a huge white frothy lasting head. Fruity and spicy wet cardboard aromas. Fruity buttery and spicy yeasty flavors. Somewhat sticky but crisp finish. Full bodied with lively carbonation full but crisp mouthfeel, alcohol is hardly noticed, a great tripple.

This beer poured a golden color and formed a nice bubbly white head that left some circular lace as it slowly subsided. Some carbonation is present. An aroma of citrus and grain. A flavor of citrus and grain with a hint of clove present. A bit of tanginess to the body no doubt brought on by the carbonation. A good beer.
Golden-orange color with a nearly nonexistant head from the tap. Nice apricot, peach and yeast aroma.  Very fruity/peachy flavors with a dry finish.  No aftertaste.  Nice moderate body.  Pleasant.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2012 2012-06-08, draught at Pibar, Lausanne, 8-5-8-4-16=41Hazy blond color with generous head. The aroma is malty and sweet, with light presence of fruit and Belgian yeast. The malt flavor is smooth, soft and quite sweet, with a touch of peach and low bitterness.When fresh it¬ís dangerous.2007-08-01, bottle, 7-4-7-4-3-14=35Hazy golden color. Good Ale, but not as I remember it, too simple.2003-01-12, draught, 8-4-7-4-15=38Bright blond color, thin persistent cap. Nice aroma, with some malt, spices, pretty fruity. Pretty dry, fresh, easy to drink; less malt, but enough spices (coriander¬Ö). The palate also is too weak. Good; nothing more.
Blond, slightly cloudy with a beautiful foam. The aroma is very subtle and well-balanced. Sweet and very pleasant. A very good beer.
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2003 Orange yeast and malty nose.  Golden orange slightly cloudy hue with a large white head.  Sour orange and yeasty flavour quite sweet.  Not the best beer.

Starts great with a big yeasty, orangy nose. The clear orange color and spongy head looked great in the glassware from the brewer. Hints of oranges again in the taste. The balance was a little in the flavor. Otherwise decent.

Spicy, sweet, citrusy and beautiful.  A friend felt there was a hint of saccharin in it, otherwise this would be a perfect beer.  It has very limited availability in the USA, so grab it while you can.

Hazy orange-gold color, small off-white head.  Very fruity aroma of apples and oranges.  Same flavor with some spiciness and wheat thrown in.  Finishes sweet with some alcohol warmth.  High carbonation, like champagne.  A pretty good tripel.

Apple, oranges aroma. Also smokey. Orange body with a little head layer. Tasted apples and oranges, real fruity. Wheat comes through. (here my notices are leaving me...to much?) Lively carbonation. Seemes I liked it a lot :-)

Nice sweet aroma.  Head dies quickly with a little lace.  Tastes like Unibroue Maudite with a little more citrus, but not as smooth, sweet or good.  Lively carbonation.  Hazy orange-yellow appearance.
Very smooth.  A bit of banana in the nose.  As with most tripel¬ís, a large, thick head.  Some citrus and spice flavors.  A very good beer.

A real disappointment overall, but started out strong with a MASSIVE cream colored, dense styrofoam head, like that egg crate padding stuff.  TONS of fat rising tiny bubbles.  Reminds me of a weak, funky Belgian white.
This one was a bit lost on me, not as complex as I had expected. Very subtle. Nicely spiced but with out the intensity I favor in a tripel. Too broad for my palette, but a beaulty to look at.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2003 Fabulous.  Complex, yet easy to enjoy.  Citrus flavor, dry yeasty-doughy flavor.  Spicy, like most Belgians- but seems fresher and lighter than some of the other Belgian strong ales.  More affordable too.
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2007 Aroma of sour fruit and flower. Pour is golden and clear, large frothy white head. Good hops flavor with a kick of spice. Citric finish, with little aftertase.  A decent tripel.
11.2 oz bottle,nice light copper color,perfect carbonation, peaches, orange,tart, very refreshing, a nice Tripel
champagne bottle and champagne carbonation, smells like serious citrus, light orange with a giant head, slight creamy citrus but overall not much there
If you want a tripel, this is one you have to have. Hits it right on the head

This is a very nice, wonderfully balanced trippel.  Soapy head.  Coriander and lemon in the nose.  Sweet flavor almost goes too far, but is reigned in late with effervescence and dryness.  Very good, not great.
I have tasted beter tripel beers.

I still hear echos of gun shot explosions as the cap came off..The head sat at least 2 times as tall as the actual beer..aroma was a yeasty concoction of strawberry banana..good strawberry banana impression with subtle spices..some fizziness..I like the balance of spice and fruitiness in this one..its very refreshing and light for 8%..Good Shizzy

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2003 Perth at last has a Belgian Beer Cafe where one can try Belgians a class above the usual Leffe and Stella type beer. While having the Karmeliet I get a flood of Belgian memories. Spicey yeasty farmscapes, small beer cafes in Turnhout and those Belgian chocolates. A consistently excellent Belgian beer jewel. I think 4 ratings of around 4.5/5 is enought so it will probably be my final rating for a while on this one.  
Third Rating: 4.5	8/15/2002 4.5This beer has slowly become one of my favourite Belgian Blond beers. Impressive erectile, fluffy lasting stand up out of the glass, variable bubbled, white head. Beer is white desert wine colour. Citrus,  hops, caramel, doughy grainy malt and spicy fruit aromas. Tingling sweet sour bitter start with a fruity palate and a hint of asprin. Smooth luscious zingy faintly alcoholic middle. Beautiful floral sweet doughy sour finish and fruity watermelon aftertaste.  Being quite fruity and sweet this beer  goes very well with many deserts. Awesome - try it. Second rating; 20 July 2002; 4.4
First rated 4/5/02 4.4
Light, sweet, spicy - light pepper.  Similar to their Kwak, but dry-er.  "Bright."  A fine drink while cooking dinner - not overly complex, just enjoyable.
Slight white grape aftertaste combined with other fruity smells.  Thick consistency.

Rerate: I¬ím thinking almost exactly the same as last time. This is really good stuff. If there is a criticism it would be that it¬ís a touch too sweet, but I¬ím just being picky.Original:Top quality beer. Golden yellow in colour with nice head. Has a ¬ísolid¬í appearence due to the sediment. Tastes like burnt grains, malts and fruit with slight hops. At least as good as if not better than Chimay White and Westmalle Tripel. OH! and right now (i¬íve just drunk it) I¬ím getting a nice aftertaste of watermelon. Lovely!

Tasted at the Barrelhouse Brewing Company Microbrew Fest on November 9. Murky yellow with an interesting fruit aroma. I tasted granny smith apples in the flavor. Nice spiced finish. Belgians have really grown on me lately.

Very attractive peach-gold color with massive and tight creamy head---thin sheets of lace coat the glass...Aroma is bready, slightly fruity (apple, pear?)and spicy (clove?)---all of it nice!  Flavor is also softly fruity, reminding me of banana-nut bread, again with cloves and allspice...This is a delightful blend of sweetness, spice, carbonated bite and alcohol warmth...It has substance but is not too  weighty...Very enjoyable, and earns value points too...

Faint cloudiness blankets the pale gold body. Streaming bubbles feed the huge white and rocky head. Aromas of bread, wheat and alcohol. The first sip tells one that the body is much healthier than the beer appears. Initially quite peppery with some fruit (bananas?) and slightly alcoholic tinge on the finish. A wonderfully warming beer.
Bubbly, almost champagne-like.   Peppery spicy yet somewhat fruity.   Alcohol hidden.   Dances on the tongue.   Unique three grain beer (oats, barley, and wheat).

Beautiful golden color with a huge white head.  Full of lively bubbles that dance on your palate.  Sweet, musty nose with promise of the spice to come.  Very sweet brew that will make you think of drinking champaign.  Spicy coriander, clove hints with plenty of fruity sweetness to balance it out.  I crave this beer.

Strong banana nose with slight spice and alcohol.  Complex fruit taste - rasberry, plum, peach.  There are tastes of pepper and cinnamon.  The alcohol adds a nice little kick.  Terrific value to boot.
Golden body with a medium white head.  Spicy (pepper and mint)and sweet apple aroma.  Flavor is delicious -- peach, spicy, flowery.  Alcohol noticeable but not overwhelming.  Finishes dry.

This beer has a very light champagne flavor with a dry aftertaste.  I expected something with a little more of the proverbial "oomph!" from a triple.  More than average carbonation.  Was a little difficult to keep this puppy from overflowing the glass.  Down boy!  Bad dog!  Anyway, this is average but could warrant a rerate when the time comes, if it comes, to purchase this again.

Another desert beer. Medium speedy then slow ..., but with the fluffy after effects. 
.. and sweet.. bloody hell yes..it¬ís sweet.
-- Yes the 3 grains come through and the camelite process has worked again! Oh and oat, barley and wheat havin a party in there.
Yep. 
Rerate:Still the same. Like it, especially the little circle of foam in the middle of the glass.

Clear amber color, huge white head.  It¬ís got that bottle conditioned aroma, with spice and perfume.  Sweet, floral, spicy taste.  Alcohol is hardly noticeable.  A really great beer.  At 8% a six-pack would be great--NOW THAT¬ís WHAT I CALL VALUE!!!!11111
Very wine like taste which is good but a little weak. Dissolves on the tongue a little too quickly.

This is by far the most mellow Tripel I¬íve tasted. While still cold this beer is kinda malty, kinda hoppy, just really nice. As it nears room temperature cloves rear their heads like nuns at a rosary sale. Untraditional clove taste...almost potpouree...tastes similar to strong sausage spices.

Bright, bright orange color, big lasting head, cloudy.  Nose citrusy, orange and lime, understated but pleasant.  Flavor also "light", sweet, malty but extremely nice, honey and almonds and oranges and vanilla.  Finish smooth, sweet, short.  Really lovely, different kind of tripel; great.
Lightly spiced aroma & completely clear. Flavour is a little light with slight sourness & some corriander. Nice aftertaste & very warming.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2012 
Sept, 2002 Pale golden colour. Nose is sherbety and spicy, with hints of vanilla, cloves, cinnamon and coriander, plus  bubblegum and a touch of soap. In the mouth it is quite honey sweet balanced by sour citrus-fruit notes - lemon and lime, with a touch of pineapple. Finish is citrusy, sweet and cloying. Chewy-thick, with a power taste suggesting a much higher alcohol content. [2.5]
June, 2012 330ml bottle Chrissie brought back from Bruge. Hazy blonde with foamy head. OK. Yeasty, wheaty nose with banana esters and woody and citric notes - some soap, faint spice, dry, mildly alcoholic. OK. Mouthfeel is dry, chalky, mildly alcoholic, some carbonation prickles. OK. Flavour is soft, with entwined and attractive notes of vanilla, citrus, flowers, soap and faint chocolate. The combination of all the elements is softly attractive and beguiling, though not especially impressive. It¬ís a good, drinkable strong pale ale, rather like Duvel or Chimay White, and worth exploring further. I certainly enjoyed and appreciated it more this time than I did 10 years ago. [3.3]
Very big and nice head with a fruity aroma. Fruity taste, a little bitter.

I dedicate this beer to a new life that will in time touch many lifes ¬í Venom¬í, this beer is for your ¬íBeautiful New One¬í. I also dedicate this beer to one who has touched many lifes, and certainly enriched my life, My Mother-In_Law ¬íWho next to my Mother was the Sweetest most gentle of God¬ís lambs. One of God¬ís Angels came and took her to heaven this morning, Julia Maxine Wills, ¬íI love You and Will miss you¬í, and ¬íSweetie¬í, this beer is also is for you, even if you didn¬ít like me drinking!.
Pours a clear dark gold, the head large and frothy, the lace in thick sheets. Nose is citrus, malt, fruity, a tad earthy, the front is malt sweet, the top light. Very dry and astrigent finish, wineish, lightly hopped, nice ¬íwarmer¬í, and a quite complex beer. Ranks #292 on my current 1000 beer master list.
Deep orange color, nice lasting head. The taste? Mmmm.. the taste! Sweet and complex with spicy hints of hop and herbs. Wonderful long aftertaste. A marvellous beer!

Hazy golden color witha a voluminous head with continuedlace down the glass. Light flowery aroma with a slight yeast and alcohol undertone. Flavors of light fruit including pears, pineapples and nectrines.  Slight orange and corinader flavors. Older bottles tend to lose some of the sweetness.  Quite smooth in body.  Alcohol comes out a bit more as it warms.  Finishes smooth with some acidity to cut through the sweetness and enought bitterness to let the malt come through.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2003 Blond with a big head. Floral, fruity hop aroma. Light floral smooth taste with a mature and rich palate. It has a light bitter finish. This is a super good beer. Especially if you let it mature for a year or so.
good beer. great glass.

Bright golden color, lots of foam and carbonation. Musty, appley, oily and slightly metallic aroma. Fizzy palate, yeast with mild green apple notes and a delicately astringent sour finish. Lightly puckering aftertaste. A little too sharp and fizzy maybe masking a little flavor. Would love to see if the corked version comes out better.
A very nice but hard to find strong ale.  The multi hop flavor is quite nice, an attractive head and a nice beer glass to match

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2011 750mL bottle.

Head is initially large, frothy/fizzy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy medium yellow, bottle conditioned.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of coriander, ginger, lemon zest, honey.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

I still don¬ít consider this a tripel.  It¬ís not very yeasty, it¬ís too sweet, and it¬ís seemingly quite spice-heavy.  My rating is as a generic Belgian Strong Ale.  The nose is pleasant (albeit spice-heavy, as mentioned).  It¬ís a bit sweet and watery in the mouth, so not as fun to drink as to smell, but overall it¬ís ok.

Hazy gold--urine color-with head that leaves a thin ring. Clean aroma that is spice dominant and has detectable hopping as well. The body is quite weak despite its 8% alcoholo content--sort of watered down. The immediate prick of flavor quickly tturns bland.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2006 First re-rate of this for years: Liquid gold, a little cloudy but a good firm white head. Soft fruity aroma, apricots, pears, lovely palate a little bit acidic, though softened by perfect carbonation.
I need to drink this more often... sooo good!
Beautifull bubbling tripel. Fresh and spicy. nice brew. Definately one of the better tripels.

A fantastic beer. It has a slight aroma of strawberry. A beutiful golden color. It has a slight acidic and fruity sweet flavor, which gives it a great balance. Definitly one of the best beers I¬íve tasted.
Huge frothy white head. Clear golden colored, like a pilsener. It has a rich, sweet taste w/ some yeastiness. Nice, but not outstanding

Excellent belgian style beer!  Looked beautiful in a tulip....nice head....cloudy light golden color.  Perfect blend of apples, bananas, spice, and alcohol.  Sweet, yeasty finish....yum!....practicing html

Golden orange beer. Typical triple aroma with a hint of candle wax (!?) and wheat. Wheat, some bitter almonds and a big bitter finish. I don¬¥t really fancy this beer. It has one of the coolest glasses though.
Terrific Belgian!  Came with a beautiful goblet, bright, bubbly lasting head.  Fruity, yeasty and just enough alcohol.

Small bottle and very fresh.  A beauty to look at.  More rising bubbles than I have ever seen.  It is a geyser springing up from the bottom and recycling the yeast through the glass and creating a contoured foamy white head.  The side of the head looks like snake skin with its large bubbles.  A floral, yeasty, coriander, spicy aroma.  I was kind of surprised with the flavor - it is very sweet.  Almost like drinking sugar, honey, and syrup.  It is soft on the palate and finishes quickly.

Aroma of sour fruit and flower, although slightly metallic.  Pours a beutiful gold color, small white head.  Good hops flavor with a kick of spice, it could use a little more tartness.  Tangy on the touge finish, with little aftertase.  A good tripel but not the best.  Allagash and Victory Golden Monkey seem to have a greater flavor.
Sweet and spicy aroma + flavour. Rich but not too heavy.

The nose is instantly hit with a cascade of flavours with citrus, spices, oats, and apples. The flavours on the palate is rich and full with a big fluffy head that hangs around the whole drink. This beer is a gem.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2008 Meteor shower in the nose!!¬Ö.Oranges, barley, wheat, apples and coriander explode and leave the drinker creating large expectations¬ÖI could smell this one for hours¬ÖThe drinker suddenly takes hold of the beer and swallows¬ÖSmooth milk and cereal with languorous honey caress the tongue¬ÖRose water ice cream galore under sticky whipped cream foam...This is perilously drinkable for its size...A spritzy champagne for a joyous harvest...

Citric with elderflowers.  You really get the grains in the aroma that carry over to the taste.  The typical ¬ífoam in the mouth¬í trappist mouthfeel is present.  Hey, I have just detected a belgium wheat beer-like character.  In an 8% beer.  This¬íll do!
Big fluffy white head that sticks around.Aroma of citrus fruits and flowers. Medium golden color with nice carbonation.This is a very nice blonde. Would be great for a hot summer day on the porch!
This is the best Belgian blonde beer that I have ever had.  It does not have a trace of that damn ¬íhot¬í taste.  Very well made, good looking, good tasting beer!
Great and complex aroma. A sweet and quite heavy beer.
Sedimenty, yeasty body. Spicy floral/citrus aroma and malt flavor. Very smooth finish, well-balanced tripel. The spice is very evident in the initial malt flavor, which is key for me.

HUGE head on this one. Clody golden color. A very spicy nose. The mouthfeel is like a tangy spice attack on your tongue. Very sharp. The flavor is of citrus, coriander, and almost a rock candy malt. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2008 The aroma is crowded with spices of coriander and dried pineapple.  Subtle hints at oranges, honey, wheat, and cloves.  Soft mouthfeel.  Oranges and cloves are also the main feature of flavors.  This is overly sweet and mushy.  Soft, simplistic, and slightly unpolished.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: cloudy golden colour with huge fluffy head. Strong wheat taste with floral aftertatse. very enjoyable, more a summertime drink.

Huge fluffy head, sweetish malt and spice aroma aroma (quite perfumy), slightly sweet first up and then dryish finish, grainy, slightly spicy, hints of cinamon, oats, coriander, cloves, herbs etc, complex and tasty.
Re-Rate: Stable, high head and golden color. Fruity aroma and taste. The three grains add a bread flavor, but the beer is not overly malty - rather refreshing.
Not bad- not as interesting as I thought it would be.  Worth another taste.
Sweet, alcoholic, and very perfumey, borderline on too perfumey. Gets better as it warms.  Some coriander spiciness begins to show decent, but hardly exceptional in my opinion.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2003 Yeasty, sweet taste , very fruity (orange, mango, banana). I also found coreander. Bit tart. Very nice beer, very easy to drink, but a bit too sweet.Re-rate: wow, what an aroma. Chalk, sweet grapes and citrus. Sweet, very fruity (grapes, mango, citrus) and yet herbal flavor.  Some tartness and alcohol. Lovely beer, full of aroma and flavor. I had to boost the rating a bit.
Very complex and hard to put a label on because of the 3 types of grain; it gives it a unique taste.

Yup, this one¬ís rather sweet. It¬ís a good-tasting brew, no doubt, but as with most Belgians, I can¬ít pin down the flavors.  The alcohol comes through a bit strong, I think.  For a ¬ítripel¬í, I might have expected a heavier, maltier brew, but I ain¬ít complainin¬í.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2006 very very sweet. stacks of coriander and orange peel on top of slippery sweet fairy floss. Not syruppy or cloying like a barleywine or a doppelbock, just unbalanced - maybe needs some age? Needs more yeast bite or something to dry it out.rer8: i think i like my tripels more in the westmalle mould - more hops, pepper, dryness. this is just too sweet and girly.rer8: (BB 12/04, drunk 03/06) after cellaring 2+ years: comes out cloudy orange still with a healthy pscchht and supercreamy head. aroma is just as fresh and complex as usual - spicy and fruity, peaches and pepper and dough - in the mouth however this has thickened up considerably to be pretty much one dimensional sweetness and coriander. kind of sickly.
I had the pleasure of sampling the draught version of this exceptional beer.  Very smooth and fruity.  No aftertaste.
When young this beer¬ís carbonation is like a science experiment.Sweet,sromatic,spicy,floral,earthy,crea from the use of oats.If you see it, buy it.

Enticing ripe aroma, slightly earthy, with hints of pear, golden delicious apple, and malt.  Appearance is that of a belgian blond; golden clear body, thick frothy head.  Once tasted, the complex character flashes notes of ripe, jammy pear, banana, orange, apple, with a texture similar to coconut juice, but really gets interesting when its nutmeg and subtle cinammon flavors become apparent.  The sweet overtones are nicely balanced by sturdy woodiness and ample malt. Delicious.
Pretty clear for something called ¬ítriple¬í, but it was good.  Sweet, smooth, fruity, very drinkable.
The beer produced a huge frothy head with an apple aroma.  For my taste the beer was a bit too sweet.
3-grain (barley, wheat, and oat), creamy tripel. I like the freshness the wheat adds. The beer has a great head and the typical Karmeliet glass is one of the most beautiful glasses around.
Pale straw color; Full head; The strangest nose I have ever encountered- suntan lotion, but no coconut, lots of orange peel. The aroma is the thing with this beer. Honey dominated the palate.
This beer has a fresh for a tripel. Very good

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2003 Cloudy, yellow, HUGE soapy head. Incredible nose of coriander, bready malts, lemon notes, banana, vanilla, flowers, hops and more. Medium-thin body, rich with flavors. Tastes as if  coriander and orange/lemon peel was just added, very citrusy and spicy. Bready malts and citric flavors are prevalent. Not as soft as I would like but it contains subtle and delectable banana, vanilla esters that I dont get with many triples. Tasty as hell and a top 5 triple and world class brew.
Golden coloured. Very malty and very complex. Balanced sweetness. Outstanding triple!
A good tripel too

Golden amber, huge head; incredible nose - very peachy, floral, yeasty w/coriander, pepper, leather, mint, sage - I could sniff at this for hours.  Soft palate - sweet malts, flowers (know nothing about botany, so can¬ít get specific), herbal hops, vinuous alcoholic depth, fresh coriander.  Finishes with a gently dryness.  By combining the yeast dryness that Westmalle fans love with the floral sweetness that Golden Rose and Zatte fans go for, this seems like the tripel for all people.
Very good tripel. Slightly hoppy, but not too overbearing.  Has an apple aroma to it, and is very smooth.
Slightly malty for a belgian but very nice.  Normal huge belgian head.  Citrus notes. Dry and slightly bitter finish.  Very nice hops without overpowering the other flavors.

A hazy gold with highlights of copper and big frothy white head.  Grainy, spicy, and thick for the style.  There is more going on in the aroma and flavor that I can easily express.  Finishes with a lasting flavor of earty grain, rye?
It has a very nice golden colour, slightly cloudy. The aroma is very fresh, very pleasant. The taste is powerfull and well-balanced. Very long aftertaste.
this tripel really is a good surprise. The taste is so different from the others : a kind of mix of fruits and sweet spicy tastes.
certainly boisterous. and not over-the-top and sweet like some tripels. spicy and invigorating
A refined delicacy. And affordable compared with many a beer.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2012 Together with Westmalle Tripel, a classic, the archetype of how I like my tripel. Great fruity aroma of orange peel, coriander, spicy yeast, bit grainy. Dry taste, slight sweet, fruity, bit spicy. Perfectly balanced. Awesome.
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2006 Complex aroma with spices, malts and wheat. Hazy, yellow color, white head, good lace. Sweet, bread and light hops. Very drinkable, very well balanced, looking good.
UPDATED: JUL 6, 2005 Sweet and complex pencil eraser aroma starts a malty, alcoholic, smoky rich blend of flavors. It¬ís compelling -- I¬íll definitely be back.
Don¬ít judge the beer by my rating.  I¬ím sure that lots of people like it, but the taste just isn¬ít for me.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 re-rated; from Bier-Bienne - light hazy blond beer with a moderate foam left; very estery fruity aroma with notes of marzipan and marmalade; pretty sweet , fairly carbonated; chewy finish with pretty lot of residual sugars and more estery fruity notes; spicy

12/2000 - clear, cloudy, nice head, deep orange and perfumy aroma, sweet and spicy flavor, long aftertaste - absolutely marvelous !
